author: MichaelMichaels
title: Skip it. Life is too short.
body: I've never read any of the Harry Potter books so I cannot compare. This book is relentlessly grim. There's not one reason I can think of to recommend this book. Each character is miserable and unhappy and horrible. And there are a million of them and good luck keeping them straight. Ultimately, you do not care what happens to any of them. Skip it. Life is too short.

author: Frans van Wyk
title: Four Stars
body: Excellent Read with a lot of real life values and scenarios

author: Sabina Duke
title: Characters
body: Hard to keep the characters straight

author: Jen Blau
title: GIVE IT A CHANCE!
body: I almost put this book down. I'm new to Rowling's work (it's true I've not read Harry Potter series . . . yet) YES, It's slow to start. Complicated. Ok it's slow until around the middle. HOWEVER, the story . . . I began to think about it when I wasn't reading. Wondering what was going to happen next in Pagford and with Krystal Weedon, with Samantha Miles. To be honest, I have the very last section to finish (just a few pages) and I can't wait. I'm not a huge fiction reader (quick, modern day women Reads like Maria Semple's work when I do) but I have much appreciated the complicated and sophisticated story Rowling has written here. I say, it's not for everyone sure, but give it a chance!

author: Lilith Eleanor
title: Frighteningly good
body: Amazing. Rowling combines fantastic writing with a story designed to make you think. It's a long book and it takes a while to read, but you will be better off by doing so.

author: Laura
title: Didn't enjoy
body: Not my style of writing

author: Amazon Customer
title: Three Stars
body: Maybe I was wxpecting more.

author: retiredandlovinit
title: Audiobook was quite engaging
body: For a long drive from AZ to IL, this audiobook kept me involved and engaged for all of its 18 hours -- not an easy feat. The reader does a fine job of differentiating all the multitudes of Ms. Rowlings' characters and her intersecting, overlapping plot lines. Many characters had unlikable traits, but all of them were believable, and the intrigue of small town and school politics and prejudice seemed all too realistic. Don't read this one looking for a happy ending; some characters do well, some do despicable things, and some die in sad and, perhaps, inevitable circumstances. I picked this audiobook because I enjoyed the Harry Potter books. I knew Ms. Rowling could tell a good story. She did not let me down with this "more adult" novel. Good story.

author: reader78
title: Slow moving plot
body: I bought this book several years ago and couldn't  get into it. I finally opened it back up and read it while on vacation. If I had another option, I probably would not have finished it. I really wanted to like this book. It deals with some very real issues and socioeconomic prejudices. Unfortunately, it felt like every person in this town was given a fatal flaw just so everyone could have one. In the end, I felt the purpose of the book was more about advancing a political agenda than advancing the plot. The plot was jerky and almost completely stalled at some points. I was NOT expecting Harry Potter as some other readers were, but I was expecting plot development. The book kept hinting of big secrets, and it fell flat. I'm giving it two because there were two characters (Terri and Krystal) that I felt were developed to a degree that their motivations made sense and I could feel empathy for their situations. Very disappointing.

author: Kindle Customer
title: GREAT READ!!!
body: GREAT  Read!!! I liked the way the children  we're involved and how they  viewed  their  parents!!  A good lesson  for all parents!

author: Summer sweatshirt
title: Must read
body: Perfect. 10 of 10.

author: R. Klein
title: Dementors might like it?
body: I read this novel when it first came out, and I am still shaken by its unrelenting ugliness. Rowling presents a bitter, hopeless view of contemporary England, an England that I (an Anglophile!) do not recognize. I would not consider re-reading this novel, and I wish that Rowling had published it under a pseudonym so that it would not tempt those who love her Harry Potter series. I applaud Rowling for wanting to strike out in a new direction as a writer, but I am saddened that someone who conceived the classic Harry Potter series chose to follow it up with such a grim and disturbing tale.

author: Sally Culbertson
title: A beautiful character study
body: I am glad I decided to read this book despite some of the reviews. It is, as expected, well written.  There may not be a lot of action but if you enjoy a story about people and their motivations you will like this one.

author: Dana Phillips
body: I received the book quickly and in great condition. Just started reading recently and it is intriguing and keeps your attention. Not like the Harry Potter series if that is what your looking for from JK Rowling but worth reading. Would recommend buying from this seller and would purchase from again.

author: Edward J. Lishka
title: Casual Vacancy
body: Excellent read

author: Katie See
title: A moving, bittersweet read.
body: This book is a glimpse into reality and the overwhelming frustration and sadness that can accompany it. I felt I had been swept right into the town of Pagford and became attached to characters, relating to their very authentic and many times contemptible actions. If you loved the Harry Potter series like I did (re-reading to the point where my covers have fallen off), then this book will not disappoint. Although definitely not for children (there were times when the situations in the book made me feel sick) it holds the same magic of creating a world you can fall into with characters that will make you smile, laugh, and cry right along with them.

author: W. Flack
title: Not Harry but a great read
body: JK does it again. She creates strong well defined characters with painfully real flaws that draw you into their stories.

author: Susanne Caputo  + Mike Caputo
title: So very dismayed and disappointed that J K Rowling wrote this  piece of trash. Having read her masterpiece of the Harry Potter s
body: Another well written story. I was literally shocked at the language and plot. It was definitely below her abilities and she should never write a trashy story again. Shame on everyone connected with The Casual Vacancy. Please Miss Rowling, don't lower your standards and tarnish your reputation justly earned by th Potter creation.

author: S. Martin
title: Drags on forever and predictable ...
body: It took me forever to get through this 500 page book...and that is VERY unusal for me.  It drags on and on and on.  Its extremely predictable  and contrived.  The last 100 pages are good.  This is absolutely NOTHING like Rowlings other books.

author: Bill Blue
title: To say it was a great read it's kind of stupid that's the way I ...
body: To say it was a great read it's kind of stupid that's the way I feel these days so that's what you get I loved it

author: Claire
title: Miserable little book about miserable people who want everyone else to be as miserable as they are.
body: Bought this for cheap at a library book sale, in perfect condition - now I know why. This book is as bad as Hubert Selby's Requiem for a Dream - it's a story about people who hate themselves, hate their lives, hate each other, and hate the world. There is no happy ending, no redemption, no climactic point at which the purpose behind the horribly miserable lives of the characters is made clear. Instead, it's page after page of sullen children, bitter parents, angry neighbors, and people who want to make everyone else as miserable as they are so they'll feel a bit better about being miserable themselves.

author: emily miller payne
title: Four Stars
body: Good book. I recommend it.

author: Ms. Piggy
title: Three Stars
body: Too depressing

author: Michelle Moore
title: Five Stars
body: Love this story!

author: L. Pearsall
title: Five Stars
body: Good read.

author: Lil Karyn
title: Five Stars
body: I enjoy this book as the characters are like real people.

author: J. McDonald
title: You'll Hate Every Character...Period.
body: None of the "magic" from Rowling's other writings is on display in this book.  None.  Every character in the book is detestable.  You will be hard pressed to really like a single one.  Sure, you may feel sorry for some, especially Robby, but you won't like a single one.  There is no redeeming ending either.  It is as if Rowling tried so hard to NOT write more Harry Potter that she overwrote and made her characters as unlikable as possible.  In the end, you will hate the characters you are supposed to like the most and also hate the characters you are supposed to hate the least.  Don't waste your time with this book if you want any of the writing and character development "magic" of the Potter series.  The only thing propping this book up is the name Rowling.

author: Dr. Paula W. Buechler
title: so so, not up to Harry Potter standards
body: A lot of characters to keep track off, somewhat confusing.Story line okay but somewhat contrived and used.

author: Catherine
title: Five Stars
body: Good read. To me it ended surprisingly and tragically.

author: Fesal
title: One Star
body: Couldn't finish the book.

author: Susan Greenberg
title: NOT GOOD
body: I could not even finish this book.  It was boring and the characters were not engaging.  After a few chapters giving it a chance, I decided it was of no value to me to plow through it.  There are plenty of other books to read that are VERY GOOD to waste time on this one.

author: E. Dennis
title: Rowling isn't the greatest author out there
body: One day someone will realize J. K. Rowling isn't the greatest author out there.  She's got fantastic ideas but her writing style is stilted and rough.  All in all I was disappointed in this book when I had such high hopes.  If you're a fan of her Harry Potter series, don't go into this book thinking you'll get the same brilliance.

author: Marie
title: I've read everything from JK Rowling and am happy I read this too
body: I didn't read Harry Potter as a young child. My mom thought magic etc was of the devil so I first read the series as a 16 year old who used her license to go to the library. I was enthralled (and continue to be) by that series. I always meant to read the Casual Vaccancy when it first came out but I was worried it would disappoint me having so loved her HP series. I knew about the bad reviews and maybe that did help that I didn't have the highest sense of anticipation when I actually read the book, but I had read and enjoyed all 3 of her Robert Galbraith novels and I decided it was time to read the Casaul Vaccancy. The premise isn't the most exciting I will give you that - an empty seat on a town council - and the characters and situations sometimes are unpleasant but they are so real and the characters become so real that you start to feel as though you live in Pagford watching all the drama unfold. It somewhat reminded me of Edith Wharton novels which are complicated and sometimes do not have a clear protagonist. The thing I enjoyed about Edith Wharton (I thought of Custom of the Country) and this novel is that despite the sometimes very grim nature of the books they make you FEEL. Books won't always make you feel happy about the outcome or the character but when books make you feel some emotion towards the characters that is job well done to me because that means the characters are developed enough that they become real to the reader.

author: Monica N.
title: Complex and Smart
body: This novel follows the perspective of several people. Inevitably all plots tie together, which emphasizes just how little we know about others. It explores the depths of human emotion and the issues others face beneath the surface. It is brilliantly written. Highly recommend.

author: nici
title: Slow burn, but worth it
body: This book is very dry and slow for the first 170+ pages or so, and it's a big book. But stick with it. It's really amazing as you get further along. (Trigger warning: there is a sexual assault)

author: The Brit In America
title: Delightful read at a great price.
body: Incisive book.

author: Dani
title: but a really brilliant read if you're looking for something that's going to ...
body: Definitely not for everyone, but a really brilliant read if you're looking for something that's going to make you feel something---sadness, pity, disgust, contempt. Although this book is for adults, JK Rowling is purposeful and pointed in the way that weaves lessons on compassion, empathy, mindfulness, etc. into her work. Characterization is, in my opinion, one of her strongest aspects as a writer, and it's incredible how she makes these characters so painfully human. She doesn't hold anything back in exploring their flaws, the hypocrisy that they don't even realize they are committing. Despite all of their indiscretions, their petty and at times even cruel ways, very few of them think of themselves as being a bad person, but does anyone ever really?

author: Cynthia L. Byron
title: Four Stars
body: Lots of Characters and twists and turns.

author: Kaylee
title: Very compelling
body: After reading so many self-published books, it was a pure joy to read an Author that competently handles the written word and obviously had editors.  Rowling brings her characters to life with vivid descriptions of their environments and actions.  This book delves into humanity with their petty nastiness to their no so petty evil.  It had some slow spots but once again she grabbed me and made me want to know what was going to happen.  The characters were a basic cross section of any town and not very likeable for the most part, which makes my caring about the outcome of this book remarkable.

author: Jack
title: Empathy
body: I originally chose this book because the author is J.K. Rowling. Having grown up with the Harry Potter series, I was curious as to how this book would go. When I first started the book my initial impression wasn't good.

author: AniM
title: Behind Closed Doors
body: A difficult read.  At times it was not easy to continue, but I am not usually a quitter.  Ultimately, I feel pleased that I persisted.  The book forces "nice people" to face sordid issues.  It gives a realistic glimpse behind closed doors and one has the sense of having been educated somewhat to lifestyles beyond the normal comprehension.

author: Rachelle
title: J.K. Rowling fan
body: I'm a fan of J.K. Rowling's writing style. I find it easy to catch interest and follow along.

author: David
title: If you have a conscience and a soul, avoid at ANY cost
body: I couldn't even get past the prologue on my sample. I deleted it. The prologue alone is filled with disgusting profanity that no one should be subjected to. Avoid this book at any cost, especially if you have a conscience and a soul.

author: Ann Roy
title: ... books I have not finished even if I didn't like them but this one
body: I could not even finish it and in all my years of being an avid reader only a few books I have not finished even if I didn't like them but this one, no problem putting it down.

author: Amazon Customer
title: One Star
body: It was bloody awful.

author: wannabe writer
title: Unreadable
body: I have vast appreciation for JK Rowling as the author of Harry Potter. I understand she is branching out into contemporary adult literature. She should have stuck with what she was good at. I don't stop reading books very often, but after several days of a good yeoman's try, I couldn't continue. Not only were all the characters dysfunctional and detestable, but the plot was jumpy with poor character development and confusion between so many personages. I'm sure there are wretched places to live in the countryside of England and perhaps this needs to be documented, but this is not what I signed up for in reading entertainment.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Two Stars
body: Expected a more exciting novel!!!

author: sawaboof
title: Regular People Living Regular Lives
body: This took me a while to read. It is incredibly long. The story alternates between characters, their current life, their inner dialogues, and how they are connected to one another. I kept reading it because I was invested in some characters. Some characters I didn't care for, some I wanted to learn more about, some I felt didn't have much of a point. Just regular people living regular lives. I finished the book not knowing if it was too long or not long enough.

author: LJB
title: Good book for a book club where more than one ...
body: This JK Rawlings book has nothing to compare it to as all her other books were written for adults. She draws characters very well. She reminds me of Mauve Binchy who also draws characters very well. It has clever twists in the story. The Ghost writer is well done.  Good book for a book club where more than one opinion can be voiced, and where the entire book can be discussed. Great use of a communities understanding of its people and the real truth of what goes on behind closed doors. You definitely get the picture that JKR has experienced, seen or observed a real community, with all its veneer and its cover ups.

author: Cillairne@aol.com
title: Touching, insightful, thought-provoking.
body: J.K. Rowling IS an author!!  Harry Potter, Cormoran Strike and this.  What range!  She is becoming one of my favorites.  Always an adventure when you read one of her novels.

author: JRE
title: Depressing and dark
body: This book is depressing and dark. Every character is in some sort of pain with the end being something so horrific and ridiculous at the same time. Parts of it were so dramatic (like a soap opera) I had to skip paragraphs.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Four Stars
body: Interesting and enjoyable read

author: Joy Anderson
body: I loved Harry Potter, but after finishing this book I'll be crying myself to sleep tonight. It was good, but not what I was expecting.

author: gatrsu
title: One Star
body: Not what I expected from Ms. Rowling.

author: Mel
title: Blah
body: Nothing very exciting.  So different from harry Potter books.

author: kidd3
title: Great book
body: I don't understand why people are giving this book so few stars. There are many characters and it is hard to follow in the beginning, but once you get the plot lines and the characters down the book is a fantastic read!  I loved how the characters whom you surmised in the beginning were horrid and those you pegged to be good were not at all what they seemed. How the characters affected each other's lives without even knowing it was a wonderful touch. I loved it.

author: Just Me
title: Disappointing
body: Ms. Rowling writes much too well to give us this. It is not necessary to resort to gutter language in order to set a tone or a scene unless she is afraid her readers are too unintelligent to understand her message. Even then I think she could have found a few more people with a few good characteristics among the inhabitants. They needn't have all been so lacking in goodness and courage in order to make her point.

author: blah
title: This book is amazing! An absolute work of art
body: This book is amazing! An absolute work of art! I can't remember the last time I enjoyed a book so much..great story line..great characters that you really learn to love..and I love her wicked since of humor!

author: KD
title: I'd Like Those Hours of My Life Back
body: I have absolutely no idea why it took 639 pages to tell this story. I have no idea why almost every character who had children felt the need to berate and verbally abuse them when speaking to them. It was an uncomfortable and depressing book to slog my way through. I picked it up because the Washington Post said, "Genuinely moving....There were sentences I underlined for the sheer purpose of figuring out how English words could be combined so delightfully." I can't figure out what they were talking about. There was only one delightful sentence in the whole book.

author: Courtney
title: It was good
body: I really enjoyed this book, even though I am very used to j.k. Rowling Harry Potters series , I still enjoyed this book.

author: Hassan Moses
title: Masterful.
body: This book isn't for everyone, that's why the ratings are all over the place! It takes a few chapters to see where the book is going, but once you see....wow! This book will haunt you and force you to examine your own conscience.

author: Stefi
title: Great read
body: Very moving story. Great effortless writing which makes the book a page turner. Would recommend to others who enjoy escapism

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great book! Does not disappoint
body: Great book!  Does not disappoint.  Wonderful characters.

author: Priscilla Seaton
title: Disturbing in its accurate reflection of human nature
body: A very absorbing book. Not at all what I expected. In a very entertaining way she reveals the basic weaknesses of all the characters.

author: Judi
title: Superb
body: Lives intertwined, humor,sadness, superior storytelling.  Rowling at her finest. A great read and an unforgettable story. Certainly delivers a punch.

author: Roberta L. Sherrill
title: One Star
body: Disappointing..... finally quit reading it.  Surprisingly sophomoric.... expected much more.

author: mk
title: Four Stars
body: A worthwhile read, a complex read that requires full attention. Characters become all but actually alive. Engaging throughout.

author: andrea savage
title: Five Stars
body: this is probably one of the best stories I have ever read

author: Kacy
title: Different from other JK Rowling Books
body: Compared to most JKR books, this book had better character depth, and a less compelling plot.

author: R A. C
title: Five Stars
body: Good Read

author: Catherine Dickson
title: I wouldn't recommend to friends or family that prefer shorter
body: I feel as though JK Rowling was trying a bit too hard while narrating from a dozen different characters' points of view. It was ok and picked up near the end. However, I wouldn't recommend to friends or family that prefer shorter, easier reads.

author: More Art
title: too many other good "reads" out there. Don't waste your time or your eyestight.
body: Very slow reading and depressing. The book does not seem to go anywhere. Every time I pick it up, I think it is going to develop into something, and it never does. Too long a book, for so little a subject. Too many characters, for no reason, whatsoever. They add nothing to the storyline. I am used to a book I just cannot put down. This one is easy to put down and hard to pick back up. The characters are all disturbed and unlikeable, but this is only one problem. Filling a vacancy, is just not enough of a story line. Too many really good reads out there. Don't waste your time.

author: Bon
title: I find myself rereading some spots to better understand what I read
body: It is a little hard to read.  I find myself rereading some spots to better understand what I read.  Lots of words.

author: Susan F. Rakoczy
title: Bring back Harry Potter
body: 500 pages is much too long. The teenage boys are very one dimensional characters.  The writing was stronger towards the end.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Starts slow
body: Starts slow and ends abruptly.  But it does a nice e job of interweaving the complexities of ordinary life into a meaningful story about love, life, and death...though all in unexpected ways.

author: Yolanda L. Salazar
title: Interesting People
body: It was interesting reading about all these different families, so different, yet so similar - all so unhappy and how the deaths of two people whom they were not interested in brought their lives around to normalcy.

author: caitlin spilker
title: A Masterpiece
body: This has been easily been the most raw, gut twisting, ear pounding, heart wrenching books that I have ever read. My never ending applause go out once again to J.K. Rowling for her brilliant mind and incomparable writing prowess. She has left another book in depths of my heart.

author: JOHN A. BROUSSARD
title: Not for everyone
body: This is more a comment on the comments than a review of the book.  If you're one of those unusual persons who read and found Dante's Inferno interesting, intriguing, albeit depressing, than read this novel at your own risk.  THE CASUAL VACANCY is superbly written, and absolutely fascinating.

author: harshman2b
title: Five Stars
body: great book so far...  still reading it

author: Hello
title: Very Different for HP Fans, but Solid On its Own
body: To be completely honest, this sort of slice-of-life story isn't a genre I tend to enjoy, and I doubt I would have picked it up was I not already familiar with the author.  Kudos where kudos is good - J.K. Rowling has an almost chameleon-like ability to completely change her style for the new genre, and people who enjoy these stories about interconnected small-town people will probably enjoy this story as well, but I doubt I'd read another non-Harry Potter Rowling book.

author: Robin Foster
title: The Casual Vacancy is not my cup of tea.
body: Much ado about class and socio-economic prejudice in a small English town. Learned several English expressions and names for our Americanized culture.

author: Amazon Customer
title: loved it and would recommend
body: Took a while to get into this book, but once I did I couldn't put it down, loved it and would recommend, well done JK Rowling.

author: Susan Miller
title: It wasn't as good as the books J
body: It wasn't as good as the books J.K. Rowling wrote under the pen name Robert Galbraith so it was disappointing.  Although many characters endings were established, some were not as though a sequel would be forthcoming and I would guess that it is not the case.  It dragged a lot while I waited for something to happen and when it did, it was pretty anti-climatic.  I wanted to get caught up in the drama, but found it tawdry.  I will wait to read this author again until she writes another novel under the pen name Robert Galbraith.

author: Brittany Riley
title: but I actually enjoyed that aspect of it
body: Do not enter this book thinking you will find Harry Potter. There. We got out of the way.

author: Barbara L. Hammonds
title: Not a "feel good" read, but thought provoking.
body: I would love to be able to assign two ratings to this book, one for writing and one for "enjoyment."  So I am settling for the middle rating as an average of the two opinions.  Any who have read one or more of the Harry Potter books knows that Rowling is expert at drawing finely developed characters, setting almost tangible scenes, and bringing the reader (in my case the listener, as I "read" this on audio CD) up close and personal with the characters.  As the book progresses, one feels increasingly drawn into the lives of the many characters. The author skillfully interweaves their lives in the most natural of ways.  The actor who read the audio version of this book was superb ... his vocal representations of the characters were so consistent that after a relatively short time, when a character was speaking, the  narrative didn't need to tell you who it was - the actor's voice made it very clear.  So for writing skills, this book would receive 4 stars from me.

author: Mikaela Nadeau
title: An unexpected love! Some may not like this, but I loved the inherent differences!
body: This book truly blew me away. It was quite unexpected to be honest, and I entered not really knowing what to expect as this is a gritty adult novel about life. All aspects of life, from marriage, to teenagers, rich and poor. Just as the synopsis stated. (But much better, of course!)

author: Kindle Customer
title: Disappointing
body: I got through chapter VI before I gave up.  I don't care about these characters or their lives or problems.

author: renemol504
title: The shadow side of life
body: A brilliant book about the shadow side of life. We all have  shadow side in our own life, this book is a mirror for it. No wonder this book has many 1-star ratings, it's hard to be confronted with one's own shadow.

author: Midge
title: Good book
body: This was different from her last three mysteries. I enjoyed it but you have to follow it closely because there are so many characters.

author: Amazon Customer
title: OK
body: I could never get into it.  This was a book that I Could Put Down, it took effort to finish reading.

author: widget
title: Nice
body: Pleasantly surprised.  A deft hand at characterization, and flashes of just outstanding prose.  Love them or disdain them, you will be touched in some measure by every character. Thumbs up.

author: Amazon Customer
title: A different type of book. Not the style you ...
body: A different type of book.  Not the style you expect from J.K. Rowling, but interesting nonetheless.  Took awhile to get into the book and keep all the characters straight.

author: Laughfingman
title: Rowling did good enough job that the book was made into a ...
body: J.K. Rowling did good enough job that the book was made into a movie.

author: Em Miller
title: Dry as DUST - maybe even drier.
body: The ONLY reason I finished reading "The Casual Vacancy" is because I purchased it as soon as it came out - i.e., the "new hardback" version, and didn't want to have completely wasted my money.  I expected SO much better from this author, but was horribly disappointed.  With any good, enjoyable book, I can stop at most any point & know there will be something exciting to get back to.  In "The Casual Vacancy", I had to search the entire book for just one paragraph which called me back to reading.  Sadly, I found none.  My recommendation is - SKIP THIS ONE - entirely.

author: Seamus Mccormack
title: Not her best effort
body: Far too many characters and the whole plot could have been accomplished in far fewer pages.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
body: Loved it!

author: Kindle Customer
title: A cautionary tale that I wish everyone would read.
body: This book will haunt me but also will remind me to hold to what is important.  I think the characters are true to life, unfortunately.  The writing was excellent.

author: Beth Chaya
title: Rowling is a good storyteller, but she takes a while to start ...
body: I had trouble getting into the book at first but as I read on, the characters started to intrigue me.Rowling is a good storyteller, but she takes a while to start getting to the point of the book. It was a good character study of how one person's death affects a whole village.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Keep it up, Rowling
body: Shades of "East of Eden." I loved it, and I haven't read all the Harry Potter books. I'm suspicious some of the more negative reviews of this work are fans of her previous work, which is all well and good, but to decide that this book in particular is anything short of magnificent is insane. There were no gunfights, just a heads up, but some roller-coasters happen inside you. Highly recommend to avid readers and appreciators of beautifully written, heart breaking, soul altering drama. Keep it up, Rowling. There's a future in this for you.

author: Susan Krause
title: Disappointing
body: Could not get emotionally attached to any for the characters.

author: CF Brown
title: Lesson for Americans
body: This book gives readers a glimpse of class distinctions that are still apparently thriving in Englad. J.K. Row kings' tale is a good lesson for Americans who need to address the inequities in our own society if this country is ever going to overcome the race and class divisions that are antithesis to the American dream and the ideals on which it was founded.

author: alex
title: JK Sees Into People as Few Others Can
body: Populated by all the people we know and have known throughout our lives, this book is both realistic and frequently laugh out loud funny as she describes the insecurities and secrets of the small but proud village of Pagford Parish. I would highly recommend it.

author: Linda W.
title: Not her best book
body: I am a tremendous fan of the Harry Potter series (like a few million other people). I also enjoyed the three Cormoran Strike novels, some more than others. The quality of Ms. Rowlings writing obviously cannot be disputed. However, I am shocked to say that I did not think The Casual Vacancy was very good. There was no clear protagonistunless it was Barry Fairweather, who dies almost immediatelyand no appealing characters. By that, I mean there was no one that I cared about. It was just a long, detailed account of small town backbiting precipitated by the sudden death of a parish councilman. As underlying grudges and illicit relationships came to light, there was no sympathy or understanding evoked in me as the reader.

author: Dora L. Davison
title: Petty political machinations
body: Who would believe that the death of one village councilman would have such an affect on the whole town of Pagford. When Barry Fairbrother dies of an aneurysm, he leaves a casual vacancy on the town council. The council had been deadlocked on two issues whether to keep a low income housing project within Pagford and whether to continue support for the addictions clinic. When an election is run to determine the new council person, posts begin to appear on the town website under the Ghost of Barry Fairbrother identity revealing secrets of candidates and standing members of the council.

author: ben walker
title: Good Read
body: The author has woven a good tale.  It may be contemporary, but the use of foul language seems rather gratuitous.  But it is still a good read.

author: Bev
title: ... 3rd chapter but kept reading hoping it would get better. It never did
body: I should've quit after the 3rd chapter but kept reading hoping it would get better.  It never did.  Don't waste your time on this book. You'll be happier if you re-read the Harry Potter series.  I gave it two stars because "hate" is a strong word.  It takes a lot for me to "hate" a book.

author: Louise E.
title: Not Harry Potter
body: I found this book touching, but a much more difficult read because there were so many characters. The different points of view weren't easygoing to understand until I slogged through a good portion of the book. Worth the read, just a hard trudge.

author: Amazon Customer
title: A gripping tale of a small towns selfish pettiness
body: An amusing account on the seemingly innocent gossip and judgements within a small town and the terrible consequences such meanness can render. Funny, sad, shocking, and witty throughout. Rowling cuts to the heart of societies pettiness while making you laugh in shock at the boldness of her truths.

author: Andrea krottner
title: The Middlemarch of the New Millenium
body: The Casual Vacancy, JK Rowlings first post-Harry Potter novel, starts with a man named Barry Fairbrother. Barry lives in a suburban English town called Pagford, where he is an important man, a loving husband, and father of four. He is well-liked among the majority of the towns inhabitants; his circle of friends includes the towns lawyers, head teacher of the local school, the general practitioner, and their families. In addition to this circle of friends, Barry is a mentor to one the towns most troubled youths, Krystal Weedon. His influence even spreads all the way into local politics because Barry is a devoted member of the Parish Council. Barry is well-educated, in good health, and living a full and content life.

author: Bruce Corson
title: Enjoy the story, learn something as well.
body: JKR doesn't need my praise of course. The book, however, was a story that just kept pulling me along. And, a side-benefit is that it gave this American a bit more insight into British ways.

author: amanda
title: Five Stars
body: Very good read

author: Jinkin
title: Fabulously written
body: The characters and how they are intertwined were vividly drawn. It felt like being pulled through all of their emotions, which is a lovely feat. I couldn't put it down. In the end I guess I would describe as a novel about human frailty and hidden selves.

author: Kailey Davenport
title: One of the greatest observations of human nature in the last century
body: One of the greatest observations of human nature in the last century. Rowling understands just what it means to be a human being.

author: AjK
title: Excellent! This book is not for children and it ...
body: Excellent! This book is not for children and it proves that J.K Rowling can write books with a mature theme...

author: Nikaeigo
title: You need to read this book
body: The entire story was captivating in itself but JK Rowling's brilliant penmanship shines through once again. I love the way she draws you into the psyche of all characters, both major and minor. A small piece of all of us can be found in the Pagford residents. I had a hard time putting this book down.

author: Breda Mc Cormack
title: really enjoyed the book
body: really enjoyed the book. JK Rowling captures all of human life and has a gifted insight into the human condition. Amazing story telling. One could see similar characters in all our communities. She writes with amazing insight.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great book! Hard to get into at first because ...
body: Great book! Hard to get into at first because of the language.  I am from US and the author is British.  Very good read.

author: David M
title: Five Stars
body: Gripping story with incredible real life characters and problems.

author: Jessica L Aimers
title: I loved Harry Potter and was hoping for an equally great ...
body: I loved Harry Potter and was hoping for an equally great book in Casual Vacancy. This book is very slow and I have tried unsuccessfully to get through it many times.

author: hendrik lieffering
title: It takes a while to get into the story. ...
body: It takes a while to get into the story. However, once you get  to know the characters it becomes quite an interesting novel, giving a behind the scene's look at life and it's complexities. Well done  J.K. Rowling.

author: JessiC
title: A trainwreck you can't look away from
body: This book is not a scifi or fantasy. Its not for kids and it doesn't really have a theme. Its about miserable people living out their miserable lives while making everyone else as miserable as they can. That aside, it is a very good story. I was surprised, but but then who doesn't love a good train wreck.

author: Spade Hackle
title: Casual Vacancy, more than a casual read.
body: Lots of characters, lots of character development with the pace almost frantic at the end as the flaws and strengths of the characters are fully exposed as the inter-dependency of individuals in society is exploited by the author.

author: Sean Brennan
title: Give it a chance, and it will amaze you!
body: I started this book ages ago, and only got a few pages in, worried the whole book would let me down based on my inability to get into it quickly. A good friend recently told me to give it another chance, and I'm SO glad I did! It was such a great book! The author gave me oodles of reasons to keep turning the pages throughout. The characters are incredibly deep, each and every one of them, and Rowling gives us a backstory on almost all of them, too. So much so, in fact, that I'd be hard pressed to tell you who the main character was. There wasn't really one. All of the characters feel like the hero, and because of the brilliance of the storytelling, each one is someone else's villain, as well! Now THAT'S a great book! So trust my friend AND me on this one: The Casual Vacancy is a fantastic book!

author: Busy_Reader
title: Leaves you wanting more!
body: I absolutely love this book. I have no idea why people are comparing this story to Harry Potter. There is no reason to. Harry Potter was for children mostly. The Casual Vacancy is more of an adult book. The characters are amazingly detailed and quite frankly, I believe the that most of the readers that have given this book a low rating are not as advanced in reading if they cannot juggle the switch from character to character.

author: Joelle
title: Initially somewhat confusing as British politics differ from American town ...
body: Initially somewhat confusing as British politics differ from American town politics somewhat.  Once into the story it is very well written and keeps your attention to the very end.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not for me
body: Though it is well written it is a bit dry. Very English. Did not finish this book.

author: James Delillo
title: Formulaic.
body: Harry Potter teens with the names changed put into adult situations of drug and sex under the guise of dysfunctional families and political rivalries.

author: Berit Danielsen
title: Five Stars
body: Good descriptipn of a small britisk tonn and the People Who live There.

author: joyful27
title: Dysfunction Everywhere
body: I decided to read this book because of Ms. Rowling's great writing. What a disappointment. Half way through I couldn't believe it. It was boring!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Vulgar Language
body: I was so disappointed in J.K. Rowling!  She did not need to add the vulgar language.  I should have read more about the book before buying it.  I didn't finish the book.  Rowling dropped in my respect, :(

author: Pat
title: Five Stars
body: bought as a gift.

author: cik2392
title: she loved it!
body: Bought this for a friend. she loved it!

author: Amazon Customer
title: It was ok
body: Not your usual Rowling novel.  I expected more character development. The story left me flat and wondering why it ended this way.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Bleak, boring, bloated and underwhelming.
body: This book is absolutely terrible. Not only is the storytelling slow, it is convoluted by an overly large cast of depressing, unlikeable, self-pitying and dull characters. There is not one single likeable, relatable or central figure throughout the entire novel, every character lacks spine.Just a collection of deadbeat characters living in a washed up town somewhere on the edge of England, where we'd rather quickly forget. The depressing drawl goes on page by page without a glimmer of light or hope for any of it's doomed characters or hope that their dull lives might actually become worth reading about. It's so utterly boring and depressing, that I gave up half way and read the plot summary on Wikipedia to spare myself the rest,  which further confirmed my suspicions. It just gets worse and continues in a dull downward spiral, its bleakness is almost intentional and it is not even remotely humourous or witty. No town or story can have such a lack for interesting people. No heroes here. If you enjoy depressing, pointless reads then this is your book.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent book
body: This was a great book! Such an honest look at human nature. It made me laugh, cry, get angry and feel sad. It explores the conscious and unconscious ways we can indelibly affect others around us!

author: Joe
title: The Best Book Rowling has Ever Written!
body: This is, undoubtedly, the best book Rowling has ever written. While I am a die hard Harry Potter fan, and a fan of the Strike mystery novels, The Casual Vacancy beats them all. The multi-perspective character narrarations bring a touching feeling to the book which make the characters incredibly relatable. While many have said the book is slow, I disagree. This book is not meant to be an action packed book. Rather, Rowling brilliantly uses subtle elements of small-town warfare to keep the brilliant plot moving at just the right speed. To top it off, the writing itself is amazing. Never have I seen such a prolific author with such brilliant use of the English language. Absolutely deserves every star I gave it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Two Stars
body: A really interesting universe, but a very drawn out story.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Disappointing
body: Disappointed in this book. I found the characters hard to engage with. Whilst I kept reading to see if the situation for at least some of the characters was going to improve, I found the abrupt end unsatisfying.

author: Oh My Bookness
title: It was adequate
body: This was by far better than Cuckoo's calling, but not something I would read again.

author: LyssaWhiteFox
title: As real as it gets
body: If you are looking for a fantastical fluffy tale this is not it. From the children to the adults you see people taking whatever charge they can manage in their lives with the best intentions, but the outcome doesn't always go as planned.

author: Stacey Cooper
title: Four Stars
body: good writing. good subject but not up to par with harry potter books of course.

author: Jacqueline Jansen
title: Hm, I find there are too many characters in ...
body: Hm, I find there are too many characters in this book, it keeps jumping back and forth to the one and the other!

author: Joshua Patch
title: Stunning.  I am Stunned.
body: If you were ambivalent about Harry Potter, you're going to either moderately loathe, reluctantly adore, or vehemently challenge the moral underpinnings of this book.

author: MELANIE SUSAN MILLER
title: Great read, Rowling is a wonderful story teller
body: Great read, Rowling is a wonderful story teller.  I went back and read the last few chapters again...and I never do that!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Totally Unexpected
body: J.K Rowling brings a life to her characters that always amazes me.  As the reviews state this is not a Harry Potter fantasy but a story of the ugliness that surrounds us and sometimes lives within us.  It's not a happy story but at times you'll find humor at the thoughts and actions of the characters. The ending is unexpected but if I can predict the outcome before I'm halfway through a book than what's the point.  I like being surprised or shocked and J.K Rowlings delivers both.

author: Ellen Stahl
title: Got it! "Not in my town"
body: Wealthy, snobby, petty, jealouse, whanna bees, honest, secretive,  honorable, dishonest, poverty, rebellion, The entire gamut neatly wrapped up in one small district with 3 defined areas. All intwined , and hating it. Death and tragedy forcing the truth. Well developed story and characters, unfulfilling ending.

author: clean kitchen counter
title: Another astonishing performance.
body: J.K. Rowling does a wonderful job with a huge, complicated cast of characters. It is a compelling novel.

author: pooled ink Reviews
title: The Casual Vacancy | a gritty slice of humanity
body: pooled ink Reviews:

author: Karin
title: Character development perfection!
body: I just completed the 505 page novel and I wish there were another 500 pages. The level of character development is supreme and even though this novel follows over 20 characters, I felt I knew them all ... and I now I miss them. I highly recommend this wonderful read.

author: A Hendricks
title: I loved The Casual Vacancy
body: I loved this book. REALLY loved it. It's not something I would normally read; the description didn't sell it very well for me, but I made myself start it because I thought there was no way I wouldn't enjoy it...hello, J.K. Rowling people!  Once I began, I couldn't get enough and devoured it within three days. I could envision the characters easily and hear them delivering their lines...I laughed, I gasped, I got mad, I cried...I find myself days later wondering what would happen next. Its one of those books you'll always remember. J.K. Rowling is a master storyteller. Ms. Rowling, I bow to you.

author: Ezra Josef
title: Very moving look into the lives of people in a small town
body: -In this story of a small town in England, we follow the interconnecting lives of about a half dozen families, as their insecurities, and family secrets slowly are revealed.

author: Amazon Customer
title: One Star
body: Hated this book! It is boring and a waste of time.

author: D. Karty
title: Disappointed
body: As I suspect from many people who are fans of Rowling, I guess I expected family friendly - this was not.  I would NOT recommend this to Harry Potter fans.  I know this is not intended for that group, but I certainly did not expect a story about the pettiness of people and not one redeeming character with whom I could identify.  Very disappointed

author: David Richards
title: Snapshot of village politics.
body: Great "character" book.  Realistic plot.  Thorough understanding of the machinations of a small town.

author: Joy
title: Not My Type of Story...
body: Had a hard time finishing this book. I wasn't expecting anything similar to Harry Potter in terms of genre or anything like that. I will say that book is well written...but the story just didn't appeal to me.

author: SMM3
title: Rowling Never Disappoints
body: I have been a fan of JK Rowling since I first picked up the Sorceror's Stone. I also loved her Cormoran Strike series, so I was excited to read this book. There are alot of characters to follow, which made it a bit difficult for me at first, but once I figured out who everyone was and how they all relate to each other, I couldn't put it down. Such a great story about so many people's lives, and how they are all woven together in a small town filled with so many large opinions. What I liked most about this story was you get to see the light and dark of every character. You think you may hate one person and side with another, but a few chapters later your loyalties are switched. I would highly recommend this book!

author: Kathryn Parker
title: Dreary
body: I don't know why anyone would want to read this book. Rowling has a nice ensemble cast and weaves the different stories together well, although at first it was difficult to keep up with who's who. The problem is once you've figured out who everyone is, you no longer want to read the book, because they are all dreary, awful people. The ending was also unpredictable and yet predictable at the same time...almost a cop out. I'm glad I got the book from the library instead of buying it.

author: Natalie
title: Awesome!
body: I love the Harry Potter books and was more than pleasantly surprised by this book. The writing style and story are VERY different from the HP books, and I think the reviews here are mixed because people were expecting more of the same HP vibe from the author. This book is very real and sometimes graphic to the point that I do not recommend children or young teenagers read it.I will say that the graphic nature isn't there for shock value; it's an important part of the story. If you're looking for more material appropriate for the HP age range, though, look elsewhere.

author: Cea
title: Really really worth the read.
body: I've avoided all things HP but I read a review about this book and it was spot on. Fabulous character study, engaging story. Author is a great story teller. I'm still going to avoid the hp hype but I will look for other fiction by this author.

author: Marilyn A-T
title: Five Stars
body: Great book!

author: Michele Ferfoglia
title: Quite good although it took me a little while to get ...
body: Quite good although it took me a little while to get my head around all the characters, but once I did it was good :)

author: Evenshade
title: I know she's a great writer.
body: Depressing and vulgar in my opinion.  I know she's a great writer....just not "my cup of tea".

author: G. Huertas
title: Sex, drugs and scandal.
body: My first impression was that everyone is just so hateful and spiteful but that slowly changes as the book progresses.

author: H. Payne McIntosh
title: Four Stars
body: good read

author: Graeme
title: Death in an English country village
body: A Casual Vacancy by JK Rowling

author: kelly rosenberg
title: Five Stars
body: Excellent book!

author: Mea
title: Great read, a little slow to start but stick ...
body: Don't expect a Harry Potter novel. Great read, a little slow to start but stick with it. Nice twist, and an interesting read. She can do no wrong in my book.

author: Patricia
title: Weird hypothesis of a social situation but an enjoyable read
body: This is essentially a tale of what happens when the keystone, the factor that balances something (in this case, a small town) is removed and everything falls apart. There is a vacancy on the town council following the sudden, totally unexpected death of the person who had managed to keep the various factions in balance despite their imminent need to make a very controversial decision. All hell breaks loose. Rowling focuses on several families, portraying them in all their complexity while portraying the downhill spiral. The teenage children of the families and their treatment or mistreatment becomes a key in proceedings. The book is definitely worth reading!

author: A. H. Clay
title: Incredibly moving, sad, but beautiful
body: Astonished at the negative reviews.This incredibly moving character study stunned me. I recognized myself in far too many of the people. Beautifully illustrated how a small group of people can see/hear/experience the same thing and yet come away with vastly different impressions. It shows how easy it is to dismiss someone we find unpleasant, forgetting that there's a fully developed human in there, with experiences and motivations of which we know nothing. No character comes away unscathed by his or her choices, or indeed, by their backgrounds. It's probably too sexual for most high schools to use, but what an excellent discussion piece about assuming things about others and judging people. Also a scathing review of current social services for the 'dregs' of society. I didn't realize Rowling had a background in social work until after I read this.

author: frequent Amazon shopper
title: It's true as some reviewers have written that there is little joy in this book
body: This book is now one of my favorites. It's true as some reviewers have written that there is little joy in this book. It describes some of the worse in humanity, but there is definitely hope in there. It is a perfect description of how connected we all are as humans and how each event or choice we make can influence those around us. The first time I read this book, I have to admit it was difficult to keep focused as you're bouncing around in the minds of different characters, but the second time I read it, I was absolutely overwhelmed with the "big" message she has in here about reaching out to others and what a difference we can make in each other's lives. I highly recommend this book to anyone who is interested in a thoughtful read.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I loved the writing style that J
body: I loved the writing style that J.K. Rowling used. It definitely gave a different perspective and feel from other books I've read, I felt a lot more connected to each and every character.

author: dfr
title: Three Stars
body: Too depressing for me

author: vandolin
title: A Change Of Pace
body: This book is a lot different than the urban/erotic genre I usually read or listen to but i enjoyed it. I kinda got lost with the characters until I had listened to almost 60% of it. I realized that most of the book was a setup for the surprising ending. It is a pleasant change of pace. I would seek out more offerings from this author in the future for entertainment.

author: Penelope Grey
title: Enjoyable
body: I've read all of JK Rowling's works and love her writing.  Her characters are very real.  The story had depth. This was enjoyable but unlike her thrillers this one was easy to put down at night...but I did look forward to picking it back up.

author: Michelle Good
title: Two Stars
body: Just couldn't get into it.

author: J. Carroll
title: A bit too much like a soap opera....
body: Landing on small town English politics for her next piece leaves Rowling in a tough place. Comparisons to The Potter series are inevitable, but this almost doesn't travel far enough away to avoid these comparisons. Overloaded with characters and with all of them being drawn pretty broadly, The Casual Vacancy just doesn't have enough dramatic heft to make up for these individuals. It plays out like an extended soap opera episode and fares about as well dramatically, save for Rowling's terrific descriptions and settings that keeps this readable rather than risible.

author: kylie
title: Four Stars
body: A little tough to get to know all the characters, but worth the effort. Fabulous read.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I don't think there was a single happy character in this book
body: I don't think there was a single happy character in this book. I hate to say it, but overall it was an incredibly depressing read.

author: Sharon Murray
title: Loved it!
body: I enjoyed reading this. Well done! Thanks, J.K.Rowling.

author: KrisT117
title: A Remarkable Book
body: If you pick up this book expecting anything akin to the Harry Potter series, you'll be disappointed. However, if you want to read an incisive and moving look at a small English town as it deals with the clash between the middle class and the poor, choose this and you'll be well-rewarded.

author: bh35023
title: I LOVED HARRY POTTER BUT I COULD NOT EVEN FINISH THIS ...
body: I LOVED HARRY POTTER BUT I COULD NOT EVEN FINISH THIS BOOK.  I HAVE TRIED TO READ IT 4 DIFFERENT TIME STARTING AT THE BEGINNING EACH TIME AND JUST COULD NOT FINISH.

author: Sara
title: It took be a while to get into it and through it but very good
body: I did find myself really believing the characters.  I was shocked at the state of these families and there was just too much drama for me but I would definitely recommend this book to others

author: Dolores
title: Not what I expected
body: Harry Potter was one of my favorite series.  This was boring, hard to get through, and didn't have much of a plot.  I was disappointed.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Modern life and relationships; tragedy well told
body: A modern tale of life in the not so well off and definitely not so happy muggle world. No magic involved. But if you study the way Rowling brings a character to life and the interaction between characters, her talent of writing has obviously continued.

author: ALL WRITE
title: Too crowded to be vacant
body: Too many characters with similar names. Pacing irregular with quick fixes in the nebulous plot.

author: RMM
title: I would recommend this novel to anyone in search of a good ...
body: This book is as far from Harry Potter as can be, but being a die-hard HP fan has not kept me from enjoying this book. While the characters are not very likable, they are a testament to what really does happen in the world. I still found the book to be extremely well-written and in Rowling's unforgettable voice. Overall, I would recommend this novel to anyone in search of a good read as long as they refrain from comparing it to Harry Potter, for they will be disappointed.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Good book but a little slow
body: The book was entertaining and the writing is good. It is a little slower than some of her other reads.

author: Scottie
title: Like You Don't Already Know
body: Super Author

author: Lee R Greenberg
title: The study of characters was interesting. It seemed so ...
body: The study of characters was interesting.  It seemed so real, but I found that most of the characters were very negative.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
body: Great writing, great characters

author: Gun in Ada
title: She is no Ruth Rendell
body: She is trying too hard which makes the profiles too shallow and formulaic. If you like Stephen King, this is for you. No, I don't like Stephen King, either.

author: KC Baltimore
title: I did not like this book
body: I did not like this book.  I did not make it past the first few chapters.  Just a personal preference, I like a "lighter" read.  Too intense for me.  I have too much drama in my life to get sucked into a book with such dark characters (mind you, it was just the first few chapters before I stopped reading).  I don't mind a few expletives here and there, but the F*word was just too frequent, along with some other expletives, which distracted me from enjoying the underlying story.

author: j bauer
title: Pompously written and deadly boring.....
body: I'd give it a zero if I could.  J.K. Rowling writes to impress herself with a thesaurus as her style companion.  Why use a perfectly understandable adjective when an archaic, incomprehensible one can be found? Even after skipping huge chunks of each chapter, this book labors on at glacial speed producing utter stupor.  I was so bored that I didn't even peak at the ending.  Who could possibly care how these inanimate subjects with their doleful predicaments end up?

author: Britt Peters
title: Not a fun read, but a necessity for literary lovers
body: When I began reading Casual Vacancy I didnt know what to expect.  I had read all of J.K. Rowlings Harry Potter series and I suppose I expected something a bit more fantasy driven. Casual Vacancy was the polar opposite. It is gritty in its realism and provides tragic real life situations overlapping and snowballing into a final triumph for one very unlikely character.

author: mc
title: I liked it.
body: A dysfunctional town makes for interesting character development. I liked it.

author: avanta7
title: Engaging, well-written, and genuinely shocking
body: Read from December 31, 2015 to January 08, 2016

author: Amazon Customer
title: I liked it.
body: Hey, I liked it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I was absolutely fascinated by every character and loved reading about their seemingly simple
body: While I can't say it was exciting exactly in the sense that, say Harry Potter is, I was absolutely fascinated by every character and loved reading about their seemingly simple, yet crazy lives. It's been a long time, if ever, that I've read a book that was more about the characters themselves than events happening around them. Loved it

author: Amazon Customer
title: The characters' own stories are enhanced by their intersections with ...
body: The characters' own stories are enhanced by their intersections with the other characters.  The development held my interest to the end.

author: Michigan Steve
title: out of the ordinary
body: At first I hated all the characters; by the end a few had me feeling for their problems. I realized that they were all just people...some good points, some bad...but found it hard to like any of them!

author: Sarah Jane
title: but I think Rowling's writing actually shines brighter when it's free from the YA constraints of epic battles and happy endings.
body: Rowling more than proves her 'adult level' writing chops with "The Casual Vacancy".

author: Richard Peterson
title: Truth
body: It has been some time since this was published. My ex-fiance (who was an avid Harry Potter reader) hated this book. I have read the Harry Potter as well, but this books hits home for me. I lived in a small town, where everyone thought their poop didn't stink. J. K. Rowling shows the absolute reality of small towns in this book.

author: ELISABETH
title: as expected
body: as expected

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
body: Like it

author: Beth N
title: Tough going
body: I really wanted to like this book, but I just couldn't get rolling with it. It had some very engaging moments, but there were too many characters with intertwined plots that just weighed down the entire book. I slogged through to the end, but did not find a payoff that made it worth my time to read.

author: yespat
title: So Fantastic!
body: The first time I "read" this book, I used the Audio CDs.  That was great.  Then a year or so later I watched the HBO 3 part movie of the book.  After that I decided to read the book again and this time using the actual book instead of the audio cds.  I'm glad I did.  Her sentences are so jam packed with perfection again and again, that it's easy to miss out on the details when just listening.  I liked the book a lot the first time and the second time I see So much more in it.  A must read.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good book with a meaningful ending
body: Yes, it wasn't Harry Potter. Yes, it was odd. But I kept with it and ended up liking it. Good book with a meaningful ending.

author: Louis Stanfield
title: Now, for something a bit different......
body: Really good book.  Rowling is just a very talented author.

author: Mary Jo
title: Was disappointed
body: I found it impossible to care about any of the characters.

author: An avid reader
title: "F-word" used constantly by almost all
body: J. K. Rowling thinks most people at unable to carry on a conversation without profanity, and use of the "F-word" at least once per sentence. The characters are almost all similarly morally derelict - racial bigots, social snobs, heroin addicts, promiscuous adults & teenagers (including one adult female attempting to seduce a teen boy), abusive husband, etc.  In the end, it all leads to a depressing, unsatisfying ending, with one like able character moving and the other one dead. Truly regret investing any time in this book.

author: SHarrison
title: Disappointing
body: Did not like this book and was disappointed.  Most books I tend to read multiple times and share with others.  This is one that I will NOT read again and certainly do not plan to share with others.

author: Dave B
title: Big issues for humanity writ on a small canvas
body: I found this to be a tightly woven and utterly enjoyable "beneath the surface" exploration of lives and politics in a small rural village environment. JK Rowling skillfully peels away the multiple layers of peoples' lives and relationships following the sudden death of village leader. This eminently readable (page-turner) novel never failed to surprise with new twists as the complexities in the village of Pagford and nearby Yarvil were carefully unpicked. JK Rowling provoked me to consider issues of class, prejudice and differing generational perspectives, and left me with a satisfyingly appropriate and very  poignant ending.

author: Sandra Gibbs
title: Slow reading for me. It jumps around so much ...
body: Slow reading for me. It jumps around so much. Many characters to follow. Interesting how a persons life impacts others.

author: xeric mama
title: Not much until the very end.
body: Well written, but I only became interested toward the very end, and then it was over!

author: Roxanne
title: Five Stars
body: Really moving.

author: Claireatwaves
title: ' Because it's certainly up there with great, rich texts to study
body: Incredibly observant portrayal  of people's behaviour in face of a death - but it could have been in the event of any major life event.

author: Daniel Munson
title: Save yourself some time and energy and skip this one.  There's no magic here.
body: Every small town has its leaders, some loved, some loathed.  Barry Fairbrother was a much-loved city council member in Pagford, but when he drops dead, suddenly, still in his forties, the town is in shock.  But the shock quickly makes way for a race for Barry's council seat.  The quiet village will face a slough of in-fighting, back-biting, and the airing of others' dirty laundry.

author: Wilder
title: I enjoyed it, knowing full well that Rowling was trying ...
body: I enjoyed it, knowing full well that Rowling was trying something different.  An odd story, but it all fits in the end, of course.  If you are willing to let Rowling try something different, you will enjoy it.  If you peg her as a one-story author and condemn her to foerever expanding upon the worl of Harry Potter, you will be disappointed.  This must be read as if it was written by a totally different author, and judged on its own merits.

author: Laura
title: Great book
body: Very good character development

author: Lynn T. Hilder
title: Two Stars
body: Disappointing. Not many sympathetic characters..

author: VALHALLEY
title: The story is sad but the ends satisfied the means
body: As far away from Harry Potter as you could get. The characters are so well-developed you can actually "see" the town either riding on a bus or cruising down the hill on a bike. Every character is complex, not just what they impress to be on a first contact. J.K. Rowling does an amazingly well job of pulling the reader in so you can smell the bleach poured hastily through the putrid bathroom.

author: J_No
title: A Struggle to Read
body: Very different from JK Rowling's other novels. This book features stronger character development, but the storyline is lacking (where generally, I find the magic of her writing is in the story-telling. She is a wonderful story-teller). I found this book a struggle to read. The first chapter aside, I found this book to be very slow-moving, and hard to get into. It took me far longer to read than it usually takes me to read a novel. It finally picked up about 2/3 of the way through, but I hated the ending. Overall, I really wouldn't recommend. Not up to her usual standards.

author: Athena Eleftheriou
title: Good read. Bye Harry, Hi Harold.
body: Rowling did a great job on this book. The character development is great and you keep wanting to pick it up to read even when you should be sleeping!

author: Kathleen G.
title: Mini-series sucked but that's quite possibly because the book was so ...
body: I ordered HBO NOW just so I could watch this as it was adapted to the small screen. Mini-series sucked but that's quite possibly because the book was so good.

author: sorenrv
title: Highly recommended slowly unfolding drama
body: Before starting to read The Casual Vacancy I read a number of online review. They really intrigued me because there seems to be so many different opinions. That can be a an indicator of a really interesting book.

author: Janet Hughes
title: Not what you expect
body: The Casual Vacancy is very slow to begin, moves up a gear in the middle and explodes into a grand finale. it was on whole redeemed by the excellent reading by  Tom Hollander.

author: Estuardo Alpirez
title: ... is hard to read and sometimes is kind of boring, but the rest is superb
body: The first third of the book is hard to read and sometimes is kind of boring, but the rest is superb, I give the book five stars because the 2/3 parts of the book are worth reading..

author: n2zsm
title: This book is the blueprint for great books
body: This is an absolutely fantastic book, and the CD version is beautifully read. I enthusiastically recommend it!

author: Amber Jordan
title: Five Stars
body: Loved it!

author: VickyT
title: Small town, big story
body: Small town, big story. But of course, it happens to be about human nature and all of our filth. The idea of living in a small town doesn't prevent you to experience the nightmare we can create for ourselves.

author: Meaghan Miller
title: Try harder if you don't like it at first
body: I tried to read this when it first came out, but gave up after 200 or so pages. I just couldn't keep all the characters straight. This year I decided to give it another go, and succeeded. While reading the first half, I would fall asleep sorting out characters in relation to each other endlessly. Finally I got it! Once you know them, it becomes an addictive tale. I'm not sure there was a single truly likable character, but that was ok. They were average people with average petty squabbles that were fun to read. It reminded me a bit of Oscar Wilde, making fun of people who fancy themselves better than those around them for money reasons. Nothing unexpected happens and life carries on, but it is a lovely snapshot of life for a town I certainly wouldn't want to live in. Bravo Rowling, even if I did have to try twice.

author: Natasha Howard
title: JK Rowling brings her writing to the adults
body: JK Rowling uses her attention to character and detail to bring a story of a small England town to life. It's deep and dark with moments of light but excellently written.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not Harry Potter, but definitely JK Rowling
body: Don't read this thinking it's a Harry Potter book. It isn't. It's dark and soul-searching and will leave you feeling thankful for the blessings in your life. But it's a beautiful look into the magic that is JK Rowling and the nuances of a small British town.

author: Heather
title: Simply amazing
body: If someone had given me a brief summary of this book, and withheld the author's name, I probably never would have bothered with it. I only gave it a chance because I love HP so very much, and I'm so very glad I did! It starts  off being a dark comedy about one man's death and small town politics, and  becomes a rich and intricate drama illustrating how connected we all are and how compassion (and lack of it) can change everything. I feel  that I'm a better person for having read this book. I'm not  even kidding, it affected me that deeply.

author: M. Ann Suter
title: Nothing casual about these lives.
body: At every turn, as the reader comes closer to understanding each character, one is pushed to look at their own lives.  The interactions, assumptions about others, the calamities, the small moments of self awareness interlaced with societal dogmas hold the readers attention and totally masks the ending.

author: Amazon Customer
title: For those that find beauty in bittersweet reality
body: I seldom post a review for a book that has more than 100 reviews already posted--who really looks at more than 10-15 when deciding what to read. I am mainly adding one here because it is ridiculous that people feel entitled to poorly review a book they have never read because they don't like the price. I didn't have a problem with paying to purchase this book, at the then much higher price, a few days after its release. It was very well written, and very realistic. If you like happy stories with light story lines and a happy ending don't read this, you won't be able to handle it. If you occasionally enjoy a dark dose of reality you will probably find this to your taste. Anyone that grew up in a small town will likely read this book and immediately be able to identify the characters to people they know.

author: Rich
title: I don't understand the hate for this book
body: Odd. I don't understand the hate for this book. If you like a bit of drama mixed in with your social issues, then you might like this book as much as I did. I have professional interests in planning and public administration so it was nice to see this in the context of fiction. Redevelopment, social services, political manipulation, there are a lot of things going on in the mix. Rowling also does a good job of developing love-to-hate-them characters. This isn't literary fiction and I could tell Rowling was having some fun. I recommend it!

author: John
title: Two Sentence Synopsis
body: 1.  Barry Fairbrother dies.

author: Krista
title: Not a bad read
body: A friend recommended this to me and although it is not my usual read I managed to get into it.  the characters became very developed and truly set the scene for story.  I found it a bit slow at times but I am probably a little impatient with this type of read, however overall I found it quite enjoyable and a little bit of fun.

author: T. Turner
title: Great story
body: Started slow, took a while to get into the characters and understand the connections but once it gets going it is hard to put down. A very enjoyable tale that I did not want to end.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
body: Tremendous book!

author: sivyaleah
title: Have not been able to get into this book - ...
body: Have not been able to get into this book - hasn't pulled me in at all.  Put it down for now, and will try again at a later date.

author: Lynn C Colonnese
title: I really did not like this book
body: I really did not like this book.  The story had no merit to it and I really did not care about the characters. The only feeling was towards the children.  I felt sorry that they all had such unstable parents and no wonder they all had problems.  This was a whole town of stupid people.

author: Andrea C
title: Interesting story
body: I really enjoyed this story. It isn't the fastest, but it was interesting and I thought the characters were fun.

author: AMK Reviews
title: I really wanted to love this book but it was impossible
body: I really wanted to love this book but it was impossible. I came so close to scrapping it so many times but suffered through it anyway. I hated all the characters, not a one was likable nor could I relate to any of them. A boring story about a bunch of self-centered boring people that no one cares about. I didn't get the point. Very disappointing from such a great story teller. Sorry.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I really enjoyed the yarn
body: It took me a little time to get into the book but as the content unfolds it becomes compelling and a page turning.  I really enjoyed the yarn.

author: Jason Debord
title: Just Okay
body: The book was okay. I think any book from the Harry Potter was better. At least I didn't give up on reading to its conclusion.

author: Outdoor Momma
title: Great book
body: This was a great book.  No it's not about a boy wizard, nor is it written for children.  The characters and location are described well and I found the plot to move steadily though the book.  There are a lot of characters and it did take me some time to get them sorted out, but I loved the book overall.

author: Katie Curry
title: I hated the ending
body: Marvelous book. I hated the ending, but that's just because it made me sad. The writing was spectacular.

author: Doctor G.
title: This one was not for me. I have loved everything else she's written (with exception to the little after the fact Harry guides.
body: I didn't read it when it first came out, even after I knew who wrote it. I'm a huge Harry Potter fan and wasn't ready for her foray into the adult world. Not that Harry didn't evolve into the adult world. I read her first Cormoran Strike book and loved it. I have read the whole series and am hoping for another. I decided that, maybe it was time to give this a chance.

author: KJ
title: Not your typical JK Rowling but one can assume that ...
body: Not your typical JK Rowling but one can assume that was her intent.  I will try a sample before purchase on her next new venture.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Outstanding
body: I never knew a book could make me feel so much emotion. As a guy who grew up with Harry Potter this book totally blew my mind. I loved every page, JK Rowling is a master of story telling and language. I laughed hysterically at times and wept like a baby at times. Read it over two months ago and I still think about it. I'm trying to get people I know to read it simply because I want someone to talk to.

author: David Charlebois
title: None better than her
body: J.K. Rowling is a master of words and imagination.  None better than her.  I'm thoroughly enjoying her Cormeran Strike who-done-it series!

author: Amazon Customer
title: It is a book that is not for the light-hearted ...
body: It is a book that is not for the light-hearted. It is deep and emotional. I was quite surprised that J.K. Rowling wrote this book; however, I also understand it from her background.

author: Diana B.
title: Its not a feel good book, a fictional story about small town life ...
body: Lots of characters difficult to keep track of.  Its not a feel good book, a fictional story about small town life in England and various family problems that get shook up by postings on the town website after a vacancy on the town board.  Disappointing.

author: Enobie Wun
title: Two Stars
body: Story turned me off and went nowhere. A real let down after Harry Potter.
