body: Our book club is reading it. It took a long time for me to "get into it." The characters are super flawed, interesting, awful & also just human! Nobody is safe. The ending knocked my socks off & after a week I'm still angry about it! :) I think that means it was good.

author: Maureen Chernick
title: Casual Vacancy opinion
body: Am in the middle of Casual Vacancy and so far I love it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: anything by this author is amazing.
body: Anything by this author is amazing, I would recommend it wholeheartedly, she can write, gets you involved into the story line and it's just a great read.

author: Kathleen Beetar
title: Excellent Mystery
body: I chose the mystery because of J.K. Rowling's authorship. I have never read her work before, and wanted to try something. But the problems of the detective are quite depressing.

author: Anna L. Crepps
title: BOREING!!
body: I found it so exceedingly boreing that I couldn't  even finish reading it.  It was a selection for my book club.

author: Amazon Customer
title: casual vacancy
body: Honestly I really liked it.  The only complaint I have is she jumps around with so many characters I found it confusing for a good portion of the book.  It is a very sad but thought provoking novel.

author: Escargot
title: Worth reading but
body: Interesting but way too many characters introduced. The story takes a while to start and it is hard to find a character that you can root for as they are all kind of mean or bad. Lots of gossiping too.

author: KATH KEATING
title: Not exciting
body: I found this book to be too slow in the telling. I've no doubt these small towns are well described and at least it is more realistic of every day events and class prejudices.

author: A. Jones
title: I wanted to like it
body: It's interesting that the majority of the reviews on this book are either at one end or another.

author: Belen
title: awesome book
body: This book is a great, it shows you the views on social issues from so many different characters. Great read.

author: Colette diegel
title: Dreadful book
body: Nothing happened in this novel just people being elected to a local council. Not worth reading I quit half way through

author: kathleen murphy
title: very disappointing
body: so disappointing... where is the story.. where is the plot?.. just a lot of characters that are not very interesting mulling around the "vacancy"... ! Hmmm might as well read a tacky mag.

author: headoverhooves
title: An intimate look at the lives behind the masks we wear
body: I loved this book. Rowling shows herself to have a very good understanding of, and a great ability to communicate the effects of things like poverty, childhood trauma, addiction, and the hidden issues in everyday life. None of the characters in this book are purely good or evil. If you want a book about good guys and bad guys this is not for you. This books takes a deep look into the private lives of many individuals in a community and how they interact. As with real humans, the characters have good and bad sides and they all have reasons for being as they are. I love that this book develops and shares the complicated lives of many characters (similar in my opinion to '100 Years of Solitude' or 'Circus in Winter'). This is not a happy tale, mind you. It examines extremely serious events with brutal honesty. Rowling's writing is superb and fearless. I highly recommend 'The Casual Vacancy'.

author: Joyce E. Williams
title: disappointed
body: Loved the Harry Potter series, her new book never engaged me.  It was my book club book and I just could not finish it.

author: Catherine Moore
title: Grown Up book
body: J.K. Rowling's writing is just as superb in this book as it was in her Harry Potter series, but this is definitely a "grown up" book.  The characters are real and the stories are real life and a very harsh reality at that. It's not a book that will leave you with a warm and fuzzy feeling at the end, but it's a good read.

author: klm
title: Not what I expected
body: This is a rather dark book,but with elements of humor and compassion.  It very well written and well worth reading.

author: LaDunn
title: Excellent!
body: I really did not know what to expect when I started this book I was pleasantly surprised. The characters are all interesting and the story kept my attention to the very surprising end.

author: zugzwang18
title: Intriguing read!
body: JK Rowling has captured "It's a Wonderful Life," by exploring the lives of people that a single death touches and their selfish conniving attitudes. The transition from teen read to adult literature is refreshing. I recommend this to the eclectic reader.

author: Huskerfan2915
title: Book was terrible!!
body: Book was terrible!!  I should have stopped reading after the first chapter! Not worth your time to read it all the way through.

author: pja08
title: J K Rowling.
body: I was a bit disappointed with the book, but possibly because I was expecting something more like the Harry Potter series.  It is a good read, just not what I was hoping for.

author: Merlin
title: If this were a first novel...
body: .. I don't think it would have been published.  I think this author rode her name to a book people would not have purchased otherwise.  I have not read the Harry Potter series, so I had no bias even though I came to the novel with high hopes.  The title refers to a empty council seat after the holder's death, but I think Rowling is simply trying to show how vacant, or vacuous, people and humanity are generally.  Unfortunately, the 'vacancy' here can also refer to the book itself.

author: garry walker
title: casual vacancy
body: it very good I would recommend it to anyone to read but then I love JK Rowling have a good time xx

author: captain
title: Rowling always pleases!
body: A bit difficult to follow at first as Rowling switches between characters and settings. Rowling sucks you in immediately with a death and interesting characters to follow along.

author: Phyllis Taylor
title: Boring
body: I chose this book because I really enjoyed her other adult book "The Cuckoos Calling".  In "Casual Vacancy" I found it difficult to connect to any of the characters and took forever to finish as it was so boring for me.  When you can't invest in any character it is difficult to get into the storyline.

author: drumnbasskitty
title: tale of many threads woven to draw you in slowly
body: slow starting. takes a little bit to figure out all the parallel lives and how they connect. before you know it, you are drawn in to pagford and the peculiar relationships therein. very raw, real, and refreshing. still, you can hear rowling's authorial voice in the careful descriptions of people, places, feelings, and interactions.

author: Happy Padre
title: book is vulgar and innapropriate
body: Bought this book for my wife for Christmas. Very disappointed. Full of vulgar language and sexual themes. It will be tossed unread.

author: Susan Beamon
title: village life
body: I have not read any of the Harry Potter books yet, so I had no preset idea of how the author would or should handle the material. The book is about an English village, on the edge of a growing town, that really wants to stay the small, insular village it has always been, without the troubles and problems of an increasingly varied population. This cannot be, so everybody is unhappy with conditions. One of the governing council of the village dies, setting up covert warfare for the future of the village. The story is bracketed by death, resulting in changes to many lives. I enjoyed this book, even if some of the people in it could, in my opinion, use a swift kick.

author: Barbara L Cavanagh
title: My least favorite book
body: This book did not hold my attention, it was easy to put down and if I didn't pick it for my bookclub I wouldn't have finished it.

author: Lorna Harper
title: A Good Story
body: I found this to be a good , well written, interesting and hard to put down.

author: Jennifer Cameron-Smith
title: Serious, awful damage to peoples lives.
body: Barry Fairbrother, Pagford Parish Councillor, is taking his wife Mary out for dinner to celebrate their 19th wedding anniversary when he dies suddenly. Barry's death results in a casual vacancy on the Pagford Parish Council, and a number of people are keen to fill it. There are those who want to carry on Barry's work, and those who want to put a stop to what he was trying to achieve. Like most small towns, Pagford has its politics and its secrets.

author: MaryEllen Putnam
title: Excellent reading!
body: What a great story! From the master story teller! I loved it! Let's hope that J.K. writes more books for the adult audience!

author: rensk
title: Was Sorry I Bought This One!
body: I pre-ordered this book when it was offered  because I had read the "Harry Potter" series and expected to enjoy a new genre from this author.  I thought I understood that this is not in the same category as Harry Potter; but to me, it did not even seem that it was the same author.  I really could not get into this book even though I read it to the end (painfully) -- I am not a prude, but the language was quite unexpected!  Sorry, but I will never order another of her books until they have been thoroughly reviewed.

author: margaret barugh
title: Enjoyable
body: I was impressed by Ms Rowling's first adult novel and I look forward to many more.  Definitely a book I passed on to friends.

author: Danielle Edwards
title: Brilliant
body: I enjoyed this book as I've enjoyed all of J.K. Rowling's books. This book should not be completed to Harry Potter, it's not written for the same audience! I found the book to be beautiful and disturbing at times! We as humans display some very disgusting, yet amazing behavior in situations! This book displays that perfectly!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Muggles can be depressing
body: It was so disappointing to only read the most depressing side of a village people life.  I had to reread HP to get over it.

author: Barry Silverstein
title: A total downer
body: JK, you might want to stick to children's literature. There is little here to excite, engage or uplift a reader. There isn't a single character who it is easy to like. The adults are petty and spiteful, their children are hateful and hopeless, and the interactions between the two are disheartening. Maybe this is what "reality" is supposed to be like in a small town environment, but it certainly doesn't make for good reading. Granted, Rowling is an accomplished writer who spins a good phrase here and there. Still, this is a completely depressing book that will leave you feeling rather slimy. Just goes to show the world's most celebrated author is human, too. This is a stinker.

author: Bob the norske
title: Outstanding Creation!
body: My expectations for this book were mixed.  First the mediocre ratings and reviews concerned me a little.  However I had already read Rowling and so was excited to get started on it.

author: susbark
title: Interesting
body: This is a good study of human nature.  Rowling demonstrates great perception and writes well.  However, I found that the book drags.  This is not a book for someone who wants action. Rather it is a thoughtful analysis of how people behave and the consequences of their behavior.  I rate at three stars because I love books that deal with human nature, but this one bordered on boring.

author: Book Addict
title: A grudging 3.5 stars
body: The story stars the death of Barry Fairbrother: father, husband, parish counsellor and general good guy. Barry means different things to different people, but sufficient to say that he leaves a gap in the lives of those who knew him. There's no avoiding the cliche of 'ripples over the surface of a pond' as his friends and acquaintances manoeuvre to fill the void - the most significant of which is his now 'vacant' (the casual vacancy of the title)parish council seat.

author: R S
title: It's not Harry Potter, which is a good thing
body: After getting this book as a gift for Christmas 2012 and procrastinating on reading it, I finally finished it last night after slowly reading it during a period of a few months. The immediate revelation is that this book is not Harry Potter 8, it's not fantasy or teen fiction, it's harrowing literary fiction that delves deep into human nature, and through a cast of diverse and intelligently-constructed characters, shows how all of us can be led to resent our fellow humans. The plot is somewhat threadbare, which is fine; it develops in much the same way a season of Mad Men does, with the bulk of the material exploring and developing the characters and showing us the facets of their personalities, before presenting two satisfying climaxes near the end where, finally, the stakes are raised for these characters and we glimpse them in their most vulnerable states. The characters in the book are very strong; Fats, Gaia, Suhkvinder, and Andrew have replaced the main trio from Harry Potter as my favorite Rowling teenage characters. Reading their subplots makes me wish that Harry Potter had had more swearing and sex, because Rowling masterfully portrays these adolescents without resorting to hyperbole or cliche, and it would've been awesome to see a Rated R conversation between Harry and Draco or Ron and Hermione instead of the PG talk of the Harry Potter series. If there's a weak link in the cast, it's the character of the Weedons. I won't spoil their placement in the society of Pagford, but after 400 pages it was slightly tiresome to keep coming back to them in the exact same position that they'd always been in when I was more interested in the development of the rest of the characters. However, the Weedons feature heavily in the finale and this makes up for it somewhat. The book is well-written, will make you exercise the dictionary function on your Kindle unless your vocabulary is much stronger than mine, and will alternatively make you bust up laughing with Rowling's dry, dark sense of humor, and cry for the characters, not with artificial tragedy (of which there's a little bit in this book) but because Rowling makes them so achingly human that you can't help sympathize yet be annoyed by them at the same time. I enjoyed the book thoroughly and highly recommend it.

author: Valerie
title: Disappointed
body: I enjoy the story telling of J.K. Rowling and thought this would be a delightful story.  Unfortunately I cannot get past the vulger language, trashy sexual references, and disgusting character descriptions.  The story is interesting enough, but I am distracted with the unintelligent conversation between characters and constant swearing.  I was hoping for something a bit more challenging considering how imaginative and intelligent her former series was.  I guess genius like that cannot be duplicated.  Unfortuante; but I'm sure her name and fame from the HP series will keep the ball rolling on this one.  I hope she makes another attempt at story telling and does a better job of it later on.

author: Andrea Ryan
title: Quick and easy read but anticlimactic
body: I found this story interesting and intriguing but was left disappointed. I kept waiting for the story to go somewhere but the climax was extremely underwhelming. I did not dislike the book but I can't recommend it.

author: miva
title: Great Book
body: i think J.K. Rowling absolutely nailed it when it comes to small town living and the range of different human experiances and emotions.

author: Peggy Glenn
title: Egads - give me death over this book
body: I don't care how famous you are, or how much you're revered for your Potterisms - this endlessly depressing and often revolting tale was the worst read I've had in eons. Ordinarily, I'd have put this down after struggling through 2 chapters. Not a single sympathetic character - not even until the end. But, I forced myself to try to see what others raved about in this. Never did see it. Now, it's on to the shelves and shelves of books I really do want to read - no hype, just good reading. GAAAAAACK, this was the most unsatisfying book I've EVER read, and I've been reading for nigh on to 65 years.

author: julie goss
title: Insights
body: Gives  much to think about & to ask yourself in the mirror every day. Pass/do a kindness everyday. Strong and touching.

author: Hans Mortl
title: Average
body: Having read the outstanding Harry Potter stories by the same author, I've been somewhat disappointed with this book. Most of the persons in this story are not quite believeable, the dialogue quite often extremely crude, yet the plot isn't bad.

author: raney
title: Book club enjoyed it !
body: Sorry, just couldn't get into it, but will try again when my mind isn't so cluttered.  My book club really enjoyed the book, so I'm sure that it is a good read.

author: yr
title: unexpected
body: I couldn't put it down. Difficult topics dealt with really well. Nobody wins. it is an insight about where we are heading to and if we will continue to be oblivious about our own lives

author: Mike Issaev
title: Deftly written, thematically wobbly
body: I thought book as a whole revealed a conscious effort by Rowling to disassociate her writing from the more or less tame HP series; in that respect, the novel is undoubtedly successful. I can't deny enjoying the wit and style of the narrative and the acute insight into the nuanced social fabric of the town she creates.

author: Sujatha
title: A big winding novel about a small town
body: I picked up the novel after following the hype in the media; especially after Ms Rowling owned up to being the author.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Well written, but no happy endings here
body: Casual Vacancy has a lot of characters and it takes a bit to sort everyone out. I was drawn into the book, but it felt like watching a train wreck, I just couldn't look away, and it left me sad and miserable. Technically the book is very well done, but I prefer a story with less reality.

author: Rae Bookgirl
title: Just not up to her usual standard
body: Found this one pedestrian to read, a bit of a downer.. Well enough written but just not a story to get your mind into.

author: Maranda Cook
title: bought as a gift
body: I bought this for my brothrr-in-law for Christmas. He was so excited. He's been wanting to read this book. Great purchase :)

author: Jeanie Wilson
title: Casual Vacancy
body: It not like this subject matter, not my cup of tea.  Awaiting her newest novel and hope it is better

author: EA, South America
title: I had to keep a list of personnae...
body: For the first third of the book, I had to make a written list of all the characters and their relationships.  They are introduced in an active mode - appearing first in one context, briefly, then reappearing later as related to other characters which have been introduced briefly in another context.  Anyway, it was well worth it.  Rowling clearly knows how to write a good book.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Gave up half way through
body: I Kept waiting for this book to take off but it never did so I gave up half way through.

author: Melissa Bowman
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Having read and enjoyed all of the Harry Potter books, I was almost afraid to pick up The Casual Vacancy out of fear of being disappointed.  However, I'm glad I did.

author: Cathy Elliott
title: I really hated this book
body: Did J.K. Rowling really write this trash?  What happened to her imagination?  What kind of people does she know that she filled this book with idiots.  I have to say that I only read two chapters and then had to ask myself, "Why am I reading this trash?" and I put it down and got rid of it quickly.  I was so disappointed but it makes me not want to read any other new things she puts out.  Not worth the paper it was printed on.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Almost hating it.
body: I'm falling asleep between paragraphs.  There's not ONE likable character in this book. I don't give a fig about any of them and can't wait for the end of the book so I can find out if they all fall in a hole and disappear in Pagford.  Boooorrrringggg.

author: Kathi Kellenberger
title: Interesting IT twist
body: This is a great read, especially after about 50% in. Before that, I really had a difficult time keeping track of all the characters. I was tempted to start over and create a diagram of the characters and how they were linked. The really interesting thing for me was the lesson to be learned from bad website design. That is the driver for many critical events in the story.

author: Linda
title: I disliked everyone, except the dead guy!
body: This book was a challenge to get through. The amount of characters to keep track of was overwhelming. Page after page the reader is introduced to more and more unlikeable, selfish, mean people. At some point, I felt like I would have to meet each and every horrible resident in Pagford. I disliked everyone, except the dead guy!

author: Anne-Marie E. Nakhla
title: Tedious and disappointing.
body: I didn't make it past page 40. For an author who is so capable, this book was a huge disappointment. The characters were terrible, and the plot lacked any moral center.

author: Eileen
title: Good Story
body: This book really makes you take a hard look at our society, the good, the bad and the ugly. It is one that will have you pondering about your own role in your personal relationships and community interactions. Great characters, great underlying moral message.

author: Ryan Crete
title: great book
body: JK Rowling was outstanding.  Book took many unexpected twists and kept me reading with out putting the book down.  Awesome ending!

author: Idle Expatter
title: Characters that stick with you; plot forgettable
body: I did not expect to like this, let alone like it a lot. What better praise can one give a novel than "it surprised me"?

author: Esther Stewart
title: Real life story
body: A bit depressing at times, but written very well and it's a real life story. I am looking forward to her next book.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Interesting read
body: I felt that the characters were familiar. These were people I knew with all of their idiosyncrasies and faults. Very human.

author: Amazon Customer
title: A detailed read
body: I'm a huge J.K. Rowling fan. I love how she creates worlds and the way she develops characters. With this book, I was skeptical because I had heard bad things about this book. When I finally got the book, I admit that I was disappointed by how slow and detailed the story was but by the middle of the book I was intrigued and by the end I loved it. The story develops at the pace it does to make sure the reader is ready for the end of the book. I recommend this story to others.

author: B. Petree
title: Great characters
body: Once again, Rowling gets lost in some of her characterizations.  This is not a bad thing, but I think with this book, she tried to make everyone so eccentric that the story itself suffered by comparison.  I've had a hell of a time finishing this one...

author: Tracy in NY
title: liked it
body: i was wary after reading reviews, but agree if you keep in mind it's nothing like harry potter, i found it very enjoyable

author: Mary Lou
title: What Happened?
body: Possibly the most depressing, unlikable book I've read in years.  There's not one character here to root for; even pity is hard to come by.  This book is all darkness with no light, no hope.  Why would anyone bother?  And it seems as if Rowling used superfluous vulgarities just to prove that she can.  What a disappointment.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Profound
body: A brilliant book. Rowling's way of creating realistic characters is totally unmatchable. A very smooth read as well. I absolutely loved it.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Great Story!
body: Wasn't certain I would like this especially since Harry Potter was so fabulous.  Great story - kept wanting to read more.

author: Happy
title: Brilliant writer; and in case you didn't notice, this is not a sequel to Harry Potter
body: This book is as brilliant as its author, for the same reasons that the HP series is so wonderful. There are many kids' fantasy series that will never outsell the Bible-- it is JK Rowling's genius that set HP apart. Many of the people who wrote bad reviews of this book seem to be mostly disappointed that this book is not another Harry Potter. So please, do not read, or review, this book from the mistaken notion that it should somehow mirror Harry Potter. It is a book for adults, which implies not just chronological age but also an assumption of maturity. Again, because so many people have made this mistake: this book is written by the author of Harry Potter, but it is not Harry Potter, so get over it.

author: Peter Jensen
title: Great story, easy reading....
body: Great descriptive novel.  Captures the characters and feeling of an English village/town situation wonderfully well.  Like the Potter stories, the characters are etched into your brain.  Recommended reading.

author: Margo Crosthwaite
title: Interesting Characters
body: This is a very dark book to read,complex and depressed people interacting in a small village where gossip is rampant

author: Deena
title: A bit too complicated
body: Although, the story consist of interesting characters and plots in the beginning it's a bit hard to familiarize oneself with the characters.

author: Eden Wales Freedman
title: Dark, difficult, powerful.
body: Rowling addresses dark themes in a realistic, heart-rending way. Those who did not like this book likely expect it to be another Harry Potter. It's not, although, like the HP series, *Casual Vacancy* also asks readers to confront evil. The evil that engage in its pages, however, is not "magical" but that which lies in our own communities (and in our own hearts). A difficult read but an important one.

author: T. G. Gutheil
title: Rowling keeps her edge
body: Fabulous analytic narrative of small town British life, relationships and how they go wrong. Excellent writing level is maintained  throughout.

author: TabH
title: Unusual
body: I love the Harry potter series & knew this would be nothing like it but I gave it a read.  Hands down most unusual book I've ever read. Several points when I wanted to give up on the book, but kept going for my love of the author. This was a very slow book & too many characters to keep track of, but after pushing through it became interesting. Worth the read if you are patient & have an open mind.

author: Peggy G. Stone
title: Slow read
body: I do not stop reading a book, but this one was not finished. I may pick it up again, may be not.

author: John C. Trentelman
title: Boring Characters
body: Too many dull characters that don't move the story. Too slow a pace in plot.  Not worth keeping it on the Kindle.

author: Jasmyne Martinez
title: Well,
body: I still haven't finished this and I've had this book since it came out. It is a lot different from the Harry Potter series as she has said. I'll finish it one day. : )

author: James P. Thompson, Jr.
title: Can of worms!
body: A crude convoluted arduous read .

author: Jean
title: Not her best
body: The premise of the book was good, but it took to long to get to the heart of the story.  The message was pretty good, but it was hard to follow so many characters.

author: K. Parker
title: It should never have gone to print.
body: I bought it because I loved the Harry Potter series. It was not the book I expected. I started to read it and had to put it down. Months later I started to read it again and put it down again. After the third failed attempt, where I forced myself deeper into the book, I put it down for the last time. I went out to read the book reviews and found that I agreed with the negative reviews more than the positive. I threw the book away.

author: Jane B. Austen
title: Forgettable
body: If I finish a book and really like it the story stays with me. I can't even remember this one. I was hoping to love it.

author: M. Witteman
title: EXCELLENT
body: Ms Rowling continues her deft hand with writing. I have read both of her novels and enjoy her ability to write characters that are so well embodied that you don't always like them but find them immensely interesting.

author: Anissa Annalise
title: Never Read Potter But I Liked This
body: The only other Rowling book I've read is "The Cuckoo's Calling" so I went into this one with both no other expectations than she'd tell me a story with characters that I would find compelling. She absolutely did.

author: Shannon
title: Took awhile but I loved it in the end
body: OK, I read it because it's JK and it took many pages to get into the story and care about the large number of characters. But by the end, JK had weaved her magic again on a story of a seemingly simple town in Britain. She's so great at writing real people, especially people you know. I can't wait to see what else she writes in the upcoming years.

author: Amarathine
title: The Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling
body: In reading the other reviews, Harry Potter fans did not enjoy The Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling.  Sadly to say I wasn't a Harry Potter fan; therefore, with no expectations from Rowling, I enjoyed this book.  The book deals with a reality that we try to facade with the perfect home, fancy clothes and the perception of having it all together in public.  Yet, as this book does, it takes you behind closed doors of many characters to show you the issues of the characters and how those issues flow into the lives of the people  around you whether you choose to interact with them or not.  I enjoyed learning about each of the characters in detail.  It does take a few chapters to keep all the characters straight but  by the end of the book you'll feel like part of each of the characters lives.

author: M.G.
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: If you expect this to be harry potter you will be disappointed.  If you read it for itself it is very enjoyable, well written, and interesting.  Kept me turning pages.  I loved the characters!

author: Jonathan Robbins
title: X-Ray of a Small Town
body: It seems that people either really like, or really dislike, this book.  I fall into the positive camp - this was a book I read quickly and enjoyed quite a bit.  It reminded me, in a way, of Richard Russo's books in the way it takes a town and examines it and its inhabitants closely, never really feeling the need to desire to stray from the town's borders.  Everything, and everyone, the book needs is within the town's reach.  The book touches on lots of issues, some pretty and some not - poverty, disease, snobbery, politics, education to name a few.  It also takes a deep dive into a number of the characters' lives and examines the realities of every day life:  a man frozen by his fears, a woman held captive to her bad taste in men and her constant belief that she'll get her fairy-tale ending, an essentially good kid destroyed by the poverty and lack of guidance surrounding her, parents utterly unaware of the life their children lead, petty people effecting small cruelties that their small lives permit them.  It also beautifully illustrates how fundamentally one person can touch so many lives and cause a town to literally unravel when he passes away.  This is the stuff of life, and sometimes it is ugly, and petty - and sometimes beautiful and soaring.  We get to go along for the ride as people get sick and heal, succeed and fail, rise and fall.  By the end of the book, I really cared about some of the characters - and really disliked others for their smallness and cruelty.  But the fact that I cared (good or bad) shows the skill that Rowling brings to this book.  For only a gifted author can leave us caring so much, right?

author: zagain
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: In the Casual Vacancy, Rowling turns her attention away from the wizard world of Harry Potter to the more adult focused small community of Pagford  where everyone knows everyone else.  The community is in the midst of a small civil war among its elected representatives as lines have been drawn between two sides who are debating whether or not the town should rid itself of the responsibility of a local housing project (called The Fields) and a connected drug treatment facility.  Readers of the Potter series will recognize Rowling's writing style in which she does an excellent job of handling multiple characters and weaving together several subplots in to the main direction of the novel.  Interestingly, there are some other parallels to her earlier work.  Like the Potter series which focused on a central dynamic figure, Harry, who the others rallied around, The Casual Vacancy has its own central player in Barry Fairbrother, the primary leader of the pro-Fields movement and an integral player in the lives of all the primary characters.  In an interesting twist, however (which is far from a spoiler), Barry dies suddenly in the first few pages of the novel, leaving the other characters to adapt and struggle with his absence.  While Barry departs the book early, his presence remains felt throughout the plot.  The elements of the book at times seem reminiscent of a soap opera with the various intrigues of the characters, however, it is an engaging story that is helped along by Rowling's solid style.  Overall, a good novel that falls a bit short of her previous (and astoundingly popular) works.

author: Cecilia Fernandes
title: Missing Rowling's magic
body: Rowling's Harry Potter books were such a delight to read, not only because of the story but mainly because of her writing style and story pace and richness of characters.

author: John R. Charles
title: Gritty
body: I did not read the Harry Potter books so I did not know what to expect when our book club chose this book.  Rowling introduces several characters very quickly and all of them are thoroughly unlikeable -- except for the one that dies as the story begins.  The teenagers hate their parents and the parents hate their children right back.  There are some interesting situations and the dialogue rings true but the only sympathetic characters are two of the teenagers.  A rather dark read.

author: K. Regan
title: Well...
body: I'm a huge Harry Potter fan.  I had high hopes for this book but I only made through a couple of chapters before I lost interest.

author: Natalie B.
title: Amazing!!
body: She is one of the most gifted storytellers I have ever read, I recommend this book to anyone and everyone who enjoys reading.

author: Frankie
title: Frankie
body: This is a wonderful book, it will make you think. So many things did not have to happen if only.... I wonder if this world will ever change. The Classes.

author: Cheryl
title: boring
body: Bought this because of the author and I adored the Harry Potter series. I don't generally read fiction and this book disappointed me all around. I tried reading it...about 100 pages and it felt like the longest book ever. Then I gave up and deleted it from my kindle.

author: Vicki Bosch
title: Difficult, but worth the effort.
body: I had some problems keeping all the characters straight, but once I got that figured out, the story was fine. It was rather sad but really an interesting testament to strength of character (or lack thereof).

author: N. Thompson
title: Quietly Brilliant, Unflinching...Worth It
body: After reading all the hype and negative reviews, I was reluctant to take a chance on this book. Even after the first 30 pages, I wasn't sure about it.

author: Laura
title: I can't get past the name,
body: The book might be very well written, the plot may be great. But to switch from Harry to Barry?! I can't get past it!

author: Anne Keats
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: After so many children's books the author vented her frustration by the use of excessive obscenities and inane nonsense, ghastly

author: Trekkie
title: Had to stop reading
body: This story just isn't interesting at all. I can't remember the last time I stopped reading a book half way through, but I certainly did with this one.

author: JHolmes
title: Puerile writing, very slow development
body: One of my friends convinced me to try reading this book. It's short enough I could have knocked it out in a day, but it took me a few weeks of failed starts to finally power my way through it.

author: Sas
title: Meh
body: I was NOT looking for the further adventures of Harry, Ron, & Hermione. I was, however, looking for a story that was as well-crafted and interesting.

author: Dana J. Robinson
title: Not her best work.
body: I found this book to be rather boring and the store wasn't all that appealing.  I also listen to the book she wrote under a different name. It was even worse! J.K isn't writing like she did with Harry Potter!

author: anonymous
title: warning: profane language
body: Love JK Rowling, but was appalled at the use of the profane language littered all of over the book.  Too many characters as well.  Could not even finish the book.

author: Sanlock
title: Review
body: Disappointing and most unexpected from this author. Took quite a while to actually get all the characters in my head.

author: Suestelle
title: Spot on
body: Characters were so realistic, I enjoyed each one. Dark and deeper than expected. One of my favorites  of the year.

author: Alison McDonald
title: Casual Vacancy - just too confusing
body: 'There is no doubt the author has great demand of the English, but unfortunately I found it very difficult to follow as there were just too many characters'.

author: lynnezi2
title: Casual Vacancy
body: This book has a very negative tone.  Heroes are primarily very unsatisfied teenagers with great angst toward live and dead parents.  I did quit the book after reading 1/4 of it and so I could be accused of giving it short shrift. Purchased from Amazon for Kindle and returned without refund.

author: Jan Kellis
title: Big book, small town
body: With a vast cast of characters, The Casual Vacancy plunges the reader into the small town politics of Pagford, its slum area The Fields, and its bigger, brighter neighboring town of Yarvil.  The characters are all well-developed, and even the most vile are, on some level, understandable.  Anyone who lives in a small town will recognize the facade vs. undercurrent of truth.

author: Jane Ryan
title: Very entertaining read.
body: This book provokes laughter and tears,  It is a poignant look at the human foilbles which affect us all.  I would recommend this book to anyone trying to work around the intricacies of local government for the good of the community.  This can be an exhausting and complicated process.  This book allows us to take time out for a humorous, realistic look at ourselves.  Life is complicated, isn't it?

author: Agnes Well
title: Wasted time and money
body: A huge disappointment! Boring plot. Political correctness all over the place. Poorly constructed. Characters have little or no redeeming qualities.

author: Stretch
title: I was tempted to rate it lower. Not sure ...
body: I was tempted to rate it lower. Not sure what I expected from this book, but surely not what I ran across. Truthfully stated, I read part of it, lost interest, and set it aside to read something else. No real suspense, at least not to the part where I set it down.

author: k Brady
title: excellent adult read
body: Read all my daughter's Harry potter books, really enjoyed them. Great to move on to a splendid groin-up adult book.

author: Arnold Camus Mas
title: I really loved it.
body: I really love the story. Maybe some people was expecting a Harry Potter-related story. The caracthers are like taken from real life.

author: mike  brien
title: An interesting read from one of the best  authors to date .
body: It,s an interesting story about a made up town, but it,s so typically  British , the characters hold your interest from  the first page.  It would appeal more to the British  market .  [i bought it on Amazons USA ] .  The further you read the more you want to know , what's afoot .

author: Julie Marrs
title: Couldn't get into this one at all.
body: A real let-down after her Harry Potter books.  I realize it is a totally different genre, which I was expecting, but I could not get engaged at all with this book.  Very disappointed.

author: Hilary Lorraine
title: Great writing, but I couldn't care about the characters.
body: I am sure the story might have gotten my interest if I had pursued it. Rowling is a good writer.  But I just couldn't care about any of the characters. Shallow aimless and pained people no longer interest me. Sorry.

author: Gail Fox
title: Book group selection.
body: Poorly written, disgusting and unappealing descriptions with too much information.  Does she hate her characters or just want the reader to hate them?  None of us liked or will recommend the book. ( we are 14 retired readers.)

author: Nefarious Oldman
title: Not for All Harry Potter Fans
body: As a Harry Potter/JK Rowling fan, I will buy anything she writes, but I absolutely couldn't stand this book at all. It was painful to read and I had to stop about 1/4 of the way through it. I'm not saying it is horrible writing. It just didn't appeal to me. I miss Harry Potter.

author: Amazon Customer
title: So Many People Can Judge, They Can't Produce.
body: I didn't read this yet.  It gets five stars, just because, the amount of judgmental folk who have knocked down a brave creative mind, someone who is willing to do something different.  Shame on the negative people - I feel bad for you.  What was the last item of creative art you produced?  Just wondering....

author: Dhuha Tawil
title: J.K. Rowling is a woman who knows how to write.
body: J.K Rowling is an amazing writer. She can capture the essence of a character and make you remember them long after you finished her book. However, I wish she could write about more powerful female characters...broken homes and men who are "the chosen ones" seems to be an ongoing theme.

author: Brian Murray
title: Book review
body: The story was not too bad but the language was atrocious.It is not worth nine more words to be quite honest

author: exercise hopeful
title: fun read
body: clever and intriguing- moved along well- the review requires a certain amount of works to be accepted and I said it all in less.

author: CHarp
title: Too Hard to get into this story.
body: I just could not get into this story.  There were too many characters for me.  I will try another time, maybe but I got bored and put it down.

author: izik
title: Far from previous books
body: Got me hooked by the first chapter, did not enjoy the rest. Really far from harry Potter books, I'm a little disappointed.

author: T.M. Patron
title: A different road taken
body: I had heard this was a different road taken by the author. In constructing real life, I found her character construction true to my life experience with the intertwining of emotions, attitudes, self justifications along with small town politics an interesting; albeit emotionally difficult read.  While not a happily ever after ending, it offers hope that individuals can make a difference in small ways.

author: Jo Mardis
title: Well written but not a feel-good book
body: For literary merit, it was top-notch, with especially interesting character development. However, there was a dark, almost cynical approach toward humanity, even the least fortunate.  The book was too raw and edgy, perhaps, for my taste--prefer to view humankind in a kinder, gentler way!

author: Susan
title: Unwanted truths
body: Not what I expected,  but very good writing and a very profond message.  Exposes parts of politics and relationships we try not to see or acknowledge.

author: Doris A. Maley
title: Disappointing book, not worth the time and effort to read
body: I did not care for this book.  I did not finish it as it didn't hold my interest.  Disappointing.  She writes well but this book is difficult to follow.  Others in my book club agreed with me on this book.

author: fred zamon
title: A real gem in a new style for Rowling
body: I loved this book- and was sad to see it end- I hope it becomes a series- very different than authors well know works- but very good in a new way.

author: F. Barrett
title: Goings on in the Village
body: Great book, so much going on with so many people in the village. Could not put it down. Recommend it.

author: RAB
title: This Book Is Not  About a Town Election
body: Nobody is safe in comfortable surroundings with Rowling's raw tale of Krystal Weedon, a teenager from the wrong side of town, whose story is told not only in her words and actions, but in those of her friends, enemies,  teachers,  counselors and adult detractors.  Read this book, and you will never look at poverty, addiction, and broken families in the same way.

author: KD
title: Love the writer, not so this book.
body: Didn't care for this book and the reason is, I like to read for entertainment as well as education.  There has to be something inspiring with the uninspiring.  Not so with this book.  There were no real likable characters.  Sad because I know JK Rowling is a wonderful writer, but when I am not looking forward to reading, I look for another book.

author: loves2read
title: Deep Muggle
body: This is not Harry Potter - in fact I'm not a huge HP fan.  I love this book though. Rowling is fierce, honest, and insightful.

author: Clare Heron
title: A fast moving eveyday story - very much in touch with relatity
body: It is a fast moving story that could apply to any community with typical characters that are found everywhere.  I loved that they were so real and not polished perfect.  A really good read

author: Larry Lippow
title: Microcosm of known and unknown interelations of life experiences among friends and/or colleagues
body: It took awhile to understand the relationships among all the characters; however, once you understand the dynamics involved, it is an interesting but sad story.  It is interesting how one man's death impacts so many people in unexpected ways.  It also makes one ponder the many challenges/struggles in people's lives that are not evident from appearance only.

author: Diane
title: JK Rowling for Adults.
body: She can really cast her spell and she did it in this book.  I remember thinking it was well worth the read and recommended to others.

author: Julie A. Gelsinger
title: thought-provoking novel
body: A great, serious read. This is not fluff. This is life in all its absurdity, vileness, and hopefulness. Read it.

author: Kerry's
title: unexpected twist gains attention
body: The harsh reality of teenager life in a complex world of selfish adults. The plot uncovers the boredom of life in an English village where there is a reluctance to accept social issues, instead opting for a false set of values that disintegrate when the only real person dies.

author: Robert B. Glickman
title: good read
body: This was a lot better than Cuckoos calling.  It was very interesting and we got to see another side of this great author

author: Pat
title: A Disappointment
body: I read this book because I had enjoyed the Potter series so much. I was very disappointed because of the rough language. I had to stop reading it. I read a John Grisham book and then came back to to finish Casual Vacancy only because I bought it.

author: Nola
title: Fabulous read!
body: I really enjoyed this book.  I love anything set in England and could picture the little town the book was set in. All the families had their twists and turns and real life was exposed as all wanted to fill " the vacancy". Beautifully written as only J K Rowling knows how to!

author: Heidi
title: Not what I was expecting.
body: Boring, boring, boring, boring.... WHAT?!?  This book was depressing and uninteresting, but I forced myself to finish it and then was rather upset that I did.  I realize that this was an attempt to branch out, and I do typically read adult novels.  I just do not recommend this one.

author: Stanley Crowe
title: you'll laugh, you'll cry, you won't put it down . . .BUT . . .
body: Strengths: The multiple plots are very deftly interwoven, and there are elements of suspense in each and elements of suspense throughout that make you want to keep reading. The writing is clear and straightforward, not particularly elegant, but it doesn't get in the way.

author: Casey
title: just in case you didn't realize that JKR is actually an amazing writer
body: I very much did not know what to expect going into this book, but I was impressed by just the first few pages. I'm a huge Harry Potter fan, but it was never the writing itself that enthralled me, but rather the plotting and the characters. Within a few pages of The Casual Vacancy there were several turns of phrases where I sat back and thought, "Wow. Wow, she's a really good writer."

author: Justin Winokur
title: Very character driven and not all that amazing
body: The Casual Vacancy follows the lives of a few families in a small England town. When a well-liked local councilman dies, the fight for his seat becomes the primary plot point. At issue is the fate of a not-so-good area of town, The Fields, and whether the local community should cast it off.

author: Suzanne DeGReeff
title: Nothing like the Potter series
body: I enjoyed this book - it was a bit depressing but well written and engaging. Looking forward to more work from J.K. Rowling

author: A. Carter
title: No Fancy Review...just my humble opinion.
body: Ok Folks, from a housewife who just loves to read.....here is MY simple review of The Casual Vacancy.  I really enjoyed it.  I found it very thought provoking and real.  It is a look into the lives of several families who are affected by the death of a prominent counsel member.  J. K. Rowling created well rounded characters and intertwined them beautifully.  Sometimes I thought the book was funny, sometimes it was sad, sometimes confusing, shocking, and while some reviewers felt that the end was predictable, I did not see it coming.  I enjoyed seeing the characters evolve, even though it took them, especially the adults, to the END of the book to make positive changes.  I found the story line very real and dealing with issues that are happening in todays world.  I read that many of the reviewers found it too dark and depressing, and felt that J. K. Rowling was attempting to be edgy by throwing in all of these hot button issues....I disagree with that.  The issues in this book, found in this community, are issues found in most communities whether one cares to believe that or not.

author: Donna Pedersen
title: I can't believe the same person that wrote the amazing HP series wrote this piece of trash.
body: If you have to use profanity to make your point, it wasn't a very strong point. Each page makes the point weaker and weaker.

author: MaySkies
title: Big Let Down- Very Depressing
body: I knew this book was going to be different then Harry Potter so I dove in with an open mind.....Wow very disappointed. Even if I didn't know the author I would not have enjoyed this book. There were very few likeable characters and I felt depressed reading this book! I read a lot of books, at least one or two a week and am usually very lenient. I did finish the book but did not feel any better by doing so. I do not recommend this book. If you are debating do not waste your money, if you feel you must read go to your library. It was not worth the money I spent.

author: Debra Steiger
title: Author could have done better
body: I did not read the HP series, but had high hopes for work by the author.  I found J.K. Rowling's writing to be just on the edge of very good.  But, she is much too good of an author to have to resort to profanity.  The story might have held my interest, but the profanity was mis-placed and unnecessary to the story or the characters.  I didn't finish the book simply because it didn't hold my interest.  I do believe this author can do better, much better.

author: Denise Shea
title: not interesting
body: i found the book very boring it did not hold my interest and i found myself skimming much of the time

author: Dennis Brown
title: Not very good
body: This story is very dark. Not as entertaining at all. I finished it in hopes that there would be something to lighten it, but it was a waste of time. J. K. Rowling should go back to stories like Harry Potter.

author: Jennifer Pye Gebbie
title: Sad story
body: Well written but very sad. If you are very happy with your lot in life and need a literary depressant, this book is for you. However, it could work the other way. If you're really depressed you could read this book and think, "Well, could be worse  At least I'm not a meth addict..."

author: Breathe to Read
title: a very real book
body: I love this book. It is gritty and honest and shows a real depth of understanding of the characters and issue of living in a small community. As a high school teacher I can say that Rowling "gets" young people - a rare thing these days as our adolescents are so rapidly changing. She has shown a depth and breadth to her writing that consolidates her position as a genuine and serious author. A great read - extremely well written.

author: Jason LaMoy
title: Stick to what you're good at
body: Stick to what you're good at. This was a waste of my time and yours, there is a reason it is already half off.

author: catlvr14
title: not for me
body: I wanted to read this book only because it was written by J.K. Rowling. I love the Harry Potter books and was interested to see her book written for adults.

author: Xinjun Wang
title: Well-crafted, a classic of tomorrow
body: This resonated for long after I finished it. HP is a hard act to follow but The Casual Vacancy worked for me. I loved how nearly every character had flaws and secrets. I loved the authenticity of the voices from every age and class. I hope JKR has some more adult novels in the works.

author: Ms Jean E Martin
title: The Casual Vacancy.
body: I have not quite finished the book at this time. I felt it took a while to get into the story.  But it "grows" on you.

author: Alan McLay
title: A different story to what the author usually writes.
body: An interesting build up to a story. Asked on characters and a limited story line. A good mystery out of the authors usual mould.

author: Weasel
title: loved it
body: All I can add to the posts already up there is that I'm one of the people who loved this novel. Extremely well developed characters -- I "know" some of them in "real life". The plot is not at all what kept me solidly engrossed -- it was the characters. Couldn't put it down.

author: Leslie F
title: Good insights into social structures of England, NOT Harry Potter....
body: So, certainly not written in any similiar style as the Harry Potter series, very complex stories interwoven but at the end of the book, it was almost a "who" cares...I just didn't feel a connection with the characters.  It is an interesting read and a view into probably the social issues within England between the have and have nots, that part was very interesting, not so different from the US.  Just didn't think the character development was on par with the Harry Potter books where you really felt you got to know and care about them.

author: Andy Moon Wilson
title: Snooze Fest
body: The first 3/4 of the book was laying the groundwork and was tedious to say the lease.  It picked up speed near the end and neatly tied up all the loose ends

author: Amazon Customer
title: This is something entirely different!
body: Gritty, real, heartbreaking and completely engaging. This book is so far from the simple entertainment of the Harry Potter books that I wouldn't have believed it was the same author.

author: Don Seymour
title: Read it
body: The woman is a genius. Hard to believe, when so many others fail to make it in an new genre, she could do this. A great read that makes the politics of a small village intriguing and interesting.

author: Jane
title: Depressing
body: As a huge Harry Potter fan I was definitely disappointed in this book. It makes for an extremely depressing read. Everything that can go wrong seems to go wrong with the inhabitants of Pagford. It is extremely unrealistic. No one town can have so much bad luck. I think JK Rowling should stick to writing children's books.

author: Megan Stewart
title: Great Book in a Different Genre Than Expected
body: About the book - it gets a bit windy in parts of it. Not for her usual children's audience. But if you are an adult, STICK WITH IT and read the whole thing. The way it all ties together in the end is genius, obviously.

author: margaret dearing
title: Awful - don't buy it.
body: Very hard to get into. I was half-way thru the book, and all the sub-plots were still not making sense. I couldn't even finish this book it was so bad. Her other book, The Cuckoo's Calling, is much better.

author: Linda
title: Far from Harry Potter ....
body: Being a HARRY POTTER fanatic (and a grandma of 5) I was very excited at the prospect of reading her first "Adult" novel. But actually, in my opinion, the incredible Harry Potter journey (so intricately and brilliantly woven from Book 1 to Book 7) is definitely not just for children, but most certainly also for any discerning adult. The Casual Vacancy - though well written and quite clever - was not riveting. It was "dark" and not very enjoyable. Such a pity!  I have always been convinced that J.K. Rowlings is a pure genius, and she can deliver far better than this book.

author: Desiree
title: Enjoyable
body: I really enjoyed this book, I have recommended it to friends and family.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not what I expected
body: This book is very different from Rowling's previous books. I'm a big Potter fan and was excited to read the new book. I was disappointed with the book for the first hundred pages. Won't disclose why so not to spoil it but it was not what I was expecting but Rowling didn't disappoint with the ending. Left me satisfied as I expected she would. Not as good as the Harry Potters but still a decent read.

author: Mavourneen Davis
title: Casual Vacancy
body: I thought this book was supposed to be written for adults.  I believe it is more suited to late teen years.

author: Suzanne J Kilcommons
title: The casual vacancy
body: Felt it a little slow to begin compared with the pace at end. Lots of characters to keep track of. But still thoroughly readable.

author: Stephanie
title: Boring with unlikable characters....
body: I never could get into the book. It switches back and forth between so many different characters and nothing really exciting happens. None of the characters were very likable so I had a hard time caring what happened to them. Eventually I gave up finishing the book. I  expected better from J. K. Rowling.

author: WZ Kid
title: Not cut out for adult novels
body: This is definitely the worst book I have read by this author. I bought the book and tried to read it only to get discouraged by falling asleep. I should tell you, I am someone who reads 2 books a month so this is odd for me. I then tried to listen to this book on tape. Awful! The narrator is fine, but dear god the language in this book is ultimately uncalled for. JK has an entire chapter dedicated to a teenage boy thinking about a porn he had watched... and detailed it. I think she was trying to be seductive but this book was a bore with disgusting, overly long, paragraphs of images even adults don't want to read about. I have read every other book she has written and wasn't as offended as this one. Stick to children's books my friend, you are just not cut out for adult novels.

author: michael j king
title: dissapointing
body: difficult to follow charactures -- crudity -- boring -- I half paused half way thro it which shows how much it captured my attention

author: Marie
title: Wonderful Book!!
body: There were a lot of people who did not like this book and I can't understand why. It was an amazing story of a whole town and instead of learning about just one person you got to learn about all the different people who made the town and how it came together. Yes it was sad, but it looked at the town in a whole new perspective. In the beginning of the book J.K Rowling introduces a lot of different people, but that isn't any different from Agatha Christie, and Joyce Carol Oates. They both introduce a lot of people in their novels as well, and it does make it hard to get everyone straight at first. I will admit that I was going back and finding the initial introduction to make sure that I had the right person but afterwards I found this book to be wonderful.

author: Earthstone
title: disappointed
body: not up to the quality of the Harry Potter books - the story line is totally disappointing.  Her grammar and use of language is great, as usual, but this book is a dud.

author: gram2-2
title: The Casual vacancy
body: This is definitely not a Harry Potter story.This one's for the adults who were waiting so patiently for Rowling' s latest literary masterpiece. It's more like some other authors' work,actually.P.D.James or some other dark noir author. The story line is adult but about teens inter- actions and sad family life.Also about the adults in their small community who are considered hypocrites by the children,and by each other.It's a sad story all the way around with everyone's secrets being spilled by  other people.The culprits turn out to be their own family members.Petty jealousies,mental illness,deep-seated senseless cruelty all take center stage in this novel about the human condition.

author: Amanda Jackson
title: Good and bad
body: I was definitely hooked, and I didn't even realize it until I was half way through.  I did like it. A lot. Even though the characters were a bit difficult I was able to keep them organized in my mind after a short while.

author: Rosemary Amodeo
title: It's Complicated.
body: This book is very long and the prose is somewhat difficult to read in certain parts.  I would not recommend this book to anyone who wants an easy read.

author: Gerry L
title: Not about Harry Potter, but a good read and good description of village life in the U.K.
body: Perfect story - kept me interested until the final pages.  Recommend it for its descriptive passages and good story line

author: Gregory Francis
title: How does the death of one person impact a community?
body: As many others have stated, this is not Harry Potter or the world that he lives in. This is a world much closer to reality and can be very painful to read at times. That said, I really enjoyed it. For me, all of the characters felt real in their own way, although at times they could border on caricature. Each of the characters (and there are many of them) saw the world in a slightly different way and responded to the world in a different way. Some of the characters you learn to despise, others you want to root for, and some you just have to wonder what made them the way they are.

author: Andrew Greensfelder
title: Wonderful journey with magical children and the dark sides of grownups.
body: Plenty of reviews so I'll be brief and cover perhaps some different angles. The heroes of this book are the children. The only praiseworthy adult dies in the first few pages the rest of the story allows us to appreciate him. While the book shows the many adults' dark sides, we suspect (hope) they have some redeeming features. Ms Rowling merely gives us the pleasure of living with their ids, as Freud would call their dark streams of consciousness.

author: Maggail
title: Made Me Laugh, Made Me Cry
body: This was a wonderful book! The characters were well rounded and the story complex. The story had been told at a leisurely pace, but the end felt hurried and "there now it's done!" attitude.  Everything was tied up, but I was a  little disappointed by it's brevity. Will certainly look forward to her next adult book.

author: Beth61
title: Couldn't finish
body: Ugh.  I couldn't even get past the first 80 pages because I was too disinterested.  It was really hard to figure out who the characters were and what their relationship was to each other.  Maybe if I had continued, I would have like it.  Loved the Harry Potter series but just got bored with this one.

author: Kenlah0406
title: Masterful writing
body: J.K. Rowling is truly a master of capturing the nature of what it means to be human on the page.  Every nuance of emotion is all there.  Her characters are complex and they came fully to life for me when reading this book.  Yes people, it is no wonder the book is 500 pages!  She weaves this tale deftly, though there is a large cast of characters and not one thread is broken.  She is also a genius when it comes to WHAT to reveal and conceal and WHEN to reveal and conceal.  This truly makes her an expert storyteller.

author: Lloyd Bever
title: Book Revies
body: Not as interesting a book as many of J.K. Rowling's past editions. J. K. Rowling's books such as the Harry Potter series were very creative and enjoyable reading

author: John Carter
title: Sadly terrible
body: Vacant pointless tedious. How could this be? I read every Harry Potter - twice - what happened JK? Her next one is quite a bit better.

author: Donna R. Kleintjes
title: Disappointing
body: I was really disappointed in this book.  It could have done without the excessive foul language.  I hope Ms. Rowling doesn't continue in this vein.

author: Mollie Sue
title: Hard to put down
body: Rowling's character development is superb and the woman does know how to work with words.  It's not the best book I've ever read, but it's a far cry from the worst.  This book is hard to put down because the characters are so despicable and you're anxious to find out what mess they're going to get into next.  I wondered if readers took potshots at the book just because it was Rowling.  .

author: Nancy R. Wilson
title: Good read.
body: This is a very good book.  She has a great depth of understanding of human nature.  Much enjoyed by me and my swimming pool group.

author: Sharon Fries
title: I Miss Harry
body: I was sad that this book was so negative.  Life can't always be an adventure or have a happy ending but this book is just depressing.

author: Ana Maria Chai Chong
title: Magnificent!
body: One of the best books I have ever read. If you enjoy British literature this is a must read. In most novels, the hero is all good and the villain is all bad. Rowling exposes the reality that there are devils and angels in all of us and celebrates our humanity in this wonderful novel.

author: kaylee schubenski
title: Loved it!!
body: Rowling, as always, delivers with her beautiful style of writing. This plot wouldn't work at all if it wasn't for the omniscient viewpoint, it makes it much more interesting. I give 5 stars, it had me hooked from the beginning. A juicy plot line with a shocking ending.

author: Jo-Ann Harper
title: A Casual Vacancy
body: What a confusing mess of characters! We read it for our Book Club for November and the general consensus was that it stunk. It was hard to read and keep all the characters straight in your mind since quite a few had nicknames (more than one) and she used them differently in the same paragraph so at times you couldn't figure out about whom she was talking.

author: cassy
title: meh..
body: did not enjoy. waited whole book for something to happen. i seem to have missed the point of the story. depressing

author: Lauren
title: Good read!
body: I initially heard very mixed reviews about this book, but being a Harry Potter fan, I had to see what J.K. Rowling's non-Harry work was like. She did not disappoint! Many of the characters are easy to relate to and the story captures the struggles of people of all different ages, which makes the book that much more interesting. I read this book over six months ago and I still find myself wondering what happened to some of the characters.

author: Vicki Mattingly
title: Causual Vacancy
body: I did not finish this book -- I was so disappointed --- was expecting more from J K Rowling.  Don't understand what happened with this one.

author: xylon2
title: very hard beginning, couldn't put it down by the end
body: I started this book months ago, and had to put it down and read lighter fun books in between, but after the 1/2 way mark of this book, I got really interested. In the end I could not put this book down. It was full of amazing connections that J K Rowling is so good at. It is sad, and I cried but I loved it. It made me think about the town and its characters and their lives. I only regret that I do not know anyone who has read this book and I have no one to talk to about it. I was a total fan of Harry Potter, and I was disappointed that this book was so different, but after putting my time into this book I ended up just glued to the pages. I was tempted to rate this with 5 stars, because I just loved the 2nd 1/2 so much, but the 1st half was so depressing and hard to read, that I could really only give it a 4 star rating. I look forward to more books from J K Rowling. I feel she is so very talented and has many more stories to tell. This book is not for everyone, but if you can make it through the first 1/2, you will not be disappointed by the end.

author: Jim Klepper
title: disappointing
body: I was so disappointed in this book.  I enjoyed all of her harry potter books so much.  Too many characters with too many problems!!  The only good thing about the book was our book club had a good discussion!!!!!  Such unhappy people!

author: Barbara Weissenberger
title: Disappointing
body: Disappointing novel from this great author. Too many characters not fully developed and none that were engaging enough to sustain my interest in a slow moving plot.

author: delwyn mudgway
title: poor
body: rowling needs to stick to writing for teenagers.  This book is all about teenages angst.  Hasn't decided if she is writing for adults yet or still stuck in the Harry Potter age group.  All in all, quite pathetci

author: Toni van Rijen
title: Refreshing and interesting
body: Her writing was refreshing and interesting and I kind of enjoyed the story even though it felt like I was reading a television series where not a lot was happening but I was slowly being drawn in to the characters lives and personalities. I was kept intrigued and absorbed although I was prepared to dislike this book. However I have to say that I actually enjoyed it. And yes, I would definitely recommend it.

author: Mags
title: A truly great read!
body: Although The Casual Vacancy is a view of life through a jaundiced eye, it's brilliantly written and the characters are sharp and  the story, while confronting, is beautifully unfolded.  I haven't read any of the Harry Potter series and I imagine people who pick up 'The Casual Vacancy' thinking it might belong in the same genre  might be quite shocked as this is adult fiction, raw, gritty and in your face.  Can't wait to read more of her adult fiction.

author: Maggie
title: Not for me
body: A big let down after the Harry Potter Series.  It was very difficult to get started and I didn't care for the story line.  What else can I say.

author: Colleen J. Nicholson
title: Not Harry Potter!
body: I liked her Harry Potter stories but am very put off on her "adult" stories.  I will find other authors for that.

author: Alexis Clark
title: The casual vacancy
body: I think that the book was kind of confusing. Besides that I think that the book was a really good one. You never knew what was going to happen next. It also had some suspense to it as well.

author: Dolina
title: not worth your time
body: I have read about two thirds of this book, but have decided that life is too short to spend any more time on it.  Rowling is a good writer, but I am tired of the unrelenting depiction of despicable, stupid and degenerate human beings.  The book is not entertaining, nor does it instruct or edify.

author: Carol Sulli
title: A rare disappointment
body: Let me start by saying I have loved every book written by J.K. Rowling until....  This book still has her wonderful way with words, but with so little point in this dirgy drama.  The story was oh so tiresome, populated with every form of loser.  The only character not a complete waste of plasma was dead by page 5.  As social commentary, I thought it was a failure.  Sorry Ms. Rowling.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Slogging through it
body: Too many characters with too many nicknames.  I am halfway through and don't know yet if there is a plot.

author: DAE
title: Well, You Ask for More Realism
body: Several people that I know were complaining about this book, so I had to read it to see what the hoopla was about. I read the book and listened to it on Playaway. I have never read Harry Potter, therefore I really didn't have any particular expectation about Rowling's writing style. I expected the writing to be decent and when it exceeded that expectation, I was glad. I enjoyed the layers that each character had, and the fact that I could clearly visualize each character as a full fledged individual and not a cardboard cutout.

author: Anita Colman
title: A Great Read!
body: Could not put this down! Great plot, characters and writing-full of wit and irony. There were a few plot developments that seemed

author: Elizabeth Wyatt
title: great characters, well drawn
body: A slice of life explored with understanding. Small town tensions and rivalries create tension and laughter. The pace is kept alive with movement and the intricate personal struggles of the characters' interaction.

author: Annette
title: Synopsis on Contemporary Life
body: Yes, it does have 30 characters and it is 500 pages long, but the complexity of the human situations are what make it so good.  Although it takes place in England, it could be a small town in any western country with a view of class conflict, child abuse, adoption, marraige, love relationships, and small town petty politics.  Well worth every page!

author: Journalism Teach
title: Not for kids!
body: This is my first digital book. I have the hard copy as well. It was so much easier to pack the tablet for a trip than the book.

author: E. Noller
title: Rowling should not have bothered!
body: I read this for my book club and that was the only reason I managed to finish it. I felt the character development was poor, probably because there were so many characters in the book. It was poorly written, poorly edited and the plot really did not interest me at all. The only person in the town that I even remotely cared about did not fare well at the end. I almost felt as if this was a book the Rowling wrote years ago, before the Potter series, and decided to publish it based on her success.

author: Fayetta P. Weaver
title: captivating and disturbing
body: Captivating and disturbing view of a community of flawed, believable characters.  Not only did I hate the ending, but I hated the book to end!

author: Clare Lonnon
title: Disappointment in reading a J.K. Rowling book
body: I found this difficult to read and could not do so without a dictionary beside me, which slowed down the reading process. The story line left me cold regarding the destructive  attitudes of the characters, and the sexual approach to the younger ones. I know that I am naive regarding the youth of today. I have not read any Harry Potter Books but have seen the movies, and I find the violence in todays movies aimed at the youth is overwhelming. e.g. The hunger games.  It is no wonder we are going to hell in a hand basket.

author: Ron Palmer
title: Great story. Small town at its worst or best
body: I enjoyed it. A good page turner. Small town shown at its worst. Great characters and vey believable. Rowling at her best

author: A. W. France
title: I am glad Rowlings is now writing for adults too.
body: JK Rowlings is an excellent author, perhaps inspiring.  Everything about this book worked.  The basic premises are unsual but  believable.  Her character development works gradually and seamlessly with moments of shrewd insights.  She makes nuanced observations of economic and social class that perhaps reflect personal learning from living in both poverty and great wealth.  I hope she keeps writing...I find I am waiting for her next book the way my kids and grandkids waited for the next Harry Potter book.

author: Stephanie O.
title: Can't I review less than 1 star?
body: I finished the book only because it was our book club selection and I was the moderator for this selection. It seemed this novel never really took off. I couldn't keep the characters straight because they were so unremarkable and poorly developed. None of them had redeemable traits. I wasn't attached to any of them. Even with a predictable tragedy in the end- or maybe because of it- I do NOT recommend you waste any time on this.

author: Kristin
title: fantastic!
body: This was an amazing book! I loved all the Harry Potter books and this one didn't disappoint. It's not a very uplifting book but was extremely well written and totally draws you in. I liked how there was no main protagonist or antagonist. Everyone had their good/bad qualities which is what made them so real! I've recommended it to all my friends!

author: C.
title: The Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling
body: I am half way through this novel by J.K. Rowling. It is terrific. I have to force myself to stop reading it at night and get some sleep.

author: Mike
title: Pretty Good Book. Recommend reading but don't think it is a clsssic.
body: I generally enjoyed the book, although most of the time it seemed like I was reading a soap opera.  The characters, while reasonably well developed, were so obviously flawed that it was difficult for me to see them as real.  I think that the flaws in most people are more subtile but those flaws can still be very damaging to their relationships with their families and with society.

author: Charles Bayne
title: Not Harry Potter
body: Wow, Ms. Rowling has come a long way from Harry Potter.  Her new "adult" book has all the dirty talk of policemen and others, some sex, and a most interesting story, to salvage my review.  You can enjoy the book, but be prepared for a totally different kind of characters, plot, and esp. dialog. I don't remember all the details of the book, but my impression is of a very adult, strong language, type of book.  If language does not bother you, then go ahead and enjoy it.

author: Gillian Wells
title: Comment
body: Very good story, but too many characters.  Reading on a Kindle, it's hard to flick back to see who is who!!!

title: Not worth the time
body: I had a hard time remembering who each character was - with the exception of the teen-aged boy, they all blended together as little people with big egos!

author: Mar
title: It's no Harry Potter
body: This book is awful, it is crude and vulgar.  I stopped reading it and will not finish.  It is pure garbage.  DO NOT GIVE THIS BOOK TO YOUR CHILDREN!

author: Lawrence Baxter
title: Fabulous post-Harry novel
body: There was a good deal of controversy surrounding JK Rowling's first foray into "non-Harry Potter" fiction.  Partly, if I recall correctly, this was because residents in various towns who eagerly imagined that the novel's primary setting, Pagford, was modeled on them took offense at the characterizations and insinuations in the novel.  I thought Rowling captured, albeit in the novelists' traditional concentrated format, a wonderful range of characters, pride, hypocrisies and great tragicomic denouements, that were all entirely believable and well painted.
