The book builds carefully, in Rowling's splendid facility with the English language, into a crescendo of disaster and comeuppances that kept me enthralled and amused to the last page.  I have no doubt that Rowling has proved herself as masterful in character and plot development outside the world of Hogwarts and in our equally jumbled "real world."

author: J. J. Woodcock
title: A CASUAL 500 PAGES ENDS IN DESPERATION
body: I would not recommend this to anyone except those that can take a chance on feeling disappointed after 500 pages of literary perambulation with a dismal conclusion. There was a lot of work devoted to this book and the author is very proud of it. She is definitely a wonderful writer, this just wasn't a good use of my time and will not sustain me in the way a good book does.

author: Kelly Mitchem
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: This book was all around terrible, I only read it because J. K. wrote it and man was it a huge disappointment. I could barely finish it.

author: S. Armstrong
title: Disappointing
body: The story, while not great, is generally interesting enough and it moves along reflecting numerous issues of our current society.  It seems Ms. Rowling is up on her current events.  What truly disappoints me is the excessive profanity.  Ms. Rowling is clearly a talented author as evidenced by her Harry Potter series but it seems she does not possess sufficient talent to convey vulgarity without being blatantly vulgar herself.  Too little is left to the imagination on this count. I wasn't expecting a children's book but the English language has too many offerings to limit oneself so often (throughout) to one or two four letter words.

author: Char
title: Great read!
body: I loved this book.  Granted, there were lots of different characters introduced at the beginning but if one continues to read, this book unfolds beautifully.  The different personalities brought the story to life and one begins to feel as though they are part of the story.  The ending was unexpected.  I was sorry to finish this book.  I wanted to keep following these interesting lives and find out what happened next.  I hope to read many more books by Ms. Rowling.

author: sandy
title: NG
body: Couldn't get into this book at all.  Didn't even finish it.  Very disappointed.  thought that since it was from JK, that it would be awesome.  It was not.

author: Amazon Customer
title: True-to-life, sensitive account of life's subtleties
body: Anxious to read JK Rowling's first non-Harry book.  As a Brit familiar with small-town living, the themes were familiar and dealt with humorously and with pathos.  I read this as an e-book on holidays and have to admit to taking a trip into a bookshop to make sure my download hadn't been truncated, because I didn't think the book had an ending...  I still don't!

author: Dermgoddess
title: a disappointment after reading Harry Potter
body: As an avid reader, I was excited to read her new book. Unfortunately, it is not well written and really was a waste of time. Wish I has stopped reading it, but as an optimist, I hoped it would get better. It did not!

author: Mary Ellen F. Dennard
title: Get this book from Rowling.
body: A great story of discord in a small town, and how they are all connected.  I little sad, with the coldness of some characters.  But it is a fun read because of Rowlings writing style and turn of a phrase.

author: Dr Jacques COULARDEAU
title: Too dark to be somber, too sinister to be caustic
body: The authoress tried herself in the social drama with a good sprinkling of politics. But how can you be better than Ruth Rendell in that line?

author: Barbara
title: Very uninteresting.
body: Incredibly boring, with no purpose. It had uninteresting characters and nothing happening.  I wondered what the purpose of this book was.

author: Ryan D.
title: love
body: this book was in excellent condition on receipt. every imperfection (which were minimal) was listed on the page before purchase. no surprises.

author: Patricia Foreman
title: A slow start
body: I was about to give up on this book it started out so slowly. It was very frustrating - but my persistence was rewarded. The authors insight into the children's lives showed real experience with teenagers angst, and the unique way they see the world. The adults turn out to be shallow, while the kids live and learn.

author: phoenixfire
title: I did not enjoy this book
body: I didn't like this book. Not because it wasn't Harry Potter--I didn't like this in it's own right! Too many points of view, too long, not enough likeable characters, and damn depressing.

author: ron smith
title: Too wordy, not enough action
body: Too "verbose" for my taste. I may have stopped reading too quickly, but after about 20-pages, I gave up and started something else.

author: Laura Schmink
title: A disappointing book
body: Rowling tried too hard to convince the reader that she was beyond the "children's" category.  There wasn't enough substance to the story.  I didn't dislike it, but was disappointed by it.

author: Janine Bates
title: a monumental disappointment
body: This was a monumental disappointment.  My initial eagerness to read the author's first 'adult' book was soon squelched by the random, unnecessary, and frequent insertion of sex in one form or another.  I also was turned off by the foul language.  I gave up in disgust - never finished it. Sorry I wasted the money.

author: Carole Astin
title: A Good Interesting Read
body: Very well written.  I've read all the Potter books and enjoyed this one too.  Her characters were very real and quite interesting.

author: Shannon M.
title: Not Harry Potter...but So WONDERFUL!
body: This is NOT the book for anyone looking for Harry Potter 2.0 (or well 8.0 I guess!)  However if you miss the sheer eloquence and amazing way Rowling can string together the English language, this is the book for you.  Beautifully written, and I look forward to more adult novels by J.K. Rowling!

author: S. Garber
title: Slooow start but so worth it.
body: This book is 3 weeks late going back to the library because it takes a while to get going. There are a lot of characters and you are very thoroughly introduced to them all. It's hard to keep them straight and honestly quite boring. BUT get through those first 100 pages and you won't be able to put it down. I feel like I need to reread the beginning now that I know the characters.

author: Lesley BH
title: Hard Work
body: JK Rowling brings life and death to a cast of the most unsympathetic and unpleasant characters to fill the pages of a book since Dickens, but unlike Dickens, without someone in its pages to care about, it becomes a bit of a slog to get through. Nevertheless, Rowling's turn of phrase, her descriptive prose and her depiction of contemporary life in a small town, persuade the reader to pursue it to the end hoping to find some redemption.

author: Snoopy
title: Enviable lightness of writing
body: I liked almost all the book very much. Almost  The book was definitely worth reading for me. I found the characters believable, the little town vividly described and the plot interestingly developing, but And I wouldn't tell more because of the possibility of spoilers.

author: Kacey
title: Tragic
body: I am a big Harry Potter fan so I couldn't wait to read this book. I read the reviews before I bought it and I knew that it wouldn't be anything close or relevant to what Harry Potter was like. Just the first chapter was a struggle to get through. I did not enjoy reading it that much and don't even know if I will finish the book. I feel that others might enjoy though...

author: Frash
title: Real Life Can be Hard
body: The plot, a council election in a small English village, seems a bit thin. But the characters gradually grew on me, and even the plot finally got beyond the election. So I stayed with the book. There are several really good scenes, and there is a kind of resolution at the end, if in the midst of great sadness. Some of the characters seem to find something like "salvation". And a couple unpleasant and unredeemed characters at least get a good lesson, and hopefully will learn something. Still, the ending does not tie everything up neatly; it is more realistic than that. A good book and well worth reading if you can stay with it for at least a hundred pages. It is long.

author: lynn aberdeen
title: Language over done
body: Did not care for this style of writing , but understanding the area where it was staged. Would not recommend.

author: Chelsea Hasenpflug
title: Different...interesting
body: Very different than J.K. Rowling 's other books but it is interesting and the characters are very intricate. I appreciated a different writing style...but beware it's not what you expect!

author: Laura
title: Tries Too Hard
body: This was a well done book overall, but it was pretty depressing, and it felt overly crass at times. I think Rowling may have been trying a bit too hard to set this apart from Harry Potter by including so much mature content.

author: roberta secci
title: Disappointing
body: Disappointing, even though it is a quite well written novel. Good for people, like me, who want to improve their English. The language is very rich and elegant.

author: Ricky Ronkonkoma
title: Not worth the paper its printed on
body: I agree wholeheartedly with another reviewer who called it "500 pages of relentless socialist manifesto masquerading as literature crammed down your throat."  JK Rowling's attempt to parlay her Harry Potter fantasies into success in the Adult World of reality simply doesn't jell.  The book is chock full of tired socialist cliches, depressing selfishness and an overwhelming ignorance and despicable loathing which she wantonly attempts to portray as an indictment against the hard working and at times selfless middle class folk.  It is basically an insult to ones intelligence - JK Rowling should return to her fantasy World of Wizards and Magic Spells.

author: MotherB
title: Redemption
body: There was nothing redeaming about trying to read this book.  Life is too short to be filling ones mind with the negativity that made up the bulk of this work.

author: CAS
title: She should stick to Harry Potter
body: Only read enough to make me realize everyone had a deep dark secret and weren't really very nice people.  I had enough and am deleting it from my Kindle.  What a waste of $7.99

author: David B. Van Vleck, Jr.
title: couldn't put it down
body: I found The Casual Vacancy extraordinary. It's sort of like a modern day Dickens, in a way, in the sense that it's that good, in its own new modern way. I kept reading it, then glanced at the number of pages I'd read vs. the entire novel, and keep being amazed: "I'm only about a fifth the way through??" That was because it was so entrancing, and rich and full. Not to sound pedestrian but it's full of truth: about adults, teens, people posh and not, heroin addicts, families above all; about good people and bad people and all the so-human shades of grey in-between.

author: Nancy Evans
title: A real diappointment!
body: What a disaster. I hope the millions of kids for whom she made literature real and exciting, don't buy this book hoping for more of the same. It was disapointing and depressing, sometime disgusting. The characters were poorly developed in a sort of on going way, very difficult to deep track of who was who, what nickname was in effect now. The plot was similarly ongoing and unpredictable. Who was doing what to whom or why. I kept asking mywelf why I was wasting my time reading it, but continued to see what point whe was trying to explain or explore. I never found out!

author: Steve
title: Interesting, quirky and kind of creepy
body: Well, actually, the title of the review just about covers it. But I need more words to satisfy Amazon. Like.

author: Joyce
title: Why this story?!!
body: Our book club read this book, as many are fans of her work...but of the dozen women that started it, only three of us read the entire book - -no one liked it.  The story is well written, but there was not a single character to care about.  With J. K. Rowling's talent - -she could write any story - -so why this one?!!  Would not recommend it -- -nor will I buy another of her books.

author: Lori Wheeler
title: Great Read!
body: I read this book more than 6 weeks ago and I still think of the characters.  The story resonates and sticks with you.

author: Susan O
title: Rowling's Casual Vacancy
body: The character studies are gradual but astute. The interplay of the Pagford politics is perfect depiction of small towns (British or American) with egos blurring purposes.  Probably lost minor subtleties as I'm American.

author: Winter
title: JK Rowling is the ultimate people watcher
body: This book is a wryly observed character study of the haves & the have nots. It shines a stark light on the attitudes, expectations, foibles, vanities, aspirations, failings and flaws of all of its characters, both the middle class Pagforders & the low class Fielders. There are not many characters that come up smelling of roses and most are downright unlikable, but all seem to have some small redeeming trait that makes them human & not just caricatures.

author: Louise L. Galvin
title: Mesmerizing
body: I could hardly put it down as i WANTED TO SEE WHAT WOULD HAPPEN NEXT.  When I finished the book I wanted the story to continue with the rest of the characters.  I told family and friends what I had read.  I immersed myself in the book.

author: zipporah
title: Just doesn't flow
body: I had to force myself to keep reading this one. It felt a bit disjointed throughout the book making it difficult to really connect with the characters.

author: Jo Ruwet
title: Compelling and well written as the Harry Potter series
body: Loved that J. K. Rowling chose to write an adult book, although many of us enjoy the Harry Potter books as much as the children did.  It was a fascinating read and I look forward to more from this author!

author: Louise Clemmer
title: The sins of our parents.
body: I took me a while to connect and care about all the characters. But as the book progressed I became more enthralled with the sins of the parents and the sad affect they have on children. It was a good read, well done.

author: mary i pelletier
title: never read
body: I bought this as a gift for a friend. i'm waiting for her to finish it so I can read it.

author: A. Gurvin
title: can't get you out of my head
body: J k Rowling reveals the inner life of her characters. As my daughter said, 'By the middle of the book, you hate every character.' By the end of the book you find compassion for most of them.

author: Patricia B. Ware
title: Dullsville
body: This very mediocre novel is so cluttered with minor, and undeveloped, characters, that it's difficult to figure out which ones to focus on.  Slow start, slower middle, but halfway decent ending.

author: claudia
title: boring
body: Extremely boring. Life situations that have already been talked about millions of times. I appreciate the spoonriver-style attempt but the result is a bit poor.

author: Mrs. Susan Taylor
title: I was hopeful
body: I wanted to commit suicide while reading, and after reading this book.  I expected better prose.  Want my copy?  I'll send it to you.  I can't give it away.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not up to previous work
body: Runs hot and cold, hard to keep track of the players. Perhaps too much attention to family squabbles detracting from the story line. Actually the story line was weak to begin with.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Too many other good books
body: If you can read it through to the end there will be a reward for your efforts. On the other hand, there are so many great books out there why bother.

author: Mladen Jergovic
title: Superb!
body: Very fluent naration, great story, impeccable writing, reliably convincing characters, superb insight into what really drives us on, brilliant masterpiece.

author: Shelley Isom
title: J.K. Rowling is this century's Chas. Dickens
body: This novel is a complete departure from the wonderful Harry Potter books, which give me hope for the next generation as I can't imagine the many fans not wishing they could go to Hogwarts School instead of what we call the public education system.  Casual Vacancy is a portrait of a British small town.  There are dozens of characters, all wonderfully detailed, and all of it is somehow tied together by the death of a man of significance (Barry Fairbrother) and his impact on the town of Pagford.  All classes and types of people are represented here in the most complete characterization of humanity in its current struggles.  Nobody has done it better!!  Rowling is a major writer.

author: Hovsep Hacopian
title: I liked it very much
body: I liked it very much.  Character study is brilliant and it transfers the feel of the moment in the story very well. I would have liked a little more at the end.

author: Mary M. Helmstetter
title: Rowling
body: The book is okay, but the foul language is totally unnecessary. If there is a next book in the series, I will pass.

author: Kimberly D. Baldwin
title: Good, not great
body: Aside from Ann Patchett, no one seems to like this book. But I liked it. In full disclosure, I wanted to like it. I tend to like the books Ann Patchett recommends; I also love J.K. Rowling. I think Rowling is a great storyteller & develops characters like no other author I've read. I wouldn't go so far as to say I loved it, or that it made me cry, but I liked it & I'm glad I read it. It's a long, winding story with a town full of characters, none of them the protagonist & not a lot happens until the last few pages. It's a beautiful, well written book that I will probably never read again.

author: Jean Banks
title: Ms. Rowling Writes Great Adult Books
body: Ms. Rowling writes a great story.  She kept me wanting to come back to the book to see what was coming next.  I really enjoyed her adult books and I never read her Harry Potter series.

author: Nancy Petralia
title: Unimaginative
body: This was a huge disappointment. I only finished it because 1) my mother told me to finish what I started, and 2) a friend said it got better after the middle and had a good ending.

author: Barbara
title: Casual Vacancy
body: Would rate zero if I could.  Worst book ever.  Not one character to like.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Sad
body: I've just finished reading the casual vacancy and I really enjoyed it. It is sad and traffic and not remotely Harry potter, but there is real depth and character development. The story is good. It's not epic or anything, just honest. I don't know that I would recommend it too everyone, but not every book is for everyone. I just know I enjoyed the emotional response this book caused.

author: PAM
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Difficult to get started.  Characters a little confusing at start.  But good read. The Casual Vacancy ---interesting to read about politics in small town in England.

author: austinannie
title: Boring
body: Too long, too many characters to keep track of. I love her other books but this one is a big disappointment

author: K. Fox
title: A captivating read
body: I really like this book and did find it hard to put it down. I wanted to read it in one go! The story is believable and the characters have their own distinct voices, reaction guaranteed!

author: Diane Howard
title: authentic
body: the darker sides of Muggles, w redemption at a steep price, told w nuance in a complex structure. worth reading!

author: JD
title: GREAT BOOK!!
body: I am a huge fan of JK Rowling, and this book did not disappoint! Different from her other books, which was a great surprise!

author: penran
title: the Casual Vacancy
body: I found it hard to understand that the author who could create such believable characters and suspense as existed in the Harry Potter books could offer such boring, dull and unsuspenseful characters and story line as existed in this book. It was predictable and trite. Maybe listening to it was part of the problem. Perhaps I could have raced along if reading and skipped some of the overly descriptive passages. I certainly would not have had to listen to the British accent. While I found none of the characters likable or sympathetic I continued listening because I kept hoping it would get better. It did not.

author: Jonie
title: Negative
body: Boring.....I gave up 3/4's of the way through.  The story is boring, the characters are boring. This is a good book to use as a sleeping pill.

author: Caseyannie
title: The effects of bulling
body: At first glance I thought there were to many characters to keep up with.  Then I found that the author developed them so well that was not a problem and each had a reason for being there.

author: Sararuna
title: Tough
body: Casual Vacancy has left me speechless and wrung out. It was challenging to keep all characters straight and to find any to like yet the story was compelling and now that I've finished I keep going over the relationships and actions were never quite what they seemed. Rawlings has achieved something thought provoking.

author: Nikki's Opinion
title: Ms. Rowling, what were you thinking?
body: I feel strongly that if you write an outstanding series for children, you have a certain responsibility to maintain values in future books, even those intended for adults. Like a child star gone wrong, this book went the wrong way ... Language & situations just way too dark!!!  It dampened my enjoyment of the Harry Potter series.

author: Suzanne E. Frew-Harris
title: Small Town Politics And Lives
body: Seemingly slow because of all the characters involved, the web gets spun and the story takes off and into each home's secrets.

author: mel3600
title: Very Disappointed
body: Loved her harry potter books.  Thought I would enjoy a more adult story, but this had too many f bombs for me.

author: Amazon Customer
title: So Very Disappointed
body: First off, I didn't buy this book.  I rented it from the library.  Second, I wanted to like this book.  I really like JK Rowling as an author.  I think she is a good one.  But man was I disappointed in this book and in her.  She seemed to take every bad thing about humanity and put it into one book about one small town, and killed off the one "good" man in the whole story. (And no, that wasn't a spoiler.  You learn that he dies from the cover.)

author: Kindle Customer
title: Odd Book
body: This book is about small town political back biting and scheming. The book is set in England and has numerous English words i had never heard before and had to figure out from the context of the sentences they were in. It's interesting but if J K Rowling hadn't been the author, I probably wouldn't have bought it.

author: Emma
title: Not Harry Potter!! :)
body: She can really paint a picture with what she writes.. But felt slightly let down by the way the book ended. But over all good read!!

author: Binge Reader
title: Exceptional take on the fragility of the human psyche
body: Thoroughly enjoyed this well-written examination on life, politics, and relationships in small town England. Have never read J. K. Rowling before so no preconceived notions of old styles and content.

author: KT
title: Well Written
body: There is no doubt that Rowling's can write and weave a tall like the best of them.  She is masterful in her darkness.  I did not love it.

author: Lauren Cooper
title: Will Be Awesome
body: I bought this for my husband to read on his Kindle. Though we've not read it yet, I know it will be awesome, odiously because it's by J.K. Rowling!:) After he reads it, I'll be reading it for sure. I know we'll both love it! Can't wait! :)

author: A. White
title: Fascinating, well-written story - difficult to put down once you start
body: While the storyline for this book is completely different in every way from the Harry Potter series, Rowling's pure writing talent shines through as stromg as ever. She takes a narrative that, in the hands of anyone else, would be boring (small town politics and gossip) and makes it fascinating and difficult to put down. Barry Fairbrother is the character who dies at the very beginning, setting off the events of the book. And yet...Rowling makes you care about him, a character you barely meet. She makes you care about all of the inhabitants of the town, and makes you see the motivations and passions driving all of them - there is no objective right or wrong in this little world of Pagford, no true good or evil. It must be said, however, that Rowling does not gloss over harsh realities of life here.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I was able to put it down
body: This was not an exciting book to read, in fact it depressed me a bit.  I loved the HP books and spent many a sleepless night till I finished each one.  This one I put down and had a hard time finishing.

author: Kelly Gardner
title: Miserable
body: This was a very confusing book with too many characters and too much going on. I do not recommend it at all.

author: Frederic Smoak
title: A small, petty book about small petty people.
body: I felt like washing my hands whenever I put it down. It makes every character look bad, weak or malicious. The only one treated sympathetically dies in the opening scene. She can do better.

author: Vicki L. Butterfield
title: J.K. Rowlings
body: I loved her other books but this book is not as interesting. Hard to follow and not easy reading. Little disappointed.

author: Rick Toboz
title: Do not read!
body: This book basically says life sucks, people are nasty and death is a release. It was too dark. My entire book club hated it! Look for better.

author: Buyer
title: worst book ever
body: It is a terrible, terrible book. I cannot believe the author of the Harry Potter books and The Cuckoo's Calling, which I recommend, wrote this trash. It is horrible. Avoid it.

author: Jodi Wibbels
title: An Important Work
body: I finished this book three days ago and I can't stop thinking about it. One major theme of the book is how absolutely trapped disadvantage people are, especially the kids. If they don't get a hand up, they won't make it. It's not a matter of working harder or even of making better choices. It was quite an eye-opener. I think our Judeo-Christian culture is a bit schizophrenic--we have our Puritan heritage that says we deserve what we get, and the words of Jesus that tell us to care for the poor and downtrodden. More often than not, the Puritan voice is loudest and wins out.

author: Debbie R.
title: It took a while to realize it was a good book...
body: I never read the Harry Potter series, so didn't know what to expect. It took me half the book to get involved and finally remember who was who and what was going on. But after that I was hooked. I also enjoyed picking up on the British jargon.  Sometimes I was anxious to get through the descriptive parts and get back to figure out the plot, but I realize now that I actually had a picture of the town and the people in my head.

author: Lucia Taddeo
title: Could do better
body: I prefer Rowling's writing when she deals with magic. This book got the message across, a very important one at that, but reading it was very tedious, a problem on every page. Rowling can support a cause without necessarily writing fiction about it. She might have done a better job researching and reporting real facts and stories.

author: Dr. Jack E. Skiles
title: A book certainly worth reading....
body: This book is surely an auto-biographic of Rowling's life before fame.  It is extremely detailed with the commonplace horrors and abuse that come with small town living.  An excellent read that requires some discipline to wade through to the very end.

author: ebs
title: Good read
body: Very interesting characters with a well developed story. Would definitely recommend this book. An easy read but  thoroughly engaging story.

author: Principessa Madre
title: Good Read
body: Enjoyed this novel.  Nothing like Harry Potter so know that before you read it.  JK Rowling is a wonderful writer.  Her insight into human nature is so interesting.  Will continue to read any novels that she writes.

author: belairdebra
title: A dreadful read.
body: It is rare that I do not finish reading a novel.  I tried to persevere to the end of A Casual Vacancy but absolutely could not!  This book was dreadfully boring to say the least!  I would have more fun putting together a jigsaw puzzle of a basketball then to force myself to finish reading this book.  A tooth extraction would be more fun!  If this is how people in a small English town live I would rather not visit it even in a fictional story.  I won't drone on and on about it.  If you have read it you know what I'm talking about, and if you haven't don't bother wasting your time.  Granted JK Rowling did a fantastic job writing the Harry Potter books, I think she would be better off staying in the genre of children's fantasy books.  Good luck next time Ms. Rowling.

author: Lelia
title: so depressing
body: i stopped reading this book almost halfway, i found it so depressing. such a bummer, i just read cuckoo's calling and loved it!

author: Vivien Halloran
title: Complex story
body: Lots of characters to follow but it is a good read. Gave me insight into small town England and the welfare and town government systems.

author: Beth Wheeler
title: Even better than I hoped it would be
body: I really don't think that any review written by someone who went into buying this book thinking that the writing would be like Harry Potter should be taken seriously.

author: DojoDiva
title: 500 Pages of Everything Wrong With the World
body: Dreary and, after slogging through it all, rather uninspiring. It's difficult to connect with the stereotypical characters. I usually enjoy Brit Lit, but I couldn't wait for this one to be over. Didn't care for the HP series either. The writing in both is very one dimensional.

author: V. Knocke
title: Well written but depressing.
body: It certainly isn't a cheerful read, and none of the characters were love able or redeemed themselves by the end. Too much like real life to offer an escape.

author: G. Russell
title: How the mighty have fallen
body: Originally published under a pseudonym, The Casual Vacancy got the response it deserved. No sale. Then J.K. decided to fess up and her loyal readers flocked to the bookstores. It is a good thing I read it as a library book or I would have wanted my money back! My daughter bought the book on tape and didn't finish it.

author: MsStaciNicole
title: I wanted to like it
body: I really really wanted to like this book, but I just could never get into the story or the characters.

author: R. D. Le Vine
title: Engaging but...
body: I chose to read this book because I am a huge Harry Potter fan and thus wanted to continue to support Rowling and her great writing.

author: Zevi
title: to the point
body: j.k.rowling hit the nail on the head with the characters in the casual vacancy.Her understanding of the teenagers in the small town was fantastic together with their interaction with the sometimes unpleasant adults.i felt I got to know almost all the characters through rowlings wonderful literary style.agreat read

author: Paul H
title: Casual Scenario
body: Well written, good characters, reasonably good dialogue, plot a little bit slow so far.  But I'm only half way through.

author: JudeR
title: Appalling and heartbreaking story of a dysfunctional community!
body: It's hard to believe so much envy,spite and neuroses could exist in one small village, but Rowling puts it all together to make a compelling and disturbing,yet intriguing story. The characters are complex.  Some will disgust you, some will break your heart.  Some will make you angry and some will redeem themselves. But they will all rivet your heart and mind to this remarkable story.  Bravo, J.K.Rowling.

author: Michael Higgin
title: Disappointing
body: I have to agree with some of the worst reviews and with some of the best reviews.  This is a mixed bag of a read.  It's extremely difficult to like any of the major characters - we may feel sorry for them, but we do not like them.  A social conscience is never a bad thing, but it needs a deft hand if the writing isn't to slip into diatribe and melodrama.  The author is not always successful.  I'm afraid I had to force myself to finish.  There's no need for the length of this book.  Tighter writing would have enhanced the read.  The ending of the book and the attempts to wrap up all the various plotlines, leaves one with little hope and with very little sense of redemption.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I enjoyed it
body: Overall this was a good book and I liked it.  There was nothing groundbreaking done, and the plot wasn't spectacular.  If you're looking for a good, basic book - then give this one a try.

author: Trish
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Just could not get interested in the book.  Did not finish it.  May go back to it later and try again.

author: nan12
title: Thought-provoking novel with few defects
body: In this novel, J.K Rowling boldly picks up her pen to deal with harsh themes, the most important ones being poverty, its consequences such as drugs, prostitution, violence, and society's responsibility for the dire circumstances some are left to live in.

author: Amy  Roth
title: HARD ROW TO HOE
body: Most of the characters were unbelievably neurotic, if not psychotic, and there is very little hope in this book.  I don't have to have a happy ending, and the denoument of all this was fairly clever, but it was tough to read it.

author: K. Chandler
title: For All The Reasons..........................
body: ...................stated in the previous 923 one star reviews, I hated this book. Do not waste your time or money. This book would never have been published if the author's name was anything other than J. K. Rowling.

author: Sean Carter
title: Page Turner
body: This books was different from Harry Potter series that she wrote for children but it keep me want know what would happen next to all characters in this book

author: Jennifer G. Loparo
title: boring, boring, boring...
body: I can't believe this is by J.K. Rowling. Couldn't put down Harry Potter, had a hard time picking this up. Not an enjoyable read for me

author: dc metro area
title: slow moving
body: The book should have been shorter. The author is expecting a lot of the reader to wade through 500 slow-moving pages. Three quarters of the book is background, with all the "action" coming at the very end.  Most people would find this book boring unless they are interested in personality studies, particularly character defects. None of the characters are likeable or truly happy. One of the takeaways from this book is the drawbacks of living in a small town. Another point seems to be that we never really know the innermost thoughts of another person, even our spouse or immediate family members. And, if we did, we probably wouldn't like them.  The book makes you question whether anyone is really nice deep down. The book is very thought-provoking about the human condition if you can get through it all, but one is left depressed.

author: Genice Dickerson
title: Vacancy
body: So many characters and so much going on, hard to put aside and pick back up.  Good characters relative to this time of our lives and things going on.

author: jmere
title: Enjoyable read
body: Great read. I had low expectations after reading mixed reviews but it's been very enjoyable. Great book for those of us who love looking beyond the exterior and seeing the inner workings of people's lives. Felt rather like a 21st century pop version of George Eliot.

author: Nora M
title: Boring
body: Didn't expect it to be anything like Harry Potter, and it wasn't. But I did expect JKRowling to be able to tell us another fascinating story, and she didn't.  This story was boring.  The cast of way too many charactors was hard to care about. Plodding through the book, knowing "something" would eventually happen wasn't enough. The deaths at the end were predictable.

author: Lucia Amado
title: A completely different J.K.Rowling
body: I was eager to go on reading and although there were lots of characters in the story, at the end the author managed to find a credible solution to each one of them.  I just found it funny to see so many parenthesis throughout the book.

author: June R from Oz
title: Not my cup of tea.
body: I am still only 50% through and I am finding it long winded and a bit boring.  I feel it is far too detailed and seems to be never getting somewhere.  I much preferred The Cuckoo's Calling.  I also find the amount of swearing rather annoying.  Obviously, the characters who swear most are either the rougher individuals or the teenagers but I feel the writer is over using the bad language, sometimes to the point of my irritation.  This probably does not affect most readers, but my personal taste deems the use of bad language used in this story is a little too much for me.

author: Tbenzy
title: A Different Beast Entirely, But a Rewarding Read
body: I was very disappointed to see this book averaged only three stars. I preordered "Casual Vacancy" because, let's face it, I'll read anything J.K. Rowling writes. I think too many people did the same thing, hoping for and expecting the same type of can't-put-it-down experience with a wonderful cast of characters who are either evil or basically fantastic.

author: Steven
title: Disappointing
body: There's no doubt Rowling knows how to write. Even with a distinct change of genre it's still clear that the author hasn't changed. What has changed is that rather than having great characters and stories like her previous work, this novel is all about petty drama and miserable pathetic people. I was bored from the first chapter, but kept going in hopes that it would get better. I eventually gave up because it was so frustratingly uninteresting. Rowling is better than this. I hope she realizes that and makes a better return in the future.

author: Kathie L Johnson
title: Good read
body: Well written, many twist. Reflected human nature and all the complications life has. Was for mature readers, but could be read by well-read younger readers.

author: Semaj
title: A Bitter Novel
body: The Aristototilian theory of tragedy required a hero that the audience invested in, so that the audience then personally felt the hero's downfall. Well written and well constructed as this novel is, there is nobody to like, to invest in. This bitter novel, a decline and fall of practically everybody, is quite unlike her other recent adult novel, "The Cuckoo's Calling", which had two central characters you immediately liked and invested in. In "The Casual Vacancy." Rowling's well-crafted characters range from petty, egocentric, not-too bright through to truly evil. This may be an accurate portrait of the human condition but I would not call it a "fun read." At the end of a satisfying novel, I feel a bit abandoned, as if friends have gone away. At the end of "The Casual Vacancy," I was really glad to get out of Pagford.

author: Lynn Arnold
title: Vacant
body: I did not really enjoy this.  Found it's characters unlikeable in every sense--know I was suppose to feel that way about some of them--but it carried over to all I felt I was just reading about a bunch of snooty people

author: M. Gelfand
title: Hard to Get Immersed
body: I had  difficult time reading this book. Actually put book aside read and finished another book. Came back to this book to give it another go at it. I did finish it but was disappointed; the characters well I could not feel them or their personality. Maybe it's me for expecting too much from Rowling.

author: Lyndy Lou 56
title: Well written characters, believable
body: A small village and its many characters.

author: Lynne
title: The Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling
body: This is an example of how the life of one citizen of a town/community impacts the lives of the town and how the death of that citizen starts a web like chain reaction that changes lives and the town itself.

author: Marylin M. Butorac
title: Don't bother.  What a disappointment.
body: One of the worst books I've ever encountered.  It is nothing but example after example of the WORST traits of human beings.  Poorly organized and generally just a beating.  I finished the whole thing hoping at least ONE character would redeem themselves in some way.  I rather think the author needs some personal counseling.  How does she exist in this sort of world view?

author: C. S.
title: Steady Read
body: The book appears to be set in the early 60s and covers the effect that an "Estate" on the border of a nearby town has on a country village. There are no killings, the plot revolves around a death on the first page and the implications it has on the lives of everyone in the country village and the "Estate", by creating a Casual Vacancy. I did not give it five stars because it plods along to a fairly expected end with hardly any real surprises or plot twists. It doesn't compare with the Roger Galbraith crime novel. It certainly brought back memories of my post war life when we had a council estate abutted to our upper class village, just round the corner from me, in a green belt village that currently is in the top ten for house prices in England.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Well written but rather dull
body: I tried to keep an open mind as I read this book, aware that the reviews were not great when it first came out.  I thought the book was well written, almost too well written.  The descriptions are very detailed and lyrical but at times seem to slow the story down as it plodded towards the conclusion.  In the end I thought it was just ok - a rather depressing read that I will soon forget.

author: James Robbins
title: Not of the caliber I have come to expect
body: Lost my interest after 25 pages. Pretty bland and uninteresting. Liked her other book under her made up name of Galbreath.

author: Sabriena
title: Just couldn't do it
body: This book, The Casual Vacancy is by the great author J.K. Rowling but, you knew that by now, didn't you? Now I want to first say that I can't really give this book a totally 100% fair review because I could not finish it. I really couldn't even get through half of it, I got through about 38% of the book before I had to just call it quits.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Love this new book.
body: It's not Harry potter but I did not expect it to be. What a great plot very entertaining, hard to predict. You want to cry, cheer and shout and root for the underdog. Can't wait to read the next book.

author: Tara
title: Okay, but not great
body: I'll be honest, I had high expectations for this book; it being her first novel outside of the HP series. She is a fantastic writer and the writing was definitely not lacking. However, I didn't love the storyline and I really didn't like the ending. So, overall, it was an okay book, but not great. If your a JK fan I'd say go for it and read it, but don't expect it to be anything like HP!

author: Bonnie Wagner
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: It was ok but a little disappointed.  Not the kinda book that I just couldn't put down, but I did read it all not just deleted it.

author: Jane Douglas
title: Not everyone in my Book Club would agree, but ...
body: I loved the way the author "draws" the characters.  She is a master at connecting the very different lives of each and making their perspectives become visible and believable to us as observers.

author: dancingteacher
title: Save your money.
body: I love JK Rowling. I did not like this book at all. I spent $20 on it at an airport bookstore because I forgot my Kindle and after struggling through the first few chapters, all I can say is I wish I could have that $20 back.

author: Carol
title: vacuous and hollow
body: Boring.....Too many characters....Convoluted and hard to follow! Plot was missing and srung out.....I'll stick to nonfiction from now on...Wasn't my type of story..

author: Jenna Ellsworth
title: Captivating and authentic
body: Rowling's description of the intertwined lives of the people in Pagford tells a story of a small town at war with itself. The different perspectives give the book depth of character and an appreciation for the individuals throughout the story. Well done.

author: Maya Craig
title: Strong, scary, uncannily observant
body: An amazing, sad, loving book about people who can be weak, blind, conceited, and some of them redeemed. It talks about the tragedy of life that beats one down and about the magic of resilience and love.

author: lola
title: Good Read
body: Rowling writes great descriptions! The most enjoyable part of her novels. You really "know" the physical areas she's writing about.

author: A. Wetzel
title: Love J.K.'s writing
body: I really enjoyed this book. I love J.K.'s writing. This book made me remember how important it is to not judge people. You never know why people do what they do, Crystal is the perfect example.

author: written
title: slow start but moving
body: I wanted to put this book down several times at the start but remembered another reviewers recommendation to keep going until the half way point when everything picks up. My advice is to do the same. This book reveals complex characters slowly.  I was able to appreciate the characters existence as a complicated human experience where good and evil were so hard to delineate. Very moving read!

author: Dominika
title: Unpredictable story of a real world
body: A lot of people expected a murder mystery novel. It isn't one. I'm not a fan of J.K. Rowling and her Harry Potter series. I read only the first four books and I was not thrilled. But this one was just the opposite.

author: verbose
title: Very sad, very gripping
body: I had expected a good story from Rowling, but I found this more than just an interesting tale. It's moving and even tragic.

author: Melinda Kinkel
title: J.K. Rowling does it again
body: It's hard to put down. Easy to pick up because of the author. She doesn't disappoint. It's one of those books you could purchase sight unseen and not be disappointed.

author: Happy Gardner
title: A good read
body: A whole village full of disfunctional people, and they are all adults. The children of these adults show just what can happen when their par nets do not pay attention.

author: Linda
title: Boring
body: I am having a hard time with the dialect but feel the story line is boring. I would not recommend it

author: Franaby
title: A chore to read.
body: Sorry to say this was a tedious chore to read.  A real downer!  About the dregs of society.  Wouldn't recommend to anyone.

author: Effie
title: No plot, many characters
body: So many angry, discontented characters in a small petty-sounding

author: A. Parra
title: Took a while to get into it, but then could not put it down
body: I was excited to get this book, being a huge harry potter fan. The story was slow in the beginning, and I actually put it down for a few months until I picked it up again a few days ago, and I haven't put it down until I finished it today. Admittedly, I like books some may consider dry or boring, and I love getting very involved in character's lives (dickens anyone?), so this was right up my alley. I saw parts of myself in these characters, even things that weren't so flattering. I think it paints a good picture of how people can get so involved in themselves and their own feelings that they become blind to what other people may be thinking about the same situation, and do not think about where their actions will ultimately take them. Overall, I really enjoyed the book, and would recommend that you at least make it a few chapters in before you decide you don't like it. I can't wait to read more of her work.

author: MFutrell
title: Worth the read!
body: Agreed with others, that there is a lot of characters to "remember." As you invest your time into this book, it becomes fairly easy to remember everyone. Excellent story!

author: Susan K Gonzales
title: Hang in there & keep reading ....
body: The first half of the book was a bit slow, but the 2nd half made up for it.

author: Lara Balter
title: its good i think that it is good it
body: its good I think it is really good and interesting i am not done yet but i think that it is good

author: Amazon Customer
title: Depressing and worthless story, I hated it,
body: If you like to read about the worst of humankind in a part of England then this is the book for you, not that I always want Pollyanna type books but I could not stand to subject myself to one more horrible character

author: prolific reader
title: Casual Vacancy
body: Rowling did a very good job in developing her characters and the story line in this book.  The ending was a bit too neat but I didn't fault her for this. I enjoyed the book very much. I hope she keeps writing for adults.

author: Jonnie Johnson
title: I loved this book!
body: I loved this book!! As the reviews show, this book is not for everyone. It's deep! J.K. Rowling is a brilliant author, and I can only hope for more adult novels. I have to admit to writing down the names of all the characters, and would recommend that in a book with so many main characters, it would be helpful to list them.

author: Amazon Customer
title: This Isn't Hogwarts
body: I just recently began listening to audio books to pass the time during the long commute to my new job. I had been listening to comedy books, but wanted to try something different. I selected this one because (a) I loved J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter series and grew to love many of the characters, and (b) I thought it would be a light-hearted read about an English community.  I was wrong about it being light-hearted. This novel turned into a dark story with wonderfully developed characters.  I felt all were very realistic with flaws that drove me crazy. Every one of them reminded me of someone I knew.

author: bill2406
title: Rowling does it again
body: I am very happy with this book. Rowling had me hooked with the Harry Potter Series. It is a good read but some people who aren,t acquainted with British Traditions and culture may find it a bit of a bore. So take the story for it's face value and enjoy the intricacies of daily life in a British village

author: R. Shuttleworth
title: Character study of a small town
body: "Casual Vacancy" is a well written novel in which JK Rowlings exhibits her best in filling out characters and presenting scenes. We become familiar with this small town and it big political issues, all made the more prominent due to the death of one of their local political personalities. This leaves the "Casual Vacancy" on their city council.

author: Mountain Mom
title: Hard time finishing this
body: Good friend recommended this read so here I am trying to finish.  I just don't like any of the people in the story.  I like to root for someone and this book just doesn't give me that.

author: Jane Roche
title: Disappointed
body: I was very eager to read something different of J.K.Rowling's because I had loved the Harry Potter series. But I have to say I was quite disappointed in this novel. All the characters were depressed and unhappy at the beginning and they were all pretty much depressed and unhappy at the end. There is some character development and some unexpected turns but I kept waiting for something to happen to change something in this town of sadness. But sadly, it never did.

author: Christina Frohock
title: Huge disappointment
body: I have never read the Harry Potter series nor seen a movie. But Rowley'a astounding popularity made me curious. I was shocked and disappointed. Very slow read; started over once to give it a chance to enhance. It never did. So I gave up after less than 1/2 way through.

author: Patricia Schenkkan
title: Really?
body: Did the creative brain and intellect that brought us Harry Potter really write this book? What a disappointment! Not a book for lovers of Harry.

author: myrna
title: VERY ENGLISH
body: DYSFUNCTIONAL TOWN, DYSFUNCTIONAL PEOPLE, WHAT MORE COULD YOU ASK FOR. SHE DID WRITE IT WELL HAVEN BEEN TO ENGLAND MANY TIMES I FELT I WAS BACK THERE AGAIN.

author: Heather M Gordon
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I really enjoyed this book and I didn't want it to end but wanted to know what happened.  Wonderful view of peoples perceptions.

author: Armando Brons
title: SMALL TOWN  BIG  INFERNO  would have been a more appropriate title...
body: What a deception!, what a waste! It is hard to reconcile that the same author who wrote the brilliant and almost spiritual Harry Potter's books could have written this demoralizing and undignified novel about the tragic and base common lives of the inhabitants of a small English town; a parody of a mediocre and hurting Hell on Earth. It reminded me in some aspects of John Updike's writing at his darkest and most depressive. There is not one single truly loving soul to be found in that inferno...

author: W. A. Bruce
title: A sad commentary (and boring)
body: If the author's intent was to deal a nasty blow to English society, then she has been successful.

author: Diane D. Zener
title: I was not expecting more Potter...
body: However, I was expecting some more intriguing reading. I just can not get into this book. I've tried starting it a few times and always end up bored.

author: Reader
title: Growing Up
body: I grew up with Harry Potter as well - Jo taught me English, taught me storytelling, inspired me to start writing. The thing I loved most about Harry Potter was that it wasn't really a children's story. There was a fog of fantasy and lightheartedness, but neither did Jo ever hold back on showing everyone how dark life can get. Harry Potter was a dark children's story.

author: debbie williams
title: bad book
body: I didn't enjoy this book at all. I thought it was predicable and the people in it were not likeable at all. I forced myself to finish it thanking it would get better but it never did.

author: Reader Frank
title: Boring, boring, boring!!!
body: Too much chatter, not enough real story, jumps back and forth too much, never really goes anywhere, very disappointing end.

author: Gardinale Stefano
title: A superb novel
body: I hadn't read any other work of Ms Rowling, so It was with an open mind that I downloaded the sample,,, which grabbed me immediately!

author: Mimi
title: Not good.
body: Just couldn't quite get into this book. I didn't finish it. Just couldn't make myself read it. Hate it wasn't better.

author: Mary E, Bois
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Well written, but the sadness of the story and hopelessness I felt at finishing the novel were unexpected.  I was glad I had read The Cuckoo's Calling first.

author: Kodemunkey
title: Not Harry Potter, but that's ok...
body: I typically don't have time to write up reviews for the books I've read, but this time I wanted to give my opinion about a book that has (unfairly) received a lot of negative reviews.  I will agree that those looking to read this book in hopes of a Harry Potter-ish type of read are going to be disappointed, as this books focus is much more sociological in nature. However; those familiar with Ms. Rowling's writing style will not be disappointed with this book, as she does a very good job of providing a casual flowing interaction between the characters in the book (much like she did with the characters in the Harry Potter series). Personally, I think being able to create a casual, unforced dialog between characters is one of Ms. Rowling's best gifts as a author.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Hours of my life I will never get back
body: This book was a waste of time. I should not have purchased this as it seemed unlikely to mentally stimulate in any way, however I had read the positive reviews by the Washington Post and others who raved about it. I thought there must be something interesting here... This was an utter bore, I thought if I kept reading it would get better... it did not. When I have time to sit and read, I prefer a book with a story... this is simply a monotonous log of petty small town daily life... don't waste your time.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Too much unneccessary detail
body: The basis of The Casual Vacancy is a simple situation - a town Councillor dies and must be replaced. J.K. Rowling delves in the past, present and future of the people of the town. `Delving' is the right word, because, for me, many times there is too much detail, which distracts from the immediate story behind the simple situation. The best example of this is the Weedon family, with all the attempts at West Country accents on paper. I must admit I thought of giving up a few times (rare for me), but I continued, and in the end I'm glad I did. However, I think if Rowling's name had not been on the manuscript this book would have struggled to get published.

author: Horrorchuckle
title: Depressing story by a great writer
body: I found this book to be thoroughly depressing story and I hated the subject matter, but Rowling shows she can write something other than children's books.  One thing I did notice that this book had in common with HP books: Rowling gave the young people the power to try and do something about their situation and, grown-ups are terrible.  The only people who found peace in the end were the dead.  I would have given this book five stars if Rowling would have done something horrible to Obbo. And maybe, the young people will learn from this tragedy and be better people than their parents. Now, I'm looking forward to Rowling's other adult book.

author: Rene
title: A moving, superb book
body: I loved this book - not a happy story, but a real, 'authentic' story. Each character see,ed vile at some point, but almost all were forgivable (Shirley excepted).

author: Tom Dumont
title: If you like a soap opera
body: you will like the book.  It's not exactly my preferred reading genre, yet it was good enough for me to finish and the ending was the high point IMHO.

author: Sonia Mathew Luvi
title: Surprisingly lovely
body: I shouldn't say I was surprised as I loved the Harry Potter books (not the movies!) but you just never expect someone to make the transition from children's books to adult ones easily.  I decided to try it anyway and was pleasantly surprised.  Interesting weave, colorful characters who stay with you even after you've put down your iPad, pace and rhythm.  Am recommendign to everyone I know (who reads).

author: Debbie Dammeir
title: casual vacancy
body: can't imagine the writer of the Harry Potter series wrote something this boring.  I was very, very disappointed by this.

author: asubtbhm
title: great story
body: this was an amazing story to read. as you read it you get suprised and blown away at the the storyline

author: B. Wieland
title: An intersesting read
body: As always, JK Rowling gives us in-depth and well rounded characters. Nothing to do with a magical world, this one is well grounded in reality, warts and all.

author: Mary M Stevens
title: Not what I was expecting
body: Could not even get into it.  Very slow reading could not get far enough into the book.  Great writer was expecting so much more than it delivered.

author: William I. Griffith
title: Do not read if you have a vacant mind
body: A dark and disturbing novel about many people you have already met one place or another.  This book hits on a host of social issues, including:

author: Allan Inkpen
title: The way it is
body: Anyone who has worked and lived in a small community and not felt similarity with these people haven't had their ears and eyes open. It was a dogged read yet I wanted more and at the end I was quite unprepared for the finale - a huge surprise yet with great insight and depth from Ms Rowling.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Just ok
body: I was expecting more. Well written but mildly entertaining for me.  I have never read any of her previous books.  Not sure I would recommend to a friend.

author: Joann Ross
title: The casual vacancy
body: Wow, what a gripping tale. Tragic. Quite different than the Harry potter books ( although those had a lot of sadness too.)

author: kate
title: THIS BOOK IS ABOUT MUGGLES!
body: Much to my dismay, this book was centered entirely around Muggles.

author: Christopher M Barrett
title: Not bad
body: Starts slow but picks up.  Sort of like the movie "Crash" where there is a few clusters of main characters yet everyone is intertwined.  Good read.

author: L. H. Savage
title: A different side of a beloved author
body: I had read the reviews ahead of time so I knew this was not going to be anything like the Potter series but I love JK Rowling so much that I was willing to give this one a try anyway, and I'm glad I did. It was a little slow on action but the characters are well developed and definitely intriguing. I found myself not wanting to put it down. Not nearly as exciting as Harry's adventures but still worth reading.

author: Teresa Wilson
title: Don't waste your money.
body: Don't waste your money.  I could not even finish the book.  I was so disapppointed in this book.  I am not a fan of the "F" word and this book tries to see how many times you can use this word.  Very, very disappointed in this book.

author: Kathy F
title: Not what I expected
body: I really didn't like this book. It is a tragedy. There are no characters that you can identify with or hope thy do well.  There are just people who are flawed that you can't care about.  To tell the truth, I did't read the middle of the book because I read the end after I didn't care about the beginning, and realized that it didn't get any better.

author: Bernie Butt
title: It's no Harry Potter
body: I knew when I bought it that it was not anything like Harry Potter, all of the reviews said as much.  But I did expect the writing to be as good, just targeting a different (adult) audience.  I really think the writing was second rate, and if Rowling had been a first time writer I don't think this would have ever been published.

author: Mary Peeler
title: Where is the story?
body: The story line was so hard to follow I found myself wondering where the story line was.  I was never able to finish it and was falling asleep by the second chapter.  Terrible writing from one of the worlds best storytellers.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Boring
body: Hated the book....very depressing....I most assuredly did not expect another Harry Potter but I did expect a book that at least I could finish...she should stick to what she does best....so many more avenues she can take in the HP series by developing the other characters....I also heard they are making a movie of this book....YIKES....can't imagine anyone going to see it...except maybe people in the UK....very disappointed that's all I can say

author: Anna Larson
title: The worst book I have ever read....heed my warning and skip this one
body: I received this book as a gift, and I should have quit reading it after the first chapter.  It was twisted, hard to read, depressing and disturbing.  The end of the book was completely anti-climatic and there was no plot or conclusion that tied the whole thing together.  The entire book consisted of the meanderings and selfish actions of various people in a community. I kept thinking that the book had to get better once I got through the agonizing torture of trying to keep track of all the different characters and their relationships. No such luck!

author: GWD
title: A Very Good Book.
body: While this book will not be in the canon of western literature 50 years from now it is still a good book. The book has characters that are all flawed even the one who is held to be a the greatest man in the town. It also makes you question issues because everything is not black and white.  The end does not end on a sad or happy note but a mix of both. The only complaints I have with this book is that it does not make an impression that will last for years. The other complaint is that a serious situation is used at the end to keep a character likeable at the end which turns it into a plot device.

author: Kathy Brawley
title: It's a keeper
body: An intelligent piece of fiction.  I find the characters very believable and the writing very engaging.

author: Amazon Customer
title: not for kids
body: this book is not for harry potter kids it for ad. do not think this is about make be. it is about kids in the real w

author: SavannaIce
title: Just so so story.
body: Sort of a soap opera type narrative.  Too many characters with too slow a direction.  Her latest book was very much liked.

author: JimH
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: This book is social commentary.  It is a hyperbole of misfortune and misunderstanding.  The book starts off dark, and things only move from bad to worse.  It isn't for those looking for a light hearted tale of life in the English countryside; it's grim, and it tackles grave topics, most of which have no clear answer or solution.

author: Sue Jaqua
title: Book
body: This book is a departure from Harry Potter.  It was a bit raunchy but maybe the author was trying to write something entirely different.

author: T. Campaign
title: Ugh for Casual Vacancy
body: I loved the Harry Potter books.  I hated this book so much that I couldn't get past page 85. I don't find pornography to be entertaining. I never found the plotline.

author: SIDNEY M. SENSING
title: J. K. Rowling is the best when it comes to Book experiences!
body: Couldn't help to love anything written by J. K. Rowling and looking forward to her new series of books coming out about the happenings before Hogwarts; bring it on and let me add more of her books to my collection.

author: Tracy
title: Haunting and skillfully written.
body: For some reason I'm reminded of Edith Wharton's books when reading The Casual Vacancy. Each character is so authentic and individual but somehow Ms. Rowling is also able to remind us that no single experience is solitary. You might think that you are completely singular and alone with your thoughts in this world, but it's a safe bet that one of your neighbors is having the exact same thoughts.

author: John O'Connor
title: Excellent and shrewd
body: Excellent writing. Very shrewd observation of characters. It's not life as we would like it but it's life as it is. Black humour softens the realisation.

author: Bobbie Linton
title: F bomb all over the place
body: We were warned that it was an adult book but most adults do not want to hear or read something that has the F word over and over throughout the whole book!  Totally unnecessary.  My husband would not even listen the the CDs.  We only got two CDs in and put it away - unable to finish it.

author: Tomi Alger
title: skip this book
body: I did not like The Casual Vacancy. I found it vulgar and depressing. There was little hope for any of the characters, who were selfish and mean. The rampant use of the f-word lowered my liking of the book. One good point of the book is that unseen ramifications of what someone posts on the Internet is evidenced.  I did read the whole book and was disappointed in how it ends. I do have several friends who started it and did not like it, and, therefore, never finished it. I am interested in viewing the murder-detective mystery that Rowling has also written, but if it is anything like the Casual Vacancy, i will not be interested in anything else she writes.

author: Debbie Marshall
title: Enjoyed the characters and story line.
body: The characters were so intriguingly unique.  The description of the backdrop and character were so vivid for the imagination. Once started reading didn't want want to stop. Initially there was some issues with the number of characters involved and their purpose. Great writing!

author: Sandra Duell
title: Great read
body: Haven't read the Harry potter series as the genre doesn't appeal so was a bit apprehensive before reading this book but was really surprised at how great this book is. Brilliant characters and a great story line. Look forward to her next 'adult' book

author: Amazon Customer
title: Forget everything Harry Potter
body: There is no Harry Potter about this book. Forget she wrote them. This was amazing, small town secrets, British humour, I loved it. Sometimes sad, sometimes dark and disturbing. All together great. I am looking forward to reading more.

author: Wordsmith
title: slow moving story - a tortoise
body: The story began with a man's death -- then many characters were introduced very soon thereafter.  The story line was the tortoise (to Harry Potter as the hare)  In the first hundred pages I had to go back and read half dozen sections to figure out who was who; basically I got lost with so many characters at once.(e.g. was Shirley related to Maureen or was Howard same person as Mr.Price?)

author: Chrissy J
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: It's all in the detail

author: Maurice
title: Not greatt
body: Far too long for the nature of the content fount it became boreing.Found it good as a sleeping potion.Thank you

author: Robert John Keefe
title: Mistress of a New Agenda
body: In "The Casual Vacancy," J K Rowling demonstrates that she commands the techniques that have given us the great English novels  rich characters, dense social relations that are far too complicated and ambiguous to be called "networks," well-mounted plotting, and the humor with which to grasp the comedy of English provincial life. But she puts these techniques to a new purpose, upending the complacent, status-quo loving resolution of traditional novels. Astonishingly, Rowling infiltrates the English village novel with a trumpeting cry for social justice. Not to worry, though; "The Casual Vacancy" is a lovely read.

author: nat
title: I was excited to get this book...at first
body: I am a huge Harry Potter fan and so I was very excited to read this book.  I was disappointed when first starting the book as it took a while to become engaged.  As I read through the book I found that I enjoyed it more but it was certainly not on my list of great reads.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Awful!
body: I don't even want to give it one star!  It is awful.  I struggled through 50 pages and cannot go on!  Too many characters to follow. I want my money back.

author: Joy
title: A Casual Vacancy
body: Probably not for everyone (what is)? But I loved it! Maybe because I am an unapologetic Anglophile, but I loved the characters from depiction through interaction. JK is unfailing in her descriptions of English life & surroundings. But make no mistake Rowling fans, this is a major departure. This is a book for grown-ups. So if your stuck at Hogwarts, and can't imagine a writer stepping away from her usual output, steer clear!

author: Joyce Eslinger
title: Disappointed in Ms. Rowling
body: My kids grew up reading Harry Potter, and I enjoyed the books, too. Ms. Rowling created many wonderful,engaging characters along with the necessary awful ones.

author: makelly
title: It was okay.
body: it was Okay. I probably with never read it again but it was an ok read the one time I did.

author: Sherry
title: Rowling does not disappoint
body: J. K. Rowling creates a compelling story with unique characters and intricate plot.  You will have a hard time putting this story down.  Adults will now be the beneficiaries of Rowling's talent as a writer.  I will be watching for the next book!

author: weasel
title: an interesting read
body: Once you figure out the many characters I the story,it became very interesting to follow how they were all tied together.

author: E. J. Lawrence
title: A vacant casualty
body: She's a wonderful writer, of course, and the book has its messages--but I don't need these particular messages ... and all of the characters are unlikable. Now, The Cuckoo's Calling is "a different story," loved it. Didn't love this one.

author: Luann o
title: I quit reading after chapter ??????
body: Simply awful. This book only sold because of authors name. So sorry I payed for this book. It's about a bunch of complaining people, hateful people.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Too dark for me
body: I was disappointed with how she made each character out to be some kind of perverted monster, then everyone was fine and dandy at the end.  It was just a bit unbelievable to me.  I felt like I needed to wash my mind after I was done.

author: sanjay m. krishnamurthy
title: Matches Cuckoo's Calling in mediocricy
body: Imagine tons of characters. Twists and turns in the story on every page. All these twists+turns leading nowehere !! Then throw in a totally anti-climactic ending on the 500th page. All that J.KRowling has proved with her 2 latest books are:

author: RexD
title: It is just too dismal
body: This is one of the few books I simply could not finish reading.  The whole setup was too full of disfunctional characters, with some of the main ones being the worst.  It felt like it was set up to pivot around the oped that was sent in by one of the town counsellors just before he died.  He sets up a young (and visibly wayward) girl as a star, and she is set up as a disaster.  Unfortunately, that setup disappears.

author: Criticalthinker
title: A sour view of small-town muggles
body: Full disclosure: I seem to be the only human who detests the entire Harry Potter franchise, and I am no Rowling fan.  So why would I read a 500-page book penned by her?  Curiosity.  I wondered what this billionaire, mega-successful author had to say to and about adults in the real world, after spending so many years in the happy fantasyland of kiddie lit.  Well, she has a lot to say, and all of it is depressing.  A Casual Vacancy could be subtitled Dreadful People Behaving Badly in a Picturesque Town.  It's Britain under a microscope, analyzed by a dispeptic depressive.  It's misanthropy and despair.  The book is bleak.

author: Tamera Longfellow
title: Disappointing
body: The story is slow and the print is so close to the binding that it makes it difficult to read.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Just okay.
body: I don't care for the explicit sex references, but suppose I should get over that.  Otherwise, it is pretty good.

author: Elisabeth Forrest
title: Beautifully Character Driven
body: Although I am a big fan of Rowling's Harry Potter books, I was in no rush to read this due to my ever-growing reading wish list. I picked it up as a book on CD from the library and started listening to it in the car driving to and from work. My commute is short and after a couple of days I was so hooked that getting a part of a chapter a day was not going to cut it and I wasn't willing just to drive around town aimlessly to listen to more of the story, so I picked up a copy in order to read it faster.

author: Jerry Brookman
title: A good read
body: The author creates some interesting characters and situations.  While parts of it are grim and sad, it kept my attention and I found the ending to be good, though inevitably sad.

author: William Van Gee
title: Sure not Harry Potter
body: A whole new type of writing from the Potter series. It seems that Ms. Rowling has a new dictionary and tries to use new words at every juncture. Story was just OK

author: Brian
title: Not much to enjoy
body: Bleh...  Quit on it. Hated the characters and pretty much everything about it. Might finish it if I have nothing else to read.

author: bookqueenshelby
title: Very powerful book!
body: First of all. I actually can really picture this book coming to life. I live in a small town with lots of the same type people involved in politics in it. JK Rowling nailed that on the head. Back biting and smiling to each other's face all in a day in the life..but anyways...

author: new homeowner
title: Did not disappoint
body: I loved the Harry Potter books and sort of expected not to like her shift in genre. The story line is comletely different but after just a few pages, the characters were completely real and alive and the story engrossing. She has not lost her touch - I came away a true believer in J.K. Rowling's ongoing ability to spin a story !

author: xochitl o'toole
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Every time I start to read this book, I fall asleep. I was excited to buy it after seeing the reviews, but it is a slow moving book about sleepy towns. I have to keep going back just to remember when the characters were introduce and who they are related to. With the Harry Potter series, I couldn't put the books down and usually finish each book in a day or two. Bought The Casual Vacancy a month ago and I am not even half way. I will finish it though seeing that I spent good money on it.

author: Maia Rose
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Had to read a new book by J. K. Rowling.  A complete departure from Harry Potter, it was a great read and well written.

author: SKM
title: STM
body: The character development was great. The people in this book were unhappy but very real. The small town politics were well developed.

author: Arkansas Red
title: Not great, just okay.
body: The story dragged on for way too long, bogged down in local political details.  It just wasn't that interesting, at least to me.

author: Sally H. Moore
title: Politics as usual?
body: This story kept my interest, sounds like welfare in America, sadly.  I did not like the "F" word and the way the kids and parents reacted to each other, but I am elderly and my children are grown.  It's a different world out there!

author: Susanna Chastain
title: What's not to like?
body: Don't compare, just sit back and read and enjoy.  Well conceived characters, interesting plot.  Like a play you want to give a standing ovation.

author: melissa keller
title: slow getting started
body: I really liked Casual Vacancy, except there was a bit too much background information at the beginning. it took me half way thru the book to really get into it.

author: Finnbar2001
title: Great Read
body: Loved the narrative, such a studied observance of human thoughts.  Relevant and it took a while to read so lasted a while.

author: Parrywinkel
title: Intriguing & Socially Informative
body: I enjoy novels that step beyond the 'politically accepted' and challenge us to think of our society on a deeper level.  Harry's story required us to face the issues of bullying, evil, and dishonesty and look at bravery both socially and emotionally.  "The Casual Vacancy" requires us to face our prejudices, our attitudes, and the social classes.  It is not different but very much 'the same style' which JK Rowling has used to address issues about which no one wants to talk.  Rowling is a clever writer with the gift of storytelling.  I will read anything she cares to write because she cares enough to write about it.

author: M. Sander
title: AWFUL
body: If you were somehow unaware that the world can be a hard, cruel place, or you just can't get enough of reading about it in your leisure time, this is the book for you.  I can't even finish it, it was so disturbing.  Sad, sick people and their sad pitiful off spring make you go diving for the razor blades.  What a downer.  And a big disappointment from someone who has so much talent.

author: SarahLawrence Scott
title: Shows off Rowling's strengths and weaknesses in a non-fantasy, adult format
body: While considerably different in subject matter and content, the Casual Vacancy exhibits many of Rowling's traits, both strong and weak, familiar to readers of the Harry Potter series. (And face it, you probably are thinking of buying this because you know Rowling from that series.)

author: Rosalie Cranston
title: Not Harry Potter by a long shot.
