The later books got increasingly dismal, complex, and bogged down -- and i liked them less, tho I read them to find out what would happen.  I resented Rowling for making the later books so dismal.

author: Carolyn
title: We aren't at Hogwarts anymore-BRILLIANT
body: This is a true work of art. Ms. Rowling draws you in and doesn't let go until the very end. I was very impressed and happy to see/read her depth as an author.

author: Charleysangel
title: Who is who...Who is where...and who knows who
body: The story was interesting albeit difficult to follow.  As a reader I was just weighted down and drowning in the over abundance of characters--I could not keep track of them.  I made myself a flow chart of who was  who and who lived where but it was still beyond cumbersome to keep track of them.  I would have enjoyed this soooo much more with fewer characters and logistics that were easier to follow.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Eh.
body: Having not read the Harry Potter series, I can't compare this story to J.K. Rowling's other writing.  However, it took me far too long to care about any characters or the plot of this book.  It was ok, but certainly not a page-turner for me.

author: peripan
title: Sorry
body: Just could not finish this book.  Not worthy of J.K. Rowling.  Harry Potter series practically read themselves - so effortless.  Instead of being un-put-downable, this book was un-pickupable!

author: J. Arora
title: Pretty Disappointing
body: I couldn't really get into it and might try again another time. I was pretty disappointed, as I was curious to see JK's ability to create new characters and storyline outside of Hogwarts.

author: Gatosqueak
title: Even through it's uber depressing, the book is a gritty, realistic of a small town in all its yucky glory.
body: This is so NOT Harry Potter or really anything you want to get near your kids. Or read to them. Or expose them to. If my kid did the stuff the teens in this book I would have to lock him up. Great googley-moogley. What a sad and depressing (realistic for some) world these people in the book live in. Being a social worker myself, I was depressed with the lack of "pulling themselves up by the boot straps" anyone managed. This novel makes me want to go read Harry Potter to cheer myself a little bit. Or go drink some alcohol. Or hug a kitten.

author: Jordan
title: Not what I hoped it would be
body: I bought the book thinking it would be an interesting read, boy was I wrong. This is a 500 page book and it didn't leave with the "I can't put this book down till I know what happens" feeling until roughly 400 pages into the book. The first part of the book is terribly hard to understand what's going on because you get introduced to a multitude of characters and short stories that don't seem to come together until a lot later in the book. The majority of the book is based around one main theme and when it comes to the conclusion of that theme in the book it is very anti-climatic and basically ends the book on a whole bunch of other stuff that isn't even a part of the main theme of the book. I was very disappointed in this book but I had to read the whole thing because I wanted to give it a chance. Ironic as it sounds if there were a sequel to this book I would buy and read it because I feel like the ending of this book kind of leads you hanging on a whole bunch of subjects.

author: LORI FRANK
title: Dissapointed
body: Maybe I was expecting too much from the fabulous JK Rowling. I struggled with the first half of the book trying to keep track of whos who & forcing myself to keep reading. The last half was better, but it read like a new version of "Peyton Place".

author: Beach Reader
title: It's Just Okay
body: J. K. Rowling does a fantastic job of developing the characters in "The Casual Vacancy."  But, I'm 60% through the book, and I'm still waiting for something to happen.  I can't imagine that anyone would want to make this book into a movie.

author: SMadison
title: Hard to get into, but gets better
body: This book was really hard for me to get into. The first third was slow as you got to know all of the characters but once you knew all of them ( there are many) the pace picked up and I enjoyed the story.

author: Susan Fasig
title: Depressing story
body: Nearly all of the characters are self absorbed and unappealing.  The only one I liked was the poor girl who cut herself.

author: S. Auchterlonie
title: I didn't read Harry Potter.
body: VEry descriptive, interesting characters and plot. I did have to constantly look up word definitions though.  Wish you would write another novel.

author: froggie
title: Great Read
body: This book is a great read, story plot is intriguing and interesting the characters are very true to rural life, I can see another sequel could yet be made from this first book, well done.

author: Janice Robinson
title: Shoud have stuck to Harry
body: I am sad that the author went for such pathetic subject matter, and I regret every minute I wasted trying to read this book. I found no redeeming qualities whatsoever. If I could, I would ask for my money back, but I ordered it for the kindle. Anyway, steer clear.

author: Sarah Cosmopolitan
title: floating chopped up pieces of difficult fiction
body: I think the author really did put an effort into separating this book from her Harry Potter books. The language is hard to read, it's awkward and choppy. The narrative itself jumps from one set of characters to the next every couple of pages, and i found it very hard to keep track of who is who and what role they play. I could not finish the book, could not follow easily the story line. So, maybe if you have the patience it may get more familiar and easier to follow. Overall, not a good summer read. Rather pompous and disconnected and overloaded. Keep it simple!

author: jt
title: Not my favorite my favorite by far.
body: Well written, but way too depressing. I dreaded reading it. I don't read books to feel bad. I was a huge Harry Potter fan. Those books made me want to live the fantasy and feel good. I would hate living with the people and in the places in this book. There wasn't a character that I liked as a person. They were all sad people and some down right hateful. I need a hero.

author: Abbey
title: Great read
body: I was impressed with the sophistication of the characters. A very different voice from 'Harry Potter'.

author: britishmaid
title: Quite a read
body: This was the only book I've read over the past few months that I could not put down.  It's a nasty expose of small town bickering, class snobbery, laced with a smidgen of scandal that Rowling explores to the detriment of the poor excuses for human beings that inhabit her fictional towns.  Hardly anyone is likable and you come away satisfied that some get their just desserts and dissatisfied others get off scott free.  The one character who one feels any affection is one who ends up being a catalyst that brings others back from the brink of downright petty treachery.  But the cost is too sad.

author: Neal J. Pollock
title: Characters Galore
body: I usually try to read extant reviews before writing mine, but I'm a bit daunted by the 3000+ ones on this book.  Still, I doubt many have reached the same conclusions as I have.  I suppose I shouldn't have been surprised that many should look askance at a book so different from Harry Potter books--it reminds me of some American Idol contestants who take a big risk, trying on a style extremely different from their usual one--as Angie did this week.  There are some downsides to this book--esp. the very large cast of characters--but then

author: Joanne Long
title: Love story
body: The story starts slow. Thought process from the author jumps all over the place. Could not finish wish is not my style. I was not intrigued at all.

author: Jan M.
title: Couldn't Finish It!
body: There was nothing in any of the characters that I liked.  Most of them were small-minded.  Decided I had better things to do than finish this book.

author: Richard
title: Dark character study
body: Don't look for an uplifting yarn and a triumph of good over evil.  Set in the small middle class village of Pagford and the nearby Fields public housing estate, this is a gritty exploration of the tensions between classes, generations, and neighbors.  Throw in some mental illness, family dysfunction, and drug addiction and...  well... you get the picture.  The character studies are brilliant.  I found myself rooting for some of the most flawed and broken personalities.  But these are generally people I am happy were confined to the book.  I'm not sure I'd want to invite any of them -- from Pagford or the Fields -- to dinner.  Perhaps that's the reaction and the attendant guilt Rowling is trying to trigger.

author: syndi
title: Just couldn't read it.
body: I loved the way she was able to bring together all the characters in the Harry Potters series but I just couldn't start to even  get close or understand the personalities of the ones in The Casual Vacancy.  I was able to get thru 1/3 of the book but ended up putting it away. Sorry J.K.

author: JT1990
title: Curious
body: Curious to see where ms Rowling would go after Harry potter  book began incredibly slow but finally came together.  Worth the read.

author: Lisa Schmidt
title: No thank you... will read something more interesting.
body: Couldn't get interested in the characters or the story line...too many characters to keep up with and nothing about the characters that made me care if I kept up with them or not!  Didn't want to waste my time reading past page 100....

author: Karyn P
title: Forcing Myself to Finish This Book
body: I am a great fan of JK Rowling's Harry Potter.  I looked forward to this book and hoped it would hold my interest.  Just a little more than half way through the book and am seriously struggling to finish.  Keep hoping it will get better, but I have my doubts.  Wish I would have gotten this one from the library.

author: Marcelyn Putnam
title: Disappointing reading following her earlier successes.
body: I could not maintain interest in the characters or the plot.  I finished reading the book but did not enjoy.

author: Anonagal
title: Surprised at the poor writing style!
body: My main issue with this novel is the use of what I consider to be writing 'cheats' used extensively throughout the book (buy this I mean instead of taking the time to do real character development and plotting she simply shoves a whole bunch of stuff into parenthesis, like I'm doing here). This was hugely annoying. It also left me feeling like there was no real connection between me and the characters and amongst the characters, as though she was going to go back and write all that good stuff in but instead an incomplete version was published where all this stuff was put in parenthesis as placeholders.

author: Judith Balph
title: Why I disliked the book by Rowling
body: Not up to standard of good fiction writing.  She should stick with "Potter" type writing.I didn't care about any of her characters.

author: MelS
title: A grim and shocking representation of life - but a good book
body: I'd like to write this review with the focus off the famous name behind it, but on the actual book itself.

author: Lilian Zakia
title: Another success
body: As a huge Harry Potter fan it was only natural that I would buy another Rowling's book.It was very well written and I did enjoy it.So different than the Potter books.

author: Oliver Richardson
title: Casual vacancy
body: Slow beginning but once you become familiar

author: TheHauts
title: Great!
body: Not sure why people don't like this book, I found very interesting and towards the end I couldn't put it down.

author: FlaTeddy
title: Stick to Harry Potter
body: I think Rowling needs to stick to Harry Potter.

author: Jon D. Cameron
title: Complicated, but worthy of the complexity
body: There are moments you want to push it away; there are moments you wonder what else you could have done with $35; there are moments when you see the train wreck coming and want to look away; there is the realization the story is brilliant; and there are hours when the characters will enter your dreams.  In the end, an almost impossible conclusion celebrates the characters previously denigrated in the rest of the book.

author: EdieTN50
title: What a story!
body: I like JK Rowling's story-telling style very much.  She builds the characters very thoroughly.  The book is definitely not peaceful reading.  A complex weaving of lives and problems.  Well Done!

author: Chris Grady
title: Too many characters to get straight!
body: The book keeps my interest, but I am having trouble keeping the many characters straight~ Probably will not recommend this book!

author: anonymous
title: Great book!
body: Really enjoyable story. Lots of characters at first, but once you learn them, you get sucked right into the story.

author: robyn
title: Adult novel by a famous children's author
body: Very readable and quite gritty and realistic in its portrait of village life in a north England town.  The characters are believable and the interaction between them is fascinating, as it covers a wide range of ages and types.

author: Yasmin H. McEwen
title: Rowing in darkness; rowing thru pain
body: Once I got past Barry Fairbrother's funeral, which literally seems to go on and on, the rest of the characters emerge, the story starts to show up on time and ready to work. This is not a feel good happy novel by any means, instead  it is quite dark as a cave with nary a light or canary. There are rough patches, but if the reader keepson, the story demands emotion and thought. There is a heaving downslope, no one remains unscathed, that compares to watching a flock of beautiful swans picked out of the air one by one. Complex, though not brilliantly written, expertly writ in regards to reality, futility and buckets of sadness; no small achievment by any standard.

author: VTMom
title: Terrible
body: I usually try to finish a book but this was so awful I just gave up.  My time is worth more than reading about boring, obnoxious people that I don't like.

author: av8s
title: Very different
body: Far cry from Harry Poter, rather crude in parts, but, she is a good storyteller.  Try and keep an open mind while reading

author: Kaylala
title: Complicated
body: The book started out rough with a complicated character list but once you got to know them it got interesting.

author: Pollie
title: Engaging
body: Of course I read all of her "Harry Potter" books, so when I started this one it felt strange at first.  It's about perfectly normal people (for the most part) who have funny, scandalous secrets.

author: Bonnie Avery
title: I had to force myself to pick this up
body: I bought it, paid full price, was excited to read it, as I love Harry Potter. The book, from the beginning, was hard to follow, painfully confusing. I didn't like one thing about it. Had to force myself to finish it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very well written
body: Not a book I would recommend to anyone but all that I can say is that J K Rowling is a very accomplished author & I suspect could write any sort of novel on any subject.

author: freenikki84
title: I'd rather drink bleach than read this again
body: I waited in great anticipation for the release of this novel.  I ran, the first chance I got, and bought this novel for myself, as a birthday gift.  I was so excited to read it that I dove into it the very first day.  Now, normally I can read a book this size in a day or so...it took me over a month to make way through this book.  It was a slow read, because it was absolutely painful to read.  I had to build myself up every time I picked it up, because it was terrible.  It is a story without a climax, and no antagonist.  It was like watching a weeks worth of the British version of Days of Our Lives, only worse.  I would find more pleasure in amputating my own leg with a rusty spoon than reading this novel.  It appears that the publisher accepted this novel based solely on JK Rowlings name being on it.  I will be much more hesitant to purchase any novel by her in the future, especially if it is another adult novel.  The worst part is, I am American and every single one of my most favorite novels were written by a British person...in the 1800's...and I still couldn't stand this book.  JK Rowling wrote the seedy side of people very well, she is an excellent writer...however, it appears she pushed this book out as not to be known as a 'one hit wonder' as it were due to Harry Potter's fame...however, she really diminished herself with this book.  Sorely disappointed.  I cannot stress enough how hard it is to make it through this story, because it is painfully dull.  Be warned, I believe a lot of people forced themselves to like this book because of its author not on its merit. TERRIBLE BOOK and not worth the money....trust me...if you 'must' have it for a personal collection wait for it to go on clearance...and even then $5 is still too steep a price to pay for it.

author: Daniel D. Gustafson
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: New book, received promptly. Plot is not as gripping as Harry Potter, but solid. Reflects JK Rowlings experiences living in apartments prior to her success.

author: Jacquie
title: J.K. Rowling amazes me again
body: The beginning to this book was very slow paced, in my opinion, and I had a hard time keeping up with which characters were who for awhile. I almost gave up about 100 pages in, but then I was drawn in by the story and the characters. I'm not really into politics, so that part of the novel honestly didn't interest me. But the characters were extremely complicated - probably some of the most complicated, real fictional characters I've ever read about.

author: Jacqueline Simonson
title: Not For Everyone
body: I was very disappointed in the language.  The profanity is simply and completely unnecessary and does nothing to further the plot.

author: Alliouga
title: Wonderful, nothing like Harry Potter
body: Loved this book - amazed that the author of Harry Potter (which I also loved) can produce something so totally different, with such completely different qualities. Suspect it may not be popular in the US - it is very British, and displays an utterly depressing picture of modern Britain that is nothing like the fictional delights of Harry Potter and the British Tourist Board. There is scarcely a redeeming feature in any one of the large cast of characters, and yet they draw you in . . . couldn't wait to get home from work to get back to the book and find out what was going to happen next. The writing, the plot, the insights, the characters are all compelling . . . my one hope is that Mike Leigh will do a movie version of it!

author: Mrs L C Tisdall
title: A great read on many levels
body: After reading it twice I found the book frustrating but also enlightening in terms of character development.

author: Shannon Lodholm
title: Disappointing, and vulgar
body: Was hoping for a bit of Harry Potterness with an adult twist. This was just vulgar. Multiple cuss words and sexual references. Sad, I was hoping for better.

author: Liz F.
title: horrible disappointment
body: i am a huge Harry Potter fan and i assumed this book would be as well-written as the HP books.  NOT!!!  i barely made it through 3 chapters before i had to put the book down.  way too many names, way too many British-isms that make it hard to understand.  i found it quite boring, pointless and dull.  waste of money.

author: Elizabeth M. Carl
title: This is no Harry Potter for sure.
body: There is way too much detail on every character and not enough plot for me.  Its a very slow read and not good for a book club, too long, not much going on.

author: MARY VON SCHREINER
title: JK Rowling writes for adults
body: This book was a bit like a 19th century book, or an advent calendar.  She painted a good story of a small town with a surprisingly dramatic ending.  The book was better than the reviews of it, but not five stars.

author: Anna Ryan
title: Not what you'd expect, but keeps you turning the page.
body: It is a little verbose at times, but I really enjoyed the book. I loved some characters and hated others. Definately a sign of a story that draws you in.

author: Mary Millie
title: Disappointing!
body: I knew this would be a different genre than JK Rowling's other books, but expected it to be an entertaining read. I struggled through the first few chapters, but the only word I can think of to describe it was, BORING! I found that I really didn't care about any of the characters or what happened to them. How disappointing.

author: JME
title: Good but not great...
body: I read this book in 8 weeks. I usually take 4 weeks to read a book at a casual pace. The book is good but not 'gripping', hence the slow read. The author paints great detail in the characters and locations and sometimes this dragged out a little. The 'common' accents of certain characters were a little over the top. Everybody appears to speak perfect english in the book except the 'common folk' who live down the hill and from the 'wrong' part of town. Their words are hardly recognizable - over the top IMHO.

author: Susan Johnson
title: I'm mystified
body: I am quite mystified about the venom of reviewers on this book. I put off reading this book because of it (and the price was a little steep but is now quite reasonable on Kindle). This is a well written novel about life in a small English town. It discusses the power of secrets- the tolls it takes to keep them and what happens when they are revealed. It's really good. The only complaint I have is the cast of characters is large and it was hard at first to keep them straight.

author: Arnold Gopin
title: Vacant
body: For American readers, it was very hard to get past all the British vocabulary, and hard to get into it. I will retry in a few months,

author: G.T.
title: Irresponsible.  Emphasis on "Vacancy"
body: There is no doubt Rowling spent much time and put much of herself into this book.  She is a very talented writer, and it shows in everything she writes.  Having said that...

author: Jill C. Repasky
title: Didn't like
body: I didn't enjoy this much, jumped back and forth too much for my taste. It didn't draw me in like most books.

author: K. King
title: Powerful and challenging
body: This is not the kind of book you read on the beach. It is not the kind of book that gives you a delighted rush as you anticipate the ending. While I had no trouble picking the book back up once I'd put it down, and I'd read past when I meant to go to bed, I don't know that I once asked myself the question "What will happen next?" like I would with a good adventure. I would be hard pressed to call this book fun to read. I love those kinds of fun books, but they're not the only kind. The world needs this kind of book too.

author: Izacat
title: Very different to the Harry Potter series
body: This was an easy book to read and felt like you were part of the village and the characters lives.

author: pugsitter
title: not Harry Potter
body: I'm not a literary critic but I thought this was a great step in a different direction for J.K..The story was interesting and the character development great . Hope to read more from J.K.

author: CMM
title: A Powerful Novel That is Not For the Lighthearted
body: JK Rowling has again shown that she is one of the greatest authors of all time with her newest work, The Casual Vacancy. She has shown the world that she can write not only magical fantasy books, but beautiful adult fictional novels as well. While it is not the easiest book to read in one sitting, it is still definitely a book to pick up.

author: Krys
title: Dark, Depressing and Disturbing
body: If you want to spend 8 hours or more of your life feeling awful, read this book. Every time you think something good will happen it gets worse. The writing wasn't bad and there was only a typo or two. And she is, of course, good at telling a story. But it left me feeling terrible. There are no redeeming lessons, no inspiring passages. Nothing even resembling redemption in this book.  Just an in depth look at the absolute worst of humanity. Save yourself the mental cleansing I now need and read something else. I wish I had.

author: Vicki
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: J,K, Rowlings is a phenominal writer,just look at the huge success of Harry Potter! She's remarkable,but this drivel was just awful, she needs to stick with what she does best Fantasy Adventure.

author: Catherine Houston
title: Well-told Story
body: Rowling spins this tale in a manner that is familiar to those who read the Harry Potter series.  But this is not a children's book.  The qualities of adulthood and teen years are well developed here: self absorption, sex drive, depression, status concerns and social cruelty.  I enjoyed this and look forward to Rowlings next work.

author: Parulaj
title: Thoughtful novel with strong message
body: Unlike some, I did not find the multiple characters confusing, rather I was impressed with how the author wove lives together even intersecting as characters were unaware. Do read to the end.  For me Rowling's message was strongest as the reader realizes how Krystal (& other characters) wanted & might have had a different life but were denied by circumstances, circumstances that each of us can affect at any time by lack of action, by ignorance, by indifference, by our own troubles, by our own prejudice.  Each of us has a responsibility for compassion, and compassion with action.

author: Mary Freeman
title: it's not HP
body: Fun book, enjoyed reading it, nice departure for JK Rowling and not for kids for sure but great for adults

author: Kathy Tuten
title: Modern "Our Town."
body: It took me awhile to get into this book because most of the main characters are introduced pretty much one right after the other in the first pages.  So it took me a bit of time to figure out who was who.  Once I got into it, however, I began comparing it to the classic, "Our Town,"  which I'm sure most of us baby boomers were required to read somewhere along our educational way.  And, I must say, I enjoyed this one much more than I ever liked "Our Town."  It's actually a dark story, about all the nasty little undercurrents of life that no one outside the family home knows about.  People on the outside think the family is perfect, but just wait....  I also thought the second major theme of the book, who's going to throw a hat into the political ring for a vacated city council seat, is probably so close to the truth of how that really happens than most of us would like to admit.  There were times through the book that I thought, is there no one in this town even remotely happy?  But then I realized this is how life really is, the ugly and the less ugly.  The third theme of 'us vs. them, the haves vs. the have nots, probably plays out in real life very much like it does in the novel.  When I got to the end, I was at first disappointed, but the longer I thought about it, the more I realized the book ended the only way it could have.  Life goes on....

author: Skilz
title: blah blah...at first.
body: there were lots of unexpected moments in this book.  a lot of back and forth storytelling between characters. i had much higher hopes for this book in the beginning but by the time i turned the last page i was happy i read the book. The farther you get in the book the better it is by the time i turned the last page i was sad to see the end.

author: Love2Read
title: Good book; very gritty and kind of disturbing.
body: I have to admit, I did read a lot of the reviews before requesting this book for Christmas and wasn't sure about really wanting to read it.  I loved the Harry Potter series and was aware this book as going to be very different from what I've come to expect from J.K. Rowling.

author: J. Harrison
title: A casual vacancy
body: A real departure . The book was long and real downer. While the book I'm sure displays real life, it is not  an environment I choose to dwell in especially with so many characters with few to redeeming features.  I would not recommend this book.

author: Shawn Holman
title: Disappointed
body: I had really high hopes for this book because I was such a big fan of the Harry Potter series. But I can barely slog through this. I'm nearly half way through and am so incredibly bored with the story that I may not finish the book.

author: C. Bowler
title: Well written but hard to like
body: I found this book very easy to read but at the same time filled with unpleasant characters that made it hard to like. You do form attachments to some of them by the end but it is very tenuous.

author: Annie
title: Nothing like before
body: In a way, The Casual Vacancy, by J.K. Rowling, is the story of a dysfunctional family. It follows the lives of 7 families who live in the community of Pagford, a small English city outside of the booming metropolis of Yarvil. Over 6 parts, we discover each member of these families and how they interact with each other, and other families within the community.

author: carole shea
title: CASUAL VACANCY
body: THIS WAS A HARD BOOK TO GET INTO, TOO MANY CHARACTERS.  BUT ONCE YOU GET STARTED YOU REALLY WANTED TO GET TO THE ENDING.

author: OneKoolChic
title: Entertaining Read
body: For a modern reality read - this was entertaining!  I would suggest it if you enjoy getting to know characters and don't mind the raw nature of life.  While I didn't read J.K. Rowling's other books, this was well written and it was a book both my husband and I enjoyed.

author: K77799
title: It's ok
body: Not even remotely like her Harry Potter books. But what can be said about J. K. Rowling is that she can really write from a child's perspective, even in The Casual Vacancy -- the best parts of the book are when she is writing about children.

author: Tezinnv
title: Harry Potter it's not!
body: This novel is depressing at best: the underbelly of a modern English village is enough to give a fan of Rowling's earlier efforts a migraine. Had real trouble finishing this book because I read for enjoyment and there was no fun in this story at all.

author: LauraB
title: No, I didn't finish it
body: I knew it wouldn't be a continuation of Harry Potter, but I thought it would be interesting.  After reading far enough to have brushed past a whole book's worth of characters (and I understand I didn't meet them all), I hadn't found one in whom I had any interest.  I didn't care about any of them.  There was no one I wanted to spend more time with.  So I didn't.  I am now able to put a book down unfinished, and this one qualified for that.  I'm sorry.

author: LG
title: A book that you can't love
body: This was a good read once you get into it. It took the first third until you knew who all the characters are. Once into it, you must finish to know how everyone's story turns out, but it's a sad premise around a death of a man and how those around him live. Also, the middle class vs the lower class and the struggles that puts upon children. Tough basis, but overall good book. I never reed any Harry Potter, but this must be a totally different genre!

author: Richard Oakes
title: Rather Gritty
body: J K has left Harry Potter far behind, and this is no story for the followers of nice (if supernaturally powered) school kids. She does retain the knack of engaging us in this often gritty tale of tension between encroaching urban decay and the last gasp of the English Arcadian ideal. There is much to pity, and little to simpathise with ...

author: Ready Mommy
title: Missing Rowling's magic touch
body: Whether by accident or in an attempt to distinguish "The Casual Vacancy" from her phenomenally successful young adult series (you may have heard of a wizard named Harry Potter), J.K. Rowling leaves the supernatural out of her first book written for an adult audience. Unfortunately, all the magic is missing. "The Casual Vacancy" is hard to get into and its characters largely lack appeal, probably for the same reason: in addition to omitting sorcery, Rowling steers clear of the exceptional. While it is possible to make stories about common lives work, it is far easier to engage readers in tales and characters of distinction and consequence. "The Casual Vacancy" isn't a clear waste of time or money; it's just not that great. We all know J.K. Rowling can do extraordinary. Fingers crossed for the next one.

author: Kindle Customer
title: A slow start, but worth the effort
body: I had a hard time getting into the story because numerous characters are introduced so rapidly that I couldn't keep them straight. HOWEVER, the story gathers speed quickly and the characters soon solidified so that they were recognisable to me.  This book soon became hard to put down. Rowling's writing is superb as usual.  Good plot twists, too.

author: Kathleen R. Childers
title: 9 hours of my life I won't get back
body: Depressing and pointless book.  There really wasn't much of a story, just a lot disfunctional characters.  Not one of the characters was very likeable.  Regret buying and reading it.  if it wasn't for the book club I would not have finished it.

author: Cattnapp12
title: Great Book
body: A slow start, but necessary to build the background to draw the reader into the lives of those who have lost their way.

author: Harry Mcintosh
title: Well Drawn- Just Too Much
body: Amazingly written characters. Perhaps there is such a thing as too much detail. Looking forward to Ms Rowling's next book.

author: Amazon Customer
title: A Real Novel
body: There are over 3,000 posts to Amazonon this novel by critics with a better way of putting things than me.

author: ptiche
title: I hated the ending!
body: Keeping up with the characters was a bit of a challenge.  The small town politics were believable.  I absolutely hated the ending. I read the book while on vacation, stayed up late to finish it and wish I hadn't.. All those slimy characters and that is who gets offed!?  Until the ending I would have rated The Casual Vacancy as 4 stars but once I finished it, I could not.

author: Joanne Willis
title: A change of. Pace from.J. K Rowling
body: Knowing some of The Rowling personal history, it's not surprising about her choice of locale, characters and plot.  It was not easy to get into.  None of the characters could be termed redeeming.  One felt that the lovely village of Pagford really had an omnipresent black cloud hanging over it.  Not a light read or entertaining one either.

author: scotslass
title: Trying to be Tom Wolfe - fails miserably
body: A meandering, rather pointless book. Seems to be trying to aspire to be like Tom Wolfe, but without any of the humor. Characters are almost completely unlikable, and as a reader I struggled to empathize with anyone's point of view. Which is hard to achieve in a book of this length. Could see the end coming a mile away, and hoped I was wrong. I wish I could get back the wasted hours. It'll be  awhile before I read fiction again.

author: Francine A. Sippel
title: Save Your Time
body: I read this book and have read the Harry Potter series.  I believe JK Rowling will go down in history was one of the greatest writers of our time and I can't express how disappointed I was after reading "A Casual Vacancy."  It was literally WORK to get through the first one hundred pages.  If I wasn't such a huge fan and fiercly loyal, I would have tossed it.  It's hard to fathom that she could create such amazing characters in Harry Potter, who you attach to and actually miss, and then write another book where not a single charcter is likable.  I'm actually angry with her editor/publisher for allowing her to publish this piece of rubbish.  Skip it entirely and re/read the Harry Potter Series.  You'll thank me.

author: jody
title: Not her best
body: Harry Potter lovers will be disappointed.  Not her usual imagination and I missed that.  Story matter was rather depressing, many disfunctional families

author: QendresaMal
title: The Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling
body: After reading the Harry Potter series, I expected a bit more from J.K. Rowling in The Casual Vacancy. The book is based on more realistic issues in the small town of Pagford such as politics, corruption, and wars within a community. The plot starts with a member of the city council passing away, and the struggle of filling in the position escalates to secrets and scandals being publicized. For some readers the similarities between this plot and reality is the reason that they continue reading, as for me, I believe Rowling should stick to writing in the Fantasy department.

author: Erika
title: Did not finish
body: This is the first book in my life which i did not finish. I would never even think that me, who loves HP books, will leave unfinished J.K's book. But that's what happened.

author: Amazon Customer
title: An interesting read
body: Very interesting book,sometimes amusing insight into human nature, and fallacies. The author proves her talent in adult fiction as well as the younger reader.

author: Shayes
title: Disappointed
body: I expected the vocabulary and descriptive eloquence of the HP series.  Got a trashy, curt story instead.  I don't mind cursing, but only if it enhances the story.  Gratuitous vulgarity is for cheap movies.

author: Amazon Customer
title: A Long Day's Journey Into ?
body: This book has one of the slowest starts in fiction that I can ever recall reading. Once you slog through it, the climax is certainly captivating yet the denouement leaves you wondering whether the journey was worth the time. Rowling demonstrates her prowess at weaving a complex plot, once again, but the reader remains fundamentally unchanged by the events of the book. I appreciated her attempt to write something other than a teen fantasy novel and truly look forward to her next book. Since she has accomplished so much through the Harry Potter series, I am not willing to write her off just yet. This book is competent, just not compelling.

author: by candlelight
title: Worthwhile Message
body: The book everyone has been waiting for.....what comes after Harry Potter??

author: Kharabella
title: Like this book needs ANOTHER review . . .but what a commentary on privilege and perspective!
body: I am STUNNED that this book has gotten so many bad reviews!  I found it to be utterly moving and memorable.  There are no magic spells, but the author who created Harry Potter is certainly evident!

author: NG9
title: Just so/so
body: I felt I owed it to J.K. to buy this book, as her Harry Potter series gave me so many hours of reading pleasure.

author: David Berglund
title: Thank you J. K. Rowling
body: I like J. K. Rowling's "The Casual Vacancy" because she shows us that she was worth her Harry Potter's books, and now one more.

author: Kashigirl
title: This book did NOT live up to the Rowling hype!
body: I absolutely loved the Harry Potter series so thought I would give this book a try.  I never got into the book nor did I like the verbage that was used.I felt like a salmon swimming upstream.  It was such a "downer" to read that I absolutely struggled to get to the end.  Not an enjoyable read!

author: Amazon Customer
title: She's just a great writer
body: Her characters and plot were interesting and  really drew me in - just like the Harry Potter story.  This one was pretty tragic though.

author: cspigy
title: Very disappointed
body: No one can paint a picture with words like j k Rowling. That being said I found this book pointless and boring. I did not like the characters or care what happened to them. I struggled to finish it.

author: Ladybug
title: Small town folks, big and dense book
body: Even though I kept in mind that this was Rowling's first adult novel and that she was entitled, just like any other first time author, to make mistakes, I must admit that I didn't particularly enjoy reading it. Moreover, I kept putting it down and finding myself excuses to do anything but read it.

author: Denise Haynie
title: charmless
body: Unfortunately, the story line was not particularly compelling.  Worse yet, none of the characters were likable people -- all rather irritating and single dimensional.  None of the adults characters garnered my sympathy.  The adolescent characters were somewhat more likable, but not enough so to make the book a good read.

author: Y.
title: It was a terrible book!
body: I was shocked after I finished the bookmthat this came out of such a brilliant writer. I love, love her and Harry Potter. But this was just a book with too much going on, bad story and a horrible ending. Hopemthe next one will be better.

author: WrayRae99
title: Surprisingly good
body: I originally wanted to read this book because I enjoyed Rowling's writing and style in her Harry Potter series, as well as the books themselves of course. However, The Casual Vacancy is quite different than her previous works and took a little to both get used to and grasp what was going on. Once I did though, I found the book compelling and hard to put down. I define the mark of a good book one that leaves me thinking about it after I have finished reading it and this certainly did. It leaves an impression of life that we sometimes like to forget about, makes us care about people we may not otherwise, and makes us understand our own humanity and that we are all flawed, but those things don't have to define us. It is definitely worth the read.

author: Madam Librarian
title: I want Harry Potter Back!
body: It took me a while but I finally finished this bad boy. This was one of those books where I was immediately hooked, then lost interest for a while in the middle, and then got hooked again. There is a lot of back and forth and you have no clue how the story will end.

author: khicks
title: Boring!!!
body: The book was very slow and the characters seemed jumbled. Missed the plot. This was written for Harry Potter fans that have grown up and reads like a Harry Potter book...would never recommend or bought it had I known it was going to be like it was.

author: Katie
title: Recommend
body: Don't know what I was expecting but it surpassed my expectations anyway. Enjoyable story, interesting and identifiable characters. Would recommend.

author: Krysi Joseph aka boekverslaafde
title: No twisted foreshadowing, but a good read nonetheless
body: I was so excited when I saw my all time favorite author had a new book out. Naturally, I rushed to read it.

author: Samantha Barbosa
title: Stick it Out - It's Worth It
body: Easily 100 pages too long, but strangely addictive if you can make it far enough in to really understand Rowling's web of characters (most of whom are, somehow, both underdeveloped and overdeveloped.) Her efforts to prove that this is certainly, definitely, absolutely not Harry Potter are abundantly obvious.

author: S. Marshall
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I pre-ordered this book and anxiously awaited it's arrival.  Having enjoyed the Harry Potter books so very much, I was expecting the same excellent writing style that kept me captivated.  I must say, I was disappointed.

author: Melissa
title: Great book!
body: Loved this book!  Could not wait to see what would happen next with all the characters. Really enjoyed reading this.

author: edel sherlock
title: its not harry potter
body: great characters..jk has captured every character.  she made me feel angry and sad for all of the characters at some stage. really enjoyed it..waiting for more of the same

author: amber
title: take notes
body: It took me awhile to get all of the characters figured out. I started taking notes to keep them all straight and how they were related. I didn't care about the characters or the story until I was 2/3 of the way done with the book.

author: D. Weber
title: Major disappointment for a huge fan
body: I must agree with the assessment written by S. McKinney. I was extremely disappointed in this book. I am a huge fan of the Harry Potter series, having read each one countless times. Both of my daughters learned to read thanks to those books as well. This book brought dark and depressing to a whole new level. None of the characters were even the least bit likeable. I had to read a quarter of the book before having a firm grasp on all of the characters and their sick, weird, or twisted ways. I continued to read hoping that maybe the end would make up for the rest of the book but found the ending to depress me even more (though I do get the meaning of it, sad as it was).

author: Karen Bruns
title: Cosy intensity, with lots of grittiness to boot
body: For me, this novel was a style merger of Barbara Trapido and Irvine Welsh - cosy intensity with a grounding in the gritty underworld. JK Rowling or no JK Rowling, I liked it a lot and am pleased to have read it. And given its size and weight in paper, I am even more pleased that I read it on Kindle.

author: Dana Holcomb
title: Not that great
body: This book was very confusing. The characters were not well developed. Overall this book was boring and not worth purchasing.

author: Pen Name
title: Perfectly Genius
body: This book carries a literary goddess. Rowling writes to form characters first story later. I have loved every chapter of this book. Her understanding of social mishaps and tense moments of all age groups amazes me. A realists novel.

author: veetz
title: The Casual Vacancy  J.K. Rowling
body: this is a most wonderful read...I've owned it less that a year and reread it already...this book is driven by its complex characters and the ripples of effect they have on each other...I loved it!

author: Ira Yelverton
title: Disappointed
body: After having enjoyed all the Harry Potter books, I expected characters whom I would appreciate.  I found the book depressing in its dealing with what I hope are the baser aspects of life.

author: Las Vegas
title: A little boring
body: I may be the only person on the planet who hasn't read the Harry Potter series, but there you have it. When I saw J.K. Rowling was venturing into new subject matter, I thought it might be interesting. I found the book to be a bit uneven, and she tried to deal with a lot of serious subjects. But about halfway into the book, I started to feel bored with the whole thing and not very interested in the outcome.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Boring
body: Coldn't master the pateince to finish the book - should stick to "Harry Potter".

author: Pamela
title: A Darker View of a Small English Town
body: I found the characters difficult to empathize with...I kept waiting for some redemptive behavior with these kids and adults alike...I had to keep reading it because I was sure the story would end with turning all these mean, petty, selfish, bullying, weak  and deeply flawed personalities into somewhat kind and nice people.......So much for that idea!!!  With that being said, I couldn't put the book down....

author: V. Black
title: Great yarn
body: Who knew she could write something not Harry Potter?  Never could get too involved in the Potter stories, but when Rowling published this one, I had to have a look. It held my interest, beginning to end.

author: BenevolentMomo
title: Well Written, Completely Depressing
body: Perhaps I missed the point of this book.  Perhaps the point was to bring to light the struggles an imperfections dealt with among all of the classes in this seemingly idyllic town.

author: Disappointed !
title: Struggled Thru This
body: I struggled to finish this (although I almost quit at least three times) just to see what this book was supposed to be about.  I loved the Harry Potter books and feel Ms. Rowling is brilliant, however, this is the most depressing and 'downer' book I've come across in a long time.  There was not one thing upbeat or made you feel good.  It was not for me but I'm glad I struggled through it so I can appreciate the other reader's comments and see different points of view.

author: San Diego Top
title: Engaging
body: I found myself pulled into the nuances of the relationships among the central characters.  Some events unfolded as expected while others were a complete surprise.  Great reading.

author: potterfan2011
title: Boring
body: I can't believe this book was so boring. I loved the Harry Potter books. They were full of excitement. I guess I was hoping it would be more eventful. This book was not for me

author: Jean
title: Huh?
body: I kept reading because I wanted to finally get it.  I don't think I did but maybe that was the point?

author: JOY RUFFEN
title: In Process
body: This book for me was just not quite up to speed, it leaves a lot that is just missing and what that is, is anyone's guess.  Their was no excitement, intrigue or mystery for me.  Not sure what I was expecting but this book did not deliver it.  That said my prayer is that others will love it.

author: kchan
title: Slow to start but a good read overall
body: A well written book with a very slow start. It took about a third of the book before I actually felt like I was enjoying it but since I picked this one up for a book club I slogged through it and by the middle, I was actively interested in the characters and their lives. There are a lot of characters and it becomes a muddle of names and relationships for the first hundred or so pages but eventually things start happening and it becomes easier to separate who is related to who and who is sleeping with that other guy.

author: B Farrell
title: entertaining read
body: I thought this was a great story. A story about small town politics, badgering of lives and the need for people to interfere with each other. The way that a whole community was entwined and we got a glimpse of what was going on inside each home made this an interesting read. I had a little trouble in the beginning remembering all the characters but as the story developed it became easier. The ending was a good finish and made me feel that what you think you want in life may not be what you really want if circumstances are different.For me this was an enjoyable reading experience and I was sad to reach the end!

author: Wm N. Andersen
title: No magic in this book.
body: What a dreary story. It could have been a fine story about these two towns instead it was like a very bad soao opera.

author: Ashley
title: Glad I read it? Definately.
body: When I found out that J.K. Rowling was writing a novel for adults, I knew that I HAD to have it.  I know that the book has gotten a lot of flak for being "too dark" or not "as magical as Harry Potter," but I have to say that I really enjoyed the book.

author: Bianca
title: Hmmmmmm.
body: I've been trying to read this, but it's hard to keep an interest.  I guess I'm more of a fantasy/sci-fi fan, and perhaps because this is more of a realistic story, so I find it less appealing.  Set it aside after the first five chapters, but I'm not one to give up.  Going to give it another try because JK is a master.

author: avid reader
title: Timely and relevant
body: Being a fan of Harry Potter and JK Rowling's writing abilities, I was anxious to read this book.  Although a bit off putting at first, due to language and subject(s) matter, I had to admit that by the end, I was 100% in the author's corner.  Not only does she write with such descriptive imagery, but there is a message there.  One doesn't often realize how one's actions affect others, even if indirectly.  It also shows that bullies do more damage than one can know, as do drugs, and ignorance.  A great character study (as were the Potter books) in all forms of personalities colliding with almost inevitable results.  The audio book is also terrific!

author: Vicki
title: Same Joanne not a kids book
body: This ain't no kids book ... so its not as bad as all the harry potter fans say it is however, its probably not worth your time

author: Jess
title: Magnificent!
body: Absolutely magnificent! I liked every page, every character, every story.

author: Patti R.
title: Surprise.
body: Nothing at all what I expected. JK keeps you entertained and for me was a much better read then Harry Potter.

author: thanos liodos
title: Enjoyable,
body: This story would make a terrific movie and I'd be the first to see it however there are so many characters that it took half the book to get them straight.  They for the most part had common names that blended together or were poorly introduced in the first place.  Parts were very sad and parts were quite funny

author: girlygirl27
title: Overall, good book but lengthy
body: For the first 30% of this book, I was bored and uninterested.  The characters didn't seem likable to me and I didn't care much for the plot.  But, as time went on, I became more involved in the stories of these tragic characters of a small town even if the plot never really mattered to me.  By the end of the book, I did feel fond of 2 characters and realized the overall development of each one was well written. Although it was a sad and tragic ending, I can honestly say I enjoyed the book overall.  There was some background in the beginning of the book we could have done without- but glad I stuck with it.

author: Emily
title: A difficult read
body: Another Harry Potter fan who hoped this new novel would be a step up or at least sideways in terms of storytelling.

author: Debby Porter
title: good read
body: It took me several chapters to warm up to this book, so many of the characters seemed so unlikable at first, but stick with it, it's worth it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Here's a tip - make yourself a Dramatis Personae list
body: This book has a lot of characters.  Rowling introduces them with last names, relationships, and jobs in the first few chapters. After that she just refers to them by their first names.  Here's a tip:  as you are reading the first few chapters, create a cast of characters listing each person's first and last names, who they are married to, their jobs and their kids' names.  The rest of the book, she just refers to Shirley or Samantha, and you are thinking, now who was she married to?  Perhaps not unexpectedly, the children, Fats, Arf and Krystal, have the most unique personalities and are easiest to tell apart.

author: Mzia
title: Interesting change for Rowling.
body: The story was rather involved but it moved slowly for me. I found it an average read. The characters were well defined but the story didn't excite me to want to keep reading after it ended.

author: A. Burchfield
title: The name of the author sold lots of copies!
body: I seriously considered buying this book just on the strength of the author's reputation as the writer of the Harry Potter series- I'm glad that I didn't. The "Potter" books were very long but easily readable, this book, by the same author- is something else.

author: A. Cusick
title: Great Quality!
body: I purchased this book for a Book Club selection.

author: T. J. S.
title: dont bother
body: tough read. hard to follow. too many characters.  she needs to stick to tween books. Will resell it if I can.

author: ullahoo
title: Brilliant!
body: It must have taken J.K. Rawling a lot of courage to write this book, and a lot of courage of the publisher too!

author: SUEDYE
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Very ordinary. Too many characters. Cashing in on Harry Potter. Not a good story line. Disappointing. Such a talented writer could definitely do better.

author: baseballblondie
title: Not what I expected
body: When Barry Fairbrother dies suddenly, the small town of Pagford is in shock. His death leaves an open position on the town's council. As different people vie for the position, long held secrets are brought to light and the peaceful town of Pagford isn't nearly as peaceful as it seems.

author: blueheron
title: Why not have a character list in the beginning of the book?
body: I had to make a list of the characters in order to recall who everybody was.  Other than that little criticism, I loved the book.  She is a very talented writer with excellent character development.  It has nothing to do with the HP books and I didn't expect it to.

author: Sandra  Lojek
title: Not What I expected
body: The book is not bad it just has too many characters,. and it doesnt get to the story until after chapter 8 , so it is kind of a drag;

author: M.Jacobsen
title: Rowling proves she is a first-rate storyteller
body: It took me a good six months to get through this book because I chose to listen to the audiobook instead of reading it.  With kids around, I found it difficult to find time where I could turn on the book and listen, lol.  As you're probably aware, this is JK Rowling's first "adult" novel.  (Personally, I think more adults than kids loved her Harry Potter series, but since everyone insists on categorizing them Young Adult, who am I to argue?)

author: Lisa
title: So different (not in a good way!)
body: Ugh.  That's all I thought pretty much through the entire book.  The characters had little or no redeeming qualities until the end, possibly.  Would I recommend it?  You want to read something icky?

author: Mary G. Hershey
title: Nothing like previous books but excellent characters
body: I certainly wasn't expecting such a strong dose of reality! Set in a small town in England, the characters are well drawn and the story is engaging. Not for kids under 16, I would say.

author: kirsten
title: Worth a Read
body: It's hard to beat Harry Potter but this adult novel is not bad. It takes an in depth look at a small British town and how one man's death brings up a host of issues. Perhaps she tries to deal with too much as she goes into poverty, drug abuse, teenage problems, adoption, OCD behavior, divorce etc etc, although the story is interesting and well written. The ending is a bit weak and lets down the story. Worth a read anyway.

author: A Libras
title: Lost in the Shuffle...
body: ...or the slush-pile on some editor's desk.  That's probably where this novel would have ended had it been submitted under another author-name.  I loved the Harry Potter series, not for it's world and fantasy elements, so much as Ms. Rowling's genius with character and character interactions.  I do enjoy a well-written fantasy world, but frankly, other authors have done that aspect more deftly than Ms. Rowling did.  Her characters, however, invite deserved comparisons with Dickens' own cast of unforgettables.  I wouldn't go so far as to say she reaches Dickens' level, by any means, but she certainly is one of the few to approach his style of handling fictional persons in so totally unfeigned a manner.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Very disappointing book
body: I realize Ms Rowling might have been attempting to break away from the HP image by doing something extremely different, but this book was not to my taste.  I had to force myself to finish it.  I kept waiting for something positive to occur.  The characters are all losers in one way or another, and have very few redeeming qualities.  It was depressing.

author: helen
title: Excellent book!
body: This book starts off slow, but the author does such a good job developing the characters.  I loved it!  I am anxiously looking forward to more books by JK Rowling!

author: Cynthia Pury
title: Reminds me of everything I like about Tom Wolfe
body: I loved Bonfire of the Vanities and A Man in Full. The Casual Vacancy reminds me more of these two Wolfe novels than of the Harry Potter series. Lots of characters (OK, Harry Potter has that too), lots of realistic social issues, and a sharp focus on both the petty and grand social issues that confront all of us. No fantasy, but a thought-provoking, moving story.

author: Snyds
title: I LOVED this book!
body: My friend loaned me this book with the caveat that she didn't like it and couldn't finish it. So I wasn't expecting much. But I was so wrong! I am a JK Rowling fan and have loved all the HP books. I'm also closer to JK's age than the YA audience of the HP world. So that's my perspective. I was just so happy to finally be reading a book written by JK Rowling again. I realized in reading this book that I love her writing style. She does such an excellent job at developing the characters and the story in very subtle ways. There were a lot of characters, and I found myself getting a little confused at the beginning, but that is not unusual. It happens with a lot of books, especially the really good ones. The book draws you in and gets you invested in these characters, despite the fact that none of them are very likable. That was actually what I found most surprising about this book. You have this cast of characters that all are either terrible people or woefully flawed, and you still are rooting for them and want to keep reading to see what is going to happen. I didn't want the book to end. It's one of those books that could just keep going and going, since it's not really about very much to begin with. And that is a testament to JK Rowling's writing style that I could enjoy reading a book about nothing, more than a badly written book that actually has a more "identifiable" plot. I can't wait for her to write more!

author: JM
title: Stick with it
body: Starts out slow and develops slowly, builds momentum.

author: DakotaBoy
title: Boring
body: Read the first 103 pages. Boring. Boring. Boring. Did not read the last 400 pages. I'm sure they are just as boring.

author: J. Acosta
title: Not really
body: If her name had been Johnson, it wouldn't even have made it past the first reader in the publishing house.  Cartoon characters behaving in each frame as they should.  Wrapped up in a tidy package at the end.

author: Peg Walker
title: There were too many characters.
body: The book had a slow start. There were some interesting characters but almost too many. It was difficult to keep them straight. About halfway through the book the story took on some energy and there was some good character development and a few surprises which I liked.  The F word was overdone.

author: BARBARA STRONG
title: JK Rowling - Casual Vacancy
body: I was very disappointed -  actually  I thought it quite boring up to the ten chapters I read - not interested in any future adult RK R

author: F. B. Craig
title: Forget everything you think you know before you read
body: Somehow, I had it in my head that Rowling was writing a murder mystery and this was it. It starts off (I knew before I even bought it) with a death. But A Casual Vacancy makes me think in a way of Tennessee Williams. He described Cat on A Hot Tin Roof as a day in the life. We peer in on a family and see how they have created their own ruts. Well, Rowling's book is like that only expanded to an entire community and a longer period of time. Her introduction of characters is brilliant (learning first from one point of view and then another). The title has its own depth as well. There is a part toward the end that was cliche and made me groan when I saw it coming, but overall it was a good read and good addition to my bookshelf. (For all you Harry Potter fans, this is an adult book--great for those who grew up with Harry and are now adults but not for those who are still kids).

author: stephan
title: Love all her books
body: How could you go wrong with a book from J.K. Rowling. Glad to read more after having enjoyed Harry Potter so much. Also glad to move on and try something new from her.

author: Jill
title: Did J K Rowling actually write this book?
body: I wish this wasn't my review of her effort after the Harry Potter series, but I was really disappointed.  There was none of the excellent description and fleshed out characters of her other books.  The germ of the idea for this book was valid, but the execution seemed sophomoric. Was it ghost written?  On some level, I hope so because she can do so much better.

author: RobinL
title: A grown-up Harry Potter fan, blindsided by dreck
body: When you read children's books, shallow, stereotypical characters are a huge part of the fun - done so well by JK Rowling, Lemony Snicket, Roald Dahl, et al. When you read adult fiction, the expectation is for significantly more nuance, unless it's really good satire. Which this book is not. If Ms. Rowling was attempting to write a funny send-up of society along the lines of John Mortimer or Ruth Rendell or Alexander McCall Smith, she failed. Her characters are small, mean, selfish, unattractive cardboard cutouts, so empty as to be totally lacking credibility. The story line wavers and wanders from one extreme setting to another - from the slovenly addict's hovel to the miserable high school classroom to the abusive suburban household. Much of the dialogue is an exercise in overused foul language. I forced myself to keep reading only because I was astonished at how bad it was, wondering where on earth it was all leading. What was the point? Would any of these horrible characters be redeemed? What was the author's vision? Where was her editor?

author: Spiritparticles
title: A British Version of Fox News
body: The only likable character in this story is the dead guy and he dies on page two.  Every character was an insipid, self-centered image of today's looking out for number one society.  I had no idea the UK was turning into the same as half of America. It's still a readable story, although I kept being overcome with the desire to throw it at the wall, to try and hurt the characters as much as they were hurting me.

author: Cranky
title: Brilliant, nuanced, heart-breaking
body: The Casual Vacancy is so much more than a big book about a small town. It beautifully and tragically depicts how we are all connected in our lives... The nobility of the disadvantaged and the recklessness of the fortunate come together in this intense, richly detailed novel. Ms. Rowling has written yet another gem.

author: Reader Gail
title: Thought Provoking
body: A host of complex characters kept me tied to this book.  The issue of how best to deal with disadvantaged young people as well as the difficulty of communicating in a meaningful way in "normal" families is presented in the compelling format of small town competition and politics. The reader is left to sift through all the different behaviors of the characters from courageous and caring to hateful, spiteful, and vindictive.  The last chapter left me more hopeful about the human race.

author: hunt
title: Great
body: Perfectly written. Shows how linked together a small town really is. Every character is relatable and you always want to know what's going to happen next. You also come to see how one life can affect so many others in various ways.

author: Sharon M Pervola
title: An OK READ
body: AN OK READ!  The book was a little hard to get involved in. Some of the language used was hard to understand, the British slang and wording took away from the storyline.

author: MO
title: The casual vacancy
body: Very disappointing from the author of the Harry potter series that captivated me.  Not much to like about the characters.  I probably should have put the book down before I got halfway through. I hope for something better the next time. I will not preorder.

author: L. M. Thorne
title: Not to thrilled.....
body: Maybe it's me but I could NOT get into this book at all. I barely made it to 85 pages and gave it away. I felt she is way too wordy and it seemed to drag on and on before getting to any point. I just wanted to throw the book against the wall I was so bored with it. I had a really hard time concentrating on the story. I love the Harry Potter books and read them all no problem, just not too thrilled with this attempt.....

author: Kindle Customer
title: nothing exceptional but a good way to pass the time
body: Lots of interesting characters and it's an interesting story, but it seemed a bit long.  I'm not sure her style changed  much from the HP books.

author: Laura Besley
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: In the style of a modern-day Dickens (too many characters and too much description) J.K. Rowling's first novel for adults gets off to a slow start. The small village of Pagford, where all the many characters are interlinked in one way or another, is thrown into disarray when a local councillor suddenly dies. The fight for the seat brings out the worst in the community: adults and children alike. Eventually picking up, this has a dramatic, satisfying and thought-provoking ending.

author: Marci
title: Huge disappointment
body: I read and enjoyed the Harry Potter series, so I expected quality storytelling. Instead, this book is full of the most horrible, unlikable, mean and selfish characters imaginable. The story line is contrived and unbelievable. I am sorry I spent my time reading this to the end. One of the worst books I have ever read.

author: Chris
title: Only for adult readership
body: This book shouldn't be mistaken as young reading material. Although all of J.K. Rowlings books appeal to adults in some way, The Casual Vacancy is different from Harry Potter because it is frank and vivid in describing sex, drug addiction and the often harrowing burdens of mental illness.

author: S. Kynor
title: Good story telling but none of the Rowling magic.
body: I was eager to read this book because Ms. Rowling is one of my favorite authors.  The first half of the story is very well written but there are a lot of characters to keep track of.  Unfortunately  I found myself skimming through the second half.  The central conflict was not dire enough to make me really care for the characters plight.  I do however enjoy her style and hope her next adult fiction book simply has a more interesting premise.

author: Kristin
title: Comfort the disturbed and disturb the comfortable.
body: Yes, this is by the author of the Harry Potter series.  No, this is NOT IN ANY WAY a book for children or young adults.

author: Tamara
title: Great read for smart people
body: Love this Rowling is a writer with a lot to say.  I look forward to seeing what she does next.

author: Gr;ammy
title: The Casual Vacancy--
body: Too much jumping around in story--characters get confusing. It was a disappointment considering the reputation of the writer. Hopefull the next adult book will be more enticing.

author: Stefanie Z
title: An honest look at the novel
body: The Casual Vacancy is an adult novel that explores major themes of racism, social class and poverty, and abuse. These are just a few of the themes found in the book. Because it's an adult novel, it's going to be hard to read at times and also brutally honest about human nature. Rowling's characters are all flawed and that's okay. She works with them to expose human nature. Her character development is incredible. It's difficult to stay with as she switches from character to character, but she ties them all together at the end. The novel is very well written, although complex.

author: Cheryl Bond
title: J K Rowling Casual Vacancy
body: My grandson has collection of all of her books in hard back and I wanted to surprise him by ordering this one on pre order... He so loves her writing as I do and was so glad to get another great book

author: constant reader
title: A social satire with a heart. J.K. Rowling for grown-ups!
body: J.K. Rowling's first novel for adults is realism at it's best. It's magic can be found in her uncanny ear for dialogue, her wonderful wit, and her mastery of the details of everyday life. She presents her characters with great satire but no malice -- even those who are rather unlikeable are treated with sympathy. The first few chapters touch on the rather mundane topic of a vacancy of the parish (i.e., town) council. I wondered how on earth she was going to sustain this premise for an entire novel. However, I became so involved in the tragi-comic lives of the characters (who are NOT difficult to keep track of) that I wished the book would go on for many more chapters. I also wished for much happier endings for the teenagers. (Despite knowing that if Crystal had lived in my town I would have judged, feared, and loathed her, halfway through the novel I was rooting for her and hoping she could turn her life around.) For the most part, the adults received their just desserts.

author: Kitty Bug
title: An Interesting Read
body: It was a very interesting fast moving story.  It gave you a lot to think about when examining the characters.  It was a very different kind of story which made it a more enjoyable read although the story is intense.

author: Sue
title: J.K. Rowlings should stick to Harry Potter
body: I have never not finished a book, but there is always a first time, and this was it.  I read all of the Harry Potter books and could not get over how well they were written and how fascinating they were to read.

author: Janet
title: Very disappointed
body: Loved the Harry Potter series, but this one just could not grab my interest.  Maybe I'll try reading it at another time, though.

author: DW
title: Fun
body: I read this because I was curious. Lots of characters to follow but she writes well and you care about each one of them in the small village. I still remember one character who was "perennially aquiver" to discover slights. She is great. And I thank her for turning my kids into readers with Harry Potter.

author: Ryan Field
title: Well Done, Ms. Rowling
body: I don't think I could add anything too different from what's already been said about The Casual Vacancy in over three thousand Amazon reviews. I've noticed that the reviews are mixed, and about half either loved the book or half didn't. I'd like to add up front that I did not read anything in the Harry Potter series because I'm not a fan of that genre. I saw a few of the movies and I yawned through them. Once again, because I'm not a fan of that particular genre.

author: Linda
title: Who wrote this book?
body: I could not believe that JK Rowling had written this book. It was juvenile, badly written and had no story at all. I kept reading to the end to find out if I had missed the plot.

author: Bill Douglas
title: An Exquisitely Meaningful View into Humanity - A True Gem of Literary Art and Heart
body: When I first began this book, I was expecting a Harry Potter read. When it wasn't what I expected, I almost put it down. I am so very glad I didn't. This book is a journey deep into the heart of humanity, the compassion and insight Rowlings weaves through the pages is one that will open the heart and broaden the vision of any person who believes in human compassion. So many books today have two-dimensional good guy, bad guy, overtold stories to tell. In The Casual Vacancy Rowling takes us into the complexity of the human heart and through the power of the most real character development and story telling shows what a profound impact human beings can have on one another, for good, or for bad. Anyone with a heart who reads this book will walk away a bigger more conscious person than they were when the started it. It was so difficult to put the book down, I read nothing else until I finished it. I hope that this is only the first of Rowling's post-Potter books, I am so looking forward to the next one.

author: Dutch Girl 3186
title: disappointed
body: Had to start a list of all of the characters, if I put down the book for a few days I couldn't keep track of who was who. Struggled through to page 100 then gave up.

author: Edith A. Walworth
title: Interesting read
body: I really enjoyed this book by J.K. Rowling. She does an amazing job weaving together all the characters in this book and developing those characters so that you believe you know them well. This would be a good choice for a book club since Ms. Rowling deals with a variety of topics that would make for interesting discussion.

author: KS
title: Sadly unimpressed
body: I wanted to like this book so much, being an avid Harry Potter fan, but I was incredibly bored throughout the book, and it's a bit hard to follow in the beginning because it so rapidly changes characters.

author: Glass House Reviews
title: A Study in Craft
body: Following the immensely successful Harry Potter series is no easy feat, and I can completely understand Rowling's decision to avoid all similarities to the magical world she created.

author: Mrs. Worthington
title: Not my fav
body: This book was a little hard to keep up with the characters at first. It was not my favorite. I did not get too excited about reading it each day :(

author: Linn Eriksen
title: Great book
body: I really liked this book.

author: Chelle
title: Like reading a tabloid
body: I carefully avoided knowing anything about this book before reading it.  I wanted to be completely surprised - and I was.  JK Rowling has a wonderful way of painting vivid pictures with her words, but after completing the book I am left with a number of disturbing pictures in my mind that I would truly rather forget (I think we know what most teenage boys are up to without reading crude, detailed descriptions of what they look at online, images that refuse to leave the mind later).  The book would have been just as effective without the most graphic descriptions.  I am not a people watcher or celebrity stalker - therefore I found the plot (following the lives of several dysfunctional families) rather disinteresting as a topic.  Only a great like Rowling could have made it even as moderately interesting as it was to me, but I can think of many other books I would have rather spent my time reading.  Overall, I was disappointed.

author: Annandale reader
title: Interesting
body: I liked the sympathetic portrayal of the residents of the council flats.  The small town politics seemed to ring true.  It was a very ambitious book that followed many characters.  I made a chart to keep track of the characters - who was married to whom with which children.  That's something I don't usually feel the need to do.

author: mawmaw5
title: Very disappointing.
body: Was a huge fan of J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter books but not so with this one.  Hard to keep track of the goings on and a slow read.  Put me to sleep.

author: janet null
title: Disappointing
body: Started reading it a couple of times but have been unable to get very far, as it's boring and showcases the weaknesses of Rowling's writing, not her strengths for story-telling and wit.  Extremely rare that I don't finish any book I start, but that may be the case with this one.

author: kjawbb
title: the Casual Vacancy
body: Excellent book!.  I was pleasantly surprised at the level of this book after having comparing her to the Harry Potter seried.

author: Ashley
title: Love it!
body: Never disappointed by JK Rowling! Loving the book so far, but of course nothing can surpass Harry Potter. Thank you!

author: Diane E. Selzam
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I did not read any of the Harry Potter books, so this was a new author experience for me..honestly, the book was a difficult read for me. The characters were all over the place, not coming together until the end and that was sort of predictable.

author: Puff Dotty
title: Don't Waste Your Time.
body: After 240 pages of tedious exposition, the plot finally started moving forward. Up until that point I had to force myself to keep reading, in the hopes that it would eventually grab my interest. But after spending 503 pages with a town full of ugly, pathetic, miserable, petty characters - none of which you really root for - the sad, pathetic ending petered out and I realized that this is one of the lousiest stories I've ever read. Don't waste your time.

author: Kate Hattery
title: Wonderful
body: Once again, J.K.Rowling has shown her literary prowess with this novel. The ups and downs are exhilarating! I'd read it over and over again.
