Like many of his novels, this one starts out introducing a bunch of seemingly disparate charcaters and then slowly brings them together into a loose narrative with a healthy dose of social meaning.

author: Knighteagle
title: A slow start to a good story, but it picks up great!
body: The Casual Vacancy is at first glance a slow paced political drama. However as you continue reading the characters become more interesting, and very real. With no true heroes or villains. (Ok maybe one or two 'Villains') there is something in any of the main characters that the reader can relate to. The more you read the less important the political aspects of the story become to the reader and the characters.

author: Avid_readerSS
title: So Disappointed
body: I was looking for a book with characters about which I could care, not a book filled with cardboard cutouts. I was looking for a plot with risk and daring and challenge, didn't happen. Even an arresting setting would have helped, but Pagford is as dull as everything else about this novel. Unfortunately, I could never read more than two pages without falling asleep. Perhaps this book appeals to readers in Great Brittan, but I don't think it will appeal to most of us in the Colonies. The only thing to be said in favor of this book is that the grammar and spelling are correct. That fact is the single quality that prevented me from giving this book only one star.

author: BJ
title: JK Rowling's "novel for adults".
body: J.K. Rowling's "Novel for Adults"

author: FarHorizons
title: A worthwhile read, but Rowling is on a hiding to nothing with this one
body: Everything that can be said - good, bad or indifferent - has already been written about this book.

author: Susan from Perth
title: Could not put it down
body: Even though I read constantly, this would rate as one of the best novels I've read in ages. When not reading it, I constantly thought about the characters. I was very sad to reach the end. Rowling has created such "fat" characters.  She has imbued them with some of the most realistic characteristics we humans possess, from unsolicited compassion to spiteful self -interest. I've never read a Harry Potter, as that style of fiction does not appeal to me.  So therefore, it was with a little reluctance I embarked on The Casual Vacany. I sincerely hope Rowling continues with adult fiction. Sadly, I'll have to try to locate my next read, knowing it will probably not capture me, the way the people in Rowling's town of Pagford, did.

author: A. Smith
title: Gritty, moving, not for children
body: It's not Hogwarts, but what Rowling accomplishes in revealing the heart and darkness of racism in the Harry Potter series, she accomplishes similarly about poverty in "The Casual Vacancy."  This is not a book appropriate (or written) for children.  Parts of it may make you sick if you're squeamish or prudish or sheltered.  But it's important.  It's the sort of story that needs to be told, is engaging in the telling, and will leave you different than it found you.

author: DLewis
title: JK Rowling's latest book The Casual Vacancy
body: I loved JK Rowling's Harry Potter series and was hoping this would be a similar style of writing.  I have had a little trouble getting into the story but have only read 75 pages so far.  I am hoping that this books starts to captivate me but not yet.  The delivery was very quick and right on the date they told me.

author: Jana
title: As Un-Potterish As It Is Possible To Be
body: I'm obsessed with the Harry Potter series. I've read each of those books more times then is ok to admit. I grew up with them, and because of this I feel a little like I know J.K. Rowling. I sometimes refer to her as "Jo" and I was so excited that she was writing a new book. In my mind, the worst case scenario was that it would be a total flop and she would go back to writing Harry Potter novels.

author: Kiwi Alice
title: Potentially great, but...
body: The world knows J.K Rowling is an amazing writer, but this one just didn't do it for me. Beautifully descriptive prose to the point that I felt I knew all the characters personally, but sooooo much of it! Just too much extra information tucked away in brackets too often. The plot was interesting, characters well thought out, but to me, this should have been heavily edited down to a snappy short story. It was just too long winded.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not my cup of tea
body: Not what I expected of this Rowling. I loved her Harry Potter and expected more here. Very disappointed in this one.

author: Grandma Becky
title: Dissapointed!
body: I guess I expected too much out of the Harry Porter author.  It was a whole different kind of story.  Very sad and depressing.

author: Tracy
title: Kind of slow at first...
body: You really need a character map to keep up with all of the characters and the relationships between them.  It is not a light read, but it is well written.  Stick with it...I hear that it goes pretty fast once you get through a couple hundred pages...if you can.

author: Darryl Noble
title: ending
body: ending was blah just stopped why why why why why why why why why why why why why why 18

author: Fiona Millar
title: Does not get my vote!
body: Peopled with charmless characters who inhabit a bleak landscape,this novel lacks the whimsy and humor which so delighted fans of the Harry Potter books.

author: bert olthof
title: The casual vacancy
body: She's a good writer of the English language, but this story is boring and not well told. I had expected much better, considering her "fame". Maybe she should stick to kid's fairy tales.

author: Connie
title: Not a bad read
body: It's not her Harry Potter series but it's good.  I'm sure I'll read it again in the future but not right away.

author: Karen Beacon
title: Hope she'll write even more for adults
body: Think a little less raunchy language could have been just as effective, but I loved and adored the characters and it was a super book.  A little hard to get into, so stick with it.

author: Pamela Jameson
title: Rough start...
body: I found the first part of this book hard to get into.  It was depressing and all the characters were at war.  Because it's JK Rowling and I'm a Harry Potter fan, I stuck with the story and was not disappointed.  Once you get thru Part 1 and you get back into JK Rowling's writing style the story comes together.  Actions and consequences throughout.  Really an amazing story.

author: Chickensoup
title: JK Rowlings Hates Muggles!  Unless you are wealthy, academic or magical you are a Muggle
body: JK Rowling Hates Muggles.  Who knew?

author: Kindle Customer
title: the casual vacancy
body: very poor i wish i could get my money back

author: Gypsy At Last
title: Disappointing
body: I'm only half way through this book so perhaps there's something coming that will make me be glad I struggled to get through to the end.  The only reason I've continued to plow through it was the author's obvious literary success with the HP series.

author: Ksan
title: One of the most boring ever
body: I thought that I would enjoy this after reading the Potter books. Shows how wrong you can be at times. I'll give her a second chance if she does another book, but it will have to be low priced!

author: ISO
title: Casual Vacancy - Too Casual!
body: Ms Rowlings attempt at writing a book for adults suffers from her background as a writer of books from younger persons. The plot is simplistic and the vocabulary is rather limited. Perhaps my expctations were set a bit too high but this transition for Ms Rowling stills needs a bit more work - it is hopefully still a 'Work in Progress"

author: Alexandra Kuznetsova
title: Casual vacancy
body: This is a very good book. The book is read at one breath - although I wouldn't say it's "easy" reading

author: PerttiJS
title: "Mugglemarch" was ok
body: Although this J. K. Rowling's adult novel has been nicknamed "Mugglemarch", I found this small-town-story compelling. The starting point idea: remove suddenly (by death) a central character from a small community and see what happens, is a good one. The suddenly died councellor had friends, enemies and people in between. Rowling makes her characters lively, And as in Harry Potters, the teenagers become the heroes of this novel.

author: Randy Everette
title: I miss harry
body: The writing is great...Rowling is brilliant with the English language, but i feel like i've been waiting for something to happen for the whole book.  Every time i pick it up, i wonder why i'm still reading it. Like a bad movie that you just want to end so you can say you know how it ends.  Too many characters that develop too slowly.  Seems like Rowling just wanted to prove she can cuss and overuse sex in a book. I hope parents don't it would make a good gift for young Potter fans.

author: Julia K. Whitlow
title: Great read
body: I really enjoyed this book. It is nothing like Harry Potter though, so if that is what you are expecting then you might be disappointed.

author: jglaser
title: Thanks J.K.Rowling
body: Thanks J.K. Rowling for transcending me back to the crappiest reality of our everyday lives.  I like to escape reality when I read fiction, not have its darker truths shoved in my face. Awesome.

author: Timothy J. Taylor
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: The story provided a realistic insight into what life in small town England.  The focus on rich vs poor, hostility on the local government council, family relationships, and life in the "projects" was well done.  I was curious about Ms. Rowling's ability at writing a story without magical characters and was quite pleased.  It was an easy read, interesting, and held my attention.

author: squirrely
title: super read
body: I do not understand those who said the characters were slow to develop and were too many. This book is a really great read, taken in slowly to develop the complex relationships between all of the many characters. A real slice of life from low to high and the real lives led by so many different people. It is not a cheerful feely good book, tragic in it's content, but truthful to life.

author: Luz
title: too many characters introduced early on
body: Too many characters are introduced at the beginning and it is difficult to follow the plot otherwise the book became very interesting towards the end.

author: Mel L Whitehair
title: i was very dissappointed
body: I didn't get past 95 pages. It went absolutely no where, slowly. I was very disappointed. The people in the book just did'nt have any action for lack of other words

author: Judy L
title: well totally different
body: I have only started reading this book and am not sure of it but its totally different from her other works of course as its targeted to "grown ups" and I need to get into it more but so far nothing spectacular.

author: FlyeMom52
title: I found it to be a good read
body: I normally would have been put off by the overall 3 star rating; however I downloaded a sample.  I didn't even bother to finish the sample before ordering the book, because I was hooked.  I enjoyed this book. It kept me reading.  While it wasn't the most uplifting I've ever read, it certainly was realistic, and I found it to be very well written.  Perhaps because I never read the Harry Potter books, I didn't have expectations.  Initially, I had a little trouble keeping up with the characters, but reading on, they became familiar and I continued reading to see how their individual story-lines would play out.  I had absolutely no trouble reading this book through to the finish.

author: SusieNYer
title: It's Extraordinary
body: Although I had not read the Harry Potter series, I was eager to try her effort for adults, as I surmised that she must weave a wonderful tale.  Not only was I not disappointed, I loved every word.  I very seldom read fiction, but I can't recommend it highly enough.  It's the first time in years that I couldn't put a book down, and I only wish that it had been twice as long.

author: Papa Smurf
title: JK Rowling isn't just for kids anymore
body: I had very high hopes for the first "adult" novel from Ms. Rowling.  I was not disappointed in the least.  The story was intriguing and the characters well developed. I wanted to know more about them with each page. Bravo!

author: Roberta
title: It ain't harry Potter!
body: Haven't finished it yet, probably because I don't really care what happens.  We know JK Rowling can do better, and should.

author: Doris
title: Not  as wonderful writing as The Harry Potter series
body: So much of this book is drugs, sex and abuse.  I am disappointed. I had been looking forward to this book for quite sometime. Boo.

author: Amazon Customer
title: brilliant dissection of human nature
body: J. K. Rowling proves herself a master of her craft in this novel.  With her characteristic razor sharp wit she shows us the thoughts, motives and inner monologues of a rather large array of characters.  Male, female, teenagers to grandparents, her characters are gradually developed in such a way that we understand (even if we dislike) the actions they take... or do not take.  In so doing, Rowling offers a brilliant and unflinching commentary on human nature as well as a compelling story of the profound effects humans have on one another, both positive and negative.

author: angies favorites
title: Not at all what I expected!
body: I had heard all the reports about this book before it came out. Saying it was entirely different than her other books was an understatement!!  I bought it though thinking since I liked her other books so much I would like this one. Boy, was I wrong.  It is so hard to follow.  Jumps all over the place.  And characters, oh my goodness you need a pad and pencil at your side to keep track. And some of the expressions she uses are definitely from where she lives.  I will finish it though as I am one once I start a book I do.  I am hoping that it will get better but being as I am half way through it I doubt it.

author: Daniel
title: Well written
body: Solid plot, compelling characters and smoothly written. While somewhat depressing, this book is also very enjoyable and worth the read.

author: carol irvin
title: She could write Benson's Mapp and Lucia here instead but went darker
body: This is a fairly dark work.  That is not to say that HP was not dark too but the fantasy in it was so entertaining that the darkness was more palatable.  This is very well written and is about the adults and the children of a small town in England who are thrown into control and class issues when one of the local politicians dies suddenly.  This is a town which was once all prosperously middle class or better but due to a political deal annexed some other territory which brought in lower classes. Those two classes are thrown together in this book, both teenagers and adults.

author: arak86
title: A Tragically Honest Portrait of the Human Condition
body: J.K. Rowling wrote a novel for adults. She wrote a political statement. Most of all, she wrote a novel about humanity. Written from a third person omniscient point of view, Rowling granted the readers glimpses into the innermost thoughts and emotions of over fifteen different citizens of the small town of Pagford. The result presented itself as a tragically honest portrait of the human condition.

author: dellinoHIo
title: Had to put it down
body: Sadly, 4 letter words and coarse vocabulary are not to my liking.  The imagination and creative author of Harry Potter series has gone to a place I prefer not to visit.  If I were able to mail this tome back to her, I would.

author: Sandra
title: Quite the characters!
body: I enjoyed reading this book.  The characters were a  sad bunch...no redeeming features...but I enjoyed the way the story played out.

author: lyly
title: Much ado about nothing
body: A very long book, difficult to get into the story. Not a page turner, rather a sleeper. Too bad. The Harry Potter series was so exciting...

author: Sara Lewis
title: Haven't been able to keep my interest.
body: I have tried to read this but can't get interested but will try again soon. Anxious to try to give it another chance.

author: G. Cooper
title: Adult writing by J. K. Rowling
body: I found this book informative about a slice of British life and certainly for mature readers. It was not, however, captivating or riveting to this reader.

author: Douglas
title: A must read!
body: If you looking for muggles, and magic, you might want to reread Rowling's Harry Potter series because you will not find that here.  What you will find is the same beautifully developed characters who attempt to meet the challenges of their sometimes joyous and sometimes profoundly painful lives.  This story is a tragedy.  And it is not for children.  Kudos J.K.!  Loved every minute of it!

author: j.
title: ZZZZZZZZZZZ
body: Ahh. New Book, by JK Rowling.

author: Jill Giovan
title: dreary, depressing, lackluster - skip it!
body: This novel is so dreary, depressing and hopeless.  The multitude of characters are almost all unlikeable and not well-developed, the tone cynical. Rather shocking, considering how good the character development was in the HP series.  The HP characters seemed like real people to me, but these characters are cardboard caricatures.  I came away with nothing of value.  This book is not worth the time it takes to read it.  Very disappointing.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Worth the read
body: This novel has had mixed reviews in New Zealand and a number have implied that it doesn't have the impact of Harry Potter so it isn't worth reading. They will have missed out. This is small town connections and in each of the characters we can see (unfortunately) aspects of our own lives and the lives of those around us. JK Rowling takes one incident, the death of Barry Fairbrother and then proceeds to see how this affects the lives of his family, friends and acquaintences. The characters I found were realistic. It was an easy, interesting read and one I recommend.

author: Nancy F. Willems
title: WAY OVER RATED!
body: The characters were developed very slowly which gave you more time to dislike them.  This book was like watching grass grow.  Total waste of time and money.

author: Liz Wright
title: A huge cast of characters and a decent plot line
body: I enjoyed this book more than I expected to, given some of the prior reviews.  The book contains multiple intersecting story lines concerning a whole cast of characters.  I almost needed a score card to keep track of how everyone was related.  But I did find I was interested in all the different story lines. And it was a quick read.  My main complaint was that I found the ending unsatisfying.

author: briante
title: Very Interesting
body: I had tried to read Harry Potter years ago and could not get past page 10.  This book, while not great, held my attention because of her wonderful writing.  I hope she does more adult novel.

author: readlikebreathing
title: Disturbingly and Gloriously Human
body: I definitely waited a while to read this one, and then had to give myself a day to recover after finishing it before I could attempt a review. Initially I scared myself into thinking it wouldn't live up to the standards of Harry Potter and I would come away feeling disappointed.

author: Colleen Frobose
title: Disappointed
body: I was looking forward to this book. I thought it had the possibility to be great having read all the Harry Potter books and expecting the same depth of plot and richness of characters. However I found Barry Fairweather's death disappointingly early.  The teens lacked authenticity. The adults were confusingly indistinct in some parts of the book and local politics are just not that thrilling. The plot was enough for a short story but not for a book. Rowling used her usual rich description but I found myself wanting more story line.  I bought it at the airport and put it down well before the end of my eight hour flight...

author: charlesehenry
title: A work in progress
body: I have not finished this book yet - only 1/3 done - but it is an interesting departure from the Potter series, and I will be interested to see where she goes with this mini-societal adventure. Quite British (what a surprise!)

author: avid reader
title: another well written book from J.K. Rowling
body: I thoroughly enjoyed this complex set of characters set within the confines of an English country village. I am from England and totally related to the local dialogue and social mores of citizens in a small village. I could see perhaps that American readers might have difficulty understanding some of the slang or colloquial language used in the written dialog. I so enjoyed the book that I read it straight through. As usual, J.K. Rowling writes about interesting characters and the complications in their lives, both secret and public. This book is  written about the common human conditions,  and aspirations, and personal secrets,  that are found everywhere in life, whether in a big city or small village.

author: Carolyn
title: No Harry Potter Magic here!
body: I was hoping to break my antipathy towards the Potter goddesses writing but no such luck! I found the first four chapters so hard-going that I have had to take a break to regain my strength...I may try to reread it when I feel I have nothing left to read in the world and/or lose the will to live ~ until then, I can manage to live with this drivel.

author: Cara
title: Great novel
body: This book is extremely sad, and not at all like HP. Rowling is a brilliant writer... The beginning of this book was quite slow, but it definitely picked up and amazed me. Very sad ending, vulgar writing, but very realistic. Must read.

author: Mona L. Stokes
title: Not a likeable character in the book.
body: Have to admit, I expected it to be more interesting.  I kept reading just to see where she was going, I guess I hoped it would get better.  It didn't.

author: Richard L. Thomas
title: What happened?
body: Way too many characters to keep track of, had trouble following who was who, what they were doing and how it related to the story.  Finally gave up.  Surprised because couldn't put the HP series down.

author: Blueheeler
title: Ho hum
body: Stop at Harry Potter. Bought this for the Rowlings name and really cannot think of any comment other than it was ordinary.

author: P. Oberlander
title: pretty Good
body: I was interested in reading this book because I was interested to see how J.K. Rowling would come out from the shadow of Harry Potter. I was pleasantly surprised. It was more adult than I expected and touched on very important social issues.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Still my favorite author!
body: This book is a study of characters. The plot serves that end. Beautifully written, well-planned, and carried to an ending that left me thinking for days. I'm only sad that I don't know when there will be another J.K. Rowling to read!

author: ebaston
title: snore.
body: I Couldn't get through the first 5% of the book. There were to many characters and not enough substance to keep me interested.

author: Isabela Cantos
title: The book is awesome, even though is way too different from Harry Potter. J. K. Rowling shows us the marvelous writer she is.
body: Even though this book is way too different from Harry Potter, J. K. Rowling is still an amazing writer. You should totally read it!

author: Rachel
title: Welcome to Pagford!
body: Yes, Pagford. No, not Hogwarts. Pagford.

author: selinz
title: Brilliant, engaging, and superbly entertaining
body: I was anxious to read this as I was thoroughly entertained by the HP series. I have listened to close to 300 audio books over the last 10 years and as such, have been exposed to many styles of fiction and non-fiction. My figure of merit is "am I pulled in." Do I finish my 50 mile each way commute and think "I don't even remember it?" Well, this one passes that. Rowling is the queen if villians and victims. This was certainly the case in HP and we see much of the same thing here. You are compelled to hate some characters, love some characters, and change you mind through the reading.

author: sundaymorning
title: modern empathy
body: The NYT reviewer didn't like the book. The book may be better read by someone not expecting more Harry Potter (me), someone interested in the limits and craziness of politics (me again) and someone trying to grasp the evils of poverty and disconnection in the modern world (yup, me). I think of Rowling here as a modern Dickens who doesn't allow the reader to put child poverty, human misery and risk into the nostalgic mists of ye olde times. The book hurts.

author: sg
title: tough read
body: This book is confusing with multiple run on sentence, stretched allusions and characters who are hard to follow.  I am half way through the book and don't think I will even finish it

author: juliette hamilton
title: Fabulous book
body: I highly recommend it, it shows how selfish human beings are and how they only really think about themselves. Am impressed with J K Rowling.

author: G. Moerschel
title: Too Bad...
body: After reading 194 pages and still not "into" the book, I quit.  What a huge disappointment for me on Rowling, I expected so much more.  Maybe she should have taken Harper Lee's advice.  "I'll put it this way. When you have hit the pinnacle, how would you feel about writing more? Would you feel like you're competing with yourself?"

author: Irene
title: Great characters
body: I really enjoyed this book and loved the author's character descriptions, although can't imagine that I would want any one of them to be my friend.

author: Momof7
title: Outrageous language
body: I realize author branching out but this was branching too

author: Nancy Kerr
title: How could J.K. Rowling be so disappointing?
body: I truly didn't think it was possible for J.K. Rowling to write anything but outstanding works of literature which is why I plodded through the most boring ,badly written  book I have ever read in The Casual Vacancy. The characters in this book were dull, uninteresting, and in all cases the most unappealing mean spirited people that could possibly live in one town. The entire town of Pagford and The Fields was at war ,and one could only deplore man's inhumanity to man as represented in all of Rowling's characters in this book. We can only hope that Rowling  gets back to writing in her true genre of magical characters in a world of fantasy ,as opposed to dwelling on depressing characters living in their dull and uninteresting world.

author: Ella62
title: Kind of Like A Soap Opera
body: While The Casual Vacancy must have required a lot of effort and skill to write, it just did not work for me.  It was complicated, too busy and confusing.  It reminded me of a TV Soap Opera with all the different characters (most of whom also had a nickname...hard to keep up with) and all of the plot lines.  Every time I picked the book back up I would have to reacquaint myself with all of the characters.  Also didn't care for the ending.  Don't want to give anything away but didn't really think it needed to end that way and it did not leave me wanting more.

author: Deb
title: Rowling is a winner!
body: Rowling's ability to delve into her character's motivations for their actions is spot-on.  The class structure these characters adhere to it so true......this story could have been set anywhere, and the characters would act the same.  Great literature!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Give it a chance!
body: I realize I'm in the minority, but I thought it was a fantastic book. A little depressing, a little more vulgar than Harry Potter (okay, a lot more vulgar), but I thought it was written well and had great character development through the way. If you go into it expecting HP, you're going to be thoroughly disappointed. If you go into it with an open mind, you might find that you enjoy it.

author: Megan
title: Another Harry Potter Please
body: Only worth reading due to her being the author of Harry Potter.  Feels like she is trying to hard to depart from Harry Potter and be a "real" author with a grown up novel.

author: Sammy
title: The Casual Vacancy - JK Rowling
body: This book was described as new and in excellent condition but there was markings all over the front cover like dried glue or something had taken the new "sheen" off.  It was a gift, so I was disappointed that it didn't look new.

author: Clair Weiss
title: Just got started with the book
body: I got interested in the book after I saw Ms Rowling's TV interview with Charlie Rose. She came across as a sharp observer of people's lives in their day-to-day situations (despite of her billionaire status and fabulous success with Harry Potter).

author: V. Vollmer
title: Boring
body: I was expecting so much more from this author.  I did read the whole book but it was a struggle.

author: Kindle Customer Patricia Bruner
title: Not what I expected
body: After having read all of J.K Rowling's Harry Potter books I expected more from her than this.  Because of the price I paid for it, I had to finish the book.

author: C. Uhres-Todd
title: A breath of fresh air
body: Not what you expect after reading the Harry Potter books. Very British writing, dry humour, wonderful insight. Loved it. Disturbing and shocking at times, but good to challenge your thinking especially in regards to teenager world. Recommend!

author: S. L. Walker
title: Village life down to a tee
body: Most of us will know someone like each and every character in this book. Great observation of archetypal English behaviour. It's what makes you keep on reading an otherwise unremarkable story.

author: Wendell Corneil
title: disappointing
body: You would think the woman who wrote the Harry P. books would have a larger vocabulary than just filth.  Very disappointing.

author: Sissy
title: Shame on Little Brown!
body: Clearly, Little Brown was intimidated by Rowling's stardom and failed to critically edit her work.  With nearly 30 characters introduced in as many pages, there is no development or distinction to any.  The dialogue, written in some form of British local dialect, is difficult to understand and requires slow reading to figure it out. The plot develops ever so painfully slowly...to the point where the reader seriously considers calling it quits numerous times. Save your money...save your time. So many excellent books to read, including the Harry Potter stories....but this is definitely not one.

author: J. Bergauer
title: BLAND PROSE NOT FOR CONSUMPTION
body: Best part of the book is the title!  Unfortunately, this is a dull book with limited character development, weak dialogue and sexual references that take the narrative nowhere. I've read a few reviews saying the last 100 pages are good but there are too many great books published to spend hours getting there so I won't give "Casual Vacancy" anymore of my leisure reading time.

author: ola fityani
title: Genuis
body: Rowling sculptures her characters.You feel them , you visualize each and everyone of them.Reading The Casual Vacancy is a pleasure in every aspect. Made me feel I was watching a movie with my own vision of the characters. Rowling has a magical way of expressive language and choice of words..What a pleasure.Brilliant author, brilliant read.

author: Ssloane
title: Depressing --- take Prozac before reading
body: I pre-ordered the book on audio CD's to listen to in the car.  A fan of Rowling's work, I greatly anticipated "reading" it.  But the only redeeming feature of this book was the narrator, who did a brilliant job. The book is told over a set of 15 CD's and I loaded them into my vehicle's CD player five at a time.  At the end of the fifth CD I contemplated tossing the whole thing in the garbage, but my desire to find out what happens to Krystal and Robbie Weedon forced me to soldier on.

author: Stephen Zack
title: A Breakdown of Communication in an English Town
body: One of the main characters drops dead on the second page.  You spend the next couple hundred pages sorting out the large cast of characters, their children, all their connections and their nicknames.  JKR should have a glossary for names. It is very entertaining and hard to put the book down once  you learn the names and relationships of many characters.  It almost seems like a sequel.

author: Chiquita
title: Where's the Harry Magic?
body: As an avid Harry Potter reader, as most of the people that rushed to read this book are, I had high expectations. I felt extremely let down, though.  Rowling seems to forget that she only has one book to introduce characters, not 7.  The amount of people and their stories gets confusing, especially in the first third of the book. It takes a long time to keep track of who's who, and by the time I figured it out, I think I had lost some of the plot.  The storyline is so-so, but the last 30 pages or so were probably the only really good part of the book. Don't read it just because you're a fan of Rowling. You might find yourself very disappointed.

author: robin
title: Unbelievable
body: I looked forward to reading this book as I devoured her prior writings with glee. However, this book was depressing, violent, sad, disgusting, with no redeeming qualities. I love to read and Hated reading this book. I just don't get it. Rowling is a great writer. Why this? Why in this manner?

author: Dark Knight
title: Below expectation
body: This is nothing compared to Harry Potter Series. So as a fan of Harry potter I bought this book but was highly disappointed. the story is slow and boring. Revolves around a small town politics.

author: Jean Myles
title: Great Character Development and Plausible Story
body: Great characters, not lovable, but developed extremely well. JK Rowling is an amazing writer, Harry Potter or otherwise. Some reviews are criticizing the lack of plot, but for me there doesn't always have to be a profound, dramatic, or twist ending plot.  The characters, relationships, and plausibility are what make Casual Vacancy a good read.  My only criticism is the length, it could have been shorter without losing it's power.

author: George A Kennedy
title: A realistic, satiric view of small town English life and classes.
body: This is a well written book, a page-turner. The female characters are treated with more sympathy than the male characters, in general. My only real objection to the work is the excess of foul language. It may be realistic (though how would Rowling know?), but colloquialism could be suggested more subtlily.

author: Angela Liefer
title: Something different
body: I truly enjoyed the characters in this book.  They were real, more real than we would like to admit.  The story lines moved along at a good clip. I had some trouble, at first, keeping the characters and various relationships straight, it was worth it in the end to pay attention.  As a social services professional, the story lines struck me as being sadly realistic.  As much as I hated that the ending was not a happy fantasy, it was true and plays out all too often in the world today.  This book explores some of the same themes as Harry Potter but in a much more mature and frank way.  It is a book I will probably read again and will recommend to anyone who asks (even those who don't ask, unfortunately for my friends).

author: Ann
title: Just okay
body: I was curious how this writer of the great Harry Potter series was going to make this transition to adult fiction. I was less than impressed. It didn't move along as well as I might have desired. The characters and their situations, which were many, had been given too much description. You had to wade through this novel.

author: MiddleK
title: stereotypes galore
body: I was very dissapointed with this book. It was a bore and so full of stereotypical characters it was annoying.  Barely made it all the way through. Not worth the $$$but the cover art is cool so at least it looks good in the bookcase.

author: karin wiles
title: Don't rush to read
body: I thought it was interesting but the characters weren't as detailed as JK Rowling's characters from the Harry Potter books. It left me unsatisfied.

author: SadieHMayfield
title: A Rowling World Without the Magic
body: I loved it. I was an avid Harry Potter fan as a child and was reticent to read something by Rowling what was not related to the books I had loved so dearly but I am glad I did. I think it was a brutally honest book about the world that people think that they live and the realities that they refuse to accept because it may not be what they had pictured their life looking like. It does have a heavy amount of swearing and sexual references, but then again it is written for adults and not young adults so let's hope people can handle it. If you are not a fan of books such as Girl, Interrupted then don't pick this up. It is well written and the multiple voices weave together a beautiful story that is heart wrenching and wonderfully written.

author: Valerie J
title: If I hadn't read Harry Potter
body: If I hadn't read Harry Potter, I'd give this book 4 stars so that's what it's getting. I had to really separate myself from the stories I grew up with and loved in Harry Potter. Enough about HP though... this was actually a good book in the end. It's not an easy read and the characters were not very likable at first. The first half of the book was really slow but once you get past part three, it really picks up and becomes interesting. The ending was not what I expected and overall the book was very dark. I'm glad I pushed through to the end though. JK Rowling's writing style in this book is totally different than what I am used to. I love the way she switches which character's mind you're in. It makes reading the book kind of fun once you get used to it.

author: Brenda J. Barnett
title: I wouldn't spend the money a 2nd time
body: I read it because I invested in it - but otherwise I would have set the book down.  Not a quality book by any means.  So disappointing!

author: H J Crymble
title: Boring
body: Dragged on too much, too many different characters, gave up quarter of the way through as story never seemed to get going.

author: Sherry Price
title: Disappointed
body: I loved the Harry Potter Books because of the positive tone to them.  This story was just too dark for me.  The humor eluded me - which might be due to the fact that I am an American instead of British.

author: Mg Gallegos13
title: Well written but I hated the characters
body: I eagerly looked forward to Rowling's first adult novel. I must admit, I did not finish it. It is very well written but I couldn't like any of the various characters (and there are a lot of them). Quite frankly, I don't like books with f-words and cranky teen-agers and selfish housewives, and brutish husbands. So this could well be a classic book that stands up to the ages (like I said, it is very well written) but it is definitely not one that I want to read so I'm not going to finish it, except maybe the last chapter to see where it all ends.

title: I think I was expecting more from this author
body: In this book there were no people with noble intentions.  I think you'd have to believe that people are inherently bad to have written like this.  The only "good guy" is someone who is dead.  It's not realistic and it's a big big downer.  I coud not wait to get through this book, constantly hoping for some goodness to shine through.  In the end...I just got to the end.  It was a complete waste of time.  No redeeming features.

author: AE
title: A waste of time
body: This is a terrible book. I bought it after hearing Ms Rowling's evening with Charlie Rose and found her charming, unpretentious and totally honest. The book has been a great disappointment, I suspect that had she tried to publish it before the Potter books and resulting fame The Casual Vacancy would not have been published. The language is appalling, the characters 'universally losers" and a total lack of a meaningful message. Don't waste your time or money!

author: Charles E.Hogan
title: You've got to be kidding!!!
body: Really? I don't care who the writer is, when every other word is the f-bomb and we turn horrid sexual encounters of rape and incest almost to the point of erotic, someone has a sick mind.  And a resolution ends with a drug overdose of a 16 year old after her 3 year old brother drowns because the teen sister was shagging in the bushes and left him unattended??!!!?????  Every sick and twisted event that parents dread their teens might get involved in is in this story so parent beware! Your teens that grew up reading Harry are going to want to read this. Don't go there.  She should have used a pen name, but then the book would have never sold

author: Sarah
title: I ended up liking it!
body: There are many things JK Rowling is good at but I think one of the best is how she writes teenagers. She did it well in Harry Potter and she's done it again here, though here the teenagers are a little less magical and a lot more realistic and sometimes dark.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Was just okay
body: It wasn't anything like I thought it would be. I have not read the Harry Potter books so I wasn't comparing this work with anything else the author had written. I didn't really find any redeeming qualities to the characters in the book. Nothing redemptive as far as I could tell.

author: Cindy Ratliff
title: J.K Rowling is a diverse as well as talented writer
body: As with her first endeavor, I wait anxiously for her next. Her whimsical humor and depth of understanding human nature shines through her writing; she never fails to entertain and move her readers.

author: Meg Cox
title: Now that she has got this off her chest....
body: .. Maybe the next non-Harry Potter novel will be good. I neither expected, nor wanted, the book to be just like her kid wizard series, but I found it a really difficult slog. I only pushed through to the end due to the strong critical reviews, and I only give it three stars out of respect to her intentions.

author: Robert Merrill
title: sucks
body: Its no Harry Potter... I was very disappointed. Not at all what I expected after reading all 7 Harry Potter books.

author: Linda Murray
title: Ok not interesting to keep my attention
body: Ok, not as good as the Potter series. I could not get into this book. I found it boring. I would not recommend it.

author: Clare albrey
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Well I didn't want to read this book but it was chosen by our Book Club.  It is an awful story but very well written and you do want to get to the end to find out what happens.

author: Kay
title: Started out slow and got better as I read.
body: I don't usually care that much for stories set in London, but this one did get to me after a few chapters. More of a charactor study than I would have thought.

author: geordie
title: This is no Harry Potter.................
body: ...........and thats a good thing! Totally different and depressing but a beautifully crafted novel about the inner workings of a small English village and the social and economic differences that lie within. Its not without its humour but don't read it expecting to be uplifted, its dark and gritty and nobody comes out of it smelling of roses.

author: Margaret L Dawson
title: Not my cup of tea
body: If I don't connect with a book within the first 50 pages, I usually abandon it. There are just too many books to be read without wasting time on one I don't like.  I stuck with this all the way through because of the author. Wish I'd quit after the first 50.

author: Connie
title: What a disappointment
body: I was really excited about reading JK Rowling's first novel for adults.  As a huge Harry Potter fan I was sure this book would live up to the standard set by that book series.  I was seriously disappointed.  "The Casual Vacancy" was unremittingly dark and depressing.  There was exactly one sympathetic character in the entire 500+ pages and she was killed off at the end.  Should I consider buying one of her books in the future I will buy a print copy so I can return it if it is of similarly poor quality.

author: Dr. Barb
title: Extremely immature writing.
body: Not a book for adults but a book with a childish theme written around adults. J.K. Rowling should stick to writing for children and young adults not the mature reader.

author: Monty
title: Disappointing
body: Over verbose and under-edited. Full of characters which were poorly explored and universally devoid of any empathetic character. However, a successful observational exercise of collective human failure.

author: Shari Luckhurst
title: It truly is vacant!!!
body: I am 2 thirds through and am struggling every day to get to the end. I normally plough through a good book, but have been trying to finish this for 6 weeks. It still isn't going anywhere. I am waiting for the crescendo, the interesting tidbit, that keeps me wondering and looking forward to reading the next chapter. It is deadly boring, banal and leaves me asking why I paid good money for it. I am forever hopeful that the climax is worth it. Perhaps, it will not get there. Maybe, I won't bother finishing it......that would be a first.

author: WOW Girl
title: What a disappointment
body: This worthless book only got one star because I had to give it one to submit the review.

author: blueann
title: It was so hard to get into
body: I found the Casual Vacancy very hard to get into from the start. It was just okay.  So many characters to remember.

author: Annette Loebach Bater
title: Variety of interesting characters and plots
body: I liked everything about it, including the non-Hollywoood ending.  Great writing, rich characters and interesting story.  A screenplay MUST be next!

author: Discerning Shopper
title: Bored to tears
body: Absolutely nothing to keep your attention.  I thought that I understood her writing style and was looking forward to a different venue, but, the storyline was boring and trivial.

author: Kathie
title: Don't waste your valuable time.
body: Disappointing.  Depressing. Disgusting.

author: bkamiens@lawrenceville.org
title: Book just ok
body: The book was just ok. It was hard to follow in the beginning with the introduction of so many characters, but the book did fall in nicely at the end.  I must say that I was  A little disappointed since the Potter books were so great.  I think J.K. needed an outlet to swear and introduce sex.

author: twinreader
title: Pleased
body: First off let me say that not too many people take their time to write about and get to understand how the less than perfect side of society think, feel, function and live.  This book is hard to get into.  The first hundred pages are bogged down with many characters and happenings that intertwine and make the story great in the end.  I found it difficult to put the book down after that though.  I thought Ms. Rowling did an excellent job portraying the many characters in her story.  The ending of this book is stomachable if you've read it before you begin, then you know what's coming.  You certainly feel invested in the town by the end, I'm just not sure Rowling wrapped the characters' individual stories as well as she could have.  I think she served what she thought as justice to their shortcomings and left it at that. I would have liked her to finish it better all around.

author: Shae L
title: Slow Beginning, Great Ending
body: This is a side of J.K. that was not seen in any of the Harry Potter books. If you are expecting wizards and trolls, or charms and curses, this is NOT the book for you. If you can manage to get past the first half (which starts off very slow), where the whole gang of characters and their relationships are introduced in minute detail, then you are in for a wild ride. Some of the darkest, cruelest, and most vulnerable sides of all people are put into full spotlight in this scandalous book. Page by page I found myself not only questioning the characters, but myself and my beliefs as well. What is done in the dark literally comes into the light throughout the story. And, if you give it even half the chance (and manage to cast anything to do with Harry Potter completeley out of your mind) then you will enjoy this as much as I did.

author: K. Ponce
title: Small Town with Big Problems
body: This group of humans with flaws, put together with their small town politics is so very real in a way which is frightening at times.  The characters' stories click together piece by piece, building to a clear need for some serious soul searching or certain catastrophe.  You can't stop in the middle of the book!

author: Kim Rizzi
title: Disappointing
body: I was so disappointed in this book, mainly becacause there is not one like able character. Rowling does not disappoint with her writing style.

author: Erica Bell
title: an almost perfect novel
body: I'm a little perplexed by the mixed reviews this book is receiving.  I was never a Harry Potter fan, although my children devoured the books (I found myself disturbed by his bratty messiah complex), and I opened this book with no real expectation of pleasure.

author: Stan
title: OK for me
body: I enjoyed the book. Being English I could relate to the characters and the local situatation. American readers might find it difficult.

author: Natalie
title: Well-written, great storyline.
body: Despite being a devoted fan of the Harry Potter series, I read this book without Potter and friends in mind. I knew this book was intended for adults and that it was supposed to be completely different than her previous books and I went into the story knowing this. That is my first suggestion for potential readers: don't expect Harry, this is a completely different book.

author: KaytiAnne
title: Oh, Jo!
body: When JK Rowling was on Charlie Rose, she said that the central theme of this novel was about who is worth saving, and what price the saving is worth. That is important to keep in mind as you are introduced to so many unlikable, and yet entirely realistic characters. Each of them needs to be saved from something, and each of them believes salvation lies down a different path. Discovering what lies at the end of each path is the joy and the heartbreak of this complex, emotional novel.

author: Duncan
title: A good, casual read
body: Inevitably, this was always going to get a huge level of interest from critics, and it would have had to have been outstanding to stand up to expectations.

author: jo merrill
title: great read
body: i never read harry potter - i loved this book . . . she is an excellent writer . . . i hope she does more along this story line . . .

author: BettyBoop
title: Love it
body: Good book by a Great author. Far from her Harry Potter seruies, It's nice to see something for us aduts,

author: Neil Henderson
title: Hard going
body: Not a particularly well written story - I'm finding it hard going compared to East of Eden by John Steinbeck.

author: endekleva
title: Wonderful Character Development, Intriguing Small Town Politics
body: I was so curious about this book, after being (obviously) a Harry Potter fan and reading the critics reviews and reviews on Amazon, I had to read it.  I had no expectations at all when I began the book, and certainly didn't expect any Harry Potter influences and I was rewarded with a great reading experience.  JK Rowling did an excellent job of developing her characters, drawing from their background and childhood experiences and revealing more and more about the characters as the plot developed.  The heart-wrenching scenes involving the Weedon household as well as the inner turmoil of all the characters were so well written you felt like you knew everyone personally.  The politics surrounding the 'casual vacancy' were very intriguing.  I couldn't stop reading this book and I completely disagree with the negative reviews about it.  I eagerly await the next installation of JK Rowling's fabulous career.

author: Rama Kocherlakota
title: A great novel - better than Harry Potter
body: I have been a fan of J.K. Rowling since I first picked up Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone but I've never enjoyed anything she's written as much as The Casual Vacancy.  It appears that being freed from the fetters of her imagined magical world has allowed her to show us a view of the real world, the one in which we all live, that is more vibrant and alive than anything Harry, Ron and Hermione could experience.

author: Melinda
title: If we forget about wanting Wizards and Magic, this is a fine story with lessons to teach.
body: Well written, interesting charters, insights and tragedy.  Not magic and mystery, but a Barabara Kingsolver type review of social issues from within a story.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Dark
body: If I had realized this book was so depressing, I never would have ordered it. I like to read books that improve my life, entertain, or a can't put this book down until I finish it even if it is 2:00 am.

author: Lisa  Connors
title: Couldn't finish it...
body: I really tried hard to continue with reading this book, but it just didn't grab me.  Thank goodness I read it on my kindle as I often had to use the dictionary to work out what she was on about. It felt like she was trying too hard to write an "adult" book, and used her thesaurus to through in grown up words. characters and plot did nothing for me - but I have to admit I didn't finish it and it may have gotten better.  I just couldn't force myself to go any further. Sorry. Still love J.K. Rowling.

author: Jacqueline Gum
title: Dismal
body: I can think of few books that I have disliked more. It's dreary and overly long filled with characters that are dismal and remain so until the very dismal end. I'm positively miffed to have spent money on the audio version for a long drive. This book made that drive twice as long. Would not recommend.

author: L. Polin
title: Meh
body: Okay, it's her first departure from the Potter series. I hope she keeps writing. This was good enough for the Kindle price but borrow it rather than buy it if you can.

author: Glenn S. Brauer
title: Nobody home
body: O.K. Count me as yet another reader who happened to enjoy the whole Harry Potter thing, but this one is a doozie of a bore. J.K. couldn't be more pedestrian now that she's decided to come down to the grim world most of us inhabit. Makes you wonder why she decided to become so darned dull.

author: SAS
title: Pass on this one...
body: I was really disappointed in this book. All the characters were so unhappy, and the book ended up in my unfinished pile. Loved the Harry Potter series and would definitely recommend it!

author: JC
title: Hated it, now love it.
body: I started off reading the negative reviews, because after finishing the book last night, I was left feeling sickened, sad, and angry.  So naturally, I thought I must not like this book.  With some time to mull it over, I am really starting to appreciate the truth of the story.  A peek behind the curtain is often hard to stomach, and JK Rowling nailed that feeling, and then some.  American audiences are used to a happy ending and lots of comeuppance.  You will find none of that here.  Almost all of the characters are despicable, petty, judgmental, and cruel, yet there is good reason for their behavior.  Pagford is anytown anywhere, and Rowling has deftly unmasked what lurks silently in the hearts of human beings.

author: S. Beck
title: I'll Say No More about A CASUAL VACANCY
body: I found this to be a complete bore.  Rowling's writing was brilliant throughout the Harry Potter Phenomenom but this - this was an absolute waste of my money.  I didn't expect the wizardry of Hogwarts nor did I expect Harry to make a cameo but I did expect writing that took me into another interesting world created by JKR - NOT SO.  I was taught that if I had nothing good to say, say nothing at all.  This review will end now before I go off on my REAL thoughts about A Casual Vacancy.

author: Amazon Customer
title: brutal
body: one amazon reviewer questioned what had happened to Ms Rowling to make her hate humanity and write about characters who have no redemptive qualities.

author: Boyko Ovcharov
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: JK Rowling's style and narrative skills are really enjoyable. This is a definite and dramatic shift from her usual target audience, i.e. children; which is really brave and worthy of praise. I know good things come at a price, however, some price reductions or promotions would be warmly welcome. At the end of the day, I acknowledge it is a matter of marketing and PR.

author: Mon Dobrin
title: Casual Vacancy
body: I'm not sure what I was expecting when I picked up this book but I did find that she relies too much on two very strong themes that she focused on heavily in the later Harry Potter books. It is possible to write a good, moving story that isn't focused on death and teen angst, however she leans very heavily on these devices. The messages about the world we see and the lives that are actually behind them are strong, which is why I'm plowing through to the end, but it drags. It almost feels like she is trying to beat us over the head with the grit of life and death.

author: Tinny
title: Great read, sad subject matter.
body: Having a toddler myself I found this book tugged at my heart strings.  I did enjoy the book thoroughly however it left me feeling rather sad and I needed to read something upbeat to cheer myself up.

author: George Mitchell
title: Unremarkable, but certainly not terrible
body: This is not so much bad as just not great.  JK Rowling shows off her strengths -- particularly being able to get inside the head of middle-aged wives and adolescent boys with stunning authenticity -- but the weakness here is the lack of any real compelling storyline.  In some ways, that is the most disappointing part of this book because that was exactly what she did so well with Harry Potter.  It is also dark to the point of being the anti-Potter.  Rowling sought to write an adult novel and she ended up taking tragedy to an extreme her fans were probably not expecting.  Worth a read, but don't expect a masterpiece.

author: jeanette scheetz
title: Good
body: Found it interesting was eager to read her new style away from Harry Potter - was impressed and a good read

author: Karen A. Wyle
title: Jane Austen redux
body: Coming from Rowling's Harry Potter series to her first book for adults, I had not anticipated how much it would remind me of the novels of Jane Austen.  Austen famously worked with a small canvas, focusing on the foibles and concerns of residents of small and insular communities. Rowling does the same. If one imagines Austen transplanted to the present, freed from any pressure to adhere to romantic conventions, and urged to give reign to all her darker and more cynical impulses, we might have something like this novel.

author: Elizabeth A. Garvin
title: Completely different and yet distinctively Rowling
body: Rowling is a compelling storyteller, and though this setting is far from the magical world of Harry Potter, it is another hard-to-put-down book. Approach it with an open mind, and you will find a well-written, well-told contemporary novel.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Riveting in its realism
body: This book is the antithesis of fantasy. It should be read separate and apart from Harry Potter. There simply is no vestige of Harry Potter in this book.

author: George C. King
title: Rowling rocks!
body: I'm not a fan of Harry Potter, but I'm now a fan of J.K. Rowling's The Casual Vacancy. I read the book compulsively on my Kindle, and my interest never lagged. The town of Pagford, England, is peopled by Rowling with a wide-ranging assortment of characters, whose thoughts propel the story. I'm reminded of John Updike and early Stephen King (before verbosity took over), who are unsurpassed at getting inside their characters' heads. Some who didn't like this novel have complained that the characters were unlikable, that they had no redeeming qualities. I would ask these critics about the innermost thoughts of their own friends and neighbors, and even themselves. If we knew what everyone was really thinking, would we find them likable? Would we want others to know our own innermost thoughts? A writer does not operate under these constraints and is under no obligation make her characters user friendly. Rowling's characters wish ill of others, swear, have sex, smoke and drink, abuse those close to them, and even take drugs. In other words, they are real people.

author: lejan
title: Good read
body: Very small townish - not sure we have towns quite like this in Australia. I had to keep going back to check on the characcters.

author: B. Rice
title: It was okay
body: I think her characterizations are very good, but the plot is lacking. I could get a good take on the characters, but she didn't make me care about them.

author: Kamijear
title: Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling
body: "Casual Vacancy"

author: Kathy Moore
title: big disappointment
body: I honestly thought that anything that J.K. Rowling wrote would have to be great, after the Harry Potter series.  Boy, was I wrong!  I would love to have my money refunded for this book.  I kept waiting for the good stuff.  It never happened.  All I got was a headache.  This is like the longest, most disappointing bad soap opera ever!  What a waste of talent to put this kind of trash into a novel.  I'll probably never read another of her books.

author: Lea
title: Better than people give it credit
body: I actually really liked Casual Vacancy, though I can see why others don't. Yes, it does have some sexual content and swear words, but I feel like those aren't too important when considering the book as a whole. I think the main difference between this book and the Harry Potter books (if you were to compare them) is that the HP books were more for entertainment... Casual Vacancy has a larger, more significant message - or two. I wouldn't recommend it as an entertaining read though. Find something else if you're in that mood.

author: Tony
title: A mirror on our divided society
body: An extraordinary novel showing the true genius of J K Rowling. A courageous attempt to depict the damaging effect of the deep seated divisions that still exist in British society. Even more remarkable that it should have been written by the most successful and richest British author.

author: Suzanne G. White
title: very dark .
body: If you're feeling too good- buy this book. The characters are universally unhappy and many are down right mean. Oh, for some prozac for this cast.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Disappointing
body: I found this book bland, slow and not very interesting. While JK is brilliant at describing different characters, the plot around them was just disappointing. Expected more :(

author: John B. Scofield, M.D.
title: Mrs Rowling's story is too causual and too vacant
body: This is a poorly constructed story.  Too many poorly developed characters move slowly thru petty, boring lives.  JK is trying too hard to escape her children's book writer  identity. Her title choice I think was an unconscious book review.

author: vetterun
title: New genre;  but the same excellence and beauty of prose
body: Thoroughly enjoyed the book.  She builds several parallel story lines that intertwine throughout the book and evenually come together at the climax.  Well written and pleasurable to read.  As always her prose paints vivid mental  images.  Good story even though its based on the mundane lives and happenings of several residents of a small, non-descript village without any "super-stars".

author: E
title: Rowling is so much more than just Harry Potter
body: I am of the "Harry Potter" generation. I grew up eagerly awaiting book after book. I was never disappointed and Rowling certainly has not let me down now. The Casual Vacancy is not the next HP. Don't read it looking for magical creatures or for a new brand of He Who Must Not Be Named. Instead, read it to enjoy Rowling's superb story telling skills and to appreciate the intricacies of her well considered plot. If you consider yourself a fan of fine modern literature, then The Casual Vacancy is sure to please.

author: R. Bhakta
title: worth the read
body: Put aside any thoughts on Harry Potter. she still has the attention to detail on characters. very good book but takes awhile to build all the characters and then it is over.

author: Erica Bonomi
title: Bland soap opera
body: I really found this book to be a bland, tawdry look into British suburbia.  It reminded me of Days of Our Lives (British style), but much lower class....  I really couldn't get into it at all.  If you were expecting mystery, magic, or even characters you could love...... You'll be disappointed.

author: Dance the Night Away
title: Good adult drama.  So what if it's not HP?
body: This is a good drama story set in a provincial burg in the UK.  It's probably a four star book but I gave it five to offset the critics that didn't read it and rated it low or commented that it wasn't HP/Fantasy/Children's book or were expecting something else and were therefore disappointed.  Love JK's style and the Kindle version was well edited.  JK enjoys writing with a large cast of characters and it was nice to have the Kindle version to so I could keep up with the characters.  I bought this for my Christmas Book Club book exchange.

author: dover beach
title: Manage your expectations!
body: This isn't Harry Potter. Your heart won't soar while reading this, ever.

author: Curious but Cautious
title: J K Rowlings Latest
body: I was curious to see if Rowling's writing style would carry over into a more adult content.  I was happy to see that, although it doesn't "sweep you up" in quite the same way as the Potter series did, it still captures  and holds your attention and makes you want to know more about this widely divergent cast of characters. ( I see sequels a'coming!)

author: Patricia Sauerburger
title: NOT Harry Potter
body: I found this book to be a really long and tedious read riddled with minutia.

author: jenn
title: Not done Yet
body: Loving every word of this book! I can't read fast enough! I have never met more despicable characters with such everyday dark secrets... To make matters worse, every characters flaw is undeniably human nature.... you can't help but see yourself in some of their thoughts and rooting for the downfall of each one anyway

author: Kindle Customer
title: Sometimes, Different Is Good!
body: Okay, so...okay.

author: Sharon Dean
title: Sophmoric interlude.
body: I went through some of the reviews for this widely anticipated book. JK Rowling, the totally famous author of the Harry Potter books, I even excepted something different because she had not previously been an author writing "adult" books.

author: Catty
title: Potential classic
body: I was so psyched to read this book that I paid the exorbitant asking price.  Then I began reading and I found it a slow starter.  Usually, this would be death to a book for me, but I plowed on.  I wasn't going to give up on such a talented writer and I'm glad I didn't.  The book is about the ripple effects the death of one man has on a small town, and it was very interesting.  Rowling's talent is evident in bringing the lives of many characters into one story showing how the lives intersect and influence each other.  This is a very European story.  Americans like bright, light, entertaining stories, but Europeans...not so much.  They usually prefer movies and books that are more realistic, and The Casual Vacancy fit the order.  Even though I started out reading as an American, I adapted and really enjoyed the downhill half of the book.  It's worth reading.

author: Frank McGowan
title: Small - like Hell itself
body: I have often struggled to describe my view of heaven, but when it comes to depicting hell, read The Casual Vacancy.

author: Vicki Appleby
title: Casual vacancy
body: It arrived very fast, and is in great shape. It's a gift for Xmas, I'm sure they'll love it!

author: Amazon Customer
title: slow and boring
body: i have only read 30% of the book and I don't like it. there a lot of characters and I am having hard time keeping them straight. I am also not crazy about the story. I will keep reading the book because I like to finish books I started. If my opinion changes i will edit my view.

author: Crystal @ I Totally Paused!
title: A lovely piece of literature from a well known author
body: Like many other readers, I was delighted to hear awhile back that JK Rowling had an adult novel for us...adult like it was written for adults, not that it was going to be some erotic romance or anything like that.  I preordered a copy the day it became available, and lamented the fact that I couldn't pick it up as soon as it arrived, since I was traveling overseas at the time.  Meanwhile, as reviews started popping up around the internet, I was disappointed to read that people seem to have quite mixed opinions about this novel.

author: bookologist
title: the Casual Vacancy
body: Rowlings educates readers about a London they may not know exists. The adolescents are dark and needy like their adult counterparts. Vengeance proves futile and sad. The broken are never fixed, but the survivors are stronger and more compassionate as a result of their travails.  A fast-paced and engaging book.

author: Gary Severance
title: Social Vortex
body: J. K. Rowling's novel, The Casual Vacancy, is a very good British village story that captures the atmosphere of a setting US readers may never experience directly. There is a long history of novelists writing in this tradition, one that comes to mind immediately is Simon Brett whose novels involve local mystery stories. I enjoy this style because of the detailed descriptions of the characters and their interactions. A key to this type of fiction is the sharply drawn images of individual emotions of the characters. The presentation of the emotional reactions of the characters is precise, and it is clear to the reader exactly what the characters are going through. This is very difficult to do, and Rowling writes with insight demonstrating a mastery of the technique.

author: james d. thomas
title: Promising Debut Novel
body: Try to think of this is a "first novel," instead of the new book by Rowling, and you just might be impressed.  Ultimately it is too maudlin for my taste, and might have been better with some level of "hook" to the plot (a mystery, for example) but Rowling proves herself a master of small detail and the hypocrisy of small-town life.  None of the characters are especially likable, but then that is the point.  I found myself more impressed in retrospect than while I was reading it.  So although it is not totally successful there is more than enough good writing to make me look forward to her next book.  In spite of some of Ms Rowling interview comments, by the way, it sure as hell isn't Dickens.

author: Jay Ocean
title: Engaging, good read
body: I have to write a review because this book is getting a bad rap and I hated Kakutani's review in the NY Times (read after I finished the book).

author: ball1ball2
title: Half way through
body: I am half way through and I hope it picks up for a faster read. I will let you know later.

author: Victor Martin
title: Aa
body: jKRowling should stick to the Harry Potter style of writing. This was slow and I did not see the point of the story line

author: harleys girl
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: The book was ok, but it was to wordy and at times it lost my interest prefered the Harry Potter series

author: raesdays
title: R-E-S-P-E-C-T
body: I finished this book with a glass of wine and a box of tissues. My tears fell for the characters in the book, and their injustices, their pain, and the knowledge that real-life people are going through the same, and worse.

author: Jim South
title: Disappointing
body: The language while generally true to the characters being portrayed really got a bit much.. to many *!#@# words.

author: Bearwife
title: Surprising and well done
body: I loved Rowling's Harry Potter books.  This very grown up novel shares the ability to introduce a sizeable cast of characters and make them distinct, to tell a complex story, and to plot tightly, with every thread tied in the end.  But it is a book for grown ups, with an adult understanding that there are no wholly good or bad people, that little matters loom large for those who are directly affected, and that terrible consequences flow from indifference.  A very good book.

author: Christine
title: Exceeded my expectations
body: Well written, interesting characters, very insightful. That there was no main character didn't bother me at all. I didn't want it to end!

author: Bob Flisser
title: Disappointing. Bored me to tears.
body: Perhaps J.K. Rowling wanted to write a modern-day Dickens novel. It had a large cast of characters, some trying to maintain firm control, and others destitute and adrift. Unfortunately, what she wrote was the most tedious and boring sections of my small-town newspaper that I usually skip over.

author: MF
title: OMG!
body: IT IS NOT HARRY POTTER! IT WAS NEVER MEANT TO BE ONE, so don't assume that just because it was written by the same author, you'll like it.

author: december
title: Love the Honesty
body: There are two camps when it comes to The Casual Vacancy. The first camp finds the book slow and very dull. These people might be the ones that are angry that this book isn't related to the world of Harry Potter. The second camp love the book and find it fascinating. These might be the people that will read anything that J.K. Rowling writes just because she's J.K. Rowling.

author: S. Al-Amri
title: Readable but just barely
body: I loved the Harry Potter books, some more than others but read them all.  So I was expecting the same level of page turning with this.  I was disappointed.

author: Kim S
title: not sure if I can go on..
body: Loved Rowling's Harry Potter Series.  Not sure I can continue on with this one.  Trying to.. not sure what the plot is - all over the place.  The Middle School age sexual bits are too frequent.  Assume all the intertwined various stories will all make some sense in the end... hoping.

author: C. R. Beresford
title: Disappointing
body: Reads like an aga saga.  Disjointed story and far too many tedious and similar characters, none of whom I care about.

author: roger c goupil
title: Boring!
body: Could not get into this cause I kept falling asleep. Author was too wordy with descriptions of the various scenes.

author: Reader_SLC
title: Gave up 15 pages in
body: Perhaps I should have done more research before picking up this book, but after 10 vulgar words in the first 15 pages, I decided this book is not for me. The F bomb and even the C word...really, really not for me.

author: tarbaby
title: PHEW!!!! Thought it stunk to high heaven!
body: Not one character to like even a tiny bit..they were all nasty, selfserving !

author: Lucy VanPelt
title: more derailment than departure
body: Ok, I loved the Harry Potter series. Every word in those books had a reason and purpose. That being said, this book has more words than it needs and I found the frequent use of the "f word" gratuitous and grating. There are too many characters circling around each other and it takes way too long for the story to gel. It meanders along for hundreds of pages. I found most of the characters vapid and predictable. The ending is inevitable and essentially it all comes down to everyone spending too; much time minding everyone else's business and ignoring those closest to them.  I was disappointed to say the least and I doubt I will read any other of her adult novels. If J K would like to explore the characters she left behind in the HP series I could be persuaded to give her another try. Until then, I would rather reread Harry.

author: Mr Fie
title: This is like The Road but with people instead of ashes
body: I experienced similar (and strong) emotions to The Road by Cormac McCarthy. That's because it is relentlessly bleak, yet somehow uplifting. I don't know how she did that, but I'm glad she did.

author: D. Michael Strain
title: Casual Vacancy
body: After reading all of the Harry Potter novels, I was very disappointed in The Casual Vacancy. The plot was weak, and the ending was very predictable.

author: mom of three
title: loved this book
body: Def not a Harry Potter book. I loved Rowlings writing style as well as the story in Harry potter. This book as her same unique way of describing the setting and characters so well that you can really envision them. But the story is dark, the characters flawed and sad. I did wish there was one character that I could root for but you dont really 'love' any of them. That said, I couldn't put the book down, waiting to find out what horrible thing would happen due to the awfulness of the characters! Def worth the read.

author: goldengal330
title: Modern Day Les Mis
body: There is no doubt about it: JK Rowling remains an expert at her craft.  That being said, this is one of the most difficult books I have ever tried to read.  There are many characters with intersecting plot lines, and most of them are unhappy.  I continued to read hoping for a triumphant ending, but mostly what I found was more misery.  That being said, I found her overarching message of social responsibility very powerful, and one that will hopefully inspire others to look past outward images, and understand how others have been shaped by their environments.

author: Momustang
title: Momustang
body: I have never been a fan of the Harry Potter series but I considered  J.K.Rowlings to be an excellent writer. Just the subject matter was not for me.

author: klsantini
title: Brilliant characters, really captured 'small town' mentality
body: Huge JK Rowling fan, have read and reread all of the HP books.  I knew this was going to be different and loved it for being so different!

author: LiniAyre536
title: A tad bleak, but worth the read.
body: With the sudden death of Barry Fairbrother, the Parish Council of Pagford is thrown into turmoil. His unexpected passing frees up a position and this vacancy is very much a coveted one.

author: readsgoodbooks
title: Casual Vacancy
body: Obscene language does NOT improve a book.  Graphic language not necessary.

author: Camilla S. Feliciano
title: NOT worth the price of the book
body: Like others I wanted to read this book by this author.  What I got was disappointment. I would not recommend anyone spending their money nor their time on this one.  It took me almost the whole book before I thought it was getting interesting, but it let me down.  I finished it only because I had invested my time and wanted to see how it ended....well that was a disappointment too. Ms Rowling can do better....we know this....but her venture outside of Harry Potter was a let down.  I wanted this to be good, but it just wasn't.

author: ginger2008petlover
title: Reading
body: JK Rowling brings her writing talent to contemparyt fiction, book is ver well written for contempary fiction. iIf you remeber her teaser, "no sequel and no movie, read it and you will know why."

author: MaggieT
title: I really wanted to like this book-- FINALLY!!!
body: I commute quite a distance, so often listen to books on cd.

author: Chach
title: disappointed
body: I was very disappointed in this book, kept thinking it would get better but it did not.kept kicking myself for paying 14.95 for it.

author: Barbara Noronha
title: Depressing book
