body: I was disappointed, it jumped around from character to character with no real pattern. Perhaps I was expecting too much from her earlier works.

author: Rob
title: Interesting but a bit Lackluster
body: I had hoped that Rowling would Wow me as she did with the Harry Potter series.  Unfotunately, though it was an interesting story, it came across as a bit lackluster.  The ending just stopped as if she was just tired of writing this story.

author: ka
title: Slow and boring
body: Yawn!! I knew the book was going to be very different from the Harry Potter series. JK Rowlings writing  style has flowed in the past. Unfortunately in The Casual Vacancy too many characters, too many nicknames. Plot line drags on!! Don't think I will finish reading the book - which rarely has happened.

author: bible student
title: Book in search of a reason
body: I was quite disappointed in JK Rowlings "adult" book.  It seems her only ideas of what makes a book "adult" literature is to frequently use "adult" (crass, needless profanity) words at any opportunity and making sure every character is an unlikable, deeply flawed person. This was a book that didn't hold my interest and was hard to finish.  There was no plot to hold the reader's interest which is so unlike her prior writing.  Nothing moved this story along and I felt I was was just plowing through it.  It was both simply bad and boring, a sad combination.  Reading should be for pleasure or entertainement and this was neither for me.  Now I don't know what to do with the book; it's not worth saving and I don't want to inflict reading it on others.  This was a very disappointing book from an author with much more talent then she showed here.  Was she just trying to "stretch" herself into something she isn't?

author: KateTall
title: I had to force myself to finish this book
body: I'm probably only one of two living human beings who has not read the HP series, so I have no preconceived notions about this author.  Having said that, I must say that I was very disappointed in the character development, style, and substance of this novel. I found myself neither liking nor caring about any of the characters, and my desire to finish this book was really impacted by this. I agree with another reviewer that the author seems to have thrown every imaginable social issue into this book - politics, domestic violence/abuse/neglect, drug usage,alcoholism, socioeconomic issues, teen angst - you name it, it's in there!  I did finish the book because I always do, and palmed it off to my niece with a very clear warning about how much I hated it.  I will be anxious to hear her opinion, since she's a JKR fan.

author: Martha Miller
title: Couldn't finish it...
body: Sorry, I tried to enjoy this book.  I started out with interest in how she would do in a different style of book, but I quickly started making comparisons to other authors, and this book came up lacking.  The further I got into the book the less interested I became in the characters, and the less interested I was in reading this book.  When I realized I was intentionally avoiding picking this up to continue reading it, I gave up.

author: NoNameNecessary
title: Casual Vacancy
body: Not only is the book grim and depressing - it's only point seems to be that there is ugliness in life and, oh yeah, that Rowling knows how to curse and be coarse.  Save your money

author: WRBill
title: A very different JKR
body: It goes without saying that this is a very different world from that of Harry Potter.  I would never have known it was by the same author.  But it is still very well written, and very shrewd in observation of adolescent thinking and relations of adolescents and adults.  The world is that of urban poverty, crime, and class politics - "hard boiled" it would have been called in the US 1940's.  Harry fans be warned!

author: Joanne
title: Not what one expects from J K Rowling
body: This is difficult. On the one hand I assumed that her adult book would be as fantastically addictive as Harry Potter: on the other, she still writes well. However, the story deals with too many unlikeable characters so it was not easy to root for any of them.  They were all flawed in some way, and I kept hoping that one of them would somehow be redeemed!  Small town rivalries and teenage angst, unrequited love, and all of them undeserving of sympathy.  A tiny bit of Rowling humour crept in, and certainly not bad, but mostly it was a difficult book.  I hope she goes back to what she does best.  I do think that fans need to read this though.

author: MikeB
title: Ponderous and pedantic
body: I bought this anticipating the same intensity and creativity that came from Harry Potter. Silly me, this is boring and heavy. If you aren't British, many things don't make sense. If it hadn't been Rowling, I would stopped after the first 50 pages or so. My advice to JKR?.. Stick to magic.

author: Pam Wiedenbeck
title: The Casual Vacancy - a perception
body: I expected more from this novel than I received. This is an attempt at very relevant social commentary on small town and rural England. As such, I think it fails to give the non-British reader a good grounding in the background of rural politics before launching into the social commentary.

author: usuk.bilingual
title: Very engaging
body: I'm about two-thirds of the way through this book and after a confusing start -- there are so many characters to keep track off -- I'm having a problem putting it down! I grew up in England and am familiar with many of the very English expressions and words; "people carrier" for example which, in the US is a minivan. The personalities are very lifelike and help you understand how everyone has a story they keep hidden from everyone else. A good read!

author: Diane Pollard
title: Why would we want to know these people?
body: Other reviewers have expressed my feelings more humorously and succinctly than I have the time or interest to do right now. Finally slogged to the end last night and totally missed whatever redemption there was. I'm not looking for frilly and frothy, but don't relish picking up rocks to look at the slimy mess underneath. I just led a book club discussion of Gillian Flynn's Gone Girl and loved the sick intricacies of Nick and Amy's relationship. Yes, we all have ugly thoughts and motivations and it's horrifying to see where they can lead.

author: prettywoman17
title: Stick to childrens books!
body: I am having a great deal of trouble reading this book. Maybe my expectations were too high because I loved the Harry Potter books. JK should stick with what she does best and that is childrens books!  I'm not sure I can even get halfway through this dull, boring book but I will try since I was dumb enough to buy it the day it came out.

author: Scott
title: Not impressed
body: This is not anywhere near the quality of the HP writing Rowling has done.

author: kcr
title: Characterization.. characterization.. characterization..
body: First, I'm not all the way through "The Casual Vacancy" but I feel as though I can make a well-informed honest review at this point. Here's my advice: Do NOT go into this book expecting 1) A CHILDREN'S story; 2) Feel good, Dumbledore & Harry Save the Day stories; 3) Harry Potter. This is Rowlings first attempt at writing for ADULTS and she did a phenomenal job. Why did people love HP so much? The original storyline? No. We've all heard/read stories of good vs. evil our entire lives... no originality there.. It was her characterization and the connections she made within those characters. It's the familiarity of those characters that made you fall in love. Every single book-nerdy girl felt like Hermione at times or awkward boy felt like Neville... we related to the characters, not the story. And "Vacancy" does not fail in that aspect. Am I loving the storyline? Not entirely, but I knew I wouldn't by reading the synopsis... it's just not my "style" of story but she's sucking me in anyway. She makes me love and hate those characters because I KNOW them.. they exist in my neighborhood, just like they exist in yours. She really brings the story to life IF you can put down your magic wand and use your grown-up brain. And yes, she uses the big four letter "c" word most famously used in "Atonement". Get over it. It's an adult novel.. there's bound to be some language & I'm sure your teenage son as thought/said it at least once.

author: Janine Rafferty
title: It's no Harry Potter.
body: Having loved the Harry Potter series so much, I was somewhat disappointed in the book. For the first third of my reading, I'd pick up the book after a 2 or 3 day interval and have to figure out who all of the many, many characters were. By the end, the story pretty much came together, with many enjoyable parts, but I would not want to struggle with such a confusing cast of characters again. Also, since I am reading for pleasure I would enjoy more likable people.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Truth or dare
body: It's as if someone dared J.K Rowling to write a book about the most mundane topic and still make it entertaining and engaging.  Unfortunately, as talented as she is, she did not quite pull this off.  The premise of this books was very boring and the characters were dull and egocentric.  She spent far too much time developing the multipe characters in this book.  If this is the first book in a series, this could make sense, but again, I would not want to read it.  Perhaps I expected too much of her considering the magical world she created in Harry Potter.  However, I think she could have done much better with an adult book, even one not set in fantasy.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Rowling
body: Although by the time thatI finished this book I could say that I enjoyed it.  It took a long time to grab my attention.  It was not a book I could not put down.

author: nwcustomer
title: A book about humans and life itself
body: J.K. Rowling's The Casual Vacancy to me was about everyday life and what humans go through.  It was very well written and I totally bought into the town and the characters.  There was no fantasy in this book.  You could go into almost any town in the world and come away with these raw human emotions.  I liked how she reminded all of us that people are not always what them seem.  People turn out the way they are due to their youth circumstances and whether or not they are surrounded by loved ones or people who really care what happens to them in this world. It's also about how small minded people can be when their egos get in the way. I definitely suggest reading this novel.  I think that we all were "curious" of what Ms. Rowling would come up with after the huge success of Harry Porter, but I find it absolutely ridiculous that this book and the HP series be compared.  That would be like comparing apples and oranges.  Looking forward to her next book!

author: James Harrington
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Rowling is terrific in her debut adult novel.  A little like an English Peyton Place with more sophistication.  Her characters come alive and are real when we consider the dark part of our own hearts.

author: Charles E. Jeffries
title: Disappointing Work
body: Like most who read and were absorbed in the Harry Potter series, I had high hopes for Rowling's first "adult" novel. Unfortunately, she did not deliver.  I found "Casual Vacancy" very slow going, the character relationships muddled, the plot mind-numbingly heavy and slow, the language often offensive, and overall, the tone of the book was just plain depressing.  Not recommended.  Wish I had my money back.

author: grandma
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: This book took time to get into and felt like a long read.  It seemed hard to connect with and I had to make myself keep reading.  Predicted alot that was going to happen.

author: D. Eko
title: Okay
body: I was so looking forward to this book.  Unfortunately, I found it boring and never finished.  I am sure some readers will love it as there are different tastes in reading material.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Dull & Tedious.
body: Tedious diatribe promoting class warfare.  She should stick to fantasy. This is not up to her usual standards.  Hope she will learn from this and do what she does best.take us into another magical world.

author: blackjack47
title: winner of most boring
body: She should have stayed with Harry Potter. I can put this book down for a week and not miss it.  Boring!!!!!!!!!!!

author: Carole from Saline
title: Not worth reading
body: I had to struggle to get through this book.  Although the social message was clear, the book as fiction was boring and poorly written.

author: Laura N. Venhaus
title: We're not in Hogwarts anymore...
body: If you're expecting a Harry Potter for adults and will be satisfied with nothing less, don't buy this book.  The Casual Vacancy is a well written novel populated by depressed, angry, trapped, betrayed and disappointed characters and it offers a startling glimpse into life in England that is rarely seen by starry-eyed anglophiles. The language is definitely "adult" as are the situations Rowling describes.  This book covers sexual abuse, petty crime, methadone clinics and all stops in between. It is not a cheerful book, it is not a happy book, but it is an intriguing book and it makes me anxious to see where Rowling will go next.

author: rwm
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I have read all the HP series, several times, seen the movies several times. I looked forward to JK trying something different but I find the book very tedious and boring - I have had it for nearly two weeks and haven't even made it to page 100 and probably won't. If it were a library book, I would return it. I will try to slog through it but I don't think I will change my opinion. If she wants to write mysteries, try in the vain of Nancy Drew or the Hardy Boys, she writes about kids very well.

author: 2thklnr
title: Big Disappointment
body: The author should have stuck with the style of writing she did with Harry Potter. The book seems to go nowhere for several chapters and even then you want to say what was the point.

author: Nancy
title: Awesome!
body: This story captures your interest from the get go! It starts with an unexpected death and dives right into the lives & people surrounding this death in a little village in England. I can't put it down!!!

author: DebG
title: The casual Vacancy
body: I was extremely disappointed in this book.  The language was very offensive.  I wouldn't recommend itto anyone.  I expected more from her and was looking forward to her new book with great anticipation

author: Robert L Casanova
title: Yawn
body: As much as I wanted to love this book, I just could not find anything to like about it. It was boring.

author: Allium
title: More magic from JKR
body: Despite the grim subject matter, JKR manages to weave her magic yet again, with an engrossing story set in "small-town" UK. Jo has great insight into human nature and uses her astute observations to create disturbingly authentic characters. Despite disliking most of the villagers of Pagford and the Fields,I was still compelled by their stories. I am an incorrigible optimist, so despite the tragic ending of the novel, I felt encouraged that at least some of these fictional interpersonal relationships were redeemed. I look forward to more adult novels from this discerning writer.

author: Emma Parker
title: I tried hard to like it... but I failed
body: I, like any other reviewers here, LOVED the HP series. The writing itself was fine - nothing spectacular, but it was the story, the fabulous story, that drew us all in. I was very excited to read her first novel for adults. Sadly, I feel as if I am still waiting for it... and I've read The Casual Vacancy. It was obvious to me from about page 2 that I wasn't going to be thrilled by it. I quickly began to recognize sentence structures lifted straight out of HP, the language level felt 'dumbed down', and twists in the plot are dealt with in a very similar way as in HP. Admittedly I am an editor, but I wasn't looking for these things. I was actively trying NOT to see them because I loved HP so much... but they just leapt off the page and slapped me in the face. And unfortunately, unlike with HP, the storyline didn't make up for the poor writing techniques.

author: Dave Morrin
title: Casual vacancy
body: I would recommend others to purchase to read. The picturesque village of Pagford is not what it seems. When a vacancy comes up on the parish council the layers start to unravel.

author: Garry
title: Disappointing work from a truly gifted story teller
body: Let me admit 2 things.  First off, I wanted to read this book because of its author (I love her command of language and imagery, as well as her understanding of and ability to create people/characters).  Secondly, I did not finish the book (or even come close).

author: P. G. Thornell
title: An excellent but challenging book
body: Rowling can certainly write, and I think this is a great though sobering story. The only difficulty is that there really aren't any redeeming characters here. It's quite a cynical world view coming from someone who wrote so exceptionally about good versus evil in the HP series. The second half moves much faster than the first, and though I still think there were a few too many characters overall, she pulled everything together by the end. Now I just have to wait for her next book.

author: R PRIUS
title: Strangers In A Familiar Place
body: Forget Harry Potter. J.K. Rowling has already proven herself to be an excellent writer. She is descriptive and thoughtful when parsing her words, but I just didn't love this book. For me, The Casual Vacancy is a lackluster book that is for adults and plays to a very different audience. It deals with a ton of adult issues that are cringe worthy as it traverses life in a small english town and the often perverse characters who live there. It has profanity which is a good sign that this is for oldsters or the over 18 crowd.. This book suffers from a melodramatic and soapy plots that have a predictable endings. The characters are often unlikeable and even despicable. Suffice to say that I didn't really care much for the characters who were as nasty as the subject matter.

author: Mockingjay
title: Casual Vacancy
body: Very disappointed!  I knew it was supposed to be somewhat "dark", but  it  is totally depressing.  I guess I really liked her writing style in her original series and this is so different and not anything I would recommend to people in my reading circle.  Sorry Ms. Rowling.

author: Jane Kreuter
title: A Casual Vacancy
body: I found this book to be disjointed and hard to follow and the contents depressing.  I kept waiting for the story to come together and become more cohesive but it never happened.  The storylines of the characters were too long as the book switched back and forth to the characters.  I was disappoointed.

author: Constance E. Mollo
title: Casual Vacancy review
body: At first; I did not like the story; however, I found the author engaging and the more I read the more I became hooked on pursuing the story.  I gave it a 4 because the writng was excellent however not necessarily my usual type of novel.

author: Writepaul
title: A Ripping Good Read!
body: Ms. Rowling's previous well known output had no bearing at all on the pleasures to be found in The Casual Vacancy.  I found The Casual Vacancy to be a psychological page turner.  I couldn't wait for each additional detail to be revealed about her score or so of richly drawn, credible and complex characters.  Her portrait of adolescent turmoil and miscalculation is every bit as astute and compelling as her portrait of a decades on marriage.  I preordered the book out of curiosity and was richly rewarded. Knowledge only makes me a fan.

author: Penelson
title: Casual Vacacy
body: Struggled through it.  Ms. Rowling built a large cast of disfunctional characters in her little township.  The ending made you wonder why you even cared what happens to them.

author: Avid reader
title: Cannot believe how awful this book is!!
body: Having waited patiently for this wonderful author's next undertaking I am utterly disappointed. I have struggled through about 40% of this book and I am still wondering what the point of the whole thing is. It is the MOST BORING piece of fiction I have ever read. Don't think I can even finish it!

author: Cheryl Keeler
title: It was a good read.
body: Not what i expected. hard to follow at first with all the characters.   better once the story gets going forward

author: Haircuts
title: Dark and dreary!
body: I don't even know where to start..... so I'll make this short and not so sweet. NOT a very good book. JKR spent too much time describing the characters. I kept waiting for something to happen to get me interested but it didn't, until the very end. Don't waste your time unless you have absolutely nothing else to do!!!

author: Sarah
title: No magic of any kind in this book, I wouldn't recommend it.
body: This is a grim story about the lives of people that hold little or no interest to anyone.  The book needed magic, not the magic in the Harry Potter series, but the magic that brings a story into the hearts of it's readers.  This books is about the pettiness of people, the useless efforts of others fill the space left by the death of a irreplaceable person, and the shameful way this person is remembered in the lives of the heartless people in his community.  What a waste of time to read, and a waste of talent of the writer.

author: J. M. Stewart Lechler
title: Casual Vacancy
body: J K Rowling is amazing! Her ability to intertwine the lives of a community, the haves and have nots, yet show no judgement on either side was just brilliant.

author: CS in Clifton
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I admit it.  I didn't finish the book. And I generally finish all the books I read. I will try at some point ... probably during the summer ... to wade through this book. Part of the problem is the disappointment that this book does not live up to the storytelling reputation of Rowling. Adults must also be entertained. Page after page introducing various characters. Bits and pieces of information that I assume will be important eventually. Then finally the characters begin to interact. Still, there is no hook. There is no one to pull for.  There is no one to like. They are all depressed and depressing. I was pulling for Rowling. Like I said, I'll check back here someday. But I'm not thrilled with the idea.  I'm being generous with two stars.

author: Kaslo
title: Bored
body: Sorry, but I didn't finish the book. It did not hook me in. In fact I found most of it rather boring. What is the story line anyway.

author: A Cat
title: I kindly suggest not to read this book.
body: This goes particularly to all Harry Potter fans. You're allowed to love Rowling as much as you want to, but please, if you haven't already: do not read this book.

author: Amazon Customer
title: boring!
body: I found the book boring and didn't finish it! Not enough character.development or dialogue. Lots of slow descriptions that just didn't keep me interested.

author: Juda64
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: To be honest I'm a little disappointed.  After the huge successes of her childrens books I may have been expecting too much?  I found it very slow to start and even at the halfway mark I was still waiting for it to "takeoff".  There were also a lot of different characters introduced very early on and I found it difficult to keep up with who's who's.  In saying all that, it hasnt put me off and I would try another of her books if she puts another out in the future.

author: I. M. Sam
title: Come back, Harry Potter!
body: In my opinion, Ms. Rowling should have stuck with children's literature.

author: Mingtangyu
title: A waste of money
body: Like all the other Harry Potter fans, I pre-ordered this book and anticipated reading it. Sadly when it arrived and I started reading, I waited page by page to see when any event, character or setting would call out to me to make me read on. There was none. The characters were all flawed but uninspiring. At best, this novel is a documentary of a dysfunctional small town. The author was right when she said that her success with the HP books afforded her to write a novel the critics may not like.  I would say with good reason! such a disappointing book from a talented author.

author: Yug
title: Casual vacancy
body: I was disappointed in this book, although as one would expect it is very well written.

author: M. E. Bertolini
title: Casual Vacancy is neither casual nor vacanr
body: J.K. Rowling engages readers in her first novel for adults. One of the most engaging aspects of this novel is Rowling's keen insight into the dark world of the mind of adolescents.

author: Karin E. Phaneuf
title: EXCEPTIONAL!
body: JK Rowling has done it again. She's so "on it" in her character description and story telling. She has, once again, crawled into the heads and hearts of the characters she writes about, especially the teenagers. Wonderful tale, and an honest portrayal of the lives we live and the complicated situations that make us who we are. BRAVO! Well done.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Rowling continues to deliver a quality product
body: I loved it.  Rowling vests ordinary people with ordinary failings, then creates a story one can't put down.  It will make a good movie.

author: JADE
title: THOUGHTS ON CASUAL VACANCY
body: I HAD TO QUIT READING THIS AS IT SEEMED TO BE REPITIOUS  I REALLY LOVED J.K.ROWLINGS OTHER SERIES AND I KNEW IT WAS A DIFFERENT DIRECTION FOR THIS BOOK.  I WISH SHE WOULD GO BACK TO WHERE HER REAL TALENTS LIE.. I WILL WATCH FOR HER NEXT BOOK...

author: Sarah
title: I am not sure this book bridges the ocean
body: I was looking forward to reading JK Rowling's venture into the adult literature area.  As a librarian I know what her books did for young adult/juvenile literature.  There are many social mores I don't understand in Casual Vacancy because the Brits appear to be much more caste conscious although not as conscious as color of skin.

author: Sid F Starr
title: Addictive Soap
body: Coronation Street in the West Country? I loved it because it felt like Taunton, Yeovil (Yarvil in the book?) and Bridgewater where I grew up. Intriguing characters that are contrasted with one another, some are transports from the world of HP. For me it ended abruptly and I'm not sure which characters I'd like to follow if JKR revisits Pagford. As pure entertainment, my Kindle copy is value for money.

author: Lauren
title: Not Another Potter Novel
body: Like all of the other reviews say, this book contains foul language, is written from the perspective of a dozen or so deeply flawed characters, and in many portions is horribly graphic when it comes to drug use, incest, rape, violence, and neglect. It is, however, masterfully written and tastefully done. There is not a single instance of violence for the sake of violence, and every page propels the story further. The novel is, however, more than five hundred pages long, so don't expect the classic build-up, climax, conclusion. The story ends without any great resolution and there certainly isn't a classic happily-ever-after.

author: Jonathan
title: Give it a chance
body: No, it's not as good as Harry Potter. Is it bad? Also no. Give The Casual Vacancy a chance. Just pretend that it wasn't written by J.K. Rowling and evaluate the book on its own merits. I genuinely liked it, because Rowling's strong point will always be character creation.

author: blueleprd_74
title: Not Harry Potter and It's not meant to be Harry Potter
body: This book is very good. I've seen a lot of people complain because it isn't like Harry Potter. However, the end of the Harry Potter series became very dark and issues were raised that people generally turn away from. I think The Casual Vacancy has raised similar issues and people need to stop turning away from them.

author: oliver
title: depressing
body: Was looking forward to the release, but disappointed in the book. Started reading while on vacation but could not hold my interest. Very sad and dis-functional family sort of thing. Big disappointment.

author: casa
title: Not a fan
body: I started reading the book and got about 6% in (reading on Kindle) but ended up stopping.  I am a huge Harry Potter fan and was so excited when I heard J.K. Rowling was coming out with a new book, but it turned out to be a bit of a disappointment.  I knew this book wasn't a "kiddie" novel, but the amount of foul language and vulgar content still took me by surprise.  She's such a good writer with out all of that, so I just don't see the need.  Maybe the story would have gotten more interesting if I had continued reading, but I had had enough by 6% and didn't care to find out.

author: longtimereader
title: disapointed
body: I had no expectations.  I was sure it would be nothing like the Harry Potter series, so in that I was not surprised.  I was suprised however at how hate-full of a story it was.  I hated every minute of reading it, yet I kept reading because I wanted just one good thing to happen.  If JK Rowling writes another book, I will read it, but I am sorry I read this one.

author: Vicki Mock
title: Mildly disappointing.
body: I guess because of all the hype I was expecting a great book.  I found it average, a little slow in spots, but about half way thru it drew me in.  If another author had written this book I would enjoyed more, perhaps because I won't have had such hight expections.

author: M from California
title: So disappointed I could cry
body: I love the Harry Potter books. Rowling has managed to create an entire world about wizards and make it believable with a story that gripped you. When I heard that she was finally writing a book for adults, I expected that the same wonderful storytelling would be there without the restraints of writing for children. Unfortunately, I was wrong.

author: Happyreader
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Our bookclub chose this book based on J K Rowling's past successes. It began alright, shaping up to perhaps be funny and ironic, but it slid into just plain dark. Most characters were disturbed, or possessed or evil. There was nothing uplifting about the book, which didn't credit anyone with any spirit of human kindness, and it left me feeling slightly ill. I have recommended to friends that even if they have purchased the book, dump it, don't read it, and just consider it a bad investment.

author: Piecemaker
title: I miss you, Harry
body: I have read all Harry Potter books two times, and i thoroughly enjoyed them. I needed to read this book even after reading the reviews. The reviewers seemed concerned about the use of the "f" word. I read all the time, and that didn't even show up on my radar. My problem with the book was that I really did not care for any of the characters so I could care less about what was happening to them. I only finished the book because I had started it. I have to say I was disappointed. I hope Rowling will write another book with characters like Harry,Rob, and Hermoine(my personal favorite) in an unknown world. Harry Potter was magical.

author: Franci Hurley Corr
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I did not read The Harry Potter series but of course I knew of their success.  I was very interested to read a novel of hers and loved The Casual Vacancy.  It was descriptive, clear, easy to follow with complex characters and fabulous story line.  I have reccomended it and always will!  One of my faves :)

author: Cora A. Victorine
title: Casual Vacancy
body: THe book had too many characters. The plot was very diverted into many little areas specific to the characters. All the characters were not likable or important. Sex and violence seemed to be thrown in for the sake of commercialism or to draw interest of the reader but failed. I was very disappoointed in this book.

author: love2read
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Rowling went from genius to garbage. I wish I had read a critique about this book before I wasted my money. Very seldom do I purchase a book and not try to read the whole thing. It was going from bad to worse and then I read a review and realized this was not for me. I hope she does better with her next book but I will never purchase another one of hers without some idea about what it contains. A real stinker. I hate to give it even one star.

author: Bookworm
title: Disappointing
body: The book was slow, to many characters and not one I truly cared about. I think it may have been a political statement of our times but I am not sure.  Ms Rowling is a really good writer of action,fantasy fiction that transcends age groups.  I am sorry she left that genre and tried something new. I would not recommend it.

author: cstodo
title: Casual Vacancy
body: For us in the U.S. I found it a bit hard to follow at times.  I also felt there was no real end to the story.  Maybe the more accurate way to tell this is that I felt it was just a bunch of odd stories all different, but tied together, but not in a way that made a whole lot of sense.  It was slow going and I guess I just expected more from J.K.  Yes, it was a story, but I got bored with it very quickly.  No, I didn't expect Harry, but I felt there should be more depth to some of the characters and they were just so predictable.  No suspense or mystery to it.

author: M.
title: wonderful story telling
body: Casual Vacancy is a slice of British life,  the good and the bad, with lifelike characterization portrayal.  An example of great story telling; taking the death of one individual and creating a world from the ripple effects of that death.  What imagination. A world that is not always pretty.  The story seamlessly draws you in and before you realize, you are caring about everyone.  The subtle underlying  commentary of how the system works ( it could just as easily be set in America) because the story works.

author: Timothy Allard
title: great book
body: The story was great.  She paints a very believable and poignant story.  I felt like I was there going through it with them. Its definately a book I will pass on and read again.

author: cindy
title: A casual vacancy
body: It was interesting and the characters intermingled, but as a whole, the story was depressing and felt "dark". Maybe that was the intent, but it wasn't what I thought it would be like. Disappointed!

author: saphire1043
title: Casual Vacancy
body: After a few pages I started writing down the names and what they did to help keep track of the story line.  I was very disappointed in the story.  I read approximately 60 pages and gave up.  The story just did not grab me.

author: P. J.
title: Disappointing
body: I'm a big fan of J. K. Rowling and looked forward to her first adult book: not sure I'll buy another. I wasn't engaged at all until well past the first third of the book and even then I had no trouble at all putting it down. Because I didn't get caught up in the story I had trouble keeping the characters straight and this was extremely irritating. I finished the book only because it was J. K. Rowling and I thought maybe it would straighten out. It didn't.  Originally from the UK I understood the words that were uniquely British so I don't know what difference that made to readers who didn't know their meaning. I suppose because I read all the Harry Potter books that I expected a page turner with lots of action and vivid characters. This book has a small plot - a man dies leaving an empty seat on the town council that must be filled, and tells a slice of the lives of the people involved. There is no, or very slow, advancement of the "plot" and no action to speak of, although Rowling employs subjects that involve children, a cause near and dear to her heart I understand, including the dark issues of self-mutilation, rape, poverty, addiction, abuse, etc. These are all awful things that need to be addressed but I'm not sure this is the proper venue, certainly not for me, or perhaps not in the way they were presented. A more intense and suspenseful story might have worked. I struggled hard to read this book in its entirety but perhaps that is because this is not the type of book I usually read. If Rowling's future adult books run along the same vein, then she will have lost me as a reader. I don't want causes in a novel I read for entertainment. I want entertainment and I'm sorry to say this book was disappointingly boring.

author: Sub Mom Wife
title: YUCK
body: This book was dark and full of sex drugs and violance.  There seemed to be no point.  I kept forcing myself to read this book hoping against hope that something would happen or I would feel some enlightment.  But in the end it just quit.  I would not recommend this to anyone.

author: Jasmeen Malhotra
title: It's no Harry Potter... but it's definitely J K Rowling
body: (Yes, I read all seven HP books.)

author: J Brown
title: Not real pleased
body: I kept wanting something good to happen and everything in this book kept going downhill. Maybe I just like a happy ending or at least someone to have a happy ending.  Not a big fan of total depression.

author: Jean Hamilton
title: Not Harry Potter but excellent
body: I really enjoyed The Casual Vacancy. Ms. Rowling is a master at defining her characters. One really gets a feeling of living in a small village and how everyone's lives  are intertwined. There are far reaching consequences for everyone's actions.

author: Harold Mosher
title: Casual Vacancy
body: I found the book to be somewhat interesting.  The story flowed and I was able to keep tract of the characters.  At times, the vocabulary was a bit too flowery.  It seemed more like a narrative of the social classes rather than a novel.

author: runladyrun
title: Excellent read!
body: If you like Maeve Binchy or authors such as Rosamund Pilcher (which I do) yet hunger for something a little less vapid you will love this book.  Similar to Binchy and Pilcher, Rowling uses a small village as a backdrop and bases her novel on the relationships woven among its inhabitants.  However, Rowling seems to infuse more colour, depth and realism into her characters. Some are crude but so are many in real life.  Harry Potter was a brilliant children/youth series but to try and compare this to that is a most unfair comparison.  This should stand alone and be judged on its own merits.

author: samiread
title: Seriously boorish
body: There is absolutely no intrigue, interest, or creativity in this book.  You could get the same amount of entertainment in picking up the newspaper or turning on the news.  Very disappointing for previous fans - the writing doesn't come close to holding your attention.  Content is distastful without providing any necessity to storyline.  Editors should provide better guidance.  Maybe sticking with fantasy would be better........

author: reader
title: Middling
body: If it weren't by Rowling, I probably wouldn't have purchased it. The characters are unattractive. Her prose is a bit overdone--somehow it worked better in a magical world. Nonetheless, I have to say that it kept me reading.

author: Bama Grandma
title: Anxious to read...
body: After reading the Harry Potter series to my grandchildren, I was anxious to read and explore her adult writing.  Sadly, I was disappointed and quit reading after several chapters.  I began at the beginning at least three times, thinking I was missing something, but it never caught my attention and curosity.  To me, it was slow.  I am keeping it in my Kindle to give it another try at some other point in time.

author: archmandrate
title: Fine book, but done before
body: I've read enough British books about class with multiple POVs to feel I can say while Rowling does a good job balancing the characters, ultimately I didn't feel like there was anything really new here.  If you want to read about a similar topic, but Ina more original manner, read Zadie Smith's WHITE TEETH.

author: clee
title: Not a Casual read
body: If you were expecting another Harry Potter type book from J.K.Rowling you will be very disappointed after reading the first page of this book. Lucky for me I did not buy the book with those expectations. This is very much a modern story and the language is rough and blunt as are the views of life and people. There were times while reading that I wanted to never read another word of it because of the cursing and raw descriptions of peoples actions. It made me uncomfortable. That said it is a good book and sometimes a reader needs to be made uncomfortable because there are people that think and talk and act like the people in the book. That's why I read, to expand my awareness. So, buy the book and if it sometimes makes you uncomfortable, ask yourself why.

author: Meridien
title: casual vacancy
body: This book was an incredible disappointment.  I tried to read it five times because of who the author is and just fially gave up in boredom. I have learned to never preorder again.  She has anounced she is writing no more adult novels because of the poor reception.  Too late to get my  money back from her

author: paula glover
title: Not up to snuff
body: I realize I'm going against the grain on this one, but I'm not thrilled at all with the Casual Vacancy. I think the writing is rough and I'm not particularly interested in the sex lives of young boys. I gave up mid-way through, although I may force myself to finish it.

author: Joop
title: unpleasant people
body: This book is well written and the characters are quite believable. Unfortunate, none of the characters are pleasant or likable which makes the book rather dour.

author: Donna M Smith
title: Boring
body: Boring characters and story, just couldn't even get interested. I couldn't wait for this book because I loved Harry Potter books and I sincerely tried to give this a fair chance but the dry characters and uninteresting storyline just completely turned me off.

author: Marjie L. Schoonmaker
title: casual vacancy
body: too many charcaters, hard to follow

author: N. Kilts
title: Prophetic Title-The Casual Vacancy-it was both-too casual and too vacant
body: I bought and loved all 7 Harry Potter novels, therefore was very dissapointed in this new endeavor of JK Rowling's The Casual Vacancy. With the Harry Potter novels being geared towards children and teens, it was amazing the depth and breadth JK Rowling maintained through each book and all subsequent books tied up wonderfully to the very end. I am an adult in my 60's, and anticipated her "adult" novel to have the same depth and even further enhancement of a powerful story line. The plot is boring and the story line drags along endlessly. I haven't "invested" any connection to the characters, not even enough to keep the names straight as to who is who. I bought it well over 2 months ago and yet been inspired to finish it. I won't give you a plot summary as you can read that on Amazon's review. I was amazed to see it listed as No.1 on the New York Times bestseller's list. I'm sure it is selling purely on the strength of her previous works.

author: 'Classical' Texan
title: Avid reader
body: I am a J.K. Rowling fan--at least until this book.  From the beginning, I could sense that this book was going to be a "downer", however, I was determined to give it the attention I felt it deserved.  I read the entire book, and there was not a single scene that made me feel good.  The characters were self-centered, selfish, dishonest, and downright mean--teens and adults alike!  The situations, while probably true-to-life, were depressing and dark.  When I finished the book, I was in a royal 'funk' for a couple of days just thinking about it.  Maybe that is the sign of a good book (having the reader 'think' about it afterwards) but I didn't like feeling that way.  Unless you enjoy reading dark and depressing stories, you better steer clear.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Ok
body: A little complicate in the beginning , a fast but interest ending. The bulling came at any age at any time and the result are ........

author: Janice Mac
title: Seriously mean
body: Does Ms Rowling lilke people? The characters were well developed but thoroughly icky. The kids were worse than the parents and the parents were pretty nasty.

author: windiswish
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Segmented and confusing, lots of uncommon "English phrases" used that muddled the authors descriptions and intent. Slow moving. Did not entice familiarity with characters.

author: Shirl
title: Casual vacancy
body: It was a downer.  My husband finished the book, also thought the same thing.  I didn't finish the book.  Would

author: Ray F
title: Reading JKR
body: She should stick to writing childrens books. I did not like the book at all.Too wordy With a lot of swearing to try and make it an adult book.Bad characters and a weak plot.

author: N. Boer
title: Don't trust the hype; decide for yourself
body: Just thought I would contribute my 2c:

author: R. M. Pauly
title: what a disappointment
body: After the epic adventure of the Harry Potter novels, I am appalled at the lack of interest generated by such negative characters in this novel. They are not even evil enough to be interesting; just repulsive.

author: J. Robinette
title: gossip kills
body: I enjoyed this book, however, I found it to be terribly gloomy and slow in some areas. The characters and the dialogue reminded me of the small town where I grew up. Constant gossiping and lack of respect for one another. I can't say that I would recommend it to another.

author: R. Stiltskin
title: Don't expect fantasy
body: One thing JK Rowling does well is characters, and here is a great example. When the Harry Potter series finished it left me wanting more mature fantasy - as the series had become book after book. Just compare the first one to the last! But even though this book doesn't fulfil those desires, it's still a great read and gives us a very absorbing insight into the more remarkable parts of a seemingly normal community, one any one of us could inhabit now! For those of you ready for the next step in Fantasy, and thus left wanting by this, I would suggest China Miville, Walter Moers or the little known J. Alastair Nash.

author: Nicole
title: Good reading
body: I don't agree with the  harsh comments I've been reading about this book: JKR has captured the claustrophobic atmosphere of small town England, with the accents and all, depending on the character's age & social rank.

author: Amazon Customer
title: A one-time read
body: A well-written book, but I will never read it again, and that's what separates this novel from those that I love.  I like to be able to identify with, or at least like, a minimum of one character in a book.  The only seemingly likeable character in this novel appears to be the one that dies immediately. I just don't enjoy books that shove "reality" and the sad state of human nature in my face.  I get plenty of that in daily life, and I read to escape or to become enlightened in some way. The overall feeling this book leaves me with is despair, and so... it's time to read more Terry Pratchett!

author: RG in OK
title: Great book for grown ups!
body: I loved the theme of the book and thought it was skillfully developed through insightful character development.  I recommend this book for adult readers.  It is not for kids.

author: Dorothy Gillen
title: Casual Vacancy
body: TOO bad I have to rate this book.  I did not want to give it one star.  I did not like it at all, I am sorry I bought it.  I tried to get through  the book, but maybe I am too old.  Loved the Harry Potter series.  This was a big disappointment.  Waste of money.

author: Holly Moon
title: Terrific!
body: I am so into JK's writing style. I would recommend this book to any lovers of the Harry Potter books. Just not for the young ones, but most teens have heard any and all of the adult stuff in this book.

author: Crazy Dog Lady
title: HP fan. Not so much CV
body: Quite disappointed in this book. Expected much more from Ms. Rowling. Her imagination from HP was sadly missing as she brought us a barrage of small town drama, predictably starting with a tragedy and ending with more tragedy.

author: Patrick Newton
title: Couldn't even finish it
body: Not at all what I expected.  Can't believe it was written by JK Rowling.  I wasn't looking for Harry Potter, but never expected this either.

author: Emily Mowery
title: Yawn
body: I'll be honest, I only read the first 21 pages, but it was boring. Worse than that, the personalities and lives she was creating seemed insincere.

author: R. Estes
title: Terribly disappointed
body: I love to read books where the characters are three dimensional people that you would recognize on the street.  Sadly this book is not one of them.  The writing is flat, unimaginative and boring.  If you must read it, borrow it from the library.  I felt it was a waste of the money.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Complex personality interactions
body: This is not so bad as the critics said.  The personalities and interactions centered around the activities of the council and local power struggles are quite interesting.  The children in the story are very interesting, and the various venalities of the adults get appropriate comeuppance.  The tragedies are appropriate commentary on the world as it is.

author: Alice M. Glover
title: Casual Vacancy
body: Pure garbage....even though we were told for adults only....even adults have a limit..Maybe in Other countries this acceptable...but I would

author: me
title: written for uk residents
body: I am sure if I lived in uk I would get it. it reads like a standard english mystery novel so I keep waiting for someone to show up dead under mysterious circumstances but that never happens. could not finish the book and I HATE to leave books unfinished.

author: Maynard M. Mitchell
title: reading off
body: It was not exciting and it ran on and on. He tried to make the book like everyday life and I was boared stiff.

author: tenaj
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: J.K. Rowling needs to stick with her Harry Potter books.  I did not enjoy this one at all.  She does not seem to have a good plot and I lost interest about 1/4 way through the book.

author: E. A. Taylor
title: Tedious
body: A big disappointment . The plot is lost in the never ending discriptions of place and characters.  few memorable characters , and it was hard to keep up with who is who. The plot is weak and silly.

author: Kindle Customer
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: It is difficult for me to review this book.  I never cease to be amazed at Rowling's talent.  Theme and Characters were very complex.  My problem was that I could never really get into it.  I finished the book, but I could have easily quit at any point and put it back on the shelf. There were no characters in the book that I liked or respected.  For me it was just sort of "blah".

author: Ellen R.
title: J.K. Rowling's different type of writing!
body: Disappointed in the story, character flow until 3/4 of the way through the book. After enjoying the exceptional Harry Potter books, perhaps my expectations were too high.

author: Bookworm1976
title: Okay, at best
body: This book was difficult to read. There are many characters and it takes a while to get them all straight in your head. It is fairly slow moving and leaves you feeling terrible at the end.

author: Lesli P. Bernat
title: disappointing
body: I was disappointed with this book.I didn't even finish it. It is such a shame that the great writer who brought us Harry Potter had to stoop to such vulgar language to write an adult novel. I really expected much more from her. Disappointed!!

author: Randy Burnett
title: Eh
body: Well written but a snoozer.  The characters are interesting but there's no twists and turns, I'm about half way through and hoping the plot thickens

author: JoAnn
title: Casual Vacancy  BORING!
body: Very disappointing.  Too many characters, jumps around, just not enjoyable.  I was expecting better from JK Rowling but think she needs to stick to the world of wizardry.  This has been a painful read but I forced myself to finish it!  I do not recommend this book--unless you want to be bored to bits!

author: Nadine
title: "Three or four families in a country village is the very thing to work on" -Jane Austen
body: I enjoyed this book very much. The character development is outstanding. The story focuses on an English country village and the stress caused by country politics, class struggles, love, family, poverty, drugs, and life in general. The writing is delightful and this is the only thing the book has in common with Harry Potter. There is no fantasyland with clear good versus evil. I loved it, but I am a Jane Austen fan and I love stories that contain only three or four country families.

author: Paula S. St Julien
title: A Little Disappointed
body: I was really looking forward to reading J.K. Rowling's new book, but I have to say I was a little disappointed.  I thought the story plot was pretty good, and of course she does a wonderful job of developing her characters, but I was really turned off by all the swearing in the book.  I am by no means a prude, and I don't mind some swearing if it enhances the story.  But I just felt like a lot of it was not necessary and didn't add anything to the story.  I gave the book 3 stars because of the swearing and because I had the ending figured out about halfway through the book.

author: Lokie
title: Meh
body: Politics bore me and even with J.K. writing couldnt save the story. It was so boring, what a shame.  I had been excited to get the book.

author: jimlongley
title: That's life.
body: Although a little tedious at the start, in switching from character to character and slow development, overall an entertaining read.

author: Jules
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I thought it was just okay.  It seemed to me that we went on a journey and ended up in the same place at the end.  Nothing really changed for anyone.  Hope she goes back to writing for young adults.

author: Myview
title: The big fraud
body: I thought any author who could hold the attention of a middle school reader for 600 pages would write a mesmerizing adult book.  In this case the "adult" designation just meant as in X rated.

author: Amazon Customer
title: very real characters
body: The characters had such depth. They sucked me into the story and held my interest in such a way that I was surprised how much I cared about their lives.

author: R. Bond
title: Just not for me
body: It was very hard for me to get into. Not that the writing was bad, just not feeling the story line. But, I still feel JKR is brilliant. Maybe she should stick with Children/Young Adult...?

author: my2cents
title: Great Book!
body: J. K. Rowling is such a wonderful writer. The characters in this book, as in her Harry Potter books, have such depth,and the stories Rowling tells are so engaging. This is a good read!

author: DeaZ
title: Didn't like any of the characters
body: Really found the characters in the book unlikable. And I didn't feel the book was resolved in a positive manner. No one seemed to learn and grow from the events unfolding in the book. Finished the novel feeling unsatisfied. I will not be purchasing another one of J.K. Rowling's books.

author: Earl W. Godt II
title: Better than Potter
body: This book was better than any of the Harry Potter series in relating the real day-to-day interactions of small town characters.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Difficult to get into but hooks you after 4 or 5 chapters
body: This book was well written but fairly depressing.  Taking place in a small village in England, it delves into the lives, relationships and emotions of a variety of people, building to a climax that one knows can't be good.  Some of the people evolve into more likeable characters than you would expect and some into less likeable characters.  Most of the characters are not very likeable.  The ending worked out well for a few and disastrously for others.

author: Lor
title: Casual Vacancy
body: I found this book troubling, I can and do enjoy books without the language that J.K. Rowling decided had to be utilized in this one. I was terribly distressed in what she presumed is enjoyed by all adults...sorry, but that is how I personally feel about her first "Adult Book"

author: Hina
title: Dark and dramatic
body: Although I never read the Harry Potter series, it s easy to see why Rowling has become such an iconic writer. Her writing style is both perceptive and realistic. The characters are very believable. The story does not have too many twists and turns but it is captivating. The novel becomes very dark at times...almost disturbingly so. Yet you cannot help becoming attached to the the characters. All in all, a very good read.

author: L. Kasseris
title: Awful and Quite Surprised
body: OMG! I thought this would be an excellent read given the author-I got through half of it and stopped the "madness". I could not keep up and or did not want to....this is obviously my opinion and I feel I am quite well read and would like to see what other people's thoughts are on this book-I am guessing I might be in the minority and others will just say they thought it was a blockbuster just to be in the "know" so to speak-all in all I would leave it at best as a "tedious" and unrewarding read.

author: JoAnn Erfer
title: Stick with Hogworts
body: I tried to like this book, but had no success.  I enjoy a book where the characters grab my interet.  I kept reading but this never happened.  It finally got to the point where, after 100+ pages, I threw in the towel.  Ms. Rowling should stick to what she does best.

author: Lozza
title: Confusing
body: i found the book very confusing. Most characters had nicknames and almost in the same sentence both names were used. This just made reading difficult, as you were constantly trying to remember who the character was and also where they fitted into the story. I admit I haven' t read any of JK Rowlings other books,so I can't comment on the author generally. I would not recommend this novel.

author: Mappg
title: The casual vacancy
body: I don't think it holds up to the Potter series but a good read once you delve into it.  Has an interesting twist of characters that keep you engaged.

author: bet33
title: Casual Vacancy
body: I guess no one could keep the Harry Potter interest going.  This book did not grab me, and hold my interest.  It was ok, but I guess I expected more from J.K. Rowling.

author: Claus Stahnke
title: No magic, but a lot of suspense
body: Well written, social realistic novel, about the lack of understanding we have for each other, rich vs poor, children vs parents, teachers vs students, and the complications that can come from this.

author: Pattydu
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I was very disappointed in this book and I couldn't even finish reading it.  I thought the characters were awful and didn't care about them at all. Can't believe the same author wrote this and the Harry Potter series.

author: Lars
title: Loved it
body: The book was great. Rowling shows that she masters adult fiction at least as well as youth fiction. Buy the book if you feel like doing it.

author: Mfree
title: Casual Vacancy
body: This whole book, "The Casual Vacancy", purchased from Amazon, was boring to me. Too many in's and out's of situations, very hard to follow without going back pages trying to recapture each situation. I do not recommend this book. Sorry.

author: MelStrella
title: A craftsman at work
body: Rarely do I find a book that I can't put down because it so comprehensively engages all of me, with its quirky but fully believable plot, the unmistakeable wordsmithing of an accomplished author, the shared insight into the broad spectrum of the human condition, and well developed, rounded characters that are very likely to do something unpredictable at any moment. I am fascinated to know how JKR could soooo nail the description of OCD let alone the other character quirks she rolls out for our enjoyment. I hoped JKR would be as good with an adult book as she was with kids fantasy, and she didn't disappoint. Eeep, hanging out for a good night's sleep tonight to make up for this book keeping me reading voraciously into the wee small hours this morning!

author: A. Jonsdottir
title: Very good book - must read
body: I have just finisthed reading Cacual Vacancy - one of the very best books I have read in a long time, and I read a lot.

author: Karen B
title: Awfully brilliant
body: The Casual Vacancy is a searing portrait of a group of  characters in neighbouring towns that explores how even the smallest stakes can create the grandest ambitions. Filled to the brim with toxic personalities, egos, class and fiscal warfare and all kinds of terrible abuses, this is a dark and awful book in so many ways. Deeply disturbing, it is relentless in its scope and in the way it investigates the levels to which humans will stoop. But it is also  intelligently and even beautifully written. I could not put it down.

author: Virginia Baughman
title: Worth the wait
body: I found the Harry Potter books hard to read, but I enjoyed this book very much. A great cast of characters with a great story.

author: slim
title: Casual Vacancy
body: Casual Vacancy was page turning and very insightful of the hopes and follies of humanity. Krystal Weedon was a comical and tragic figure.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Too much profanity
body: I was hoping that J.K. Rowling's first book for adults did not mean profane and obscene language.  Unfortunately, that was not the case. Too bad a gifted writer like Rowling cannot take a hint from the likes of John Grisham that one can write excellent fiction without being offensive.

author: Jerryb
title: Disappointing!
body: In an attempt to be"adult" in this new endeavor,the author created a totally unspeaking cast of characters. No redeeming values!

author: Owen Corps
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Excellent. J. K. Rowling has a wealth of knowledge at her disposal. Extremely well written and thought out. Even at the very end, Ms Rowling was still releasing details of the characters that we thought we knew. A sequel would be very welcome!

author: lorat
title: For those who love to read and not because of wrote it
body: Excellent read! Stop thinking about who wrote it and just enjoy it. I'm glad I didn't read it based on the bad reviews I saw before buying it!

author: Mary
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I bought this book at Costco,wasnt going because of all the 1 star reveiws. Took me awhile to get through it. Read about 50 pages and stopped to read a book on my Kindle Fire. Then I started it up again. It is slow going  and took me awhile to remember who is who. But then it got more interesting and I couldnt put it down. I really liked it!

author: M. Keesee
title: Brilliant Character Study
body: I cannot believe that I read the same book that the reviewers with the one-start ratings have been tearing apart page by page. I LOVED THIS BOOK.  I went into it it with trepidation since I loved the HP books and expected to be disappointed.  I was thrilled by the multitude of characters populating this tiny English town.  If anyone lives in a small town like I do you will agree that while we think we know everybody's business, none of us are aware of the nasty dark secrets behind our neighbor's closed doors.  All these characters are well drawn, have depth and will walk around in my brain for a long time to come.  I hope people give this book a chance because it is well worth the read. I look forward to Rowling's next endeavor.

author: Barry Weiss
title: Politically Uncomfortable For Some!
body: This was an excellent character study and political narrative from a progressive point of view.  I can't help but feel there are a lot of Howard's and Shirley's (you will know what I mean when you read the book) whose right wing sensibilities (if there are such things) were wounded by the political positions taken and thus many of the negative comments about the book.

author: Barbara Lucas
title: Boring
body: Very slow moving.  The characters are dull and uninteresting. Found it hard to care about them  She should stick to fantasy.

author: Alphacat
title: The worst ever
body: The worst book I have ever read, in fact couldn't finish it. The characters are awful - didn't like any of them; no redeeming qualities at all. What is the point of writing such an awful book? No empathy for any of them. Time wasted for sure.

author: SFWINO
title: Can't Get Through It
body: OK, I read a novel per week; I loved Harry Potter; I looked forward to and expected a different story that showed JK's writing skills.  BUT..... I have started this book 4 times and can't get pass 20%. Confusing, rambling, too many people,,,ugh.  I am going to walk away from it for now and pick it up for a 5th try in a few weeks. Maybe it's me..... but I don't think so.

author: Derek
title: Casual Vacancy
body: the seamier life styles of the candidates for the "Casual Vacancy" & their families is revealed in this (Hog)warts and all (pun intended) tale. The language is at times coarse , but I found the story intriging.

author: avidreader
title: Disappointing
body: In a word, boring.  I don't dislike serious books and had high hopes but one-third of the way in, The Casual Vacacny is not even remotely compelling.  I care nothing about the characters all whom so far are unappealing.  I don't think I can bring myself to finish it.

author: Johan Adkins
title: Die hard fan
body: I  understand that Jo Rowling is an advocate for distressed teens and their families and is actively trying to help.  I know these types of lives and characters exist and the hopelessness of their situations and the inadequacy of any social and community systems to help is discouraging and dire.  I was just disappointed in the down and dirty...we expect magic and uplifted spirits when we read her books.  We care about all of her characters and unfortunately I didn't care about any of them in Casual Vacancy.  I wanted to love this book as I did her Harry Potter series.

author: tsetsefly1
title: Village Politics Meets Something Wicked This Way Comes
body: I am reading this with bated breath: it's hard to put down. Just when you think you know enough about particular characters, something new happens to them, or they make something happen to someone else. As Miss Marple of St. Mary Mead village might have put it, there is much wickedness in village life, under the surface. A very adult novel. I didn't expect Harry Potter, and J.K. Rowling is simply stretching and limbering up her literary muscles. More power to her! It can be a disturbing read, but the exaggerated evils are there to make a point about hypocrisy. Real life can be just as unsettling. I alternate between really enjoying this and biting my fingernails down to the nub. You decide!

author: Regina
title: Beautifully Written Work of Art.
body: Casual Vacancy is a beautifully written work of art. Nothing has been missed in the story. No storyline was neglected. Every character and every scene is perfectly orchestrated to completion. Reading Casual Vacancy is like eating that perfect meal. It starts off with an explosion of flavor, akin to a beautifully prepared appetizer and from there Rowling guides the reader through a perfectly told story that is nicely sustained. A good story is one that the reader does not want to put down, but is not forced to rush through. It is a story that once over, its characters will be missed. And once completed, the storyline line and messages are still being contemplated in the minds of its readers. This is the brilliance of Casual Vacancy.

author: Kali the Cat
title: Boring and tedious at best.
body: This is a very disappointing outing by J.K. Rowling.  I found the story boring and a tedious read at best.  I had read some of the other reviews of 'The Casual Vacancy' after starting the book but still felt promise for a good read, after all this is J.K. Rowling.  Other reviewers stated you needed to read at least half of the book before the storyline would pick up.  I didn't find this to be so.  Even at the end I wondered why I had bothered with the effort to plod on when I could have been reading something much better.

author: Ann
title: A lot of realistic issues crammed into a volatile political landscape
body: I know why you've either read, or are going to read this book. It's because you're curious. Curious as to what has Rowling come up with for adults post Potter, and if it can live up to the legend of Potter or not. I went into this with my mind still set in the idyllic childish world of Harry Potter (you really shouldn't, clear your mind and just read this book as it is) and I can tell you the exact moment that Rowling effectively shattered any childhood fantasies that I had left (it was when she dropped about 7 f-bombs in the span of two consecutive pages really early on).

author: rdr
title: casual vacancy
body: Knew book was for adults and not at all like HP series but I only got to the third or fourth chapter and was totally bored, confused,and the really foul language was a turnoff.  She is a better writer that what is found in this book. Maybe you should take a look at it in a library and read a few chapters before buying just to see if you will like it.

author: Julie
title: Too many characters... and nothing happens in this book besides people dying
body: Too many characters to follow, gets very confusing. There is not one normal family in this town everyone is screwed up to the point where it is very unbelievable. the end is horrible, nothing is resolved! Had a hard time finishing this book. This is one I will not reread!

author: Jan
title: Worst Book Read
body: Our Book Club selected this book with the high hopes our families have had with the Harry Potter series. Never have I been so disappointed and dismayed. This book, to my surprise, was just one step from being labled porno. With that said, the writing was more of a rambling farce about a small town. The language was more than the usual hard core and the characters were almost impossible to separate or remember from one page to the next. I realize the ratings jumped to the top when her book came out, but what a quick tumble they took with me.

author: booklover343
title: So disappointing
body: I was really looking forward to this book but it was so disappointing.

author: Aaron
title: Tough Transition
body: I read this book without the notion that it would be anything like the world of HP. I was very excited to hear Rowling's voice in a new arena. I have just finished the book and I feel just so-so about it.

author: Lynda B
title: Good read
body: No, it isn't Harry Potter but then I didn't expect it to be.  This novel was reminiscent of P. D. James without the murders.  Well written with well drawn characters (lots of them too).  I won't say this was her best effort because I loved all the Harry Potter books but it was very good and I only expect her non-magical writing to improve as time goes on.

author: Renate Scheelar
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: This book is an excellent read.  All the elements of the plot work together and there are no events which, when one has finished reading the book, one wonders what roles these events played in the overall unity of the story.  The characters and the situations created for them are very real.  The plot, at times, is quite gut wrenching, but true to life.

author: PG5000
title: Complex, Dark, Engaging - but takes some time to get there
body: Hello,

author: M. Worch -. Telaak
title: Casual Vacancy
body: The most Boring book I have ever tried to read..  I was very disappointed. Barely made it through chapter 4.  Maybe too British? Very descriptive but going no where..

author: Kindle Customer
title: Vacant
body: I rarely start a book I do not finish but this is it.  I tried to stick with it, thinking it might get better, but I cannot force myself to read the rest of it.  Too many characters introduced to be able to follow, very heavy subject material, I am disappointed.  I dumped it from my Kindle.

author: Pen Name
title: Great book
body: This was a great read, could hardly put it down. Can't wait for a sequel! Or more from her like this!

author: Gayle Hughes
title: Fan of J.K. Rowling in Tallahassee, Florida
body: It was well written and the characters are expertly drawn.  It is not a "happy" book and some readers will be sorry that it is not.  Overall, though, she gets is right in the struggles of the lower classes and the political fights that rule their lives.

author: Pen Name
title: Not Quite Harry
body: Plot was engaging throughout, but the shifting perspectives were hard to follow. Some of the story lines were a but lackluster as well.

author: chelsea
title: A good read but ...
body: I suppose I was expecting something absolutely extraordinary from the author having been utterly enthralled with her Harry Potter books- and I am over 60!  It is written very well, she really does have a superb turn of phrase, and  she has tried to touch upon many big problems facing society today.  But the end was so dark and so depressing.  I thought it petered out somewhat and was expecting something a little more triumphant: reinforcing the social services, establishing child care facilities, dealing with the horrific housing problem.  And the pettiness of local councils!!!  I am glad I read it and i have recommended it to others but I would not read it again.

author: K. Dickson
title: Barry Fairbrother and the Chamber of Secrets?
body: J.K.Rowling is a great story teller, but her real skill is character portrayal. She didn't disappoint with the Harry Potter novels and she doesn't disappoint with THE CASUAL VACANCY. Although the most likeable character dies in the first few pages, Rowling fleshes out the others realistically and skillfully over the course of this long but very readable novel. They are all flawed, vulnerable and very identifiable. Some are almost caricatures, but their stories all complement each other. As with Harry Potter, I couldn't put it down and I cried at the end. Can't get that Rihanna song out of my head: "You can stand under my umbrella..."

author: Jay P. Chawla
title: rented
body: Why do authors study people, and why do they experiment on them?  What gives them the inspiration that keeps them going as they study people and break them into parts and figure out their mistakes and see what causes behavior?

author: Eric M Small
title: Magic of a different kind.
body: When Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone was published, I was nine years old, and I devoured every page. I have continued to delight in Ms. Rowling's work for well over half my life, and now (at 24) I have just finished The Casual Vacancy. Once again, I have not been disappointed.

author: Robyne Melia
title: I Liked It
body: for the first chapter or two, i struggled to put the characters together... i was also quite ill so that's something to consider, but when i got in i really got in. i have a lot of respect for the author, but really forgot about her altogether.

author: Sue Fitzmaurice
title: Superb portrayal of parochialism and small-mindedness
body: There is barely a single likeable character throughout, but each is superbly depicted.  Rowling has "set to" with her obvious dislike of the parochial, small-minded English middle class, and its lack of any decent sentiment for those less fortunate than themselves - and that's no small number of the population today.

author: Nicola
title: I kind of expected more....
body: I really looked forward to reading this book. I had high hopes for a book targeted at adults but in that same un-put-downable style that Rowling is so very capable of. Alas...it wasn't to be. It seems to me that Rowling's idea of good writing for adults is picking a fairly grim (but very factual) topic and then using really obscure words to describe it. Thank goodness for Kindle's definition function. The story didn't grip me and I didn't find any of the characters lovable enough to retain my interest. It's a real shame because she can write....I think maybe she just tried too hard to be different from her previous works this time round and it didn't quite work.

author: Anoif
title: Hard going
body: Expected more than just a long saga. It was like reading an episode of East Enders. Everyone knows each other and it's all doom and gloom. So many characters, week story line and hard going. Disappointing. Best to stick to fantasy JK.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Bravo, Ms. Rowling!  Bravo!
body: I was so immersed in Casual Vacancy and realized only when I finished the book today, that I'd been as deeply involved as ever I had been in the Harry Potter series.  But this time there was the deeper, darker, adult current that is behind the lives the children lived through in the earlier series.  JK has proven once more her immense capacity for character development and the complex inner workings of the desperately narcissistic psyches thriving in any community.  Having worked as both a community therapist and a school counselor in my own career, her descriptions of families and children at risk and those dealing with addictions were written so precisely as to feel like  real families on every street in every town.  The ego conflicts and complex weaving among the adults of her community also accurately reflect the human tendency to scapegoat the less fortunate and hide their sufferings from our own eyes because they too closely reflect our own hidden and feared pain.  I would not have sacrificed one page or one word of this gifted artist's book.  I was in awe till the very end.  Thank you and I can't wait to read the next one!  So, Bravo, Ms. Rowling!  Bravo!!

author: reader
title: casual vacancy
body: I was disappointed in the book. It was long and boring and the story line was way out there and difficult to follow.It was not up to her standard of holding ones interest.

author: M. Marble
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: After plowing through the first 300 pages of this disappointing novel, I would say that J K Rowling should stick with young peoples' literature.  Adult literature to her is a lot of profanity in both American words and British words, teenage libidos running wild, and all the other evil deeds as listed by other reviewers.  There appears only to be hate, self-centered egos, and highly dysfunctional people.  There is no mystery, romance or even steamy sex scenes, the drama is even lacking...just raw emotions of getting even with those you have a distaste for whether it be parent, spouse, child or friend.  So many characters it is often hard to keep track of who is who.  The plot line is just who will fill a vacated councilman's seat and the "fight" to fill it.  This book makes our American political muckraking look tame.  Don't waste your money.

author: cori casas de gonzalez
title: Lost in the writing!
body: I just love to read all kinds of books. I purchased this book not expecting any concrete results. I thought an  adult  novel from a very entertaining and well read author would be enjoyable or at least interesting, it's none of those things.

author: connie
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I couldn't get interested enough to read very much at a time, I read on it for over 2 weeks and only got through a small portion of the book.
