It seemed to skip all over the place, it was hard to keep up with the characters, I couldn't figure out what was going on. It just couldn't hold my interest it was boring.

author: MC
title: Casual Vacancy
body: Very, very slow.....having a really hard time getting thru it.  I think she probably does better with children books.Better luck next time.

author: Music Lover
title: Terrible!
body: I really wanted to like this book as I am a big Harry Potter fan, but I just couldn't. The  characters, especially the adults, were awful people. Very few had any redeeming qualities, and many of the story lines were left unresolved and left all of the children in the same unhappy households they were in throughout the book. There were a few too many characters to follow, and the main plot was just boring. Not a good outing for Miss Rowling.

author: QLO
title: SLOW GOING
body: Well, I'm about 100 pages in and find it kind of hard to get going. But will keep at it

author: montanajen
title: Waste of time
body: Nothing to cry about. No joy, no comedy, no suspense, no love. I wouldn't buy another book by this author without reading glowing reviews first. I don't expect many of those for this novel. Yes, I read and enjoyed all of the H.P. books. Is this really the same author?

author: Adam Faughnan
title: 1 star Reviews are idiotic
body: This is well written, expertly plotted and stays with you long after it ends. The 1 star reviews here focus on the fact that it is not like Harry Potter. I thought it was made pretty clear this is an adult novel and is not suitable for kids.

author: Robert Rose
title: Nothing casual about it
body: JK Rowling's transition from wizard world into the realm of a small town abutting a larger one, set against the backdrop of local government, with the hopes, dreams and dark desires of people who could be our neighbours, is at times akin to an uncomfortable train ride. The scenery slips by giving us a glimpse of rural beauty, counterpointed with images of despair, poverty, addiction, and petty politics portrayed by the sort of characters not created from dark magic, but the grittiness of contemporary life in rural England. There is little that is mystical in Casual Vacancy apart from the inner workings of teenage minds heavy with hormones on the voyage of discovery to adulthood. And with the solidity of rolling stock on steel track, there are lurches and resonances along the way.

author: M. S. Baldivieso
title: Worst book I ever read.
body: This book was terrible. I guess I was expecting too much because I actually read the Harry Potter series along with my son as he was growing up. I was not looking for an adult version of that series. I was under the mistaken belief that the author would write something for adults that would draw one in to an interesting story.

author: Michele Hamele
title: Duh, It's Not Harry Potter
body: I am a huge Harry Potter fan, so of course I will read anything put out by J.K. Rowling.  When I read the description of this book months ago, I was disappointed, as the plot didn't seem like one that would appeal to me.  However, I decided to give it a chance.  I generally finish every book I start, unless I am REALLY not enjoying a book.  For about the first half of this book, I was ready to quit.  The only thing that kept me reading was that I wanted to be able to assess the book fairly, since it is from a favorite author of mine.  There were two main things that made this book difficult for me to stick with. First, the characters are not very likeable at all.  They ranged from annoying to pathetic to downright repellent.  Second, I just couldn't get myself to care about the whole plot with the election and the Fields issue.

author: Iris
title: the Casual Vacancy
body: This was the most boring, uninteresting, no-point book I have ever attempted to read.  If this had been J.K . Rowling's first book, she would never have been published.  After 3 attempts to find something redeemable in the story or the characters, I deleted it from my Kindle.  Don't waste your time on this one.

author: Sanam
title: Absolutely Loved It
body: This is definitely an adult book, and discusses many adult themes. Also, it might be beneficial to have a laptop next to you so you can look up some of the British slang that is used by the younger characters.

author: Kelly Brianna
title: I wanted more.....
body: The writing is solid, JK Rowling is a very good writer. And there were interesting bits peppered throughout the book, but for a 500 page novel, I needed more to be happening & for those parts to be more frequent. There is a lot of slow parts.

author: Kristi Mickelson
title: Just genius...
body: The Casual Vacancy and JK Rowling are pure genius. Rowling takes you to picturesque Pagford, a small English town, and introduces you to a cast of characters that will make you laugh, cry and pound your fists in anger.  I was engrossed in every word and when I wasn't reading, I was thinking of the characters and longing to get back to Pagford and to the lives of those who live there.  I had no trouble keeping up with who was who, and enjoyed how their lives intertwined with one another.  This book makes you think about class distinctions, prejudices and social issues.  It brings to light the petty thoughts and personality flaws that many of us have.  The characters in the book are people we all know. And to get into their thoughts... well, it was down right hilarious at times.

author: TravelStudent
title: One Word:  Depressing
body: This was a hard read.  The book is well written in a very British sort of way, but the story line is brutal on just about every level.  I came close to giving up several times but in the end I muscled through mostly because of few moments of a television interview with J.K. I happened to see, I believe on the Today show.  The interviewer said he cried at the end.  I wanted to read that ending.  I did mist up there but I'm not sure it was the story that did it.  I simply may have been relieved it was over.  Depressing hardly describes the entire work.  I'd really love to know what J.K. was thinking as she wrote this book.  I read all the Harry Potter books and loved them.  There are plenty of dark moments in HP but The Casual Vacancy left me exhausted and completely cold.  If it was the only book I'd read by J.K. I would never read another.  It's that demoralizing of a story.  If you're looking to be sad and depressed this book will fulfill that wish.  Otherwise read something else.

author: C. Christopher
title: No Vacancy Here
body: I'm not a Harry Potter fan, not having any interest in reading them. Yet with her grand success with the series, and now writing an 'adult' story, I jumped to buy the book the day it came out.

author: DeeP
title: Disappointed
body: The characters are diverse but shallow. They are, for the most part , pretty unsympathetic. Perhaps I just expected too much.

author: Jennifer L. Johnston
title: It was okay.
body: There are good and bad things about this book.  I'm not going to compare it to HP at all.  It's entirely different!

author: SunnyLorraine
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Enjoyed the read.  The language was brutal but not as much as her descriptions of the abject poverty the poor live with in council housing in England.  Drug addiction, abuse of children, rape, no hope ... she covered it all.  Having grown up in a small country town in Manitoba, I saw many of the characters in this book in my home town.

author: CHUCKC
title: Not what I expected, didn't care for it at all.
body: I never caught on to what J.K. Rowling was trying to say, other than that small villages can harbour resentments that go back for decades and that resentments and prejudices can fester until a boiling point is reached.

author: scotty
title: Stick to Harry Potter
body: I did read the book.  But to be honest, it was so pathetic that toward the end, I was skimming just to be done with it.  It deserved one star, but I gave it two for creativity.  Much of the atmosphere is crude and lowlife.  Many of the love scenes are brutish and animalistic.  If you like that kind of stuff, go for it.  But get real, J.K., this is not your genre.  Stick with Harry Potter fantasy. You deserve those 5 star accolades.

author: Chihuahua Zero
title: An Underrated Foray into Adult Fiction
body: Slowness? What slowness?

author: Anne
title: Very disappointing
body: The novel is hugely disappointing.  JK Rowling was not served well by her editors. The work is over-full of static, rather stock, characters. The descriptive passages are bloated.  It is overly-emotive yet strangely flat. At the same time, the plot hardly moves forward.  I read about half of it with a kind of horrified fascination, as one looks at a train-wreck, but finally had to put it down.  I hope that her next novel will show more of the tight plotting and drama of the Harry Potter series.

author: Candice Hayden
title: I love this woman for her talent and all she has given us...but, hate this book.
body: As one who spent countless nights perched at the bedside with my children reading the HP series...it was a nighttime ritual at our house...I couldn't wait to order the book on my Kindle and rabidly opened it immediately. It was extremely difficult to follow the characters who seemed quite two dimensional, difficult to maneuver much of the UK vernacular. I finally just put it down and shook my head. JK Rowling is such a gifted writer. But I am wondering if her editors and publishers were frank with her about this book...or just looking at the $$$.

author: julie
title: i loved it, i really really did!
body: i don't think i've ever written a review, but the reviews for this book are so bad and i loved it so much that i had to write.  here are some thoughts that might help you decide to buy this book or not:

author: TXJG
title: Well written, but so depressing
body: The writing is beautiful and insightful.  Unfortunately, we don't care about any of the characters in this seedy story and without a protagonist it is hard to find a reason to pick the book back up and finish it.  Harry Potter readers, don't bother buying it.  If you like well written books about how pathetic people are, you'll definitely want to pick this up.

author: Linda Martz
title: Casual Vacancy
body: J.K. Rowling's style is great.  Her character development is excellent.  It's really too bad that I can't say the same for the story.  Even though everything was tied up in a neat little package at the end, I was still left with a feeling of disappointment.  About all I got from the book is that everyone has secrets and nobody is really happy.  I read books that move me or entertain me more than once.  Once was enough for Casual Vacancy.

author: Sophiafrancesca
title: Human inheritances
body: I for one enjoyed this book.  I thought it depicted the common sins of our humanity.  Rowling  shows what jealousy, greed, and loveless families without true guidance springs forth in this world.  It shows how our lives seriously effect our children  in the most important years of their  lives.  Although the language is a bit raw, you skim over these words in the anticipation of reading onward.

author: P. Smith
title: Casual Vacancy
body: The story began as a page turner. I looked forward to what would happen to the characters and the coming events. I did not realize that was the prolouge. Trying to get through Chapter one is wrenching. I eventually gave up and started reading from one of my other favorite authors. One day I will go back to try and finish the book, especially since paying the price for the new release. I recommend borrowing from the library when it's available.

author: WBH
title: Not a Casual Vacancy
body: At first there were so many characters so quickly that I became somewhat confused trying to follow the setups, but if you stick with it, about a third of the way through, the story takes off and it is the vintage J.K. Rowling that you were hoping to meet once again. I thoroughly enjoyed this effort, and it became a real page turner in very short order. This is a very adult J.K. Rowling in both the use of language and in the tough issues that she investigates.

author: BamaLover
title: It makes you think
body: This would be a great book for teens & adults...especially with focus these days on bullying. Book starts slow & there are a lot of characters for the reader to become familiar with (I would suggest simple notes) but I was quickly drawn in to the dynamics at play.

author: Liz Williams
title: None
body: This was one of the most emotional reading experiences I can recall in a very long time. These characters became so real; flaws and all.  Each of their scenarios really reasonated and I found myself unable to put it down even though it was uncomfortable and almost unbearably sad at times.  I think this book is a contemporary masterpiece in the vein of the Harry Potter series but an entirely different subject matter.  sometimes it is possible to write a story that reflects real life and offers hope and light depite the darkness and Rowling achieved this in spades.  Read this book, reflect on it...you wont be disppointed.

author: Kimberly Denz
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: The Casual Vacancy is painful, beautiful, uncomfortable, dark, funny; but mostly it's honest. Rowling's gorgeous prose is familiar to Harry Potter readers, and her storytelling is as masterful as ever in The Casual Vacancy.

author: Johann
title: not great, but I liked it
body: Book was good, not great

author: essbeepee
title: Disappointment
body: I bought Ms. Rowling's book out of curiosity. If my opinion can save any of you from reading this very disappointing trite piece of airport trash, I will have done you a favour. The characters are one dimensional and stereotyped, the situation contrived. Ms Rowling must be a very dark person, none of the characters have ANY redeeming social value. The children hate their parents and do teen age rebellious stuff (who would imagine such a thing?) The grownups are either drunk, having sex with the wrong people, violent, or terrified. Everything gets worse, in a totally predictable way. Its like reading a trashy People type magazine about people you would never want to meet in a place you would never want to go. Give it a miss!

author: Janette
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I was wanting to read this to see if I would love JK's adult fiction as much as her children's  fiction, unfortunately I didn't.

author: Gramz
title: R rated
body: I was soooo disappointed in this book.  I would never have expected the author of the amazing Harry Potter series to write a book like this.  I am a 57 year old grandmother, but am selective about my reading.  This book is definitely R rated and NOT suitable for kids.  I repeat . . . NOT suitable for kids.  I read some and then skimmed the rest. It was vulgar and crass.  There was an abundance of sex and profanity. If this is the type of book the public wants, it's a sad commentary of what we find entertaining.

author: Mark W
title: Disappointing
body: Slow moving. Bounces around. Rather boring. I read the Harry Potter series and truly enjoyed it. Based on the literary value of that series my wife and I purchased Casual Vacancy expecting the same level of fast paced intrigue. We are both reading the book and have both set it aside for now as it doesn't hold our interest.

author: Susan D
title: Not Harry Potter
body: I enjoyed reading The Casual Vacancy very much.I thought it was very well written and the descriptions of the characters were very believable.I did,however,think one character may have been based on Uncle Vernon from the Harry Potter series.The plot kept me interested throughout the book and although the ending wasn't totally unexpected I did find it extremely sad.I hope Ms Rowling continues to write books for adults as she seems to be totally in touch with the real world, which is quite unbelievable considering the fantasy world we have come to know through her previous books.

author: Taylor
title: I liked it
body: I liked it.

author: sps4
title: Miserable, unreadable
body: Doesn't matter who wrote it. It's not a good book. The plot and storyline are my cup of tea, so Iif anything I was biased toward liking it but by page 20 I was sad and disappointed that The Casual Vacancy was not to be the cozy "someone died in a small English town lets have a look at everyone's lives" story I'd anticipated. Not sure who would enjoy this book. Someone already miserable and cynical and dull, who's also not looking for an escape from all that.

author: Allison
title: I actually returned this book
body: This author goes so far out of her way to differentiate herself from Harry Potter that she goes completely and miserably overboard. The words got in the way of the story so much so that I could not even get past page 40. This book was offensive and totally lacking any reason to hang on and persevere.  I returned the book.

author: artistchick46
title: Absolute Trash
body: This book is the biggest disappointment! JK Rowling has prooven that she can write characters that we love and that we love to hate in the HP series, but you don't see any of that in The Casual Vacancy. Either the characters are not worth mentioning or just disguising because of their behavior and disregard for others. What a waste of time, money and energy. JK Rowling should stick to what she knows.

author: Grammybaz
title: A book that no intelligent reader should waste his time on
body: There is no reason to describe every scene, every person, every home or relationship in such base and disgusting terms. PIMPLES AND SWEAT, BELLY BUTTON HAIR AND WIGGLING CONTROSEPTIVES, FILTHY BATHROOMS AND SOILED DIAPERS, OBESE MEN AND SWEARING TEENAGERS ALL MAKE THE BOOK A DISGUSTING READ.I CAN ENJOY A WELL WRITTEN SEX SCENE AS WELL AS THE NEXT BUT THIS BOOK MADE ME CRINGE AS FAR AS A COULD READ IT.

author: Margaret R. Tomczak
title: Enjoyed it. A little rough in spots,
body: It took me a substantial amount of time due to visual impairment and no dedicated long uninterrupted periods for reading.Good character development. Clear setting descriptions.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Not a Keeper
body: I am an avid reader and my home is small, so I've learned to categorize my books as 'one-time reads' and 'must own for life'.  One time reads are borrowed or loaded on the Kindle.  Must own books are hard copies to be kept forever.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Magical in its own right
body: Characters and plot were very excellent!  If Rowling wants to write more adult books, this is off to a great start for her.  I love Rowling and I always will!

author: Norm 43
title: ENJOYED THE WRITING AND CHARACTERS
body: FIRST-TIME READER OF THIS AUTHOR.  I DIDN'T READ ANY OF THE HARRY POTTER BOOKS. ENJOYED HER WRITING STYLE, AND THE CHARACTERS.  THE PLOT WAS OK, PROPOSING A GENERAL THEME OF MAN'S INADEQUACIES, ALONG WITH HIS BLINDNESS TO HIS OWN SELFISH JUDGEMENTS. CERTAINLY HIGHLIGHTED MAN'S PREJUDICE AND JUDGMENTAL ATTITUDES TOWARDS THE POOR AND MARGINALIZED.  IT WAS AN ENJOYABLE READ.

author: Beverly Debenedictis
title: Bev's Opinion
body: I thought this book was okay and, no, I was not comparing it to Rowling's previous books.  I liked the characters but didn't think the story was interesting.

author: Dusty
title: Casual Vacancy
body: I was looking forward to a captivating read. Very disappointing - boring! It reminded me of a soap opera.  It went on and on and on with no pizzazz.

author: Rose Strickman
title: Rowling's Trying Way Too Hard
body: I knew this book wasn't going to be another Harry Potter.  I knew it was going to be a "literary" novel exploring humanity's darker side.  But I didn't expect this.

author: David Carney
title: What a Great Read!
body: Most of the negative reviews complain of a lack of story line / plot.  I agree: there really is no "plot."  However, that said, this is an excellent read-it is absorbing, entertaining and contains fantastic dialogue and character development.  Congratulations to J.K. Rowling on a work well done!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Just Harry please
body: I find the book boring. It's like reading a soap opera. The plot is lame. After reading 70 percent I jumped to the ending because I couldn't take it anymore and of course the ending is a let down. Overall the entire book us one big let down.

author: Diane K. Bird
title: Heartbreaking
body: I found The Casual Vacancy to be absorbing, engaging, often darkly humorous, and ultimately heartbreaking. The many characters were well drawn . It didn't take long to learn who was who even though the relationships were complex. Highly Recommened.

author: FoothillCouponer
title: It's just NO good! Vulgar language swearing on Cd
body: I pre ordered this on cd....Gosh...I'm on the 2nd disc......still slow and boring, and the swaring is too much! With all the swearing and vulgar nasty language I cannot listen to it at work in my spare time.

author: Bookworm
title: Behind closed doors
body: Hard to put down. Believable plus entertaining, start to finish.  These people are as real as your own friends and neighbors.

author: vickie
title: Get from the Library if you feel you MUST read it!
body: I'm upset that this book was such a disappointment. I read all genre of books, so I didnt start reading this expecting another Harry Potter. I did expect to be drawn into the book and unable to put it down. and it was so bad I found reasons not to read it.

author: Jack C.
title: Jack don't like it
body: I have tried three times to "get into" this book. Each time I have been unable to get any meaning out of the story line and just put it down in frustration.

author: MamaW
title: Good, but a departure from the Potter vein
body: I am enjoying The Casual Vacancy, but not as much as the Harry Potter books.  Guess I was hoping for the page turning can't-put-it-down experience of the other books and this is an entirely different animal.  It is good, just has different pacing and so many struggles for each of the characters.  To be honest it is a bit depressing, but picks up very nicely in the end.

author: Rex Katz
title: Excellent story - Compelling and Gripping - Classic
body: I thoroughly enjoyed the book. The darker side of human nature is often disturbing and not easy to write about. These characters are real - they mirror many a family and acquaintances. Don't make the mistake of comparing this book to children's book. Compare it to Dostoevsky, or Dickens or any of today's popular authors like Deaver, Kellerman, Childs, Sandford, Grafton, Crais, etc. - Then you see how JK towers above them.

author: nadia
title: Good read
body: The storyline was OK and it was enjoyable, not earth shattering, but good solid enjoyment. This is definitely not a Harry Potter type story, and I would recommend it.

author: yvonneadrienne
title: A big disappointment
body: I purchased the book on its release day and have not been able to get into it.  I go back to it when I am trying to sleep and it helps me to nod off.  Usually, after a short period of time, I can get into a book, but it is not happening.

author: K. Coonce
title: Great Book
body: This is a great Book.  I really love the way the author writes.  My only issue with the book is that if you are not British you might have a hard time understanding some of the words she uses.  Other than that the writing and vocabulary is awesome!

author: Dagny
title: What is the point?
body: I loved all the Harry Potter books.  So I was eager to see how JK Rowling would do with an adult novel.  I have not finished the book.  Not sure I will.  There are endless characters--too many to want to keep track of--especially with no real dramatic point as far as I can see.  Perhaps there is a surprise ending.  But right now close to 50% of th book read, I am still wondering what it is.  Small town English politics may be of interest to some--but I have not been hooked half way through the book. Usually, books I choose grab me in the first chapter--this book has gone way beyong my grab factor.

author: My Little Pony Girl
title: A Different J.K. Rowling! For adults only
body: First, let me state that this is NOT a book for children!!!

author: Steve
title: Compelling, powerful, adult, gritty and ultimately optimistic
body: JK Rowling has mastered another literary genre in "The Casual Vacancy."  She provides the reader with a powerful and compelling look at poverty, class structure and small town life in modern day Britain.  Her story combines drama, social commentary, dark humour and ultimately a message of optimism about the human condition presented through a cast of fascinating, flawed, complex characters whose lives are entwined in the web of English village life.

author: jan
title: Casual vacancy
body: The characters were VERY well developed but it just took too long getting to the

author: emilie00
title: A casual vacancy
body: Very clever premise, very complex interwoven plot. Enjoyable seeing teen characters as major players in an adult novel The most interesting character- `Fats'- lovely. The story saved by being balanced. It didn't condemn the middle classes while it poked derisive fun?  Didn't condemn anyone specifically- all of us- antiheroes.  I thought it less about class distinctions and more about human condition. Soul has to express itself someway - rare heroes like Barry Fairbrother make the most of what life has to offer while the majority  of us squabble & squander it tragically. The internet shown as a damaging force- Fat's facebook bullying- but also as a positive force for the silent sufferers - Andy & Suhkvinder  who found a voice  there & got their messages across.

author: Indy
title: Big let down
body: Not only is the book CRUDE, it falls way short of the level if writing that J.K. Rowling is capable of. The story took a long time to get into and when it did get moving just wasnt that good. I skimmed 20% of the book just so I could finish it. I will be deleting it off my kindle. Pass this book by!!!

author: asibe
title: CASUAL VACANCY
body: This was a very well written book but overall I found the storyline depressing hence only gave it 2 stars :(

author: Robert Griffiths
title: I loved it
body: I enjoyed the story, and the way this book was written; simple as that.

author: Anonymous
title: ZERO stars
body: I would give this book ZERO stars (or negative stars) if that was an option. I am returning it for a refund at Costco. It's just depressing, disgusting, and crude.

author: Deborah s
title: Some uncomfortable truths
body: Glad she had the talent and courage to write this. A different genre but equal skill, a great read. Do hope we see more from Ms.JK.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good character novel
body: This book delves into the minds and motivations of the residents of a small town. JK Rowling's talent for creating full, three-dimensional characters truly shines. The people are in turns generous, flawed, tortured, selfish, damaged, intelligent, and loving. Getting into the story is a bit slow until you get the hang of who's who, but soon you feel yourself being pulled into their lives. You'll find yourself chewing on the resolution for days. It's not a happy-go-lucky story by any means, but more a story of humanity and what we choose to do with our fragile human lives.

author: Rebecca
title: A bit of a downer
body: The Casual Vacancy is filled with, and told from the point of view, of many different characters from the small town of Pagford. Somehow with the number and variety of characters we are introduced to I can honestly say (aside from a few moments here and there) there was not one single character I liked. The citizens of this town from young to old were for the most part unlikable, petty and obnoxious to name a flaws. It is is a testament to the writer that despite this I continued to read this novel and see it through. The novel goes on and on cycling through the character chronicling the events in the town following the death of Barry Fairbrother and up to and after the election to fill his vacant council spot. The entire book I was expecting it to build to a big finish, which it did for the most part. This was full of social and political commentary told through the events in a seemingly normal small town. Worth the read and shows Rowling's talent in that despite being known for and spending so much time living in and building a world that is now so well know she is able to go in a completely different direction and write something so different.

author: N. Bery
title: An Excellent Story of Characters
body: I must admit I bought this book because I am a huge J.K. Rowling fan.

author: Annalaura Brown
title: Not that great
body: I'm having a hard time finishing this book. It's got quite a few swear words as well which really bothers me and it's kind of boring. Being a big Harry Potter fan, I find it hard to believe that the same author even wrote this book.

author: kayhart
title: Casual Vacancy
body: I am an avid reader (I read every single night before bed no matter what) and was very excited about the potential of this book. Had been looking for a month for a good one.  My kids grew up on Harry Potter and all the hype about this "adult" content novel was overwhelming. Now I realize that it was just that, marketing/hype,  and I was sucked in.  I have been trying to read this book for several weeks.  It does not hold my attention and has so many characters that I have to re-read 3-4 pgs. back. each night.  I am now into it for the price of the book w/Amazon so I will continue to struggle through.  A  racket and a disappointment.  Waste of money.

author: Pamela Hines
title: the casual vacancy
body: A very enjoyable read. I enjoyed how each character was woven into the plot as they interacted and influenced each other. Very reminicent of Maeve Binchy.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The Spell Has Been Broken...
body: First, I would like to preface this review by stating that I am an avid Harry Potter fan (I'm in Ravenclaw, if you must know), and maybe that was my problem -- my expectations were too high.  In HP, I genuinely cared about the characters.  I felt for them -- I felt connected or impacted in some way by each of them.  Even as an almost irrelevant character, I felt compassion and sadness for the father of Cedric Diggory when he was murdered.  Unfortunately, I cannot say the same about A Casual Vacancy.

author: Mary Ellen
title: Such a disappointment.
body: Such a disappointment. Knowing what a skilled writer JKR is and her amazing creativity I purchased this book with high expectations. What a let down. I found the characters to be dull and no one was likable so I didn't really care about them or their situations which were not very interesting anyway. The first fifty or so pages were just introducing the characters. I tried to read it to the end thinking it would improve as we went along but it didn't seem to be heading in that direction so I gave up. There are plenty of good books to read; why waste my time.

author: Sam Falkner
title: Better than I Hoped
body: I've always like J K Rowling's work, and wasn't sure what to expect here. I knew she was breaking genre. Would it be awkward? Would it work? I'm happy to find that it worked very well.

author: SPT2011
title: Incredible descriptive writing - but just not for me
body: This book is very well written. JK does not disappoint with her incredible descriptive writing. The imagery created while reading this book was the best I have ever experienced, along with the Harry Potter books.

author: orcadeb
title: A grim tale brilliantly written and narrated (audio version)
body: I had been looking forward The Casual Vacancy and particularly the audio version read by the brilliant Tom Hollander ever since I first learned that he was doing it.  I may be a bit biased being a huge fan of anything Mr Hollander performs. He has the uncanny ability to paint a visual image of each character in whatever story he is reading. I am also a fan of JK Rowling and the two together are pure magic though not the Harry Potter type by any means. The story is grim and there are a lot of characters but somehow you become a part of their lives and by the end I found myself with tears in my eyes, wondering what they were doing after the story ended. In my opinion Ms Rowling has proven that she can write anything! I can't wait to see what is next!

author: Higgie
title: Human Nature
body: J.K.Rowling's novel, "Casual Vacancy", should be on the book list of every psychology class in human nature.  She went right to the depth of who we are.  I am amazed at her insight and the way she wove a tapestry of human nature, in a pleasant read.

author: Katie
title: Boring!
body: Had mediocre expectations for this book, despite loving the Harry Potter series, and I am still disappointed.  In my opinion, it has a very slow start, uses too much British slang (makes it difficult for an American audience to follow at times), is short on plot and a little on the dark side.  About 3/4 through and haven't finished it yet because I don't find it to be an enjoyable read.  I do not recommend it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Pagford ain't no Hogwart's!
body: Some reviewers have given this book one star based on the price, and while I will say it is much too expensive for a digital book, my review is based on the book itself.  Let me add that I was given this as a gift - I never would have paid so much for a digital copy.

author: D. Williams
title: Rowling can do SO much better than this
body: THE CASUAL VACANCY, Rowling's first novel for an adult audience, takes place in an English village called Pagford.  A member of the parish council, Barry Fairbrother, has died suddenly of a brain aneurism, leaving the casual vacancy - the British term for the need to fill a vacated seat on the parish council.

author: Cathy
title: Better than Harry Potter
body: I read Harry Potter books and enjoyed them however Casual Vacancy is by far better written, and more interesting.  It definately attracts a different audience and maybe that is why some people are disappointed in the book.  Harry Potter fans will be disappointed in the down to earth plot (no wizardry) and more indepth character development. I think it was one of the best books I read this year. I couldn't put it down.

author: Patty L.
title: Not as expected
body: This book isn't exactly for adults. Teens could read it & learn from it. I wouldn't recommend anyone pay what I paid for it on kindle, that's for sure!!

author: katielmr
title: Only ok
body: I bought this book asap because i am a huge fan of J.K.Rowling, however this book was nowhere near as captivating as any of the Harry Potters, I know they are in no way comparable but to be honest i haven't even brought myself to finish it, its a struggle to read.

author: navymomma26
title: Confusing
body: This time JK introduced too many characters at one time. The book is hard for me to follow and I would rather go back and read 50 Shades of Grey all over again. She should stick to young adult fantasy books.

author: Lady D
title: Fantastic book!!
body: What I loved about this book is that each and every character is 'disgustingly human'.  They are our friends and family, our neighbors and co-workers, and even ourselves.  Ms. Rowling reminds us that "the line between good and evil cuts through every human heart".

author: Dr. Trish L.
title: Disappointed.
body: I was very excited waiting for JK Rowling's first adult book to be released---even pre-ordered it. The disappointment came from the fact that she is still writing about children, or should I say, adolescents in this case.  She did a wonderful job with character descriptions(and there were many), however, I was hoping that the plot would be over-the-top excitement. Next time I'll think twice about getting another one of her "adult-themed" books, if there is one.

author: ECV
title: Slightly dull
body: A surprisingly dull offering which focuses on character descriptions for the first 100 pages. The latter half of this bleak book becomes slightly more engrossing. I am an avid fan of Rowling's writing but I was disappointed with this book.  I also think the sympathy with the teenage characters places this book more in the young adult genre -- it would seem that there are very few adults with any redeeming qualities I this tale.

author: Hounds of God
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: After 25 pages I was done. Not a prude, just tired of all the foul language. $$ down the drain.

author: Lady on Corbin
title: Engaging Read!
body: Was very interested to see how JK Rowling would handle an adult book and was not disappointed. The characters were intricately drawn and captured your interest.  The twists and turns kept you wanting more.

author: iphone4-toronto
title: Glimpse of British village life
body: I had heard a friend complain that this book was long, boring and depressing but I totally disagreed, I loved it!  It is not a fast-paced read, and it is not action-packed, but that's not what it's supposed to be.  It is a glimpse of a village in Britain which is small enough so that just about everyone knows just about everyone, or is connected in some way, and everyone gossips about everyone else, and everyone has an opinion (and feels superior to the opinions of others).  I also loved the separate worlds of the parents and the children, sort of like an upstairs-downstairs juxtaposition - the worlds are inextricable, but totally different.

author: KsanaO
title: Not Harry Potter
body: Reading the reviews here, I think that many of the readers are doing J.K. Rowling the supreme disservice of secretly hoping for an adult version of Harry Potter while reading this book.

author: Karen
title: Disappointed
body: Reading this book was like watching an endless episode of Survivor in which you see the degradation of humanity.  It was the British commoners at their worse or "white trash" hypocrites.  I wanted to scream at those self-absorbed characters that if they hate their friends and family, leave the situation or change your own attitude!  The class distinctions, racism, and sordid swearing at family and friends in front of them and behind their backs was disgusting. I am no prude.  I swear occasionally but this was over the top!  I found the whole read boring and full of blue language with "f_ _ _ in'" this and "f_ _ _ in'" that.  The audiobook gave me a whole new insight to the uppercrust sound of British English.  They can cleaverly put you down or in your place with the most debonair of accents and witticisms.

author: Donna Hartpence
title: DWS Kindle Books
body: This was a very interesting, even though sad, story from our favorite wizard Author, J K Rowling.  Though the plot was simple there are interesting character developments and interactions/links that made for a theme about people and their personalities and how what they did or didn't do had consequences that affected all of them.  There was a bit much obscene language but not so much that it made the reading a bad one. It was enjoyable and would recommend it to fans of Rowling and modern mystery, or social readers.

author: john kelso
title: A Casual Vacancy
body: A Casual Vacancy is a good read. J.K.Rowling writes well for adults, too.  One criticism:  at times I had trouble keeping up with the characters. There were plenty of them, and they moved quickly from plot twist to plot twist. But the book was entertaining, and it struck at some serious points -- such as the ongoing  fight over how  the fortunate should deal with the downtrodden. The book spoke to the battle between those who want to help the poor, and those  who want to keep all their stuff and everybody else be damned. As a side note, American readers will pick up a lot of British speak from reading this book. Who knew that "shagging" means, well, never mind.

author: SD
title: The Casual Vacancy review
body: No one can deny that J K Rowling is a talented, imaginative writer with great vision and the ability to create fascinating plots, realistic characters, inspiring settings and important themes; however, in her debut adult novel, some elements are less than stellar.  The basic premise, exploring the characters in two adjacent towns as they fight to fill a vacant council seat, has some merit, probably, but I had trouble distinguishing the characters and caring about them.  Eventually I did end up caring about a couple of them and Rowling succeeds in making them believable, but the theme is disheartening and the outcome depressing. Buy it to see how she writes for adults, but don't expect the quality or enchantment of the Harry Potter novels.

author: annie
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I could not get past page 30, I felt like I was reading Shades of Gray. If I could return this book I would in a heartbeat.

author: ADDICUS
title: Casual Vacancy, no wizardry here!
body: J.K. wanted to get away from Hogwarts with Casual Vacancy, but where she went needs Harry's cloak.  I read 5 chapters and J.K. must have won a Quidditch Race and been awarded the universes's largest thesaurus.  J.K.'s chacters are many and without soul (who cares).  Five years in the making, Casual Vacancy reminds me of an open book essay question in high school where you don't want to leave any thing out and a one page assignment becomes a ludicrous

author: Kindle Customer
title: not Harry
body: A true English novel.This author never disapoints in settings, characters or plot.Was sad when it ended.Looking forward to the next book by this author.

author: Chandler Foster
title: WHAT???
body: Ok... I have to admit, I bought the book because of the author.  In reality, I don't usually read books based in England.  However, I have to say it captured my attention and kept it throughout the book.  The characters were typical "little burg" mentality... and they were charming to say the least.  But the end... the end... came so abruptly, I felt like I had just walked off a cliff... no warning.. no logical end to the book.  (Hopefully, this is the author's way of telling us there will be a sequel.  So in short, it was a good read until the abrupt ending...

author: ELS
title: A moving work about politics and responsibility
body: This book stands alone, bearing the mark of Rowling's talent without hearkening HP too directly. Yes, the end-of-chapter cliffhangers are still there, and so is the dark psychology of the characters; but this is no children's novel. The power of this book comes from its multi-voiced storytelling, through which the reader accesses the inner worlds of a web of community members, all of whom are inexorably self-absorbed, fearful, and suffering. You will recognize yourself in all of these characters-- the adults and their teenaged children. This book makes your heart race, your stomach churn, and your mind question. You will be caring about its characters long after you've read the final page. Flanked by funerals, this story is a distinct kind of 21st century tragedy that you won't soon forget.

author: Librarian
title: Audience?
body: If this was supposed to be a book for young adults, it may grab a few of them, but if it was supposed to be for adults, the author failed miserably.  It is boring, discombobulated and hard to stick with...it may be the first book I don't finish.

author: Jane Easterly
title: A brilliant and powerful novel that is incredibly difficult to read
body: Harry Potter author J.K. Rowling's new adult book The Casual Vacancy is a brilliant and powerful novel that is incredibly difficult to read. Rowling proves in this book what a skillful writer she is. She is able to create characters so complex, so multi-faceted, that it's hard to remember they aren't real.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Truly great read!
body: I bought this book after reading several lukewarm reviews- mostly comparing this book to Rowlings previous works.  I decided to go into reading this as if I had never heard or, or read anything previously creating by the author. I loved this book!  The storyline is fantastic, and draws you in to all the families in the story.  You can't help but identify with the characters.  She shared with the reader a special talent in this book- showing depth for every character, and how you never really know someone or what has brought them to this place in life.  She took each character and gave you the good and bad that exists in all of us.  She also knows how to tell a story without giving away the plots too early.

author: Conitis
title: After a slow start, a compelling read
body: This was the first JK Rowling book I've read, but I had heard good things about from everyone who's read the Harry Potter books.  I found getting to know the characters in about the first quarter of book a rather slow affair. However, once I knew all the players the story really picked up and the book was hard to put down.  I really enjoyed developing strong feelings about the characters and really caring who would prevail in all the conflicts going on in Pagford.  I look forward to Ms. Rowling's next venture into adult novels.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Underwhelmed
body: Not my favorite...I find her writing style difficult and her characters not well developed, or rather disjointed.  I am disappointed and would have returned the book had I purchased it traditionally.  Sorry...I had been anticipating its arrival....

author: Ann Ominous
title: Gritty
body: I have never read a Potter book... That said, I found this to be a great read.  It was a bit difficult to grasp all the characters, went back a few times to reorient on who was who. Worth the effort. Not for kids, but that was made clear prior to it going on the shelves. It wasn't a happy story but you routed for the foul mouthed heroine all the same.

author: Dina @ All The Stacks
title: Enjoyable Social Commentary
body: I have so many thoughts about this book and must preface with a little bit about my own personal beliefs. I am a very political person (I am very active in county and state-wide politics). I would identify as a liberal. All that being said, I found The Casual Vacancy to be a well-written social commentary.

author: Mariann Grace
title: Disappointing... J.K. Rowling, please try again!
body: Having read and re-read the richly allegorical Potter series, I was hoping for a novel as thought-provoking and endearing but at an adult level.  After reading 130 pages, "The Casual Vacancy" just doesn't deliver.  The characters aren't likable, or even interesting;  the drama and story seem pointless.  I really don't care what happens next, there is nothing compelling in the first 25% of the book that makes me want to keep reading.  Rowling describes her characters dispassionately, much like Stephen King... many times I actually felt like I was reading the beginning of a Stephen King novel, just waiting for the first sinister or other worldly event to occur!  The problem is:  nothing like that happens, and the only real horror lies in wasting one's time reading about these characters' dreary, colorless lives and musings.

author: E. Ollie
title: An Emotional Ride
body: JK Rowling knows how to create a world. I came to really care about the characters and their lives. This is not a "happily ever after" kind of tale, youll want to look elsewhere if youre looking for hufflepuffs and rainbows.

author: zoshi
title: Loved it!
body: Chatty and immediately comfortable to read. It has well-observed characters, nowhere near as much profanity as some reviewers would have you believe, and a really decent, plausible story line. A really good holiday read - not highbrow "literature".

author: Arya&Xander'sMom
title: Whip Lash
body: I, like so many others, was extremely intrigued about what JK Rowling wrote about in her newest novel.

author: jocflier
title: What a disappointment!
body: Same detailed character development as the Potter series, but very poor plot development.  And I became seriously tired of reading about highly dysfunctional families.  Not an enjoyable book.

author: Dr Agana
title: The casual Rowling Reader: Not half bad
body: Just because everything has been said about a book doesn't mean more can't be said, right? The first I'd say (though certainly not the first to say it), looking at the number of reviews it has prompted in record time, is that if it weren't for this author, there wouldn't be that many. But neither would there be this well-rounded, engaging, fine story. So the standard for me was: Would there have been just "fine" shrugs, or more, with another, less-famous writer? Was J.K. Rowling under a particular obligation to write a better-than-fine book? If you've read even one of her--here goes, I can't not mention it--Harry Potter books, you've already pre-formed an opinion. I've only read the first, and I thought this was better.

author: Cathy Ann
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I WAS NOT looking for a Harry Potter repeat but what was described as a "dark comedy". The whole book would be better as a TV show like "Eastenders". I read & read waiting for something to happen, but read in vain. While well written it was very dull. It did make a point about poverty & Rowling's charitable cause of helping poor children & promoting literacy, but offered little else. The characters were well presented but the book as a whole can be missed. If you want to read it borrow it from your local library, J.K. Rowling & her publishers have enough money, save yours. For "dark comedy" I would encourage everyone to read Terry Pratchett's Discworld books. Best written satire on the planet!

author: openmind
title: no place to hide
body: This first adult novel of J. K. Rowling has a Jane Austen-ish tone to it, in how it lays out the land, but that's where the similarity ends. Ms. Rowling sliced open all the souls to the core, revealing all of their weak and ugly sides to the degree that there's "no place to hide". She painted the pictures so clearly, not to mention deftly, sneaking up on you, that when outrage finally pours out it can afford to do so without any doubt or apology.

author: nannie801
title: What a bore!
body: This book is so awful I quit reading after the first 20 pages...it seems that in order to be ADULT you have to be as crude and vulgar as possible with no story line in between the nastiness. Where did the writer go that wrote such engaging books that adults loved and read them right along with the tweens in the household? She certainly lost her muse with this thing...don't waste your time or money...I'm taking it back tomorrow and having learned my lesson, will NEVER read anything she "writes" again.

author: A. Wolcott
title: Poor language choice
body: So sorry to see that she has fallen for the F___ word.  I detest that word and it's use, multiple times, in the first chapter has encouraged me to throw the book in the garbage.  I will never buy another foul language book by Rowling as I am extremely sorry I wasted money on this trash.

author: Nikki
title: A sad but good read
body: This book is different than others because it follows about 15 different characters rather than just a few.  That made it hard to get into at first: remembering all of their names and backgrounds and connections was very confusing in the beginning.  But once I understood what was going on I found myself very drawn into what was happening.  I'll be honest- this isn't a very happy story.  There was a little bit of dark humor but also blatantly depressing points throughout the story, and it was all set against a slight political background which was interesting.  I think Rowling did a good job of showing how desperate people can be to achieve some sort of happiness, but I would have preferred a slightly happier tone.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Wonderful book!
body: I don't understand the negative reviews that I read.  Yes, in the first part of the book there are a lot of characters to read about and digest but if the information wasn't there the rest of the book would not make sense.  Once I was past the first part, I absolutely devoured this book.  The story was in some ways dark but so is life.  I got "involved" in the plot to the point that I felt I was in the middle of the story myself.  It grabbed me in a way that few books have recently.  It wasn't a happily after after kind of story but that's part of what made it real and personal.  Real life doesn't have many "happily ever afters" either.  I hope Ms. Rowling writes another book for adults - I will be first in line.  Three cheers and five stars for THE CASUAL VACANCY!!

author: Helen BB
title: An engaging look at real life
body: Casual Vacancy was a page turner from the beginning. The characters are well rounded and engaging. I feel sure I have met many of them in my time. For the people who are critical, I suspect you need to move on from Harry Potter.  Yes - they were fantastic books, but so is this. I'd say this is neither better nor worse than Harry Potter - just different. JK truly is talented to be able to write such diverse works - no one trick pony.

author: VBH
title: I sooo wanted to like this book
body: It was just a struggle to read. I kept hoping that there would be a point to the story but there didn't seem to be. JK Rowling writes well, no doubt about that but the characters in this book just seemed flat and uninteresting.

author: Alice
title: I loved it!
body: I loved this book.  It is very internal which I adored - lots of what people are thinking versus how they are acting, their motives, how they view those around them and why (I would love to be - and a little scared of being! - JK Rowling's friend.  She is so perceptive!  I would constantly be wondering how she was assesing me, ha!).  Very well written.  I devoured this.

author: Amazon Customer
title: casual vacancy
body: very difficult to read,didn't have any sort of flow,too many characters waffling on about nothing.

author: Potter Fan
title: Boring, had to force myself to finish it.
body: A dark story about life in a small town. The emphasis seemed to be on the struggles of teenagers, perhaps that was the target audience, not adults? I'm sorry I bought the book.

author: Craig Waldon
title: A good read
body: I like her writing style. Very descriptive and I really enjoyed the book as the characters slowly revealed themselves. The story had to end somewhere but I found the ending a little disappointing. It seemed to wrap everything up too quickly. Perhaps I wanted more, did not want the book to end!

author: walnut
title: Getting motivated to move on is a struggle
body: It's been a real struggle to read this book.  I really have to push myself to pickup where I left off......I can't believe that I am only 10% thru the book.  Very slow...

author: H. Thomas
title: The threads of hope are thinly woven
body: As a huge fan of the HP series, it was a surprise to read Casual Vacancy.  The plot was sound, but the only character with any redeeming features such as compassion or kindness died in the first few pages.  I found it impossible to care what happened to a cast of such mean-spirited people.  Only the teenagers had any depth, and I kept waiting for something good to happen, for some to have a change of heart and grow. Disaster heaps upon disaster and what little hope arises is too little, too late. The book ends as it begins, with death.

author: Stacye P. Murphy
title: Welcome to the real world
body: First two things, this is not Harry Potter and its not a comedy.  It is one of the best written books I have read in a while and I applaud Rowling for going to this little perfect town and exposing  the closed doors and minds of its inhabitants. These people do walk among us and if we look inside ourselves deeply we might even be them.  Excellent read!

author: Mark Twain
title: Great read
body: I don't know why everyone is comparing this to Harry Potter. It is not Harry Potter. It's a new book. I believe it would have received better reviews if it was an unknown author. I thought it was a "great read."

author: SuzieDoozie
title: Brilliantly Unexpected Tale of Humanity and the Lack Thereof
body: I am a huge fan of "Harry Potter"... I'm talking HUGE--As in, I've read all the books several times and I listen to the audio books often.  Most people have the radio, I listen to Grammy Award Winning Jim Dale read J.K. Rowling's seven-book masterpiece.  That being said, I was excited and at the same time very wary when news broke that Rowling was writing a new book unrelated to Harry Potter.  How could she measure up to a standard she had already set so high, and in a genre so different from what she's always written?

author: KSDisque
title: A Casual Vacancy or a Colossal Waste of Time ?
body: Horrible, depressing, pointless book.  The characters were despicable in general, and never fully developed.  The story drags along.  For American readers, lots of British slang which didn't always make sense.

author: Dooley
title: You requested a star so I gave it one. I would not normally give it anything!
body: I regret purchasing this book.  It is dreadful.  The language and smarmy descriptions were not what I expected from J K Rowling.

author: Usha Rajendran
title: A disappointment!!!
body: Rowling is disappointing in this book. Though it is interesting in parts and has an easy flow, I wouldn't recommend this book. I do hope her next book will be interesting as she IS a good writer.

author: gardengirl
title: Dull, depressing, unengaging
body: I started this book with great anticipation and kept reading hoping I would eventually begin to find it interesting, enjoyable, etc. This never happened. I could have cared less for the characters. The plot was a snore. Perhaps not living in England makes it more difficult for me to embrace the story. I still look forward to Ms. Rowling's next writing project.

author: Amazon Customer
title: An insightful glimpse into the lives of others (and maybe ourselves)
body: As with most others, I had to calm my inner craving for more Harry Potter and try to move on.  After I was able to do that, I was impressed and was able to enjoy A Casual Vacancy.

author: Stacey R. Willman
title: Casual Vacancy left me feeling vacant.
body: I read books to escape my world for a little bit.  When you read a book, you do not want to go to a world that is worse than your own and without adventure.

author: D. Holmer
title: I think it wanted to be "Confederacy of the Dunces"
body: Who doesn't love JK Rowling?  I have no joy in criticizing her work here, but I think this is a book that tried too hard to reflect something the author wasn't.  I think Rowlings had in mind to craft a comedy like "Confederacy of Dunces" but didn't digest it enough for the end result to go in as "in-your-face disgusting human behavior" and come out as art.  It was all just too raw.  Why so raw?  She is skilled enough to write a "Confederacy of Dunces" type book.  But this one makes me think of the ingenue actress who spends years on the big screen becoming the world's sweetheart and then decides she wants to be known for deeper work, but rather than doing deeper work she bares her breasts on screen.  I always feel a little embarrassed for her when she does that.

author: A. G. Mattocks-lewis
title: Great read
body: I have to admit, I was a little apprehensive about reading this book as even as an adult i just loved the Harry Potter books. However from the first opening lines i had put aside my reservations and immersed myself into this book. I thought it was a fast paced and complex read. I loved the book start to finish and even though I could see what was going to happen it still had my heart in my mouth and a little tear in my eye by the end. There have been mixed reviews about this book, but I would suggest you read it for yourself and give it a try. I loved it

author: Pam Quattrone
title: Boring and long!
body: I was so disappointed in this novel. I was expecting much more. It was very long, and I had to force myself to keep reading it ( because once I start a book I have to finish it). Toward the end it got a little exciting but that didn't make up for the rest of it.

author: Michael Burke
title: Yay!
body: I loved the writing in Harry Potter and I am not disappointed here. The plot:  a dead council members job needs filling. More than politics, Fraught with internecine and family and friends conflict.  She has painted the feelings and personalities every bit as engaging as the Potter books. And there is adult language.

author: Bruno P. Baumberger
title: Disappointing
body: After having been thrilled by 6 large Harry Potter volumes, I bought the book the first day expecting a similar experience. I fought through the first 80 pages of the new book. I found it boring and I gave up. I will give it another try at some later time.

author: Peter Garganese
title: the Casual Bore
body: I was finally going to read a J.K. Rowling book, but was somewhat disappointed. This book is kind of boring!

author: Dixie Grace
title: A British Peyton Place?
body: What a great read!  While the premise of the book (the multi-faceted relationships between folks in a small town) has been done before, this one is set in a small village in England, which lends it an entirely different feel.  J. K. Rowlings continues to write beautifully, with some lines so finely sculpted you want to go back and read them a second and third time. You get the impression that Ms. Rowlings knows life in a small town intimately, with all the ugliness and pettyness that that entails.  The many characters are very well developed, but you find yourself wanting to read on to learn even more about them.  Looking forward to what she comes up with next!

author: boliveras
title: casual vacancy
body: Stop reading cause it not what they said it was. Fifty shades was a better book. This one is not good at all

author: Pink
title: Interesting characters and story
body: I'm not sure why there are so many negative reviews on the profanity and subject matter, this is no different that a lot of other adult fiction books I have read.  That being said, this book has very interesting, if not very likeable characters.  I had a hard time deciding which one I disliked the most!  Some are pretty despicable. The story is interesting too.  I like the way each chapter is from a different person's point of view.

author: Floo Powder
title: What was she thinking?
body: I waited on pins and needles for this book to come out and bought it on the first day it went on sale.  I sat down with it and got about half way through and decided to see what other people thought about the book.  OK, so I'm not the only one who thinks this book belongs no where else but the trash bin!  But I read on thinking there has to be a point to all the swearing and "shagging".  Nope!  I finished the book and its in the trash where it belongs.  I've never read a more pointless book in my life.  Again, what was she thinking???

author: Larissa
title: A much-needed story of truth
body: As a teacher of English literature, I'm thrilled by The Casual Vacancy. The characters are rich and captivating. The story is intricate and honest. I can't wait to invite my students and colleagues to explore their own reality mirrored in this monumental literary triumph. Do yourself a favor, and allow the truth of Rowling's masterpiece to pierce the thick wall of your existence.

author: fifie
title: The casual vacancy
body: This was a fabulous read - while I havent read the Potter series I now understand why she is considered one of this century`s great writers.  The development of the characters combined with the ability to make you like them one moment, feel sorry for them the next moment and then hate them a second later is a rare gift in writing. Her ability to weave so many stories yet keep the plot tight is also very good. From memory I think I was told it was light hearted comedy - dont be fooled by this description - yes there are some laughs but Rowling isnt afraid to go to some very dark places yet manages to leave you feeling uplifted and retain your faith in the human race.

author: Anne G. Henry
title: Casual Vacancy
body: One of the best books I have read in years.  Adult language and situations but reflects life as some people must live it.  One of those you can't put down.

author: Gabrielle McCann
title: Loved it
body: AS soon as I finished this book I immediately started it again! I loved how Jo drew you in as a reader - I wanted to find out more about the characters. Great book!

author: Berecca
title: I know these people.
body: This book was not as novelly as I had expected because it was impossible for me to really care about any of the characters.  The story had too many weak entanglements and I thought it ended quite abruptly.  There wasn't one main character, really, but a variety of background characters of greater or lesser importance.

author: Jessica B.
title: Quite frankly the characters are boring
body: Before I start my review, I want to make it clear that I only read 25 pages of this book (and it took me 5 days to even get that far because it wasn't keeping my interest). I also want to make it clear that in my life I have not finished about 6 books and this is one of them.

author: E. Smiley
title: Brilliant in unexpected ways
body: This is not my usual genre. For me books about modern life generally fall into at least one of the following categories: pretentious, boring, saccharine or trashy. So I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed this book, which I read out of curiosity; in fact I was completely sucked in, living in the book rather than merely reading it.

author: anthony scandiffio
title: dribble
body: This book is very slow and so tedious to get involved with.

author: Lori
title: It's a mediocre read
body: I am a big fan of the Harry Potter series and as such, I was not expecting anything like that from Rowling's first adult book but I WAS expecting a riveting tale and The Casual Vacancy just isn't.  I read a couple of books a week and get into the characters pretty fast, but I kept forgetting who everyone was and that's not normal in a book of about 500 pages.  It's not a bad story, but it's not a great story either.  The characters in her other books (HP) make them great books but the characters in TCV were nothing special.  I wanted so much to love this book.  I didn't.  :(

author: Sean Hallissey
title: Disappointing...
body: While I understand that, unlike the Harry Potter series, "The Casual Vacancy" is to be an adult novel.  Unfortunately "The Casual Vacancy" just hasn't captured my attention like Harry Potter.  I will most likely finish it because I paid for it, but this makes me sad.  I wonder why I am wasting my time. J.K. Rowling is a goof zuthor, but I think her niche is Children's Liturarure.

author: Rebecca W.
title: Loved it!!!
body: I absolutely loved this book!!! It is nothing at all like the HP books and it stands very well on it's own. I had to double check the author a few times because it is so different.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Not worth the 3 days I wasted on it
body: I was looking forward to reading this book, but as I kept reading, I kept thinking, it's got to get better...it never did.  J.K. Rowlings' Harry Potter series was so well written, clever and insightful.  This book is just diappointing--there is more dysfunction than a Real Housewives show---I kept reading just to be able to say that I'd read it all the way through--and secretly hoped there would be a better storyline as I read.  J.K. Rowling should stick to what she does best---this isn't her finest hour.

author: kenusee
title: Muggles in Dystopia: a disturbing read, but it will stay with you
body: When I read the Harry Potter books, I thought they were beautifully crafted. I bought this book because I wanted to see what J. K. Rowling would give us next.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Beautifully Tragic
body: Barry Fairbrother's death is the catalyst that changes the lives of numerous people in the small village of Pagford.  JK Rowling has intricately woven together seemingly unrelated characters in her first "adult" novel.  She tells with heartbreaking honesty about the lives of both adults and teenagers in a small English town (that could just as easily be in America).  At the heart of the tangle of lives is Krystal and Robbie Weedon and Barry Fairbrother's death was the beginning of the end for them too.  Husbands and wives, fathers and sons, all of their secrets are revealed and you just might recognize yourself in one of these oh-so-human characters.  There is no magic to make their lives more bearable (but magic never did that at Hogwarts either) and people learn that they must live with the consequences of their actions, or lack of action in some cases.

author: Katie M
title: Kept Reading Expecting It To Get Better
body: I pre-ordered this book on the assumption that any work from her would be very good, and quite possibly great.  I was wrong.  It is not that good, and certainly not a great read.  It is one of those books, that the reader sticks with, expecting it to get better, or expecting at the end to realize it made a point or an impact.  Again, to me - it did not.  To me it was a mediocre soap opera.  A story that might play better on screen, in a series like Desperate Housewives, than written as a novel by an author as noted as J.K. Rowling.

author: Forget Housework, Read!
title: Making a great story out of "normal dysfunctional" families!
body: Alot of characters introduced quickly, but once you get into it a great and fast read.  Suggest you write down the couples names as they are introduced in the book with a key word to remember them, or you will find yourself going back chapters to remember them and their "dysfunction" (which is harder to do reading via the Kindle.)  This is especially a help if you don't read alot in one sitting.

author: Deb
title: Disappointing
body: In spite of high hopes, this foray into the adult genre lacked a story line that would have been expected of Rowling.  While the characters had the depth she so exquisitely bestows in her writing, I found the storyline uninspiring and the mood of the entire novel to be bitter and depressing.

author: Lady Judith
title: Rowling's new venture
body: I don't know what I expected, but was rather sad after reading this book. I expected so much more.  The writing was fine, and the intertwining of the characters was good, but just too English for me, I guess. My personal opinion would ask that the author should stick to fantasy. I am glad I read it but will not be on my re-read list.

author: Ames
title: Loved it.
body: I've read a lot of books this year. Some have been multiple narrators, most have not. I'm a big fan of the multiple perspective genre that seems to be becoming more popular these days, and absolutely loved this book. As for everyone saying that the characters did not hold their attention, I can not disagree more. The characters were so realistic and detailed, and the writing was fantastic. The characters were exaggerated for entertainment, rather, they were very much like you and I, but perhaps some a bit more gritty. It was a wonderful story that I would definitely read again.

author: H. R. Allen
title: Just realize this is by no means a childrens book!
body: I will attempt to leave no spoilers. I hate reading reviews with spoilers.

author: Francis
title: Gritty plot a long way from Harry
body: JK Rowlings new book has achieved her objective of being a long step away from the Harry Potter series.  It is a gritty novel which is unyielding to sentiment.

author: Carolyn Zalon
title: Much Awaited Book
body: In J. K. Rowling's book Casual Vacancy, we experience the author's release from the restrictions of writing for children. As many authors and actors eagerly admit when they get to go to HBO, it is a relief to swear brazenly and discuss all sorts of questionable topics and not worry about censor.  Rowling's teenage characters exercise great hostility and disillusionment towards the adults closest to them as adult failings are literally advertised one by one. Rowling also takes on the tension ever present between the haves and the have nots and brings up the topic of entitlement so much part of the current presidential debate in the U.S. The novel is a serious look at reality.

author: Viv
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: This book holds your attention all the way through, although with so many characters i did sometimes get confused as to who was whom sometimes, but very good reading

author: Etexan
title: Casual author
body: I have read all of the Harry Potter series and loved them . This book is boring at the beginning and gets worse.

author: Parispony
title: Casual vacancy
body: Full of caricature rather than character with many reminiscences of Harry Potter characters it is an easy read but not a compelling one.

author: Rascal's mom
title: Horrid Book
body: This is one of the worst books I have ever read.  There is not one sympathetic/likeable character; the book has no redeeming quality.  The profanity just seems to be gratuitous.  I really hate that I pre-ordered the book because I enjoyed the Harry Potter series so much.  Now I've paid more for this Kindle edition than for any other I've purchased.  If I had a hard copy I would just throw it away; donating it would just make it available for someone else to waste their time on.

author: the casual reader
title: Dont Waste Your Time
body: I was drawn to this book because of my love of the Harry Potter series. I of course knew that it wouldnt be anything like the Harry Potter series, but my respect for JK Rowling and her ability to transport me to another world through her writing was what I expected. I must admit, I hated this book.  I knew that this was written for adults, but come on.  The language, the graphic sexual content, and frankly the boring topic made it impossible for me to complete the book.  The question I have is if JK Rowling did not have the previous successes that she already had, would this book even have been published?  My opinion is no.

author: Millie
title: A Good Yarn
body: I enjoyed this story but found the number of characters confusing especially in the first half of the book. Still worth the read  !!

author: Margaret
title: pl
body: This was a decent book, not nearly as entertaining as her Harry Potter books.  The problem is that her characters were too cartoonish and none had any redeeming charachteristics so that you wanted them to do well.  It was a bit disappointing.

author: CatieOlovestoRead
title: Big Shoes to Fill
body: I tried not to think of this book as a JK Rowling book-- because there was really just no way it could compare with Harry Potter.

author: Big Griff
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Having returned reciently from England I find this look into West Country English life very interesting.  The Characters play very well and the insights into young minds facinating. Unfortuniately, the portrail of adolicent morals is all too close to the mark.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Somewhat disappointed
body: I have long been a fan of JK Rowling and was delighted to see a new book from her. I couldn't wait to get started and the first few pages with her typical way with lush descriptions of characters didn't disappoint.

author: Translucent
title: hmm
body: You know, J. K. Rowling has a huge amount of talent, and if you use Tolstoy's definition of art as something that makes you feel as if you were right there, then Ms. Rowling is definitely an artist.  Yet I hate every character in her book.  They could use some magic all right, but there isn't any to be had.  It was an extremely depressing experience, reading this book, and that is because of the author's extreme gifts.  I noticed, incidentally, that she still most values the Gryffindor mentality.  Courage and loyalty still seem to be her most admired qualities.  But other than that, such human misery!  Well-drawn, well-observed, yes.  Enjoyable to read, well, I'm not so sure.

author: Wendy Buckley
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I was very disappointed in this book. The foul language was unnecessary, and I felt took away from the story. I have not read the Harry Potter series, but I expected more, given that her books were so popular.

author: Joan M. Williams
title: None
body: I found this book to be a great disappointment.  The writing was excellent but the story was very unimportant except to the characters themselves.  Rowling killed off the only truly likeable characters at the end.  It was difficult to remember all of the characters and keep their relationships straight.

author: Book Mother
title: Too depressing
body: I read this book because I loved the Harry Potter books.  This book is not nearly as well-written or easy to follow, nor is is nice to read.  There is really not a redeeming person in the book; there is no joy; there is no real redemption.  It is sad and depressing to think that everyone in the world has such serious problems as those that JK writes about here.  I finished it, but had to force myself.

author: Di
title: Poor
body: Was really disappointed in the boook.  It has not grabbed my attention.  Wish I would of downloaded the free part of the book before purchasing

author: kim m fowler
title: a very SLOW read!
body: First book in some time that i haven't finished.  I read at least a book a week and after 6 chapters, i had to move on.  Hard to follow; and just not all that interesting!

author: Mark Twain
title: JK Rowling
body: Very good read; Rowling is obviously capable of stringing a lot of detail behind the plot.  I was not aware of this kind of ability to craft a novel.

author: AshleyP
title: JK Book Review
body: This is an excellent book from JK Rowling as a first novel for adults. As a huge adult fan of the Harry Potter series, this lives up to every one of my expectations! Worth every penny!

author: M. H. Bayliss
title: A bit of a chore to get through
body: I tried to read this book with no preconceived ideas about what JK Rowling might write. Judged on its own merit independent of the HP series, this book is DARK. Rape, drug addition, seriously disturbed characters,viscous family relations, compulsion disorders around pedophilia, self inflicted cutting... this is not a light read. There are more messed up teens and parents in this small town than seems humanly possible. If that's the point that everyone is a hypocrite and has a hidden agenda, then she made that point well. That being said, the writing was sharp, the intertwined lives of the characters well conceived, the depiction of the town was vivid, but I found that I had to will myself to finish the book, mostly because there are really no sympathetic characters in the whole lot of them. You end up alternating between feelings of intense dislike mixed with pity for most of the characters and that fact kept me from really enjoying the book. I feel like I survived a 3 day ordeal just by finishing. My conclusion is that JK Rowling is a very perceptive writer with a sharp grasp of people's character flaws, but deep down I wished she'd touched upon some redeeming features of humanity. I felt like I needed a shower after finishing this book. Sure, she brings up many important social issues but you have to prepare yourself for a bleak few hundred pages. Whatever comedy there is more along the lines of "funny/sad" not funny/funny.

author: booklover
title: Casual Vacancy
