body: I have just read Casual Vacancy and while I enjoyed it some of the english words were confusing. I am waiting for the next book by her.

author: Laura0417
title: Great characters!
body: First of all, let me just say, not about Harry Potter = Boo!! But once I got over the hope that Harry would make an apperance in this book...:) I really enjoyed this book. The subject matter is definitely gritty at times, but very real. Too real. Definitely an adult book. But the way J.K. Rowling writes the characters is amazing. Even the characters you hate, are perfect. The story sucked me in right away, and the way it all is pulled together in the end is amazing. I especially loved how each character is tied to the others, through someone who knows someone, or someone's kid works for another character, or their kids are friends, and their stories cris cross back and forth at different paths, each character touching another's lives in different ways, whether for good or bad. Highly recommend this book as a great story, written by the best, but be ready for lots of swearing, descriptive drug use, and sexual situations.

author: JCW
title: give or take
body: This book is so-so. It wasn't something that I would read again. Maybe all the pre-release hype made it anti-climatic for me but it didn't hold my interest.

author: Judi B
title: Save your money.
body: First, let me preface this with I loved the Harry Potter series.  It is hard to believe that this was written by the same author.  This book was a major disappointment to me. I have only stopped reading a couple of novels in my 64 years and this was one of them.  I made it about as far as I could.  Enough said.

author: Janice L Smith
title: Casual Vacancy
body: Too many characters,  plot is confusing and doesn't seem to flow together with all the different scenarios going on.  Lost interest

author: Lyndac
title: Very good, but could be better than very good
body: There's a large number of characters and that you get to know as each chapter or section moves on, this is enjoyable, you become involved in people you can believe in. The build up of the story is slow and precise, soon you're living in the fictional world and are less and less surprised as the characters unfold. My only disappointment is that the end came - well, too close to the end. I'd have liked to approach the end of the story more slowly, to have had more time to revel in it.

author: Eileen Engle
title: Casual Vacancy
body: Well written. Rowlings captures the diverse personalities of the town's characters and their foibles.  Poignant in the descriptions of the intertwined relationships of the characters.

author: T. Anderson
title: Dark but couldn't put it down
body: Loved this book.  While many of the characters were pretty unlikeable, I still couldn't wait to see what happened to them.  Ms. Rowling is a consummate storyteller and this book is no different from HP in that regard.  It's dark, yes.  It's certainly not for kids but really, can't we all recognize a bit of each of these creeps in some of the people we run into in our daily lives?  Their innermost thoughts are just what I imagine certain acquaintances and co-workers have in their heads too! :-)  I look forward to more books in the adult genre from Ms. Rowling.

author: Mary
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Disappointed!  I loved the Harry Potter series, but this book never reached that level.  Far from it.  Sorry I wasted my time.

author: Rod Petree
title: Lost Time
body: I did not see any plot or purpose to the book. It probably would interest a female (I'm male) reader more because it is oriented toward people and familys. It is well written but I do not think it is JK's style. I would like to see her do a continuation of "The Girl with the Dragon Tatoo" series.

author: Mickey
title: 1st book of J.K. Rowling I have read
body: I saw all of the Harry Potters movies and enjoyed them. The first few more than the last ones. I know people who have read her books and was told how wonderful they were, so I was excited to read a book of hers. She is a good writer but the theme of this book was not my cup of tea.

author: Barbara A
title: Addictive
body: I am still reading this first book for adults by J. K. Rowling but totally absorbed in the characters she has painted with glorious color, humor, flaws, jealousy and survival.  It's a story about years of the rich dominating the poor,  as well as about detached parents and angry kids. I have not arrived at the resolution of all the issues brewing, but strongly feel that I will be delighted at the end of the book.

author: Bookreporter
title: Readers expecting the charm and magic of Harry Potter are in for a surprise
body: Imagine for a moment that you are J.K. Rowling. Your internationally bestselling novels about an orphan boy who attends an imaginary school for wizards and witches, over which you labored for 10 years, have sold hundreds of millions of copies. They have been translated into 73 languages and turned into eight blockbuster movies. Harry Potter is now and probably will remain a household name for decades. You are reportedly the richest woman in England (even richer than your queen), quite possibly the world. You are A-listed for every conceivable event on the planet. Would you rest on your laurels, perhaps buy a private jet and a yacht or two, and tour the world?

author: Safira925
title: A Haunting Psychological Perspective of a Small Town
body: So everyone knows JK Rowling wrote Harry Potter, and that this is her first adult-only novel, and that it is nothing like Harry Potter, right? I have to wonder if the shift in style, as well as the anticipated release ( and subsequent reality of the preceding facts) has prompted all these one-star reviews. Honestly people, we were warned!

author: PatE
title: Better then expected
body: Although it took me a few chapters to become engaged with this book, I am now looking forward to every opportunity to read it.  The characters are well developed.  Although one can sense where the story is leading it stills hold my interest.  No doubt this will end up on a best-seller list.

author: BrandyWinn
title: Wonderfully Gritty
body: Definitely not Harry Potter, but just as engaging for adults.  And it is for adults only.

author: SteinbeckFan2010
title: Disappointed
body: Not the Rowling I know and grew to love. Such a complete letdown. 15% through the book and none of the characters were interesting enough to make me want to read more. I don't usually leave books unfinished, but unfortunately this is one of the very few that belongs to that pile.

author: nancy of new york
title: Terrible
body: This is a really sick view of humanity. There is not one decent intelligent character. Very disappointed. Rowling could have so much more imaginative in character development

author: Wendy Napier
title: Not what I was expecting
body: Interesting story, but not at all what I was expecting, very slow in the beginning, with an abrupt ending. Don't know that I'll even read it again.

author: Joan
title: Casual Vancency Disappointing
body: I was very disappointed with this book. To me it was very depressing and I had to force myself to finish the book. I am a great fan of Rowling, but this is one book that I would not recommend...

author: Shelly Horton
title: Surprising
body: I warmed slowly to the book at first but by the end I thought it was genius. I was amazed at the raw emotions, abject poverty, and despair she talked about and yet it is supposed to be a dark comedy.  I work with kids (and their parents) who are socially comparable to her characters from "the Fields" and I felt it too realistic to get much humor from it. It is also a story on race and political issues and that part was funny but at the same time, I felt, a window into the sad reality of how social climbing and power can be so very corruptive. Overall I was captured by the characters.

author: lily
title: Casual Vacancy
body: I am finding it difficult to finish this book chiefly because I consider it to be young adult/teenage material. It is slow moving and does not for me have adult appeal.

author: Ksenia Anske
title: Bitter, sarcastic, delicious, nasty. This is J.K. Rowling you don't know.
body: Bitter, sarcastic, delicious, nasty. This is J.K. Rowling you don't know. Ghastly, loving, disgusting, bleak, sensual, murderous, lusty. This is J.K. Rowling you never read. Real, human, mundane yet complex and heartbreaking, The Casual Vacancy is a story of one man who did more by dying then he did by living, a story penned over an idyllic English town that is all sparkle on the surface but rotten guts inside. Or is it? What J.K. Rowling did here is take the grit of ordinary life and elevate to the heights of beauty, with all of its daily drama, dirty politics, gossip, abuse, neglect, rape, violence, drug addiction, bullying. The list goes on. Rest assured, every aspect of our imperfection is touched upon, and masterfully at that.

author: Judijudi65
title: What were you thinking?
body: J.K., what were you thinking?  A mundane book with unforgettable boring characters in a trite story.  That her characters are unforgettable is usually a good thing however, this book was so trite and depressing I wish I could forget the characters...unfortunately they stay with you long after the story is over and not in a good way.

author: BookCity2012
title: Very Well WRITTEN but NOT for the faint at heart
body: The Casual Vacancy is a very well written book. The breaks in the chapters are all lead into by the character mentioned in the previous section. Its a rather clever way to wright. It goes round in circles and makes the story very easy to read. The characters are complex and there are sublites to the story that you have to think on. The Casual Vacancy it may be but the book is anything but casual.

author: reader
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Very slow, language not good, characters not interesting or appealing.  Difficult to finish, she should have stuck with Harry Potter.

author: sweet girl
title: DISSAPPOINTED TO SAY THE LEAST
body: After watching Rowlings on TV interview, was very anxious to get book from local library. Put name on the waiting list and hurried to library once called.  There is NO WAY I can make myself finish reading the dull, dreary, depressing book.  Only half way through I have taken notes and there are 47 characters thus far! I have really, really tried hard to get into this book.  I stopped to come read reviews here to see if it was just me.  Thank goodness I'm not going crazy and others feel as I do.

author: Jenni Bellin
title: Because she can
body: With great interest and excitement I began this first non-Potter from Jo Rowling, and it did not disappoint. Both sad and entertaining, it is a social commentary on small town culture and the danger of taking oneself too seriously. Jo has that knack of familiarising you so well with a character in such a short span, that even if you cannot like them, you empathise. One cannot help but become involved, rather then just merely objectively viewing the story as a whole. I hope she keeps writing. I for one, am sold.

author: C. Fazio
title: Overblown and overrated
body: Expectations were high that JKR could transition from Harry to adults.  Disappointed with the results. An easy read but not of the quality we have grown to expect from this author.

author: OhioPat
title: Great new read from Rowling
body: J. K. Rowling has brought her considerable talents to adult fiction.  There is much to laugh, cry, and think about in The Casual Vacancy.  This is a book I would read again.

author: hearthside
title: Wow! Wow! Wow!
body: Amazing book!  Rowling captures the "real" world - the world of liberals & conservatives, bullies & victims, rich & poor, old & young - in her first adult novel "The Casual Vacancy".  Her characters are fully realized, flawed members of the human race with all their capacity for love & kindness as well as mean-spirited stupidity.  Rowling has successfully created the same kind of magic here that she brought to "Harry Potter": she has invented fictional people who become real to the reader.  These are characters to love, to hate, and to mourn.  This is a place to live in and know - the way we know our own home town - and the way we know Hogwarts.  A fantastic achievement!  I can't wait to share this book with my adult friends who've grown up with Harry Potter!

author: B. Holley
title: PHENOMENAL
body: What a great book. I am a huge JK Rowling fan and was wondering how her next offering would fare. It is totally different than her beloved Potter series and it is just wonderful. What a great voice she gives to the community and how wonderfully she weaves her spell of the impact that a death has on everyone involved. She ends it all wrapped up in a huge bow of satisfaction for this reader. Next?? I can't wait.

author: M. Blades
title: Back in Little Whinging...
body: It was well written and I did enjoy it. That said, I did prefer the HP series to this offering by J.K. (which is probably my preference in books over any flaw in the writing). All in all, a good read, but if fantasy/upbeat comedy is your thing you just might be sorely disappointed.

author: Krissy
title: Disapointing, waste of time and money.
body: I reserved this book the moment I heard about it and anxiously awaited the release date.  It was a huge disapointment.  There are way too many characters and to make it even more difficult they are all dull and have nothing really remarkable about them.  Their names seem similar (or perhaps I was just that confused) and then adding in the various nick names for the various characters who have nothing exciting about them, I spent most of the book thinking "now who the hell is this?"  I wanted to tough it out and get through the book in case something got exciting, but it never happened.  It was a long, painful read.

author: kennglen
title: Compelling
body: This was not a children's story, but it was a great read, and I found I could not put it down until it was finished.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Bad Parents Beware.  Retributions can be severe
body: The things these English parents did do their children without even thinking about them finally caused the downfall of careers, and worse, a death of a young teen who was on the brink of being saved by the one person who cared about her and died an untimely death.  I think Rowling harbors a great deal of anger in her soul towards adults who are unkind, uncaring, and unfeeling towards their children.  This was evident in the Harry Potter series, but the young had recourse to magic.  In this book, the young have no recourse other than revenge by anonymous internet sabotage of the adults who have been monstrous or just plain stupid in their dealings with children and teens.  Personally, as I grew up, adults around me were so engrossed and occupied with their own problems, hang-ups and leftover hurts from their own childhoods, they were not able to see their own children objectively

author: Some Chick
title: A Big Novel
body: Just finished J.K.Rowling's "The Casual Vacancy".  I'd say it is the antithesis of Harry Potter.  Hard read (compared to HP), cast of dozens and all omniscient up in there (though I luv watching skilled writers break rules, as a writer myself I kept mentally whispering "No Sir!" followed by "You go Girl!").  Wow.  Brilliant. All I can say is it is worth the effort it takes to read.  Though I sincerely hope the next book will take us inside a few more pleasant minds.  If it's not a classic, we've allowed our short attention spans to ruin us.

author: Grace
title: The magic is gone
body: This book really makes me upset. One thing that J.K. Rowling was excellent at was making even the characters you didn't like, likeable in a way that kept you interested. There was not one character in this entire book that I liked or thought was the least bit drawn out. It's as if she wrote a book every crappy person she's ever met and tried to write a story around it.

author: David A. Appling
title: Bleak, sad, tragic, but never banal.
body: Rowling's venture into the adult (very adult) novel is good, but no Harry Potter in any way.

author: Missusan
title: satisfied my curiosity
body: As a reader of the entier Harry Potter series (twice) I already knew J.K Rowling was a writer who could grab you & keep you interested, but I was curious how she would handle a different kind of story.  In my opinion, it was harder to get into the story (Harry Potter books were engrossing from page 1), but once I got into it I wanted to keep reading, and the expansion of the story was surprising and went in directions I didn't expect. So I would definitely recommend this book and look forward to anything new from this author.

author: R. Martin
title: A detailed study of human nature
body: Human behavior fascinates me, and this detailed exposition absorbed my attention to the extent that for much of the book I forgot to look at the Kindle indicator at the bottom of the screen. Rowling clearly is a keen and perceptive observer and listener, and her facile use of dialect and vocabulary of each character is accurate and consistent.

author: rynbaskets
title: Slow start, sudden ending
body: This book depicts typical conservative small town in England. As in the Harry Potter series, Rowling is masterful in building up characters, but the storyline moves so slowly and once the expected tragidy happens, bamg, the book is over. I was left perplexed.

author: Reviewer
title: Wonderful
body: Could not put this book down, not just because of the intriguing plot but also because of the great writing. It is amazing that after so many years, Rowling is still able to keep me up and night turning the pages.

author: Heather168
title: A good read,  unsatisfying end.
body: I was very keen to read this book, and did read late into 2 nights to finish it. I love a good mystery story, and the plot was well-developed. Just found the end unsatifying... makes me wonder if Rowling intends to write a sequel.

author: Patricia
title: A very engrossing plot from a masterful writer
body: Wow - I thought this was a powerful book.  Since I've never read any of the Harry Potter stories, I was curious to read something by J.K Rowling.  It is not easy to get into - there are so many characters to keep track of.  I finally had to resort to writing down a list of characters - something I haven't done since "War and Peace and all those Russian names - but the list really helped.  The other reviewers have covered the plot - a small English town full of politics and dysfunctional families.  But what a plot Rowling can weave.  Some of it is so realistic as to be hard to take - particularly the bullying of teenagers (my least favorite part) but I quickly became engrossed in the characters and stayed up very late last night to find out what happened to them all.  I plan to read parts of it again.  If you like a good story with many characters and excellent writing, I can definitely recommend this book.

author: CAW
title: So disappointing
body: I was so looking forward to reading this book as I am a huge Harry Potter fan and think JK Rowling is a genius. However I just cannot get in to her new book. I have read almost 50% and am struggling to get in to the story at all. It is as if the author is trying too hard. I sure hope the story picks up or I may not bother finishing it. Harsh words from someone who has read each of the Harry Potter books  at leats three times.

author: cakelady
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Still reading but find it well written and very enjoyable and I'm more than halfway through,

author: Jane Freeman Wilson
title: Will there be a sequel?
body: Firstly, those people getting upset that this is not a kid's book/not Harry Potter really need to read more about a book before they buy it. It was categorically stated that it was an adult book, and not more HP. Secondly, I thought this book was excellent. I just finished it this morning, and I really would like to read more about the people of Pagford, as soon as possible. I was completely drawn into this very real and well written world, and if I have any disappointment, it's that the book was not longer, and that there isn't (yet) a sequel in the works. The characters were three dimensional, and interesting, and I have absolutely met many similar "types". Yes, there were a lot of characters, but this is a story about the inhabitants of a town - and to fill that larger picture, you need a big cast. I could see this novel translating easily to the small screen, perhaps over 5-6 episodes - I would love to see that in fact. Perhaps at some point, J K Rowling can shake off the mantle of Harry Potter and write more novels like this. I would absolutely invest in another one, and hopefully I will get the chance to do so.

author: KARIN
title: THE CASUAL VACANCY
body: I HAVEN'T FINISHED THE BOOK YET,BUT AM ENJOYING IT.  THE SOCIETAL JUDGEMENT AND THINGS WE COVET IN SOCIETY ARE DETAILED PERFECTLY IN THE STORY!

author: krissi
title: plot?
body: Wow! I knew going in that my expectations of Rowling were too high so I put that aside and prepared to read. Currently on page 70 and I'm pretty sure I'm throwing in the towel soon. There's no plot.... No one seems to be able to say this is a book about____. So in the midst of a sea of dark random moments, characters I can't stand, and cursing I think I'm done

author: Judith A. Zaleski
title: Vacancy in Thought
body: This is one of the worst books i have ever read.  It is about a small town filled with residents who are  dark and depressing.

author: James W. Havens
title: A Casual WHAT ??!!
body: After writing seven books without a swear and nothing more sexual than a little "snogging" JK let herself go wild.  I am concerned because some of the Harry Potter material was taken from her childhood so if some of her childhood is included in this book she needs counseling. The book details child abuse on every other page, which inclused neglect, emotional, and sexual abuse.

author: Minnie
title: Yuck!
body: I pre-ordered Rowling's new novel, thinking that a writer with her imagination and story-telling ability would write something else that was at least half as good as her previous works. No dice! This book was so crappy, I didn't fully finish it. I got through four chapters and couldn't stand it any more, so I just skimmed and speed-read the rest of the book.

author: Lorelei
title: The Casual Vacancy by J.K. Rowling
body: I really enjoyed this book. It reminds me of a Maeve Binchy type novel. All about the little town Pagford and the towns people. Definitely a good read!

author: mary
title: Casual Vacancy
body: It was very overated. I did not enjoy enjoy reading it. I only finished it because I spent money to buy it.

author: Jen
title: Disappointed
body: I really like the Harry Potter books, so I jumped at a new book by J.K. Rowling. So far I am pretty disappointed. There just isn't a plot to this book - I feel like very little has happened and the entire book is just snippets of the characters relatively depressing lives. To be honest, I'm only about 35% of the way through - and if my assessment changes, I will come back here and change my review. I WILL FINISH THIS BOOK! Even if it kills me - mostly because I paid $17.99 for the kindle edition. Totally not worth it. Maybe the author should stick to writing young adult.

author: Ktb
title: A change and very different
body: You can't expect to know what this book is going to be like  Jk Rowling writes an intriguing novel that whilst slow and really not much happens till the very end she keeps it ticking over enough that you struggle to put it down. I thoroughly enjoyed it however I do get a little lost in stories that every chapter is  told by 'a difference perspective'.

author: Carla Lilie
title: We're not at Hogwarts anymore
body: Poverty.  Addiction.  Racism.  Abuse.  Alienation between spouses, and between children and parents.  These are some of the issues J. K. Rowling writes about in "The Casual Vacancy", her first novel intended for an adult audience. And these are real-world issues even harder to overcome than Voldemort.

author: Kathleen Alexander
title: Vacancy review
body: Vacancy was very slow moving.. hard to get into the characters.. too much time spent on characters ruminations and not enough substantial action

author: Artguy149
title: Not very entertaining
body: I went into this book with an open mind, fully understanding Rowling wanted to do something totally new from her Harry Potter series. That said, I was left thinking, why should I care? While the characters are excellently fleshed out, like people you might really meet, the entire story has a rather parochial feel, like a gossip column in a small town. After several chapters I wondered when anything relevant to me would happen. If you like a story about bigger themes, the wider world, this is not the book for you. If you like a small, regional story about petty people you might enjoy it.

author: jogo
title: a casual reading
body: not all bad. she should return to the style who suits her better. I have faith in the future of this writer

author: Ronald E. Parsons
title: A First-Rate Book by a First-Rate Authoress
body: Whatever else Casual Vacancy is it is a marvelously drawn account of true, largely-unrecognized virtue hidden behind the gritty exterior of the teen-aged girl Krystal Weedon from the wrong side of the tracks in small-town England.  Among the few who saw value within her was the man around whose death the book's story is centered.

author: Karla Hatfield
title: Loved Harry Potter and loved this book!
body: This book showed a completely new side of JK Rowling and I really enjoyed it. The book was very honest about people and their feelings and thoughts. It reminded me that people are fragile and can be severely misunderstood. At times I would confuse the characters because there were so many of them, but after the first fourth of the book I had them all straightened out.

author: 'laine
title: First Adult Book-teenagers' viewpoint
body: This book was advertised as Ms. Rowling's "first adult book".  While the subject matters were adult, I found the book was mostly centered around the teenagers' point of view and not from the adults...I was disappointed.  I was expecting an adult book about adult matters and centering around the adult characters.  I would not recommend this book to friends without explaining this point...If I had known what the book was really about, I would not have bought it.

author: starrie
title: speedy~
body: i got this book really quickly .. i am a super fan of JK ROWING in harry potter of course. but this one is also what i'm looking for~

author: padarn princess
title: Slow start ...
body: I have never read a JK Rowling book in my life (Harry Potter just didn't appeal to me) and I was curious to read a book by the author. The book is a slow burn.  The first half of the book introduces the reader to the characters, most of whom are hard to like. I continued to read the book as it was quite an easy read and suddenly found myself gripped and couldn't put it down. The issues highlighted in the book are a sad reflection on society and all our petty prejudices, however, a few of the characters manage to transcend the hopelessness portrayed in a few of the characters narratives.  I enjoyed the book - but it's not life changing.  The best part is that I can now say that I have read a JK Rowling book!!

author: analies
title: A "modern tale" of human relationships.
body: Sad story, not really a mood enhancer, but well written.  Some of the terms are specific for UK.  Felt that the storyline was all too real.  Did a good job of developing characters, and motives for their behavior.

author: md
title: Nothing Casual about The Casual Vacancy
body: The Casual Vacancy is a very interesting story about the interactions between people.  J. K. Rowling gets into the minds of her characters, and does an excellent job of showing the characters point of view.  The story is about what actually happens to real life people and the games they play between themselves.  This book is a wonderful read, and it can teach you so much about the interaction between different social statuses of people, the goodness and the evil mischievousness.

author: Catherine
title: Succumbing to Mainstream
body: J K Rowlings in her book Casual Vacancy has succumbed to a genre that is based on reality, but delves into the world of sensationalism. Her fantasy is much faster paced and exciting...rather than boring. This reader found some pages were worth skipping.

author: Wilma
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I was so looking forward to JK Rowling's new book.  I love her story telling ability, however I was very disappointed in this story.  It really left me flat.  To me, the characters were not very interesting and the story did not keep my interest.  Sorry, but I cannot recommend this book.

author: M. A. Vanhuizen-husselson
title: disappointment
body: First time I am reading anything from this writer.So far it does not live up to its expectations. Very all over the place and not a very good storyline (I think).I would not buy a second book of hers.  (sorry!!)

author: lupinelady
title: casual vacancy
body: Expected more from this book.  Difficult to follow the many story lines.  If I had been able to read it in one day I probably would have found it easier.  Wouldn't really recommend this book for purchase.

author: HP lover
title: Amazingly thought provoking
body: This book was fabulous, heart wrenching and depicted flawed people at their worst. Characters were well developed and beautiful. Looking forward to her next one!

author: James M. Arrington
title: Definitely not Harry Potter
body: A novelist who switches genres (i.e., from children's fiction to adult fiction) risks disappointing her fans.  The reviews I've read so far speak to the dissonance Harry Potter fans feel when they encounter a novel that echoes (in my estimation) those of P. D. James.  James's characters are seldom likeable, but James strives for truth-telling:  most people, in life as in her novels, are not pleasant people.  The same is true of Rowling's new novel:  telling the truth about one's characters is what Rowling's novel is about.  It's not sweet reading.  But it has the punch of truth:  the truth, as Rowling sees it, is not pretty.  If you want pretty and nice, stick to her novels for children;  if you want to understand human nature, read The Casual Vacancy.  The only problem I had with The Casual Vacancy was keeping track of who was who and how the characters related to one another.  But I'm willing to think that this problem is MINE, not the author's.

author: Sketchy
title: Great read
body: I think the key to enjoying this book is to not expect Harry Potter with adult content. There was always going to be huge pressure on JK Rowling to deliver the goods with her book after Harry Potter and I believe she has.

author: M
title: Sheer Genius of Character Exploration
body: After reading so many negative reviews, I approached this book with a bit of trepidation, wanting simply to put a toe in the water by reading the first few pages. What I found was one of the most engrossing pieces of literary composure of our time.

author: Dennis S Gardner
title: Not a good book.
body: Surely the English people have not become as sickening, hateful and archaic as J K Rowling describes?  The personalities in this book are full of decadent thoughts and actions, with very few redeeming characteristics.  I found each character hard to believe, which spoilt this story for me.

author: A casual observer
title: A new favourite
body: Every review of this book seems to start with 'This is not Harry Potter..' and that's correct, it's not. And as long as you're not expecting Harry Potter you'll be fine. Otherwise you might want to go read, well, Harry Potter.

author: Bobbie
title: Casual Vacancy
body: I expected a different type of story. Too much about teenagers and their sexual habits and not enough about the adults.

author: Amazon Customer
title: No one to root for
body: Throughout the book you continued to hope it would improve, that something would occur to spark your interest.  This never occured.  The were no likeable characters, no one to cheer on, and in actuality just remained a very depressing book.

author: puzzlemaze
title: Huge disappointment
body: I couldn't imagine that JK Rowling could write an awful book after Harry Potter, but, sadly, she has.  This book is unreadable-- it's world is miserable, sadistic, hateful, bleak and totally uninspired.  And couldn't her editor have clued her in to the fact that in print, a little of the F word goes a long way and a lot of it is just lame. I soldiered through 46 pages before I began skimming for about ten minutes, and then skipped to the end. In HP, the Muggle Dursleys were deliciously horrid, and was the family I loved to hate.  I CV, Muggles are just horrid and mercifully, completely forgettable. The ending was not remotely sad, it was just the rotten cherry on top.

author: Jude
title: Casual Vacancy
body: An absolute and complete waste of time.  Nasty, abusive, disgusting.  I would never purchase another book by this author and I have deleted it from my kindle.

author: SLC
title: The Empress Has No Clothes...
body: I'm sorry I wasted my weekend on this Tawdry Tale.  What a waste of J.K. Rowling's considerable talents!  This dark, gritty book features a host of unlikeable characters on a collision course for disaster.

author: Krystal Veverka
title: This book leaves you feeling awful.
body: It's kind of trashy- like Jeanette Walls, The Glass Castle, but much better written. I feel kind of sick after reading it (and through most of the chapters). I would not recommend it unless you've got a strong stomach, a zest for unhappy marriages, and teenage suicide. It is expertly written, the characters well developed, and a good flow through the book, just terribly depressing. No thanks. I hope she tries again in her area of specialty- HP!

author: Anne, 47
title: Casual Vacancy
body: I enjoyed this book. It followed a few families who were real, with their own ambitions, histories, and personal faults.

author: lioness_torres
title: Ive Read The Entire Book
body: The Casual Vacancy was a great read. The first few chapters give you the background on the town and the characters and it was important for JK to do so. I laughed, cried, was shocked and mad all in one book. It is a roller coaster ride. JK did a wonderful job of showing a glimpse of the minds of very different people while connecting them all. It left me wanting more and I cant wait to read another adult novel by JK... so I hope she writes one soon! Dont listen to the complaints about this book, read it and love it!

author: Sweet Pea
title: Pretty entertaining
body: Liked this turn for JK Rowling.  Very unlike Harry Potter but characters are very well written and I was engaged and interested in how it would all turn out.

author: Benjamin Vaterlaus
title: Disappointed
body: I was hoping for a "clean" adult book with intrigue, challenge, and fun. What I found was a dirty soap opera. Unfortunately, this was one of those times when I couldn't even finish the book. I read somewhere that Rowling was willing to take criticism for this because she wanted to write something totally different from Harry Potter. Well, she did and she will. I will read another juvenile fiction that she writes, but if she does a sequel to this book (or even in a similar vein), I won't waste my money.

author: princess
title: princess michelle
body: good book, I didn't read Harry Potter, but liked her writing form for this book. look forward to JK writing more books for adults

author: Jacqueline A. Emuryan
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: This book was very hard to follow as far as the characters were concerned.  Definitely not a book that kep my interest.  I had to force myself to finish it.

author: windy
title: Great expectations
body: I found the story a little predictable and rambling. My expectation of the book was very high because of previous childrens books so I was a little dissapointed, but that will not stop me reading the next book.

author: Maryanne T. Heller
title: Reminiscent of Jane Austin
body: Unlike other reviews that I have read, I found Ms Rowling's Casual Vacancy to be quite an interesting glimpse of life in modern,non-urban England.  The character development was elegant and the social commentary brilliant.  I loved it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Moving and engaging, masterful storytelling
body: I don't usually write reviews for books because I find the experience of reading a book to be so personal and so subjective it's hard to translate that into what I think someone else's experience of the book might be.

author: Gentle reader
title: Disappointed
body: I was so enamored with the creativity and magic in the Harry Potter series.  This book just seemed gritty.  I guess she was capturing human nature, but I hope for better from mankind.

author: Michael Conley
title: wish I could "un-buy"
body: It took an effort to finish this book.  Ala Miss Marple, Rowling has decided to expose English village life as the a true cesspool of humanity.  There is not one sympathetic character.  They range from nasty and unpleasant to warped and vile.  Nothing good happens in this book.  It is a total downer with many tragic events and noone even learning from them.  If you want to be depressed, read this book.  I guess the author wanted to prove she is a serious writer.  If this is how she sees the world, she needs some serious help.

author: Lila Maine
title: not my style
body: The writing was wonderful. The story was not. I found it to be dull and could not care about the characters. I had to force myself to finish it.

author: Blueladybug2
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I'm half way through the book and I'm having a hard time following all the characters.  There is a lot of charaters in this book and it gets quite confusing.  All the reviews I've read says to read it to the end.  They say the ending is worth finishing the book.  I guess I'll find out.  JCM

author: Sandi
title: Tragedy
body: This book was a waste of my money & such a disappointment.  I was so excited to get it because I loved Harry Potter, but unless she changes a lot I will not buy another one without reading some first. The book was nothing but sadness, gossip, tragedy, & more sadness. Color it black. To me, there was no mystery, no suspense, no real direction.  The characters had no redeaming values.

author: trjmom
title: very good
body: Really enjoyed Rowling's new book.  Unexpected ending but the book was realistic.  Only criticism is the introduction of so many characters in the beginning.  Difficult to keep everyone straight until further on in the book.

author: Blue Mist Reader
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: Always interested in books by authors that are a "first" or an "only". This is indeed a first for J K Rowling (in adult fiction) and I enjoyed it enough to hope it is not the only one she writes.

author: Kisa
title: Wait, who are all these people again?
body: Too many characters, many of whom don't develop enough for me to have a sense of their identity until halfway through the book.  Writing felt a little uneven to me, in some places her descriptions and dialog are brilliant, but others felt a bit forced and over the top.

author: Willow
title: No characters to root for
body: I haven't finished the book. It's taking me a while to slog through it.  Actually, I got tired of being mired in so many disreputable characters, I am taking a break from the book and reading another one before I go back to it. It's been mildly interesting, though I'm waiting for something to happen.

author: M. Cotton
title: Well written but..
body: This book was well written, but just not my cup of tea. It was a well woven tale of a middle class town.  However, if it hadn't been a JK Rowling book, I wouldn't have given it a second look on the shelf.  JK once again proved herself to be an excellent author, but fans of the Harry Potter series might have trouble jumping over to the new genre with her.

author: LRock10288
title: Enough to keep my interest, not enough to blow me away.
body: I just finished The Casual Vacancy last night, after receiving it as a birthday gift. I'll admit, as a massive Potter fan, I was beyond eager to get my hands on Rowling's new work. The Casual Vacancy was good, I finished it and did not feel "dragged" to do so, but I was not left wanting more, wishing that I would have milked the brilliance and wanted to continue on with this story. Ironically, one of the biggest upsides in this book, to me, was also hand in hand with one of the biggest annoyances. This book is very much riding on observations of common human behaviors, which I thought at times to be brilliantly executed, and in the same breath, sometimes painfully cliche and stereotypical. In such a character-based story, I felt that the character layers and developments were to be crucial in telling it.

author: Kurt Stefan
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: After reading a number of the early reviews on this, I approached it with trepidation.

author: James Heron
title: Not Harry Potter, but a great read.
body: Like many, I  purchased this book to see how it would compare to the Harry Potter books, all of which I made a point to read and thoroughly enjoyed. This is a very worthwhile read. The author has made the move to writing for adults very well, with the shortcomings as well as the gifts each of has to balance in our lived. While the characters are very well developed; I had to turn back several times to remember who was was connected to who ... and how. I finally resolved this by a simple "family tree" for each family. A good read ... actually I enjoyed this every bit as much as the Potter books.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The first boring thing J.K. Rowling has ever written
body: Like 99.97% of everyone who has read this book so far, I am a huge "Harry Potter" fan. However, I love to read books from many genres, and I was very well aware that "The Casual Vacancy" was J.K. Rowling's foray into a whole new world. I wasn't expecting wizards or magic or broomsticks or even humor. What I was expecting was a novel that wasn't super dull to read, and unfortunately  for me, that's exactly what "The Casual Vacancy" is, from start to finish: boring, boring, boring. And my goodness, how it DRAGS! Rowling's extremely vivid descriptions and characterizations were apparent in this book, but the problem is that all of the characters are basically selfish and one-dimensional, not to mention completely uninteresting. This book paints a dark picture of the lives of the residents who inhabit a small English town and come to blows over its politics, but there's nothing for the reader to really grab onto or care about, and the pacing of the story is unbelievably slow, especially for the first half of the book.

author: Brian and Nancy
title: Library Now Has a Vacancy
body: I could not force myself to finish this book.  The book starts out with a myriad of characters, but few of them are likeable or interesting enough to care about what happens to them.  The plot drones on ad infinitum with the first hundred pages flitting among the host of characters recounting where they were when another one of the unliekable characters died.  Who cares?  No me.

author: NCGal
title: Doesn't grab me.
body: I'll admit that I was curious as to what J.K. Rowling would do to try and follow up after Harry Potter. And I find myself not really making time to read it. I believe that I am just now starting chapter 5 and I purchased it the day after it was released. It certainly isn't the same caliber of Harry Potter (and, truthfully, was hoping for the encyclopedia she said she would write) and so far isn't as interesting as the last book that I purchased. I'll eventually finish it, considering I paid $18 for the Kindle version.

author: woman on the move
title: Ture to life book, not for children
body: This book is a portrail of real life in society. It is a very graffic account of what goes on in peoples lives, and how lives all intertwine, in one way or another.I would say that it is not a book that should be read by anyone under the age of 16 at least.

author: wasateacher
title: A memory filled turn of phrase
body: A former 5th grade teacher, I always enjoyed sharing the newest Potter books informally with my students and loved watching them use what they'd read about in the Potter repertoire; as one student (who'd been reluctant to read the books just because everyone else was reading them) said when she dropped her pencil on the floor,"Levioso!"

author: Amazon Customer
title: its not supposed to be pretty, its supposed to be real and it is
body: If you are looking for a light , sunny read this is not the book for you.  If you can't handle seeing what really goes on in the lives of many sad souls this is not the book for you.  It is a look at the seamier side of life.  Rowling paints an accurate picture of what life is for many teens and adults in a small, rural town.  She captures their emotions brilliantly.  Is it depressing?  Yes.  Is it hard to read at times? Yes.  Is it a well constructed, deep piece of literature? Yes.  It is human emotion and raw need at its worst.  And it is very much like her Harry Potter books. They are dark and disturbing not light, sunny books either.  J K Rowling makes you feel strong emotions with her writing. She makes you think.  You need to look behind the story to see the real story she is telling. I had to come back and add to this review after continuing to read so many negative reviews. First- if you have not bothered to read the entire book please don't write a review - its not fair to the author. Second, if you bought this expecting Harry Potter that was your mistake not the author's. This book is clearly advertised as an adult fiction book. And finally, she did not write  a book about all of the inhabitants of a small town. She choose to write about a group that was bound together by a common  event /cause. That these people all had serious life issues they were dealing with was the setting of the book. Life is not always pretty. In fact I recognized many of the same issues I see  people I know dealing with- people you would never expect to have these kinds of issues/ problems. Someone commented that there was no clear character to root for.I disagree. I was rooting for all of them.

author: Jeanette T. Smetana
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: A large amount of characters were inroduced close to the onset of the book, with more coming forward as the book progressed.  It was difficult to keep these people straight and I had to keep going back to earlier parts to be able to place them.  It was also hard to like anyone in the book except for the Social Worker and the teen-agers, Krystal and Andrew, so the ending, while very realistic, was very disappointing.

author: Happy Scherer
title: A bitlLike Elizabeth George but without the "mystery"
body: This is a difficult book to rate.  It reminded me a lot of books by Elizabeth George and/or PD James, with alternating chapters about different characters who all intersect at the end.  It's that type of texture and character development, but without the mystery/detective piece or the characters we love like Lynley and Havers or Dalgliesh.  But it does share that same sense of small town British life, and certainly the characters are interesting and well-developed.

author: Scifigirl20
title: A Casual Vacancy
body: Interesting comparison and conflict between an ideal Britain and modern Britain as it truly is. The characters and the plot were rather depressing however. It was a solid effort but lacked the magic of Harry Potter

author: Hugh A. Whitesell
title: Casual Vacancy
body: I am extremely disappointed in this book. It does not in my opinion hold a candle to Ms. Rolwing's Harry Potter Series. To me it seems confused, poorly organized, full of extreme and unecessary bad language... and a not very interesting plot. Ms. Rowling, whose creation of the Harry Potter Books was brilliant, can surely do much better than this first attempt at an adult novel.

author: Niseymaria
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I was curious to see if it would compare favourably with the Harry Potter books. Sadly it did not. I was totally bored and did not finish reading it. Very , very disappointed.

author: Lil Sue
title: An average book
body: I am an avid reader and was looking forward to reading JK's new book as I have so much respect for her, but was disappointed with the read. There were too many characters and the story line was lacking excitement with an obvious ending.

author: Dottie Logerot
title: Slow as molasses
body: What a disappointment.  Who would have thought the same mind that made up the world of Harry Potter could create this mess.  I just didn't get it from the very beginning.

author: Nan
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I couldn't make it past 100 pages. Completely depressing storyline, a ridiculous amount of swearing and just plain vulgar. I didn't even want to give the book to anyone so I threw it away.

author: Cynthia Hicks
title: Slightly disappointing
body: I wanted to like this book a lot more, but the characters only became compelling toward the end.  The plot was adequately complex, but I grew frustrated with Rowling's  inability to pull everything together in a smooth, concise way.  The ending felt appropriate, though a bit frustrating.  I hope that the author will focus now on another gripping series for youth - her Harry Potter fans will probably have mixed emotions about this venture.

author: Michael J. Smith
title: Incredibly Disappointing
body: I was really looking forward to this book.  Yes I read all of the Harry Potter books and loved them.  I also read Dickens, Russo, Irving, Wodehouse and lots of other authors this new book would supposedly be compared to.  I hate to say it, but good lord, I was amazingly disappointed.  Disappointed doesn't begin to cover it.  I was barely able to keep reading.  I finished this book only because it was by J.K. Rowling.  I am too old to spend time reading books that, after more than 100 pages of reading, I just don't like.  I decided to make an exception of this novel.  I expected a story about class struggle and death, but I also expected some humor.  The book is devoid of any real humor, it is simply depressing.  There is also no desire to feel any kind of sympathy for any of the characters, because you never really get a chance to like any of them from the beginning.  There are so many characters to keep up with in this book that you would think some of them would be likable.  they aren't.  I"m sorry.  I won't recap the book, everyone reading this probably has an idea.  I cannot recommend this book.  I hate to say it, but there it is.

author: LadyBeth
title: Disturbing & Icky
body: I pre-ordered this book in anticipation of another amazing, well crafted story from the Queen Authoress herself.  The intro was okay but dull; however, I was quite certain J.K would weave her writing magic in a splendid fashion as the story progressed.  Each character she presented was despicable and JK's "adult" descriptions of them were foul, pornographic, sadistic and disturbingly dark.  The F-bomb was used so many times, I wondered if this was the first time she allowed herself to cuss because it was like she just couldn't get over herself about using excessively, ugly language.  I only read 17% of the book (on my kindle) and then quit reading it altogether because I couldn't stand another deplorable word.  I concur with those who said they wouldn't even put the book into the GoodWill or other thrift store bins.  Wouldn't want it to get circulated into the hands of another unsuspecting reader.  I am hoping inspiration returns to this very gifted writer but I won't pre-order her next book.  I will wait patiently to read the reviews first before I part with my money.

author: Voracious Reader
title: JKRowling is a genius.
body: This book is a masterpiece. She has to be one of the best writers of our time. For any adults that felt she was only capable of writing children stories, you are terribly wrong.

author: Diane Bellomo
title: Not Potter.  Didn't Have To Be.
body: I've read (some) of the other 600 reviews of this book, and I really can't find a whole lot to add, pro or con.  I'll leave it at this:  I liked it, found it satisfying in ways that are impossible to put into words.  Rowling's writing style here is different than it was for Potter, certainly more *grown up,* but the narrative (and those metaphors!) bring depth, and the characters are as multi-faceted as they need to be for the story.  The ending is less predictable than inevitable, which is, to me, a much better word.  It's not likely I'm going to re-read this - like I do with the Potter books - but I'm not sorry I read it once.

author: momreads
title: Night and day
body: Anybody holding back from reading this book based on the "Harry Potter" books should rest easy. They are NOTHING alike!

author: JKM
title: Disappointing!
body: I was curious to see how Rowling would make the jump to writing adult literature.

author: Dr. Carole
title: Casual Vacancy
body: I bought the book with great expectancy, but I was very disappointed and could not finish reading it. None of the characters were likable and the plot uninteresting.

author: Katie
title: Upsetting and Confusing
body: I am a Harry Potter fan, and while I knew this would be a big departure, I wasn't expecting this. I kept getting characters confused because of their similar names and lack of connection developed between reader and character. Every time I read the book, I just felt sick, but I had to get through it. It was very upsetting because I could easily see it all happening in the real world. Overall, I just wasn't happy reading this. It took me to uncomfortable places I didn't want to go, and now I'd be concerned about reading anything else she puts out. I'll stick with Hogwarts.

author: Kerry Sullivan
title: Smaller than life and dull
body: I'm sure it's a mixed blessing being J.K. Rowling.  Your books are all expected to be magical and are held to impossibly high standards.  On the other hand, you're richer than the queen and get to live in a castle, or could if you wanted to.  But this book is a long, dull slog by any standard.  With one exception, the characters are smaller than life, boring, and unlikeable.  And the one exception, well--SPOILER ALERT--she goes the way of Dumbledore.  A completely unsatisfying waste of time, money, and shelf space.

author: sonshine
title: soap opera
body: I purchased this book based on her great suspenseful writing with Harry Potter.  This is nothing more than a vulgar soap opera.  I stopped reading after about 10% of the book.  Sad.  Wish it could be returned.

author: Sahara
title: Casual Vacancy
body: To tell the truth I was a little disappointed. The characters don't seem real to me and the story just rambles on without really generating any interest in how it will finish. I like my stories to make me want to read as quickly as poosible.

author: mgab4045
title: causal vacancy
body: I have just started the book and their are many details about the town.  So I have not got real excited about staying with the book until midnight.

author: Jennifer Gross
title: ADHD
body: I couldn't even finish this book. When I picked it up. I assumed it was fantasy. I love to read, But since I have ADHD. After the first chapter. My attention started to wonder. Tell I finely gave up. I personally thought it was boring and slightly crude. Thou I would have looked past the crudeness for a good fantasy.

author: deeptissue808
title: Missing the magic
body: I am not able to "lose myself" in this book as I did in Harry Potter.  Plot, characters, writing just ok. Took a long time for the plot to get my interest. If it wasn't written by JK Rowling I would not be putting the effort into finishing it.

author: Mary Jo R.
title: 21st century "It's a Wonderful Life"
body: I can't quite understand all critics' and Amazon readers' bad reviews. This is the best novel I've read in a long time. I'm not sure if it's deliberate, but it has echoes of "It's a Wonderful Life." One man's death causes the unraveling of a community. Yes, it's a pretty grim story, but Rowling's biting social commentary is entertaining. Each character is deeply flawed but in a very human and recognizable way.

author: Dawn Romine
title: Disappointed
body: I found myself just wanting to quickly finish the book so that I could start a different one.  When I read the Harry Potter series, I didn't want the books to end.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Too many F bombs!
body: I purchased this book because I loved the Harry Potter series.  I have to admit I only read the first 6 pages of the book.  Lords name in vain 3 times, 1 bloody hell and I lost track of the F bombs.  I was crossing them out and I looked down the page and saw 3 more.  This book is currently in my trash can.  I wouldn't even donate to the library.

author: Melissa C. Dare
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: If this had been J.K. Rowling's first book, it probably would be the last to find a publisher.  The overall impression of the story is one of dismal hope, diminished opportunity, and downright mean people.  It doesn't help that the most likable person in the story is killed over in chapter one.

author: Page Turner
title: I Need Mental Floss
body: I was repelled, disgusted, depressed, but mostly bored. But I kept forcing myself to read because it just had to get better, right? Wrong. It was Awful.  Dismal.  Depressing. Sad. Dirty. Tragic. The mind who created Voldemort and the Dementers created this book.

author: Gaby Cesman
title: Impossible to stop reading
body: As I never read Harry Potter I cannot compare this book to the best selling series.

author: Stype
title: Good, but not what I expected
body: If it didn't have JK Rowlings on the front cover, I think I would have been blown away. Unfortunately, my expectations were that I was reading the author of Harry Potter, and it turned out to be surprisingly Ibsenesq. Not a bad thing, just unexpected. The story was exceptionally executed, and overall a good read. I will likely pre-order her next one too.

author: Dayle
title: Casual Vacancy
body: I am trying to read "Casual Vacancy. There are so very many people to remember in this book.

author: Beverly
title: Disappointing !
body: JKRowling is a fantastic author. However she tries to hard in this book to prove that she can write an adult novel. I couldn't get past the pre story. Just lost interest in so many unsavory characters. Hope to see something more refreshing in the future.

author: coppella
title: slow to start
body: I am 3/4 way through this book, and it is finally getting interesting.  Tedious reading at best.  The character development was laborious.  The "English" verbiage took a while to comprehend.  I would not purchase another novel of hers.  Did not read "Harry Potter" and now I won't.

author: teeny
title: disappointed
body: I was a big fan of her other books but casual vacancy did not come close to being a good and entertaining story.  Personally, I found it boring and too drawn out to be entertaining.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Well drawn characters and well crafted story
body: I became really invested in the characters and story.  This book gets one of my highest accolades - it seems plausible.  The characters are interesting and complex but are completely human.

author: Samira Manners
title: Couldn't finish it
body: Depressing .... Not what I wanted or expected. Very detailed yet too much detail of a sad little town. I wanted an escape not a kick into sad reality for some parts of the world.

author: Robin Duxfield
title: Great book
body: An enjoyable book. JK Rowling confirms that she is an entertaining story teller, this time telling a tale about a council in a small town.

author: Taylor
title: JKR moves on
body: This book has very little relation the Harry Potter ones.  It is very good on its own.  Clearly this was a story she felt she had to tell and I am glad that I read it.

author: tibker
title: Casual vacancy
body: It gave me a headache trying to keep all the characters straight. A couple if interesting strands of story, put it down half way through. Will try again later

author: aztrainer
title: Just okay
body: 5 chapters in and still waiting for the pizzazz. Too much dirty language for my taste. I wish it was a book I just couldn't put down but it's not. A little boring.

author: claudia swisher
title: Not Potter but That's OK
body: Because my mother was a huge Anglophile and I have seen a ton of British comedy films, I understood this genre and fell right into the world of this tiny town with its tiny-minded inhabitants. Pagford is the center (centre) of their existence, and everyone knows everyone else's business. But, once the doors are closed, families are hiding secrets that are crippling. Children are abused, mental illness rules, dissatisfaction and sadness. Small meanness keeps some hearts forever closed.

author: elite5091
title: Not my cup of tea
body: Bleh. I couldn't finish the book. There was no central hero. I don't know about you but I need a hero to cheer for and a villain to despise (and secretly admire). This book contained neither. It is a snapshot of a town and its residents. This book will probably be turned into a TV show or mini-series. It would be better served as a script than a novel.  So, in summary: Bleh.

author: Chris
title: Casual Vacancy
body: I may not be fair to the author by rating this book so soon.  I am 45 pages into the book and am quickly losing interest.  If it doesn't pick up soon I will be extremely disappointed in the authors writings on this book.  I shall continue on and hopefully it will get more interesting.

author: Sheila
title: Disappointed
body: Having not read any of the Harry Potter books, I was very excited about reading an adult book by this author. I am having a really hard time getting through this book! Because of the popularity of the Harry Potter books, maybe I expected too much or maybe it's just me. I love to read and usually can't wait to get back into whatever book I am reading, but I may have to pass on this one.

author: Jackson
title: casual vacancy
body: J.K. Rowling is a excellent writer, however this book was disappointing.  I never got involved in the story because most to the story was not interesting.

author: Cheryl A. Youree
title: Casual Vacancy lackluster
body: After the delightfully developed characters and the vividly descriptive settings of the Harry Potter epic, I found Casual Vacancy to be flat and lackluster. I did not connect with the characters, nor did I find the story itself to be imaginative.

author: longdaydogs
title: snorefest
body: Not my cup of tea. Filled with bad language. Story was just too predictable. There was no one in the story that I felt connected to. Nothing to get excited about. I would not recommend this book.

author: M. Weedon
title: too bleak
body: Most Harry Potter fans will not like this book, not that anyone should compare Rowling's new book to the Potter series. But I didn't expect this book to be so bleak. The Casual Vacancy is set in a small British town that's populated by small minded, selfish people with dysfunctional families and failing relationships.  Yes, Rowling created a world with strong characterizations, but I have a hard time with books if I don't like any of the characters, and that was the case with her first adult novel. The most likeable character died in the first chapter.  The characters who have some humanity are enablers with flawed relationships. Only at the end of the book do the other characters start showing each other some compassion, finally making an effort to patch up their families.  It's a sad book.  But I will probably read Rowling's next book in hopes that it's more uplifting.

author: Hi there!
title: Casual Vancancy
body: [[ASIN:B007THA4FI The Casual Vacancy] I loved the Harry Potter Books and could hardly wait to read an adult story by J.K. Rowling--I am not sure what I expected--this is a serious story full of social problems--as you read you are drawn into the lives of the characters--you cry with them--you laugh with them--you wish for them a better way of life--we the readers--begin to understand this is our world--we are the ones who can make this world better--the book is thoughtful and strangely compelling--Thank You--J.K. Rowling--I love the way you put the words together!

author: Ann H. Karegeannes
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: I find the cast of characters a bit confusing. There is not enough background on each to easily delineate them from each other. The conflict over the newly empty Council seat does bring out the underlying conflicts and mean spirited relationships that often exist in very small towns.I do find her use of the children's lives as almost separate from the parents but who are controlled almost unmercifully by these parents.

author: Connie
title: Stunk
body: This book was terrible.  Poorly written, pointless plot, and an Extremly unessisary dirty storie line.  I am shocked this is the same person that wrote Harry Potter.  Thank you so much Amazon for giving me a refund, I would hate to own this book!

author: Kimberly D. Parthemore
title: Love J.K.Rowling
body: I love J.K. Rowling and her new book "Casual Vacancy" is very good. It is NOTHING like Harry Potter but it is a very easy read. The reader will imagine themselves tangled in the lives of the townspeople. I read it in 2 days....ENJOY.

author: Anne c kelly
title: casual Vacancy
body: I thought the book was well written but I still wouldn't recommend it to everyone because it is so gritty. It's like reading an episode of East Enders.

author: Margaret
title: Deep, dark and dysfunctional
body: She is a master of words however her subject matter is very dreary. When did fatal flaws such as hubris or egotism disappear, to be replaced with victimization? Each character seems afflicted with any of the current societal woes such as ADHD, child abuse, drug dependency or incest, and on and on. Hardly an uplifting story.

author: Teresa T
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: J.K. Rowling's skill with creating characters that are real and jump out of the page carries over into her writing for adults.

author: Elphaba5110
title: Not Harry Potter
body: I was really excited to read this book. I love the Harry potter series and JK Rowling is by far my favorite author. I downloaded it and at midnight I checked to see if I had received it. Had to wait til morning. Part of me likes the book. The plot of the book was hard to grasp, I know her writing style is to describe everything and in certain genres it works. I plan to reread this book at a later date so I can hopefully understand it.

author: D. D. E Middleton
title: Little Disappointed
body: Pre-ordered the book with great expectation. It is a good novel but not the quality of storytelling I expected from J.K. Rowling.

author: Natasha Harder
title: Great Book
body: I am currently half way through this book and it is wonderful so far.  The writing is on par with her Harry Potter books.  I am enjoying this new topic and village she is taking me to.  I am certainly going to finish this novel and hopefully see many more from her.

author: Bob
title: It was OKay!!
body: It was an interesting read.  I did not like the ending of the book.  It kind of left you hanging.  Harry Potter was much better.  She should sit at home and collect her royalties.

author: David B (Louisiana)
title: Wonderful book
body: I read the reviews before I bought the book (they almost persuaded me not to buy it).  I'm glad I trusted my instincts.  I found this to be a truly good story.  I think Ms. Rowling took an ordinary setting and premise and brought them to life extraordinarily well.  She certainly understands human nature and shares that understanding with great wit.  I don't know if she intended it, but I think she also manages to teach a life lesson on the mess we can all make of things when we let our lives become self-centered.  I'd recommend this book to any adult and, certainly, any parent.

author: Helly
title: Casual Vacancy
body: When I read the town name Pagford I expected a wizard to come round the corner immediately.

author: emoc
title: Better than expected.
body: Though I purchased this book with some trepedation I fully enjoyed it. The writing was wonderful with fully developed characters and a story line that kept me guessing until the end.

author: gigi
title: disappointed
body: This book and author did not live up to expectations.  The characters were bland and the subject uninteresting.  I forced myself to finish reading this book - hoping that I would find redeeming feature.  Sadly, I did not.

author: BobbyGee
title: Rough language put-off.
body: The story is rather slow in getting started.  When it finally revs up, the foul language is offensive -- something not expected from J.K. Rowling.

author: G. Hall
title: Unexpected
body: I wasn't sure how to feel about this book at the beginning.  It is SO different from the Harry Potter books.  I thought it got off to a slow start, with the introduction of lots of characters and the mingling of all these characters in a small town, but the pace picks up & the ending is unexpected.  Once the reader gets a feel for each character, the book becomes an enjoyable read. I recommend it.

author: Barbara L. Moeller
title: A Casual VACANCY
body: Very confusing and difficult to get through. I am still plugging through, hope it gets better. Halfway through and still do not get the point of this book.

author: Peggy S. Moore
title: Very disappointed
body: Needless to say, I loved the Harry Potter series that J K Rowling wrote.  I guess I was expecting this book to be written in the same great style but I would have never guessed that it was an adult rated xx book....I was so disappointed....there are lots and lots of great books that are written without the filth and profanity....but if you like the filth and profanity, then this book is for you.

author: Daniel F Peavey
title: Casual vacancy
body: Very disappointing read. I understand expectations were high, however this story didn't even come close. I felt like I was reading a dictionary, too much discriptive writing, not enough dialogue. My 12 year old could have thought up a better story and written a better plot. I blame the publisher, it looks like someone wanted to make a quick buck on a big name. Suggestion for book - use as fire starter.

author: MJoPow
title: Lacks "Magic"
body: All good novels have "magic"--something that makes you care about the characters. For me, The Casual Vacancy lacks that quality. I'm not all the way through, but it's a struggle to read it because I don't particularly like any of the characters. I'm keeping at it in hopes that it will eventually be worth the read, but I have my doubts.

author: Diane Cramer
title: Couldn't finish it
body: Characters I could not even begin getting interested in.  Located in a town that is flat and lackluster.  Rambling plot.  The only characters with depth are the teenagers.  It seems to me the author is best sticking to her comfort zone of adolescents.  Wish I had not bought the book nor wasted my time reading half of it.

author: gpfnyc
title: not good
body: this book was a total bore . I wish I were Harry Potter so I could get back the time I wasted on this book

author: T. C. Brayshaw
title: Where is the story?
body: I am presently almost half way through this book, and still asking myself why I keep reading it.  The opening chapter sets up a multitude of plot lines that that could have been followed but none were.  After her excellent series of young adult books I have been disappointed by the lack of structure.  It is an easy read.

author: peewee
title: The Casual Vacancy
body: ... an array of characters with a multitude of conflicts... it boils down to the story of Krystal Weeden. It is plain to see Rowling's keen interest in needy children. The ending of this novel ... the funeral ... is perhaps the best I have ever read. What a tribute to a courageous girl!!!

author: Ken Hall
title: Character matters
body: A writer who can create compelling characters and set them in motion in a story that raises universal questions is one who deserves to be read. That's what J.K. Rowling has done in The Casual Vacancy. I can't imagine anyone who has been a teen or a parent or who lives in a community -- in other words anybody -- being put off by this book the way some of the critics were. I'm astonished that any book review editor would have accepted a submission that started with and sometimes continued on the premise that this was no Harry Potter. That's not what you would call news or insightful. What was interesting and worthy of mentioning was her ability to create similar characters in vastly dissimilar situations. Harry and friends always felt like real teens with real teen troubles and desires even if their world was unreal. These teens and adults are real in the real world. It was not a perfect book. The prose and focus bogged down occasionally but only briefly. I wish she could have published this under a pen name. It deserved an honest and unbiased reception, one it did not get. But it deserves to be read and enjoyed on its own terms.

author: anonymous
title: Casual Vacancy, a bit too real for me!
body: I have been looking forward to the release of this book for a few weeks now and I feel a bit disappointed. The story is well written with some very clever phrasing, however I enjoy reading in order to imagine an alternate world for the duration of a story, not a more bleak glimpse of other's existences. I have not yet finished the book as I am finding that I only read it in small increments. Given J.K. Rowling's talent as a writer when she set out to create a more "real" town with characters you could meet on the street, she succeeded!

author: Dale Wilson
title: Casual vacancy
body: Very disappointing...after enjoying all the Harry Potter series and the wonderful imagination that went into her writing, Casual Vacancy was hard to get into, had characters that were so uninteresting and all worried by SO many issues, there was hardly a likable one in the book.  The English "slang" made reading very stilted.  I read the whole book, but at the end wished I hadn't read it at all.

author: M. Sanchez
title: Casual Vacancy Review
body: I have not finished this book because it is a book that is easy to put down.  Not a page turner for me.  The death of a council member allows you to go inside the lives of many of the small town"s citizens.  I expected more from the writer that brought us Harry Potter, books that I have read many times.

author: Conrad F. Sterling
title: DISAPOINTED
body: So many cuss words and not a sin left uncovered in the book.  Reaaly a slow read and too many characters to try and keep track of. I was really disappointed in this whole book.

author: Stephanie
title: Complicated read
body: I gave up 1/3 through the book. All the political talk and constantly switching back and forth between characters was killing me.

author: Frances Lee Carlson
title: my review
body: it's not up to the level of her harry potter books but it is very entertaining.  i'm hoping that it will be made into a movie.

author: Elizabeth M. Ortiz
title: Casual Vacancy
body: In her first attempt at "adult" fiction Ms. Rowling holds nothing back, using language and very graphic images that only very wel grounded adults should read.  All of her characters are seriously flawed, as are most of us; but they have made some very fateful decisions that affect those around them in very negative ways.  It is a very dark story, and the ending brings no relief from the sadness, only relief that the book has finally ended.

author: George B. Lane
title: A Little Boring
body: I believe Ms. Rowling should stick with Harry Potter. Her plot line in the new book seems contrived and rather provincial. I had trouble maintaining interest and could only read a few pages at a sitting, whereas with a book that interests me I can read about 100 pages at a sitting. I also had trouble empathizing with her characters.

author: Peggy S. Bell
title: She  should have stuck to writing kid's novels!!!
body: Wow!! this book is just awful!!!1 Boring,boring, jumbled and confusing @ times. I think she should have stuck to Harry Potter. Will never read her again!!

author: Ari Dale
title: Missing magic.
body: In her iconic Harry Potter series, Rowling had even hard core, no-nonsense, no- fantasy readers in awe of her wit and wizardry with the written word; many who didn't  believe in magic  became fully enchanted.  By contrast, The Casual Vacancy is a regular novel, with a reasonably interesting but not extraordinary plot.  Some of the sex scenes are really quite superfluous- even amateurish, as if a highschool student were trying to shock his Creative Writing teacher.  There were too many forgettable characters doing unremarkable things.  Try again, JK, but maybe don't try so hard.

author: bames
title: Interesting read
body: The Casual Vacancy is definitely something different from JK Rowling's Harry Potter series. The reader is best to leave any preconceived ideas that the book will be somewhat similar. The Casual Vacancy is an interesting story about the residents of the fictional town of Pagford.

author: ckodin
title: Loved it!
body: I hope that Rowling contines to write adult fiction. I couldn't put this book down. The characters are so intense and weave an excellent story.

author: Ant
title: Bleak, bitchy and brilliant
body: After Harry Potter, we all know that JKR is a good storyteller, but who knew she could write as well!

author: Coffee Addicted Writer (Billy)
title: Beautifully Written, but Flawed
body: J. K. Rowling is one of the most successful writers of all time due to her Harry Potter franchise becoming a worldwide phenomenon. I was a bit surprised when she announced that she was writing an adult book instead of another children fantasy series. The moment she made the announcement the pressure for success was on her.

author: Goodreading7778
title: Loved it!
body: I bought this book, before it was released, with no expectations of what it would be like. I was very excited to find that it was a really enjoyable book and I was thoroughly entertained whilst reading it. I loved J.K. Rowling's writing style, the characters were interesting and her view of small town interactions was really funny and even twisted at times. I hope she continues to write adult fiction as I loved reading this book.

author: Timothy S. Reader
title: A great read (if you're smart enough to take it on its own merits)
body: I'll give the naysayers one thing - it is kind of a slow burn and you probably won't be racing through the first few chapters with your heart pounding.  I can even understand why someone without a lot of time to read could put it down and forget to put it back up, but when it gets going this is a cracking domestic melodrama that will have you grabbing a few pages whenever you can.
