I have experienced no problems at all with the format of the book; the Kindle Fire offers 8 different font sizes, and I have been reading this book at the second smallest option.  So, price and Kindle format both were essentially non-issues for me.

author: Booksrfun
title: You are truly inspiring!  Keep it up, J.K.!
body: The portrayal of the characters on this book is very deep and real and as original as if someone really lived through the situations, totally different from her previous published Harry Potter fantasy series.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Have not read and will not read
body: Maybe I am not being fair but, based on the reviews that I have already read, the use of the "f" word and other profanity is not entertaining to me and I will not read a book that is laced with it.  If I start a book that "sucked me in" with it's description and find that the profanity is there, I dump it and go to another.  That's why I mostly get the free ones or ones for a few bucks.  I won't wast money on such things.  This author was so successful with the Harry Potter series without the bad language.  It saddens me that she would resort to using it just because she is writing for adults.  Doesn't say much for us older folks does it!!  Sooooooo, I am rating without reading this time.  Sorry if I offended anyone.  Not my intention.

author: Holly Day
title: From Someone Who's Actually Read It!
body: Just to set the record straight on Casual Vacancy, I was given a copy as a gift. When you read the book, you need to forget this is the same author who gave us Mr.Potter's world of magic. This is set in a tiny English town and deals with politics,class struggle,poverty,drug use,child abuse,rape,self-mutilation, suicide, pedophilia,mental illness and other ugly realities. Much to her credit the author does this with sharp comic wit, however it does all go on a bit too long with the ending being somewhat predictable and heavy-handed. It goes from being a lively comedy of manners to over-wrought slog by the end. I will say that I did enjoy her attempt to combine cutting comedy with social commentary. This is definitely not a book for the children in your house with the salty, profane language and delicate subject matters.

author: Saguaro View 124
title: So far so good!
body: I've only gotten about halfway through the book, but I can honestly say that I've been enjoying it. The characters are beautifully realistic. I think that as someone who grew up reading Harry Potter it is very nice to see J.K Rowling writing again. So far I have loved this new different novel, but it makes me honestly upset to be critiquing it for its format and it's price. And I at least read a story for the story itself and not for its looks.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Everyone can see the price, Idiots!
body: I can see the price for myself when looking at purchasing the kindle edition so I don't need 20+ people telling me that it's too expensive! There was only one review of this book out of MANY that was actually about the content of the novel. I love JK Rowling and grew up with Harry Potter so I will buy this book and pay the $17.99 without a complaint. As Americans, we pay for convenience... that's what makes the economy go round people! If you don't like the price DON'T BUY IT! If you want to read it I'm sure you can wait until the price drops or it's available at the public library. The world has enough REAL victims without all of us thinking we are because of the price of a book... get a life!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Thanks for nothing
body: Thanks a lot, folks. I looked at the reviews to see how other people had rated this book and why so I could decide whether or not to purchase it. What I found here were complaints about the e-book price and responses to those complaints. A book is a book, no matter the format. I own a Kindle but do not necessarily expect the books to be less expensive. My decision on what format to purchase is sometimes determined by the weight of the book but mostly by whether I have friends who would also like to read it. Get over yourselves and your complaints about price. Buy the book or don't buy the book. The rest of us don't really care and you are wasting our time.

author: DearMYRTLE
title: Initial thoughts
body: Just started reading... using Kindle App on my iPad, strictly for the larger screen. So far too much unnecessary use of the "f" word. Hope this isn't an indication of things to come. Copious use of foul language doesn't make this an adult book. Hope this isn't an indication of things to come. Copious use of foul language doesn't make this an adult book. J K Rowling may be trying too hard to break out of her Harry Potter mold. But I am willing to get past the first chapter. Usually by now in a book, I know if I'll like it. Just saying...

author: Amazon Customer
title: The Casual Vacancy of Harry Potter
body: LOL! It was funny to see J.K. Rowling try to write a book that was not Harry Potter.  The title is misleading but there is more than a vacancy that's casual.  Some may call the title artistic and witty, but I think it's quite the opposite being that Harry Potter is not in the book which makes the vacancy more than casual.  I think the book should be titled "The Enormous Vacancy."

author: discerningreader1
title: keep it up jk
body: excellent character portrayal,insightful,and as an agatha christie fan, i was quite pleased to find a novel reminiscent of her style.  thrilled to become lost in the fantasy of an english village setting with a cast of amusing and brutally real characters

author: Anne Gowlett
title: stop complaining
body: I wish some readers of this kindle edition would stop complaining.

author: Ann V.
title: Buy the Hardcover Copy
body: If you do not like the Kindle price, buy the hardcover copy.  Only a few dollars more for something concrete which may make you feel its worth despite its worth in literary sweat, creativity, & execution.

author: Wooddell
title: As a product - too expensive
body: I thought I would like to read, but the preview chapters are not very exciting and the price is way too high! This is a review of the worth of the product as a whole and in my opinion the value is not there in writing or price.

author: Carm
title: Format!
body: I have no official review for this book as I have yet to read it. However, I just downloaded it to my kindle and the font is tiny. I must set my kindle font to the biggest it allows and it is still too small to read comfortably (plus the margins are now huge). Considering it killed me to purchase an ebook for over the usual 10-12 bucks I really feel that one costing $17.99 the font should be formatted properly.

author: William Hegedus
title: Great book
body: This book shows a realistic, slightly cynical, portrayal of people. It is in no way, shape, or form a sugarcoated version of a novel. I am ashamed that so many people are giving it low star reviews because they either a) don't like the price or b) don't like its Kindle formatting.

author: Letting Light In
title: What One Needs to Know About Kindle Price
body: I'm confused by people who complain about kindle prices not being lower. For starters they do not understand the difficult economics of book publishing [printing costs are only a small part of cost--thus only a small difference in cost]. Buying a kindle or ebook reader for cost savings isn't a wise idea--unless you plan to just read public domain books. Used or secondary market physical copies usually cost less or if they aren't it will generally be for a popular book you can buy and easily resell. So while I understand there are good reasons to own a Kindle or Nook, just getting it for saving money seems to be missing the point.

author: rocka-chic
title: Don't buy it if you cant afford it
body: There is such a place called a library. You can check the book out and read it if you feel the price of the book is too high. People complain about the most absurd things. In the time it takes to type up a nasty review...most people would come to the conclusion to 1. go to the library or 2. wait a couple months for the price to go down. Work smarter not harder people! It would be really nice to read a review on the content of the actual book =)

author: Mary E. Rumbaugh
title: Not any amount, I have now read the sample.
body: When I pay more the $10.00 for a book it had better be a Hardcopy GREAT WORLD CHANGING book, School Text book, or the Bible. Never an electronic book.

author: Tricia K.
title: Seriously?  $17 bucks for a computer file???  Do you think I can wave a wand and make money?
body: Premise sounds dull as dirt.  For $17 for a computer/Kindle file??? No thanks; I'll wait until I can gete a used one for a buck ninety-five.  Rowling is NOT God, even though the kiddies seem to think so.

author: Pretzel
title: A must read
body: The depth of character development and storyline echoes why JK is one of the greatest storytellers of our time.  This is not your kid's fantasy book - but is a thoroughly enjoyable escape which is exactly what I want in a good book.

author: Prodigy
title: I love it
body: The book was great and I will love to re-read it again and again. I really hope Jo goes for more books- Adult or Fantasy and that I will continue reading them. This story is great. The price may be high but it is worth it. You see, it's all about different points. Like Shirley Mollison who HATES Barry Fairbrother or Mary Fairbrother the wife of Barry. Please buy the book and see whats going on in Pagford.

author: David Katz
title: Kendle price too expensive
body: I started to order the kindle edition and than looked at the price. It was only a couple of dollars cheaper than the paper one. Having been in publishing I know the cost of paper and manufacturing and the Kindle edition is over priced.  I hope this is not the new wave of the future.  There should definitely be a larger gap between kindle and hardcover.  I am a big supporter of Amazon I hope this doesn't change my mind

author: M. A. Barnett
title: too expensive
body: I would love to buy this book but it is too expensive! I find it hard to comprehend why I will be able to but this book cheaper in a soft cover version.
